ngiemboon: Mezíŋ pàmangʉa njʉ̀’ Yěsô Kristo gẅie aa na ngẅɛ fùɔ Ndavíd, éfóo na ngẅɛ Ábalam e mɔɔn:
en: The book of the generation of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.

ngiemboon: Ábalam la zyé Esâg, Esâg zyé Yakwɔ́b, Yakwɔ́b zyé Jẅida pâ mefɛ́ pé.
en: Abraham begat Isaac; and Isaac begat Jacob; and Jacob begat Judas and his brethren;

ngiemboon: Jẅida zyé Fares pɔ́ Zara, má wɔ́b gwɔ́ Tamar, Fares zyé Esrom, Esrom zyé Aram.
en: and Judas begat Phares and Zara of Thamar; and Phares begat Esrom; and Esrom begat Aram;

ngiemboon: Aram zyé Aminadab, Aminadab zyé Naason, Naason zyé Salmoŋ,
en: and Aram begat Aminadab; and Aminadab begat Naasson; and Naasson begat Salmon;

ngiemboon: Salmoŋ zyé Booz, má pà Booz gwɔ́ Raab, Booz zyé Obed, má pà Obed gwɔ́ Lẅid, Obed zyé Jesé,
en: and Salmon begat Booz of Rachab; and Booz begat Obed of Ruth; and Obed begat Jesse;

ngiemboon: Jesé zyé fùɔ Ndavíd, fùɔ Ndavíd la zyé Salomo, mbà má pà Salomo láa nzwě Wiri.
en: and Jesse begat David the king; and David the king begat Solomon of herthat had been the wifeof Urias;

ngiemboon: Salomo zyé Loboam, Loboam zyé Abia, Abia zyé Asaf,
en: and Solomon begat Roboam; and Roboam begat Abia; and Abia begat Asa;

ngiemboon: Asaf zyé Josafad, Josafad zyé Joram, Joram zyé Ozias,
en: and Asa begat Josaphat; and Josaphat begat Joram; and Joram begat Ozias;

ngiemboon: Ozias zyé Joatáŋ, Joatáŋ zyé Asház, Asház zyé Ezékias,
en: and Ozias begat Joatham; and Joatham begat Achaz; and Achaz begat Ezekias;

ngiemboon: Ezékias zyé Manase, Manase zyé Amoŋ, Amoŋ zyé Josias,
en: and Ezekias begat Manasses; and Manasses begat Amon; and Amon begat Josias;

ngiemboon: Yɛ̂ kwò pʉ̀a tɔ́g, Yekonia zyé Salatiɛl, Salatiɛl zyé Zorobabel,
en: and after they were brought to Babylon, Jechonias begat Salathiel; and Salathiel begat Zorobabel;

ngiemboon: Zorobabel zyé Abiud, Abiud zyé Eliakím, Eliakím zyé Azɔr,
en: and Zorobabel begat Abiud; and Abiud begat Eliakim; and Eliakim begat Azor;

ngiemboon: Azɔr zyé Sadɔg, Sadɔg zyé Akím, Akím zyé Eliud
en: and Azor begat Sadoc; and Sadoc begat Achim; and Achim begat Eliud;

ngiemboon: Eliud zyé Eléazar, Eléazar zyé Matan, Matan zyé Yakwɔ́b,
en: and Eliud begat Eleazar; and Eleazar begat Matthan; and Matthan begat Jacob;

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ́b zyé Yesyɛ̂b, Yesyɛ̂b gwɔ́ ndǔm Malîɛ, Malîɛ gwɔ́ má pà Yěsô gẅie mé tóŋo le*Nzà’nkÿo.
en: and Jacob begat Joseph the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò lɔgɔ ḿbumte pá’ɔɔn nà shwóŋó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la lɔ́g ncwò Ntsẅì Nkʉ̀ we ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Now all this was done, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet, saying,

ngiemboon: mè tsẅi lezíŋ sé lê Emanuel, e lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: «E Ssé ee nùɔ pege».
en: which being interpreted is, God with us.

ngiemboon: *Cÿɔ́’ Ssé gɔɔn pú’u, Yesyɛ̂b gwɔ́ tà ńzyeen, ńgÿo mmó gie à tsẅǐ né yé, ńkẅé nzwě we ńnéŋe ndá.
en: Then Joseph being raised from sleep did as the angel of the Lord had bidden him, and took unto him his wife:

ngiemboon: Tá’ pɔ́ yé ké ńdá’ tè nuŋe, tà á gÿo ńzyé múɔ ŋwɛ́, Yesyɛ̂b tsẅi lezíŋ sé lê Yěsô
en: and knew her not till she had brought forth her firstborn son: and he called his name JESUS.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ne ńgwá ńzɛ́te pú’u, ànò àyɛ̌ gwe metuŋó fùɔ*Herôd, ḿbú ńcu’u twó yé, ńcu’u twó pʉ̀a metsèm tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ Yerósalem.
en: When Herod the king had heardthese things, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.

ngiemboon: á nue àfùɔ gẅie à ge lá’ sá’ pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn pà Israel ge lá’ kẅɛ pɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi».
en: That shall rule my people Israel.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gyá pú’u, ḿbú ńkág tɛ’,
en: When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceeding great joy.

ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̂b lu ssé pɔ́ letsẅɛ́’, ńkaa múɔ, pâ mápfò gʉa lê tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Egipto,
en: When he arose, he took the young child and his mother by night, and departed into Egypt:

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ pú’u, ḿbumte nà nò gie Yeremi,*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé la tʉ́ njÿó ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremy the prophet, saying,

ngiemboon: Á pú tè né ńkwoŋo ngie mé tsí’i ntse nÿɔ́g mé wɔ́».
en: And would not be comforted, because they are not.

ngiemboon: *Herôd la gwɔ́ tà ńkwé, Yesyɛ̂b lyé njÿòon Egipto, ńgyá àtsɔ̌*Cÿɔ́’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tó,
en: But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeareth in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,

ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̂b lu ssé, ńkáa múɔ, pâ mápfò ne ḿbiŋe nzèm né tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Israel,
en: And he arose, and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.

ngiemboon: Á zye ńnéŋe, Jâŋ Mbabtis kẅɛɛ nkwòŋo tsẅɛ Jẅidea, ńně sá’a ngie:
en: In those days came John the Baptist, preaching in the wilderness of Judæa,

ngiemboon: Pi kúbe mà gẅi, á nue àfʉ̀’ gie Ssé ge nyɛ lefùɔ sé tsoté tà ne ḿbɔ́ɔnte.
en: and saying, Repent ye: for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.

ngiemboon: ńgÿo melyěen nzsè mé e tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ».
en: Make his paths straight.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a ně fóo Yerósalem, éfóo Jẅidea, mbɔɔ ná pàga ngwòŋ gie áa ngʉ̀ŋe ntse Jurdeŋ, ńtóo, ńgyá Jâŋ,
en: Then went out to him Jerusalem, and all Judæa, and all the region round about Jordan,

ngiemboon: ńtyé mvfò mânyìŋ ntsèm, ńzẅíŋe meno tepoŋ mɔ́b, á nu’u wɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ ntse Jurdeŋ.
en: and were baptized of him in Jordan, confessing their sins.

ngiemboon: Pi gÿo pɔ́ menò mbòŋo mie e nyɛɛ ngie pi kubé mà.
en: Bring forth therefore fruits meet for repentance:

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké fó Galilea ńtóo ncwò ntse Jurdeŋ, ńgyá Jâŋ légwɔ́ gie Jâŋ ge nu’u yé ntse.
en: Then cometh Jesus from Galilee to Jordan unto John, to be baptized of him.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ ně ńdʉ’ʉ, ńně ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Gù zɔ gẅiin lénu’u wɔ̀ɔn ntse, ɔ̀ pǐŋ ńtó ngie mèŋ n nu’u gú tsɛ̀ɛ ntse lá?
en: But John forbad him, saying, I have need to be baptized of thee, and comest thou to me?

ngiemboon: Ngyè fó tÿǒ lepwó ngie: Wɔɔn aa Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n kwoŋo yé tɛ’, aa wɔ̀ɔn lekág
en: and lo a voice from heaven, saying, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.

ngiemboon: À Zẅìge Ssé fó jʉ’ó, ńdɔgɔ Yěsô ńgee nkwòŋo tsẅɛ, pá’ Sátà ge kwa’te yé.
en: Then was Jesus led up of the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted of the devil.

ngiemboon: Á ńnéŋe wó lyɛ̌’ lá’ móm lekùɔ té pfɛ́ɛ mmó tà nzyè gyáŋa yé.
en: And when he had fasted forty days and forty nights, he was afterward an hungred.

ngiemboon: Sátà tó ńkwa’te yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Pá’ ɔɔ Míŋ Ssé lá, leen ńké ńtsẅi né metóon pɛ̂ ngie é sele ńcʉ́’ʉ mmó léjÿó ɔ̀ jÿó.
en: And when the tempter came to him, he said, If thou be the Son of God, command that these stones be made bread.

ngiemboon: Sátà lɔgɔ Yěsô ńgʉa lê tÿǒsoŋ Yerósalem, ńtÿɔ́gɔ yé nà ntsɔ́’ gie ee*jʉ’ʉ Ssé,
en: Then the devil taketh him up into the holy city, and setteth him on a pinnacle of the temple,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńkẅí’te mvfò mèŋ ńgu’te wɔ̀ɔn, m bú ńná né gu.
en: and saith unto him, All these things will I give thee, if thou wilt fall down and worship me.

ngiemboon: Sátà leen ńké ńnyé Yěsô.*Mecÿɔ́’ Ssé tó, ne ńkẅéte yé.
en: Then the devil leaveth him, and, behold, angels came and ministered unto him.

ngiemboon: Mé la ńnéŋe Jâŋ ndá tsǎŋ, Yěsô gÿo ńjú’, ńgʉa lê Galilea,
en: Now when Jesus had heard that John was cast into prison, he departed into Galilee;

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ pú’u, tá nò gie Esǎya*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé la gɔɔn lɔg ḿbumte. À la gɔɔn ngie:
en: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet, saying,

ngiemboon: pi pʉ̀a Galilea, pi pie pi lâ pʉ̀a pie e té Ssé zsé neŋé
en: Galilee of the Gentiles;

ngiemboon: ná pʉ̀a pie e ka neŋé tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie ssé nzěm we legwé à kaa wó».
en: Light is sprung up.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi tó, ńcʉ́me nzèm mèŋ, n dɔgɔ gẅi ńgÿo pàfà’ pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: And he saith unto them,Follow me, and I will make you fishers of men.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwóon ńnyé menkÿò ńcʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: And they straightway lefttheirnets, and followed him.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwóon ńnyé kanú’ mbɔɔ tá wɔb ńcʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: And they immediately left the ship and their father, and followed him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá pá’ menùɔ lá’ tǒ, ńkwɔ́’ɔ ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́, ńnéŋe ssé,*ngàŋa kwò yé tó ńkẅɛ́te yé.
en: And seeing the multitudes, he went up into a mountain: and when he was set, his disciples came unto him:

ngiemboon: Á zye léla’te nò mbwó pɔ́b ngie:
en: and he opened his mouth, and taught them, saying,

ngiemboon: mélà’mie pɔ́ ge gÿo jÿó pì*lefùɔ Ssé.
en: Blessedarethe poor in spirit: for their's is the kingdom of heaven.

ngiemboon: mélà’mie Ssé ge gÿo tsí’i ntse nÿɔ́g mɔ́b
en: Blessedarethey that mourn: for they shall be comforted.

ngiemboon: «mélà’mie pɔ́ ge gÿo jÿó ngwòŋ».
en: Blessedarethe meek: for they shall inherit the earth.

ngiemboon: «mélà’mie Ssé ge gÿo pɔ́ gÿo yɛ̌ mmó».
en: Blessedarethey which do hunger and thirst after righteousness: for they shall be filled.

ngiemboon: «mélà’mie e Ssé ge gÿo tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mɔ́b yɔ́b».
en: Blessedarethe merciful: for they shall obtain mercy.

ngiemboon: «mélà’mie pɔ́ ge gÿo gyá Ssé».
en: Blessedarethe pure in heart: for they shall see God.

ngiemboon: «mélà’mie mé ge lá’ tóŋo wɔ́b lê púɔ Ssé».
en: Blessedarethe peacemakers: for they shall be called the children of God.

ngiemboon: «mélà’mie pɔ́ ge gÿo jÿó pì*lefùɔ Ssé».
en: Blessedarethey which are persecuted for righteousness' sake: for their's is the kingdom of heaven.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔɔ kyɛ̀’ tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó. Mé lɔɔn ńkwɛ́ɛ tÿǒsoŋ ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á le lyeen.
en: Ye are the light of the world. A city that is set on an hill cannot be hid.

ngiemboon: Aa yɛ̌ tá á poŋ ngie pi kyɛ’ pʉ̀a mesoŋ tá pɔ́ gyá nò mbòŋo gie pi ne ńgÿo, ńdeen ńké ńgu’te Tá gẅi gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó.
en: Let your light so shine before men, that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father which is in heaven.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, àngàŋ ge lá’ gwɔ kẅɛɛ tsǎŋ, é pú toŋo kɔ́ɔkɔ́ gie mé ne ńkʉ́a mbwo yé tà tsɔ́ le pyé.
en: Verily I say unto thee, Thou shalt by no means come out thence, till thou hast paid the uttermost farthing.

ngiemboon: Pi la jú’ ngie mé la gɔɔn ngie: «Tà nyìŋ lá’ ńgÿo gÿɛ́».
en: Ye have heard that it was said by them of old time, Thou shalt not commit adultery:

ngiemboon: Mé la gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: «Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgee ńjwoŋ nzwě we, á náa ŋwà’ne lélɔg ńjwoŋo yé».
en: It hath been said, Whosoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a writing of divorcement:

ngiemboon: Tà pi lɔgɔ tsetsá’ ńkʉa, á nue ee ntÿɔgɔ́ mekwó Ssé. Tà pi lɔgɔ Yerósalem ńkʉa, á nue aa tÿǒsoŋ fùɔ we lÿò
en: nor by the earth; for it is his footstool: neither by Jerusalem; for it is the city of the great King.

ngiemboon: Tè ké ńdɔgɔ twó jú ńkʉa nò, á nue ńgwɔ́ ɔ̀ légÿo tà’ nnoŋo twó jù fɔ́g wɔ́, é ke légÿo é síŋ wɔ́.
en: Neither shalt thou swear by thy head, because thou canst not make one hair white or black.

ngiemboon: Oon gẅi gwɔ́ pɔ́ oon, ngǎŋ gẅi gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngǎŋ, àgie mé kẅi’i mǒ fóo mbwó Sátà.
en: But let your communication be, Yea, yea; Nay, nay: for whatsoever is more than these cometh of evil.

ngiemboon: Pi la jú’ ngie mé la gɔɔn ngie: «Nyìŋ pyág lejÿɔ́g nyìŋ, àngàŋ pyág sé, nyìŋ tsɔ́’ lesoŋ nyìŋ, àngàŋ tsɔ́’ sé».
en: Ye have heard that it hath been said, An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth:

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ fa’a lésẅiŋe nyìŋ jʉ’e ntsaŋ, pá’ à ge gwoon nzsǒ ngàŋ yé ma’ e kẅé, àngàŋ pú ńnyé wɔ́b yé fÿɔ́g né yé.
en: And if any man will sue thee at the law, and take away thy coat, let him havethycloke also.

ngiemboon: Mékéle lɔg tʉ̀ sẅɛ́ɛ nyìŋ ngie à kaa pì’ yé, ńdɔg ńgiŋe mmó tà’ kilometà lê gwǒŋ, á lɔg ńgiŋe nà mmó mekilometà méntá.
en: And whosoever shall compel thee to go a mile, go with him twain.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ náa mmó mbwó nyìŋ gẅie à ne ńdúɔ mmó mbwó yé. Tà nyìŋ ké ńtém nzèm nyìŋ gẅie à zɛté ngie à fuu yé mmó.
en: Give to him that asketh thee, and from him that would borrow of thee turn not thou away.

ngiemboon: Pi la jú’ ngie mé la gɔɔn ngie: «Nyìŋ kwoŋo fɛ́ we nyìŋ mesoŋ, ḿbʉa ngàŋ mbù we».
en: Ye have heard that it hath been said, Thou shalt love thy neighbour, and hate thine enemy.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńtsyɛ’te pɔ́ ndà’ mefɛ́ pí, mbà pi gÿǒ kɔ́ yé sẅé? Pàte zsé Ssé gíŋe ne ńgÿo yɔ́b pɔ́ pú’u.
en: And if ye salute your brethren only, what do ye morethan others? do not even the publicans so?

ngiemboon: Pú’u lá, pi gwɔ́ pàtè*lɔ̌’, pá’ Tá gẅi gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó aa tè*lɔ̌’
en: Be ye therefore perfect, even as your Father which is in heaven is perfect.

ngiemboon: Tá á gʉa ná gu, mbà ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńge ńná nkáb mbwó pàte mmó, ɔ̀ pɔ́ɔn légÿo tà mbòŋ shǔ gù zsé.
en: But when thou doest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth:

ngiemboon: Tà pi fʉ̀’ʉ wɔ́b, á nue Tá gẅi à ne ńzsé mmó gie á ne ńzága mbwó pi, tà pi gwaa lúɔ á ne ńzsé.
en: Be not ye therefore like unto them: for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of, before ye ask him.

ngiemboon: Gÿo pʉ̀a mesoŋ zsé ngie ee ndà’ gú ńgwɔ́ Ssé.
en: After this manner therefore pray ye: Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name.

ngiemboon: Gÿo mé ne ńjú’u ncwò gú ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, pá’ mé ne jú’u tÿǒ lepwó.
en: Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done in earth, asit isin heaven.

ngiemboon: Náa yég mmó léjÿó gie á ge ku’u ná peg nà lyɛ̌’ɔɔn,
en: Give us this day our daily bread.

ngiemboon: lege mefʉa még, ńná né peg, pá’ peg ne ńdege yég ńnáa mbwó pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ fʉ̌a nò mbwó peg la.
en: And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors.

ngiemboon: Áa pú’u, ńgwɔ́ gie pi lɔɔn ńzɔɔn ńdege mefʉa petsɔ́ pʉ̀a, tá mbà Tá gẅi gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó ge gÿo lege mí gí.
en: For if ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you:

ngiemboon: Tá’ pi lɔɔn ńké tè lege mefʉa petsɔ́ pʉ̀a wɔ́, mbà Tá gẅi těen nge gÿo lege mí gí wɔ́
en: but if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná gù, mbà ɔ̀ lɔɔn ne ńnéŋe nzyè lésẅíŋte Ssé, ɔ̀ sɔg shÿó gú, ésyɛbɛ twó jú.
en: But thou, when thou fastest, anoint thine head, and wash thy face;

ngiemboon: Á nue eshúm tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ shú lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nzɔ̌ wɔ́, mbà ntʉ́m gú ge gwɔ́ pɔ́ jʉ’ó.
en: for where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.

ngiemboon: Menÿɔ́g mú ee mbwó gù ńgwɔ́ pá’ lâm gẅie ɔ̀ lɔgɔ ńgyá jʉ’, menÿɔ́g mú lɔɔn tè síŋ, mbà ɔ̀ ge gyá jʉ’ mboŋó.
en: The light of the body is the eye: if therefore thine eye be single, thy whole body shall be full of light.

ngiemboon: Àwɔ̌ aa ná pi gẅie ńgwɔ́ á seen ńdɔg pɔ́ pá’ à pǔ’ mbùm ye, ńku’u lékẅi’i tà’a lyɛ̌’ nà melyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ mé?
en: Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?

ngiemboon: Tà pi gíŋe ḿbú’ mbùm gi, ńgɔɔn ngie mé ge pfɛ́ɛ kɔ́? Mé ge lɔg ntse nzɔ̌ é núu? Mé ge lɔg nzsǒ nzɔ̌ é ma’a?
en: Therefore take no thought, saying, What shall we eat? or, What shall we drink? or, Wherewithal shall we be clothed?

ngiemboon: Pi vɔg mvfò fa’ pɔ́ nò*lefùɔ Ssé, lâ mmó gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, à leen ńké ńcʉ́’ʉ ńnáa sɛ̌ shúm ńdɔgɔ ńkẅi’i kẅi’i.
en: But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.

ngiemboon: Tà pi ńnéŋe ńtúu*melɔ̌’ pʉ̀a, ḿbɔ́g Ssé létúu gí*lɔ̌’.
en: Judge not, that ye be not judged.

ngiemboon: Pi lúɔ, e Ssé ge náa mbwó pi. Pi fa’, e Ssé ge gÿo pi gyá. Pi kwá’te ncwò ndá, à ge tsɔ́’ ńná né pi.
en: Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you:

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lúɔ mmó, mbà mé ge náa mbwó yé, éfa’, mbà à ge gyá, ḿbiŋ ńkwá’te ncwò ndá, mbà mé ge tsɔ́’ e ná né yé.
en: for every one that asketh receiveth; and he that seeketh findeth; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened.

ngiemboon: Pi pɛ̀ ńgwɔ́ metá penkʉ́, míŋ wɔ̌ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi lɔɔn ńdúɔ mbelég, mbà à ge náa tóon né yé?
en: Or what man is there of you, whom if his son ask bread, will he give him a stone?

ngiemboon: Míŋ wɔ̌ lúɔ mbab ssó, mbà à ge gwoon nnú ńnáa mbwó yé?
en: Or if he ask a fish, will he give him a serpent?

ngiemboon: Tá ncwò nká’ gẅie é gee lá’ letsẅɛ́ temi, kʉ́mte kʉmtě. Mánzsè piŋ ńtege tege, pà pfó wɛ̌ té gyɔ́ɔn.
en: because straitisthe gate, and narrowisthe way, which leadeth unto life, and few there be that find it.

ngiemboon: Tÿǒ mbòŋo zém pɔ́ ntɔ̌ɔn mbòŋo, tá tÿǒ tepòŋ zém pɔ́ ntɔ̌ɔn tepòŋ,
en: Even so every good tree bringeth forth good fruit; but a corrupt tree bringeth forth evil fruit.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ tÿǒ mbòŋo le zém ntɔ̌ɔn tepòŋ wɔ́, àtÿǒ tepòŋ ké le zém ntɔ̌ɔn mbòŋo wɔ́.
en: A good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit, neithercana corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.

ngiemboon: Àtÿǒ gie á té zém ntɔ̌ɔn mbòŋo wɔ́, mé kɔ́’ ńtuɔ mmɔ̌g.
en: Every tree that bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, pi ge gÿo gwaa zsé pʉ̀a pie é cÿɔɔ nò ngie pɔ̀ ee pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé, é cʉa pɔ́ ná mà wɔ́b
en: Wherefore by their fruits ye shall know them.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n deen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ tè gẅi zsé, pi ee pàfʉate menò, pi fó lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ ńtsíŋte nnɛ́
en: And then will I profess unto them, I never knew you: depart from me, ye that work iniquity.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zí’i pʉ̀a mɔ̀ɔn menò tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, àlá’ pú mɔ̂ɔn ye ntí lézí’i pʉ̀a mmó,
en: And it came to pass, when Jesus had ended these sayings, the people were astonished at his doctrine:

ngiemboon: mélà’mie à lɔ̌ɔn ntě ńgÿo pá’*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê wɔ́. À lɔ̌ɔn ńzí’i tà ńzsé mmó gie à gÿo yɛ̌.
en: For he taught them asonehaving authority, and not as the scribes.

ngiemboon: Yěsô piŋ, ńgwaa fó ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́ sẅɛ́’, menùɔ lá’ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn cʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: When he was come down from the mountain, great multitudes followed him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô jú’, ńtsege pwó ńkíbe yé, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Mèŋ n kwǒŋ pú’u, zeŋe, nkà’ gwóon ḿmaga ná yé, á gwóon ńzeŋe.
en: And Jesus put forthhishand, and touched him, saying,I will; be thou clean.And immediately his leprosy was cleansed.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gʉa tà ńkúu tÿǒsoŋ Kapernawúm, àtsɔ̌ tándá ncù pà*Roma zá’a yé, ésẅíŋte yé,
en: And when Jesus was entered into Capernaum, there came unto him a centurion, beseeching him,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mênkʉ́ wɔ̀ɔn nuŋe ndá, mbà kwʉ́’te gwǒon yé, à ne ńgyá ngɔ́’ tɛ’.
en: and saying, Lord, my servant lieth at home sick of the palsy, grievously tormented.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Mèŋ n ge gʉa gÿo à zeŋe.
en: And Jesus saith unto him,I will come and heal him.

ngiemboon: Megʉ̀ gwaa gwɔ́ wó, mbà mé kẅilé púɔ ntɔ́’ ńnáa pǐ tsɛ̀ɛ mwòon nzém. Pɔ́ gwɔ́ wó ne ńdʉate, melóŋ pɔ́b ne ffó
en: But the children of the kingdom shall be cast out into outer darkness: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

ngiemboon: Yěsô fó jʉ’ó ńgʉa ndá piɛ, ńkúu wó ńgyá màkẅi’ Piɛ nuŋe, nnɛ́ ne ńkwɔ́’ɔ yé.
en: And when Jesus was come into Peter's house, he saw his wife's mother laid, and sick of a fever.

ngiemboon: Yěsô kíbe pwó yé, nnɛ́ zá’a. Á nyɛte shúm ńdɔg ńdye yé.
en: And he touched her hand, and the fever left her: and she arose, and ministered unto them.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá pá’ lá’ cú’te lejʉ́ŋ yé tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, ńtsẅi mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie pâ pɔ́ túm né yetsɔ́ nzǐŋ ntse.
en: Now when Jesus saw great multitudes about him, he gave commandment to depart unto the other side.

ngiemboon: Àtsɔ̌ nkyàgte*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê tóo lejʉ́ŋ yé ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: tsítsà, ɔ̀ ge gʉa nzɔ̌ wɔ́, mèŋ n ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nzèm gù.
en: And a certain scribe came, and said unto him, Master, I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest.

ngiemboon: Àtsɔ̌ tà’ ná pʉ̀a pie ee nzèm yé gɔɔn né yé ngie: Àndè cʉ́’ mèŋ n zɔɔn ńgʉa ńtúŋo tá wɔ̀ɔn.
en: And another of his disciples said unto him, Lord, suffer me first to go and bury my father.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó yé ngie: Cʉ́m pɔ́ nzèm mèŋ, ńnyé mepfó pɔ́ túŋ mepfó pɔ́b.
en: But Jesus said unto him,Follow me; and let the dead bury their dead.

ngiemboon: Yěsô kúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’,*ngàŋa kwò yé kú yɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ wó,
en: And when he was entered into a ship, his disciples followed him.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tóo lejʉ́ŋ yé, ńne ńzyeen yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, kẅé wég mbwó legwé. Pège kwě tà ńdem.
en: And his disciples came tohim, and awoke him, saying, Lord, save us: we perish.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ métsèm pú ḿmɔɔn, ńgɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Yɔ̀ɔn ee yɛ̌ ntí nyìŋ tà mbɔɔ fóm pɔ́ ntse jú’u ncwò wé?
en: But the men marvelled, saying, What manner of man is this, that even the winds and the sea obey him!

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́ àtsɔ́ nùɔ mekúnɔ́ɔn gwɔ́ ngʉ̀ŋe jʉ’ó ńne ńgwá ńkʉ́’ʉ ḿpfɛ́ɛ shúm.
en: And there was a good way off from them an herd of many swine feeding.

ngiemboon: *Messé tepòŋ sẅíŋte Yěsô ngie: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńjwoŋo wég, ɔ̀ zẅíŋ peg gʉa ńkúu nà nùɔ mekúnɔ́ɔn pi.
en: So the devils besought him, saying, If thou cast us out, suffer us to go away into the herd of swine.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn pú’u, Yěsô kúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, ńtúm ntse ḿbiŋ né tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ yɔ́b,
en: And he entered into a ship, and passed over, and came into his own city.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê gwɔ́ jʉ’ó, ńjú’, ńne ńgɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Nyìŋ wɔ̀ɔn kaŋá lʉŋe Ssé mboo!
en: And, behold, certain of the scribes said within themselves, Thismanblasphemeth.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zsé mmó gie pɔ́ ne ńkwaŋa, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gÿo lêkɔ́ ńgẅiin yɛ̀ ntí mekwaŋá tepòŋ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m gẅí?
en: And Jesus knowing their thoughts said,Wherefore think ye evil in your hearts?

ngiemboon: Pi gyǎ ngie á zeŋe pɔ́ légɔɔn né nyìŋ ngie: Mé legé menò tepòŋ mú, ka pɔ́ légɔɔn ngie lu ssé ńgiŋ?
en: For whether is easier, to say,Thysins be forgiven thee; or to say, Arise, and walk?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ lu ssé, ńgʉa nê mbʉ̀a yé.
en: And he arose, and departed to his house.

ngiemboon: Àlá’ gyá yɔ̀ɔn nò á kʉ’ʉ wɔ́b, pɔ́ ne ńgu’te Ssé ná pá’ à nǎ yɔ̀ɔn ntí metʉ̀ mbwó pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: But when the multitudes sawit, they marvelled, and glorified God, which had given such power unto men.

ngiemboon: Megàŋa kwò Jâŋ gÿo ńtó, ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: Peg lâ pà*farisay neŋé ńkwoŋ kwoŋ ńnéŋe nzyè, epú ké tè pú’u, gÿo mélà’a kɔ́?
en: Then came to him the disciples of John, saying, Why do we and the Pharisees fast oft, but thy disciples fast not?

ngiemboon: Yěsô lu ssé, pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé cʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: And Jesus arose, and followed him, andso didhis disciples.

ngiemboon: mélà’mie à la ne ńgɔɔn ngie: N dɔɔn ńzé’e pwó yɔ́ɔn tà fó ńkíbe pɔ́ nzsǒ yé, mbà mèŋ n ge zeŋe!
en: for she said within herself, If I may but touch his garment, I shall be whole.

ngiemboon: Pi gʉate, múɔ manzwě kaa kwé, à lye lyě. Àlá’ jú’ ńgẅe yé gẅe.
en: he said unto them,Give place: for the maid is not dead, but sleepeth.And they laughed him to scorn.

ngiemboon: Mé fó ndá ńkẅile pʉ̀a. Yěsô kúu ndà, ńkíbe pwó múɔ manzwě, á gwóon ńdu ssé.
en: But when the people were put forth, he went in, and took her by the hand, and the maid arose.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔgɔ yɔ̀ɔn nò ḿbú saa jʉ’ nà yɛ̌ pàga ngwòŋ.
en: And the fame hereof went abroad into all that land.

ngiemboon: Menÿɔ́g mɔ́b leen ńké ńgyá jʉ’. Yěsô tɔ’ɔ wɔ́b ngie: MÀbɔ́ɔn gẅi lé ké ńgÿo tà nyìŋ zsé pá’ á cʉ̌a pú’u.
en: And their eyes were opened; and Jesus straitly charged them, saying,Seethatno man knowit.

ngiemboon: Tá’ pɔ́ zyɛ́’ tà ńkúu pǐ ńdɔg lezíŋ Yěsô ḿbú saa jʉ’ ntsèm ná yɛ̌ pàga lá’.
en: But they, when they were departed, spread abroad his fame in all that country.

ngiemboon: Pàfʉ̀ menÿɔ́g gwaa fó ndá kẅɛ, mé lɔgɔ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ńtóo mvfò Yěsô, mbà tsɔ́*ssé tepòŋ la gÿo á cʉ́’ʉ mbu’ ncwò.
en: As they went out, behold, they brought to him a dumb man possessed with a devil.

ngiemboon: Tá’ pà*farisay gɔɔn yɔ́b ngie: Tándá*messé tepòŋ zɔ gÿo tá Yěsô ku’u léjwoŋ*messé tepòŋ
en: But the Pharisees said, He casteth out devils through the prince of the devils.

ngiemboon: Á leen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwó*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Eshúm sie mé gee nká’ ńdagá é gyɔ́ɔn tɛ’, nzẅìŋ ngàŋa fà’ piŋ ńkɔ́g.
en: Then saith he unto his disciples,The harvest trulyisplenteous, but the labourersarefew;

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie pi sẅíŋte ngàŋ nká’ à kẅi’i megàŋa fà’ pie pɔ́ ge ne laga shúm sé.
en: Pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he will send forth labourers into his harvest.

ngiemboon: ńgÿo Símo múɔ ngwòŋ pɔ́ Jẅidas Iskariod gẅie à la gÿo sẅiŋe Yěsô
en: Simon the Canaanite, and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him.

ngiemboon: Pi gʉa fa’ pɔ́*menjʉ̀njÿò Ssé mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ mendá pà Israel, mbà é la pyé.
en: but go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.

ngiemboon: Pi gʉa sá’ éshwóŋ pʉ̀a ngie:*Lefùɔ Ssé tsoté tà ne ḿbɔ́ɔnte.
en: And as ye go, preach, saying, The kingdom of heaven is at hand.

ngiemboon: Tà pi néŋ nkáb pɔ̀ɔn, tà mbɔɔ pá’ e gwɔ́ pɔ́ láa wɔ́.
en: Provide neither gold, nor silver, nor brass in your purses,

ngiemboon: Pi gʉa tà ńkúu ndá nyìŋ, pi gɔɔn ngie: E Ssé néŋ mbʉ́lè tsɛ̀ɛ yɔ̀ɔn ndá.
en: And when ye come into an house, salute it.

ngiemboon: Pi laga twó gí, mélà’mie pʉ̀a mesoŋ ge gÿo sẅiŋe gẅi mé ŋaga gẅí, ńdɔ́g mengwɔ̀ɔn ńcuɔ gẅi á tsɛ̀ɛ*mendá cú’tè mɔ́b
en: But beware of men: for they will deliver you up to the councils, and they will scourge you in their synagogues;

ngiemboon: mélà’mie pi zɔ tě ge zɔɔn lá’ gɔɔn nò wɔ. Àzẅìge Tá gẅi zɔ̌ ge lá’ lɔgɔ gẅi gɔɔn nò.
en: For it is not ye that speak, but the Spirit of your Father which speaketh in you.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a metsèm ge lá’ pú pʉ̀a gẅi mélà’ mɔ́ɔn, tá’ nyìŋ gẅíe à shÿɔ̌g shÿɔg tè kʉ́a zɔ ge gÿo tsẅɛ́
en: And ye shall be hated of allmenfor my name's sake: but he that endureth to the end shall be saved.

ngiemboon: Nzì’i mmó tè tsítsà we cʉa, nkwɔɔn piŋ ńké tè tá we cʉa.
en: The disciple is not abovehismaster, nor the servant above his lord.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà pi, mbà Ssé ne ńzsé nzẅìŋ menoŋo twó mí.
en: But the very hairs of your head are all numbered.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi pɔ́ɔn légíŋe ḿbɔ́g, pi ee mbwó Ssé ńgwɔ́ mmó tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ ńcʉa mejʉŋé tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: Fear ye not therefore, ye are of more value than many sparrows.

ngiemboon: Tà pi kwaŋ ngie mèŋ n ka lɔg mbʉ́lè ńtóo ndùmo ssé tsetsá’. Mèŋ n ka tè lɔg mbʉ́lè ńtó wɔ́, ńka lɔg pɔ́ fagte ńtó.
en: Think not that I am come to send peace on earth: I came not to send peace, but a sword.

ngiemboon: Megàŋ mbù nyìŋ ge kẅɛ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ tsìŋe ndá yɔ́b
en: And a man's foesshall bethey of his own household.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn tè kaa yé tÿǒ nkǐ, ńdɔg ńzẅíŋe lékwé tá ńcʉ́me nzèm mèŋ wɔ́, mbà ńgwɔ́ á le ku’u légwɔ́*ngàŋa kwò wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́
en: And he that taketh not his cross, and followeth after me, is not worthy of me.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ngie à ge pɔ́ɔn we légwɔ́ wó, mbà à ge pyé, tá nyìŋ gẅie à pǐŋ ńzẅíŋe lépyé mélà’ mɔ́ɔn zɔ gÿó ńgwɔ́ wó.
en: He that findeth his life shall lose it: and he that loseth his life for my sake shall find it.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńkúe gẅí, mbà à kúe pɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn, nyìŋ piŋ ńkúe wɔ̀ɔn, mbà à kúe pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn
en: He that receiveth you receiveth me, and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me.

ngiemboon: aa*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie mé ne ńzẅí’te yé lá ka pɔ́ gíŋ ńzẅí’te pɔ́ tsɔ́ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ wɔ́?
en: and said unto him, Art thou he that should come, or do we look for another?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa ńgyá Yěsô, á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Pi gʉa ḿbíte mmó gie pi jǔ’ mbɔɔ gie pi gyǎ éshwóŋó Jâŋ,
en: Jesus answered and said unto them,Go and shew John again those things which ye do hear and see:

ngiemboon: Àshÿó mbòŋo aa nyìŋ gẅie à tè kwɔɔnte ná*Míŋ Nyìŋ gwe ssé wɔ́!
en: And blessed ishe, whosoever shall not be offended in me.

ngiemboon: Tà pi kɔ̌ɔn ńgee ńgyá pɔ́ wɔ́? Á*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé lá? Oon tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋó gẅí, à kaa wɛ̌, tà ńcʉa mbɔɔ*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: But what went ye out for to see? A prophet? yea, I say unto you, and more than a prophet.

ngiemboon: ńne ńnyɛte mánzsè gù tá ɔ̀ tó».
en: Which shall prepare thy way before thee.

ngiemboon: Aa pá’ɔɔn, mélà’mie Mǒsê pâ pà Ntsẅì Nkʉ̀ Ssé metsèm la gɔɔn nò tà ńkúu ná fʉ̀’ yé Jâŋ.
en: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin metuŋó lélɔg ńjú’u nò á jú’.
en: He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

ngiemboon: Peg ka pú’ leluŋó pi tè zíŋ, ńtú legwé pi tè lʉa.
en: and saying, We have piped unto you, and ye have not danced; we have mourned unto you, and ye have not lamented.

ngiemboon: Wɛ̂ kwà’ pá’ pɔ́ la gÿo nà Jâŋ. À la tó à tè mmó pfɛ́, à tè melù’ ńnú, pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie aa pʉ̀a.
en: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, He hath a devil.

ngiemboon: Aa mmó gie á gÿo mèŋ n gɔɔn ngie: Á ge lá’ gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ gie e Ssé ŋaga pʉ̀a mesoŋ, égi ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ cʉa yé pʉ̀a Sodom.
en: But I say unto you, That it shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom in the day of judgment, than for thee.

ngiemboon: Oon me Tá wɔ̀ɔn, ɔ̀ la gyá ngie ɔ̀ ge gÿo yɔ̀ɔn nò pɔ́ pú’u.
en: Even so, Father: for so it seemed good in thy sight.

ngiemboon: Pi metsèm pie pi kǎ pì’ á zɛɛ gẅi tà pi kʉ́a, pi tó ńtsɛ́ɛ wɔ̀ɔn, n gÿo pi zẅɛte.
en: Come unto me, allyethat labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.

ngiemboon: Àyɔ́ɔn*kɔ̌’ pʉ́le, àpì’ gie mèŋ n gee gÿo pi kaa, á zéŋe zeŋe lékaa.
en: For my yokeiseasy, and my burden is light.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋó gẅí, tsɔ̌ nyìŋ aa jʉ’ɔɔn ḿbú ńcʉa*jʉ’ʉ Ssé.
en: But I say unto you, That in this place isonegreater than the temple.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie:*Míŋ Nyìŋ zɔ zɔɔn ńgẅiin légɔɔn mmó gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé gÿo nà lyɛ’ɛ́ nzse pa Yuda.
en: For the Son of man is Lord even of the sabbath day.

ngiemboon: Yěsô fó jʉ’ó, ńgʉa ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ*ndá cú’tè pɔ́b.
en: And when he was departed thence, he went into their synagogue:

ngiemboon: Á cʉa pà*farisay, pɔ́ fó*ndá cú’tè ńkẅɛ, ńcú’te fa’ shÿó pá’ pɔ́ ge gÿo tá zẅé Yěsô
en: Then the Pharisees went out, and held a council against him, how they might destroy him.

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ńtɔ’ɔ wɔ́b tà ḿbʉ́, ngie pɔ́ pɔ́ɔn légÿo tà mé zsé nyìŋ gẅie aa wɛ̌.
en: and charged them that they should not make him known:

ngiemboon: Pú’u, ànò gie Ssé la lɔg ncwò Ntsẅì Nkʉ̀ we Esǎya ńgɔɔn, á lɔgɔ ḿbumte
en: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet, saying,

ngiemboon: à gÿo ńnyɛ ntí lesá’a lá’ gie ee ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mbwó melá’ mie e té pà Israel wɔ́.
en: And he shall shew judgment to the Gentiles.

ngiemboon: Mé ké le jú’ á tyé metwó nzsè ńnáa shwóŋò wɔ́.
en: Neither shall any man hear his voice in the streets.

ngiemboon: é ké lá’ gÿo pɔ́ pú’u, tà ntí lesá’a lá’ gie ee ndʉŋ ndʉŋ e jÿó mânyìŋ ntsèm.
en: Till he send forth judgment unto victory.

ngiemboon: Mengwòŋ ntsèm tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó cʉ́’ʉ ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ yé ńnéŋe».
en: And in his name shall the Gentiles trust.

ngiemboon: Àlá’ ntsèm pú ńgyá ḿmɔɔn tɛ’, ńgɔɔn ngie: Ndyɛ̀’ tsɔ́ aa nyìŋ na ngẅɛ fùɔ Ndavíd wɛ̌.
en: And all the people were amazed, and said, Is not this the son of David?

ngiemboon: Lefùɔ se Sátà gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ kwà’ pú’u, epʉ̀a pé lɔɔn fagte, ńzye lesele ńdÿɔ́’ ncù tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, mbà lefùɔ sé ge pyé.
en: and if Satan cast out Satan, he is divided against himself; how shall then his kingdom stand?

ngiemboon: E Ssé ge lá’ lɔg pɔ́ nò gie á lǎ kẅɛɛ ncwò wɔ̌wɔɔ, ézá’ ntsaŋ yé, à tè gwe, á tsẅɛ́.
en: For by thy words thou shalt be justified, and by thy words thou shalt be condemned.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lá nyé shwóŋó mbwó lá’ shwoŋó, má we pâ mefɛ́ pé tó, ńtyé pǐ ne fa’a légyá yé.
en: hismother and his brethren stood without, desiring to speak with him.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ tó ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Má gù pâ mefɛ́ pú ee pǐ ńne ńtsɔ́ɔn légyá gú.
en: Then one said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren stand without, desiring to speak with thee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Àwɔ̌ aa má wɔ̀ɔn, pàwɔ̌ gwɔ́ mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn?
en: But he answered and said unto him that told him,Who is my mother? and who are my brethren?

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńdɔgɔ pwó ńnyɛ*ngàŋa kwò yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Má wɔ̀ɔn pâ mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn pɛ̀.
en: And he stretched forth his hand toward his disciples, and said,Behold my mother and my brethren!

ngiemboon: Yěsô piŋ ńkẅɛɛ ndá lyɛ̌’o, ńgʉa ńnéŋe ngʉ́ŋe letʉŋ.
en: The same day went Jesus out of the house, and sat by the sea side.

ngiemboon: Á lɔg mesagá nò éshwóŋó wɔ́b menò tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Tsɔ̌ nyìŋ lǎ’ ńgʉa ḿmá’ mbyè mmó,
en: And he spake many things unto them in parables, saying,Behold, a sower went forth to sow;

ngiemboon: ńtóo ḿma’á, tsɔ́ memvòm gwe mánzsè, meshʉ́ŋ tó ńdagte ḿpfɛ́.
en: and when he sowed, someseedsfell by the way side, and the fowls came and devoured them up:

ngiemboon: Nèm gÿo ńtʉ́a mboŋó, ńtuɔ é júm ńtí nue menŋaŋ la tè lyɛɛ ssé wɔ́.
en: and when the sun was up, they were scorched; and because they had no root, they withered away.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ memvòm gwe tsɛ̀ɛ legǐ tepòŋ, legǐ tepóŋ gÿo ńdu sse éfóme mɛ̌.
en: And some fell among thorns; and the thorns sprung up, and choked them:

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin metuŋó lélɔg ńjú’u nò á jú’.
en: Who hath ears to hear, let him hear.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô tóo lejʉ́ŋ yé ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Mélà’a kɔ́ ɔ̀ lɔg pɔ́ sagá nò ńgɔɔn nò mbwó lá’?
en: And the disciples came, and said unto him, Why speakest thou unto them in parables?

ngiemboon: ńne líe jʉ’ é ké le mmó gyá
en: And seeing ye shall see, and shall not perceive:

ngiemboon: ńdɔgɔ tě ńkwoŋo ngie n gÿo pɔ́ zeŋe wɔ́».
en: And should be converted, and I should heal them.

ngiemboon: Tá á gʉa ná pi, mbà pi ee pàshÿó mbòŋo, á nue nÿɔ́g mí ne ńgyá jʉ’, metuŋó mí ne ńjú’u jʉ’.
en: But blessedareyour eyes, for they see: and your ears, for they hear.

ngiemboon: Pi zẅí’te nò gie sagá nò ná nyìŋ gẅie à pye mmó lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn:
en: Hear ye therefore the parable of the sower.

ngiemboon: Àjʉ’e metóon ée pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ jú’u nò Ssé, ésẅɛte ńzẅíŋ nê lekág,
en: But he that received the seed into stony places, the same is he that heareth the word, and anon with joy receiveth it;

ngiemboon: Tá’ mé gwɔ́ tà ńdyé, ngàŋ mbù we tó ḿbye legǐ tepòŋ gẅie à sẅé mmó mbòŋo yá, ńgʉa.
en: but while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat, and went his way.

ngiemboon: Shúm gÿo sá’, ńgú’ tà ńná metsɔ̀’. Mé gyá mmó tepòŋ gwɔ́ tsetsolo.
en: But when the blade was sprung up, and brought forth fruit, then appeared the tares also.

ngiemboon: Á yé ngǎŋ, ńgwɔ́ pi tóo ńtsɔ́’ɔ mmó tepòŋ ŋwɛ́, ḿbú ńtsɔ́’ wɔ́b lâ shùm mbòŋo.
en: But he said, Nay; lest while ye gather up the tares, ye root up also the wheat with them.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ké ńdɔg pɔ́ sagá nò ńgɔɔn mɔɔn menò mbwó lá’. Á lɔ̌ɔn tě ńgɔɔn tsɔ́ nò lê pɔ̌b té sagá nò ńcʉa mǒ wɔ́.
en: All these things spake Jesus unto the multitude in parables; and without a parable spake he not unto them:

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge gÿo shwóŋó wɔ́b menò mie ée lelyěen tà fó fʉ̀’ gie mé la nyɛte njÿó».
en: I will utter things which have been kept secret from the foundation of the world.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Nyìŋ gẅie à pye mmó mbòŋo aa*Míŋ Nyìŋ.
en: He answered and said unto them,He that soweth the good seed is the Son of man;

ngiemboon: Ngàŋ mbù gẅie à pye mbyè mmó ye tepòŋ, á gwɔ́ Sátà. Lelag shúm á gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ɛ nzsònzèm, Megàŋa fà’ gwɔ́*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé.
en: the enemy that sowed them is the devil; the harvest is the end of the world; and the reapers are the angels.

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ mé tsɔ́’ shúm tepòŋ ńtúɔ mmɔ̌g lá, á ge là’ gíŋe gwɔ́ pɔ́ pú’u, ná nzsònzèm lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’.
en: As therefore the tares are gathered and burned in the fire; so shall it be in the end of this world.

ngiemboon: é ma’a wɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ máamáa mmɔ̌g, pɔ́ gwɔ́ jʉ’ó ne ńdʉa, melóŋ pɔ́b ne ffó.
en: and shall cast them into a furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.

ngiemboon: Ànò*lefùɔ Ssé gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ nò ntàŋ metʉ̌a gẅie à fa’a tɔgɔ́ tsye mbòŋo.
en: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a merchant man, seeking goodly pearls:

ngiemboon: À gwɔ̌ tà ńgyá tsɔ́ tɔgɔ́ tsye gie á jÿó nkáb tɛ’, ńgʉa sẅiŋ shúm sé ntsèm ntsèm, ńdɔg nkáb ńtó ńjúu yɛ̌ ŋwɛ́.
en: who, when he had found one pearl of great price, went and sold all that he had, and bought it.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ngie: Àno*lefùɔ Ssé gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pà’ nò lekÿo sie mé ma’a tsɛ̀ɛ letʉŋ, messó kúu tsɛ̀ɛ wó ntí ntí.
en: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a net, that was cast into the sea, and gathered of every kind:

ngiemboon: Á ge lá’ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pú’u, ná nzsònzèm lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’.*Mecÿɔ́’ Ssé ge lá’ tó, éfó nùɔ ngàŋa nò nénʉ́, éfag pʉ̀a tepòŋ,
en: So shall it be at the end of the world: the angels shall come forth, and sever the wicked from among the just,

ngiemboon: é ma’a wɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ mejʉŋ mmɔ̌g. Pɔ́ gwɔ́ jʉ’ó ne ńdʉa, melóŋ pɔ́b ne ffó.
en: and shall cast them into the furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Tà pi jǔ’ mɔɔn menò ntsèm? Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: Oon, peg jǔ’.
en: Jesus saith unto them,Have ye understood all these things?They say unto him, Yea, Lord.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lɔg mesagá nò ńgɔɔn nò mbwó pʉ̀a tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, éfó jʉ’ó ńgʉa
en: And it came to pass,thatwhen Jesus had finished these parables, he departed thence.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pé pe pànzwě metsèm té gwɔ́ pɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege wɔ́ lê? À lɔgɔ yɔɔn ntí menò fóo pɔ́ nzɔ̌?
en: And his sisters, are they not all with us? Whence then hath thismanall these things?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn pú’u, à tè gÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn wó tà é gyɔ́ɔn wɔ́, mélà’mie pɔ́ la tè záb ntʉ́m ná yé wɔ́.
en: And he did not many mighty works there because of their unbelief.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ ayɛ̌,*Herôd gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn sá’a pàga ngwòŋ Galilea jú’ pá’ mé kíme Yěsô ńtí menò mie à ne ńgÿo,
en: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard of the fame of Jesus,

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà Jâŋ ka ne ńgwá ńkaga yé ngie:*Lepʉ̌ té ne ńzẅíŋe ngie à zɔ́’ɔ*Herôdiad wɔ́.
en: For John said unto him, It is not lawful for thee to have her.

ngiemboon: tà á gɔɔn tà ńkʉa ngie: À lɔɔn ńdúɔ pɔ́ kɔ́ mbwó yé wɔ́, mbà á ge ná.
en: Whereupon he promised with an oath to give her whatsoever she would ask.

ngiemboon: Má pà múɔ manzwě tsóte múɔ manzwě ŋwɛ́, ngie à gʉa ńgɔɔn ngie à ne ńkwoŋo twó Jâŋ Mbabtis á tsɛ̀ɛ káŋ pɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn.
en: And she, being before instructed of her mother, said, Give me here John Baptist's head in a charger.

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńké ńtúmo nyìŋ, á gʉa ndá tsǎŋ, ńzá’a twó Jâŋ,
en: And he sent, and beheaded John in the prison.

ngiemboon: ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ káŋ ńdɔg ńtó ńnáa mbwó múɔ manzwě ŋwɛ́, á kẅé, ńgʉa ńnáa mbwó má we.
en: And his head was brought in a charger, and given to the damsel: and she broughtitto her mother.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Jâŋ jú’, ńgʉa ndá tsǎŋ ńkaa pfó yé ńdɔg ńgʉa ńtúŋ. Tà á ku’, pɔ́ gʉa shwóŋó Yěsô nò gie á cʉ̌a.
en: And his disciples came, and took up the body, and buried it, and went and told Jesus.

ngiemboon: Á kúu jʉ’ó, éfó tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’ ńkẅɛ, ńgyá nùɔ lá’, mezìŋe mɔ́b kúu yé. Á zye légÿo megàŋa guɔ pie ée tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b zeŋe.
en: And Jesus went forth, and saw a great multitude, and was moved with compassion toward them, and he healed their sick.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Á té gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie pɔ́ ge gʉa tsɔ́ jʉ’ wɔ́. Pi zɔ náa mmó pɔ́ pfɛ́.
en: But Jesus said unto them,They need not depart; give ye them to eat.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó yé ngie: Peg gẅiin pé ndà’ mbelég mbu’ú ntʉ̀a jʉ’ɔɔn ńgÿo mbaŋ ssó yépʉ́a.
en: And they say unto him, We have here but five loaves, and two fishes.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi lɔg ńtó, ńná né mèŋ jʉ’ɔɔn,
en: He said,Bring them hither to me.

ngiemboon: Àlá’ pfɛ́, ńzẅɛ́. Mé cú’te mepfwɔ’, é lúe tsɛ̀ɛ metúŋ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém.
en: And they did all eat, and were filled: and they took up of the fragments that remained twelve baskets full.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie é la pfɛ́ɛ mmó laa mbàŋa mmó ntsá’ tʉ̀a, té sáŋ pànzwě paa gubé.
en: And they that had eaten were about five thousand men, beside women and children.

ngiemboon: mbà kanú’ zyě ńgiŋ tà ńgwɔ́ soŋ ntse. Ntse ne ńgege pʉ̀a pé, mélà’mie fefà la ne ńtóo pɔ́ mvfò mvfò.
en: But the ship was now in the midst of the sea, tossed with waves: for the wind was contrary.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ nkwɔ̀’ njÿó, Yěsô gwɔ́ jwoŋte wɔ́b, ńně ńgiŋe ndùm ntse.
en: And in the fourth watch of the night Jesus went unto them, walking on the sea.

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô gwóon ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi pʉ́le ńnéŋe, à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mèŋ, tà pi pɔ́g.
en: But straightway Jesus spake unto them, saying,Be of good cheer; it is I; be not afraid.

ngiemboon: Piɛ leen ńké ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ kwà’ gú, ɔ̀ gÿo mèŋ n giŋe ndùm ntse ńtó ńzá’a ɔ́.
en: And Peter answered him and said, Lord, if it be thou, bid me come unto thee on the water.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né ye ngie: Tóo! Piɛ kẅɛɛ tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, ńne ńgiŋe ndùm ntse légʉa ńzá’a yé.
en: And he said,Come.And when Peter was come down out of the ship, he walked on the water, to go to Jesus.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgyá fefà ne ńcʉ’ʉ tɛ’, á pɔ́g, ńzye léme’e tsɛ̀ɛ ntse, ńdeen ńké ńga’te ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, n kwě le.
en: But when he saw the wind boisterous, he was afraid; and beginning to sink, he cried, saying, Lord, save me.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ yé kúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, fefà zá’a.
en: And when they were come into the ship, the wind ceased.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’ kẅí’te mvfò Yěsô ńgɔɔn ngie: Áa kwà’ nénʉ́, ɔ́ɔ Míŋ Ssé.
en: Then they that were in the ship came and worshipped him, saying, Of a truth thou art the Son of God.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ túm ntse tà ńkúu nà nzǐŋ ye Jenezared,
en: And when they were gone over, they came into the land of Gennesaret.

ngiemboon: Esẅíŋte yé ngie à fó ńzẅíŋ, pɔ́ kíbe pɔ́ ndà’ tsɔ̌ɔn nzsǒ yé. Epʉ̀a metsèm pie pɔ́ la kíbe tsɔ̌ɔn nzsǒ ŋwɛ́ pú ńzeŋe.
en: and besought him that they might only touch the hem of his garment: and as many as touched were made perfectly whole.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’, etsɔ́ pà*farisay pâ*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê fó Yerósalem ńtóo lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, ńzɛ́te yé ngie:
en: Then came to Jesus scribes and Pharisees, which were of Jerusalem, saying,

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Á gʉa ná pi, pi lɔgɔ tsẅé lá’ gí ńgwága Ssé mélà’a kɔ́?
en: But he answered and said unto them,Why do ye also transgress the commandment of God by your tradition?

ngiemboon: E Ssé la gɔɔn ngie: «Gÿo mekù’ tá gù pɔ́ má gù, ńgíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzoonte tá we ka má we wɔ́, mé zẅé ngàŋ».
en: For God commanded, saying, Honour thy father and mother: and, He that curseth father or mother, let him die the death.

ngiemboon: ntʉ́m wɔ́b té ná mèŋ wɔ́.
en: But their heart is far from me.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ne ńgu’te wɔ̀ɔn tá ànò té mǒ wɔ́, ńtí nò gie pɔ́ ńnéŋe twó ńzí’i pʉ̀a mmó tɛ’ tá’, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ye pʉ̀a mesoŋ».
en: Teachingfordoctrines the commandments of men.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tóŋo lá’, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi zẅí’te, ńcwoŋo ńjú’,
en: And he called the multitude, and said unto them,Hear, and understand:

ngiemboon: àmmó gie á fó ncwò nyìŋ ńkúu lepfòm yé, té cʉŋte yé wɔ́, àgie á kẅɛɛ ncwò yé zɔ̌ cʉŋte yé.
en: not that which goeth into the mouth defileth a man; but that which cometh out of the mouth, this defileth a man.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Mé ge gÿo pú tsɔ́’ɔ kɔ́ɔkɔ́ gie Tá wɔ̀ɔn mie aa tÿǒ lepwó zɔ la tè pye.
en: But he answered and said,Every plant, which my heavenly Father hath not planted, shall be rooted up.

ngiemboon: Piɛ leen ńké ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Kyagte sagá nò yɛ̂ shwóŋó wég.
en: Then answered Peter and said unto him, Declare unto us this parable.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó yé ngie: Ńzsé ngie sí legye nyé ḿvɔ́g vɔ́g pá’ se petsɔ́ pʉ̀a gwaa?
en: And Jesus said,Are ye also yet without understanding?

ngiemboon: Tá’, àmmó gie á fó ncwò nyìŋ ńkẅɛ, a fóo tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m yé, yɛ̌ zɔ̌ ńnéŋe*lɔ̌’ ná ngàŋ.
en: But those things which proceed out of the mouth come forth from the heart; and they defile the man.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo fó jʉ’ó ńgʉa ná tsɔ́ pàga ngwòŋ, á shÿó tÿǒsoŋ Tir pɔ́ Sidoŋ,
en: Then Jesus went thence, and departed into the coasts of Tyre and Sidon.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: E Ssé la túmo wɔ̀ɔn pɔ́ ndà’ mbwó*menjʉ̀njÿò mie é la pyé tsɛ̀ɛ ngẅɛ̀ ndá pà Israel.
en: But he answered and said,I am not sent but unto the lost sheep of the house of Israel.

ngiemboon: Tá’ manzwě awɛ̌ tó, ńkẅí’te mvfò yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a kẅéte wɔ̀ɔn!
en: Then came she and worshipped him, saying, Lord, help me.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Á té poŋo lekẅé shúm léjÿó penkʉ́, ḿma’a mbwó ngwé wɔ́.
en: But he answered and said,It is not meet to take the children's bread, and to castitto dogs.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo fó jʉ’ó, ńgʉa né ngʉ̀ŋe letʉŋ sie ée Galilea, ńkwɔ́’ tà ńkúu ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́, ńnéŋe ssé.
en: And Jesus departed from thence, and came nigh unto the sea of Galilee; and went up into a mountain, and sat down there.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé gɔɔn mbwó yé ngie: Ńgwɔ́ peg lɔg mbelég nzɔ̌, á nkwòŋo tsẅɛ wɔɔn, ńdɔg ńjÿɔ́g nzẅìŋ lá’ yɔɔn tà pɔ́ zẅɛ́?
en: And his disciples say unto him, Whence should we have so much bread in the wilderness, as to fill so great a multitude?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsẅi ngie àlá’ ńnéŋe ssé,
en: And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground.

ngiemboon: Mânyìŋ ntsèm pú ḿpfɛ́ tà ńzẅɛ́, mé piŋ ńcú’te pfwɔ’ á lúe metúŋ sɔɔn mbʉ́a.
en: And they did all eat, and were filled: and they took up of the brokenmeatthat was left seven baskets full.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie é la pfɛ́ɛ mmó lâ mbàŋa ntsá’ lekùɔ, té sáŋ penkʉ́ lâ pànzwě.
en: And they that did eat were four thousand men, beside women and children.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsẅi lá’ gʉa, á kúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, ńgʉa né tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Magadaŋ.
en: And he sent away the multitude, and took ship, and came into the coasts of Magdala.

ngiemboon: Pà*farisay lâ pà*sadukay tó ńzẅí’ ncwò Yěsô, ńzɛ́te yé ngie à nyɛɛ wɔ́b liŋé gie á la’te ngie Ssé zɔ túmo yé.
en: The Pharisees also with the Sadducees came, and tempting desired him that he would shew them a sign from heaven.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Á gʉa ncwò nzém gẅie lefaŋ é selé ḿbaŋ pi gɔɔn ngie: Njÿó ge lʉ́a àlyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ zɔ́g ḿboŋ.
en: He answered and said unto them,When it is evening, ye say,It will befair weather: for the sky is red.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gÿo ńtúm letʉŋ yɔ́b, ńgwaa túm, ńdege té pí mbelég.
en: And when his disciples were come to the other side, they had forgotten to take bread.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ne ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi laga twó gí, ḿbɔ́ɔn*mvòŋ pʉ̀a*farisay lâ pʉ̀a*sadukay.
en: Then Jesus said unto them,Take heed and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé jú’, ńdeen ńké ne ńgɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie, ndyɛ̌’ à gɔɔn pɛ́’ɛ, mélà’mie pege ně ńdege té pí mbelég.
en: And they reasoned among themselves, saying,It isbecause we have taken no bread.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Kwà’ pi gí gɔɔn ngie mèŋ n gee wɔ̌?
en: He saith unto them,But whom say ye that I am?

ngiemboon: Símo Piɛ tsɔ́’ ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ*Nzà’nkÿo, Míŋ Ssé gie ee wó.
en: And Simon Peter answered and said, Thou art the Christ, the Son of the living God.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn pú’u, ńdeen ńké ńtsẅiŋe*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie, tà pɔ́ kím tà nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ zsé ngie aa*Nzà’nkÿo.
en: Then charged he his disciples that they should tell no man that he was Jesus the Christ.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gyá àliŋé Yěsô pú sele mvfò pɔ́b, eshÿó wé ŋwʉŋe pá’ nèm la. Menzsǒ mé pú fɔ́g tà ńkyɛ’ jʉ’.
en: and was transfigured before them: and his face did shine as the sun, and his raiment was white as the light.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gyá, mbà Mǒsê pɔ́*Elîɛ vegé vege ńkẅɛ, pâ Yěsô ne shwóŋe.
en: And, behold, there appeared unto them Moses and Elias talking with him.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gwóon ńjú’u yɔɔn nò, ńgwe ssé, ésɔb shÿó wɔ́b ssé, ḿbú ne ḿbɔ́gɔ tɛ’.
en: And when the disciples heardit, they fell on their face, and were sore afraid.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tó, ńzába pwó ná pɔ́b, ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi lute ssé, tà pi gíŋe ḿbɔ́g.
en: And Jesus came and touched them, and said,Arise, and be not afraid.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ pʉ’ʉ twó yɔ́b ńnáŋte, ńcʉ́’ ńgyá pɔ́ Yěsô gíle yé.
en: And when they had lifted up their eyes, they saw no man, save Jesus only.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ pú’u, ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: Tà mélà’a kɔ́*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê gɔɔn ngie*Elîɛ ge lá’ vɔg tó?.
en: And his disciples asked him, saying, Why then say the scribes that Elias must first come?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Pi shwóŋó nò, à*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé*Elîɛ vɔgɔ ńtóo, lézába kɔ́ɔkɔ́ nà yé jʉ’.
en: And Jesus answered and said unto them,Elias truly shall first come, and restore all things.

ngiemboon: ńgɔ́ɔn pú’u,*ngàŋa kwò yé leen ńké ńjú’ ngie à gɔɔn pá’a pɔ́ Jâŋ Mbabtis.
en: Then the disciples understood that he spake unto them of John the Baptist.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa tà ńkúu jʉ’ gie lá’ laa wó, àtsɔ̌ nyìŋ tó ńkẅí’te mvfò Yěsô,
en: And when they were come to the multitude, there came to him acertainman, kneeling down to him, and saying,

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ně ńdɔgɔ yé ńtóo mvfò*ngàŋa kwò jú, tá’ pɔ́ té ku’u légÿo á zeŋe wɔ́.
en: And I brought him to thy disciples, and they could not cure him.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔgɔ yé ńtó, Yěsô cÿɔ́g*ssé tepòŋ, é kẅɛɛ ná múɔ ŋwɛ́, á gwóon sẅéte pɔ́ fʉ̀’ó.
en: And Jesus rebuked the devil; and he departed out of him: and the child was cured from that very hour.

ngiemboon: Pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gÿo ńgwɔ́ gíle pɔ́b, pɔ́ zɛ́te yé ngie: Àkɔ́ ně ńgÿo, peg tè ku’u léjwoŋ*ssé tepòŋ ŋwɛ́ wɔ́?
en: Then came the disciples to Jesus apart, and said, Why could not we cast him out?

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà yɛ̂ ntí*ssé tepòŋ, mbà nyìŋ lɔɔn tè zɔ́g nzyè, ńké sẅíŋte pɔ́ Ssé, tá ńjwoŋ wɔ́ é le kẅɛ.]
en: Howbeit this kind goeth not out but by prayer and fasting.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’,*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô pú ńcú’te Galilea, Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔb ngie: Mé ge sẅiŋe*Míŋ Nyìŋ mbwó pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: And while they abode in Galilee, Jesus said unto them,The Son of man shall be betrayed into the hands of men:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gÿo à kwé, a piŋ ngwɔ́ ḿbɔ́ɔnte lyɛ̌’ tá á zíme na le gwe.*Ngàŋa kwò yé jú’, ḿbú ḿmÿɔg tɛ’.
en: and they shall kill him, and the third day he shall be raised again.And they were exceeding sorry.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó,*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô tó ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Àwɔ̌ aa nyìŋ ndÿò tsɛ̀ɛ nò*lefùɔ Ssé.
en: At the same time came the disciples unto Jesus, saying, Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tóŋo mùɔ memúɔ, ńtÿɔ́gɔ yé mvfò pɔ́b,
en: And Jesus called a little child unto him, and set him in the midst of them,

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à sẅe’é mbùm yé ńnáa ssé tà ńcʉ́’ pá’ cʉ̀cʉ̀ŋ yɔɔn la, aa nyìŋ gẅie aa ndÿò tsɛ̀ɛ*lefùɔ Ssé.
en: Whosoever therefore shall humble himself as this little child, the same is greatest in the kingdom of heaven.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔg lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn ńkúe mùɔ memúɔ pá’ wɔɔn lɔɔn, mbà ngàŋ kúe pɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn.
en: And whoso shall receive one such little child in my name receiveth me.

ngiemboon: Á nue*Míŋ Nyìŋ la tó pɔ́ léfa’ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la kúu pyé é gÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́]
en: For the Son of man is come to save that which was lost.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo tá, Tá gẅi gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó tè kwoŋ ngie tsɔ̌ tà’ nà gubé yé pyé wɔ́.
en: Even so it is not the will of your Father which is in heaven, that one of these little ones should perish.

ngiemboon: Àjʉ’ gie pʉ̀a mépʉ́a ka pʉ̀a métá wɔ́, cu’té wó nà lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn, mbà mèŋ n ge gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b.
en: For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there am I in the midst of them.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ tà ńzye, mé lɔgɔ tsɔ̌ tà’ ńtóo mvfò yé, pɔ́ yé gẅiin nkáb ta é gwɔ́ memileyoŋ.
en: And when he had begun to reckon, one was brought unto him, which owed him ten thousand talents.

ngiemboon: Tá ngàŋ jú’ ńgwe ssé mvfò fùɔ, ńgɔɔn ngie: Ànkwɔbɔ́, mé ná’a shÿɔg ńzẅi’te wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n ge gÿo toŋ tà e mag!
en: The servant therefore fell down, and worshipped him, saying, Lord, have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.

ngiemboon: Mezìŋe mé kúu fùɔ, á nyé nkab ye mbwo, ńnyé ye á gʉa.
en: Then the lord of that servant was moved with compassion, and loosed him, and forgave him the debt.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ wa gwe mvfò yé, ésẅíŋte yé ńgɔɔn ngie: Ná’a shÿɔg ńzẅí’te wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n ge gÿo ná nkáb jù.
en: And his fellowservant fell down at his feet, and besought him, saying, Have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.

ngiemboon: A te lʉ’ lʉ’ nda’ wɔ́, efó ngiŋe ńdɔgɔ ye ngʉa ma’a nda tsǎŋ.
en: And he would not: but went and cast him into prison, till he should pay the debt.

ngiemboon: Mélà’a kɔ́ ɔ̀ kaa tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe shǔ gù, pá’ n ně ńtsɔ́ɔn mú jú wɔ́?
en: shouldest not thou also have had compassion on thy fellowservant, even as I had pity on thee?

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò pú ńgyáŋa fùɔ, á túm mé gʉa ńnéŋe yé tsǎŋ, lényɛɛ yé ngɔ́’ tà ńkú fʉ̀’ gie à pǔ ńtoŋ ye njǔ.
en: And his lord was wroth, and delivered him to the tormentors, till he should pay all that was due unto him.

ngiemboon: Àlá’ cʉ́me nzèm yé tà ńgyɔ́ɔn. Á kúu wó ńgÿo megàŋa guɔ nùɔ pɔ́b zeŋe.
en: And great multitudes followed him; and he healed them there.

ngiemboon: Pà*farisay zɛ́te yé ngie: Tà mélà’a kɔ́, Mǒsê la gɔɔn ngie: «Mé náa ŋwà’ne á mbwó manzwě lélɔg ńjwoŋo yé».
en: They say unto him, Why did Moses then command to give a writing of divorcement, and to put her away?

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gÿo ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Àlɔ́ɔn ndá lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pɛ́’ɛ, ḿba mvfò nyìŋ léńnéŋe té zɔ́’.
en: His disciples say unto him, If the case of the man be so withhiswife, it is not good to marry.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Pʉ̀a metsèm zɔ̌ té ku’u lézẅíŋe yɔɔn nò wɔ́. Tá e Ssé kě ńne ńgÿo, étsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a ku’u mǒ.
en: But he said unto them,Allmencannot receive this saying, savetheyto whom it is given.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Pi nyé gubé pɔ́ tó ńkẅɛ́te wɔ̀ɔn, tà pi táte wɔ́b, èpʉ̀a pie ée pá’ gubé zɔ̌ gẅiin nò ná*lefùɔ Ssé,
en: But Jesus said,Suffer little children, and forbid them not, to come unto me: for of such is the kingdom of heaven.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńzáb mbwó mé ná pɔ́b, tà á ku’ á fó jʉ’ó ńgʉa.
en: And he laidhishands on them, and departed thence.

ngiemboon: Àtsɔ̌ nyìŋ gÿo ńtóo lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Tsítsà, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mèŋ n gÿo kɔ́ nò mbòŋo tà ńgẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmí?
en: And, behold, one came and said unto him, Good Master, what good thing shall I do, that I may have eternal life?

ngiemboon: Ná mekù’ tá gù, pɔ́ má gù, kwoŋo fɛ́ gù nyìŋ mesoŋ pá’ ɔ̀ kwoŋo twó mbùm jú».
en: Honour thy father andthymother: and, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

ngiemboon: Mûɔ shùm ŋwɛ́ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Mèŋ, n gee ńké ńtsẅé ńkú’te mbʉ̌ mɛ̂ ku’té ntsèm, àkɔ́ nyé ńzága wɔ̀ɔn?
en: The young man saith unto him, All these things have I kept from my youth up: what lack I yet?

ngiemboon: Mûɔ shùm jú’u yɔɔn shwóŋó, eshÿó wé sẅɛ́’, á tém nzèm ńgʉa, mélà’mie à la gẅiin shúm tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ tɛ’.
en: But when the young man heard that saying, he went away sorrowful: for he had great possessions.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé jú’u yɔɔn nò, á pú ńkʉ’ʉ wɔ́b tɛ’, pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie tà á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɛ́’ɛ, mbà wɔ̌ ge lá’ tsẅɛ́?
en: When his disciples heardit, they were exceedingly amazed, saying, Who then can be saved?

ngiemboon: Yěsô líe wɔ́b tà ńgɔɔn ngie: Á cʉa pɔ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, e Ssé ku’u légÿo kɔ́ɔkɔ́.
en: But Jesus beheldthem, and said unto them,With men this is impossible; but with God all things are possible.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gɔɔn mbwó Yěsô ngie: Tà peg leen nyé shúm ntsèm, ńcʉ́me nzèm gù pá’ɔɔn, tà yég nò ge lá’ gwɔ́ lêkɔ?
en: Then answered Peter and said unto him, Behold, we have forsaken all, and followed thee; what shall we have therefore?

ngiemboon: Tá’ lelÿò pàgwɔ́ mvfò fʉ̀’ɔɔn, ge lá’ cʉ́’ pàgwɔ́ nzèm, lelÿò pàgwɔ́ nzèm fʉ̀’ɔɔn e lá’ ńgwɔ́ pàgwɔ́ mvfó
en: But manythat arefirst shall be last; and the lastshall befirst.

ngiemboon: Pâ megàŋa fà’ lʉ’te pá’ à ge náa tà’a pàga nkába mbwó tà’ nyìŋ ná lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’. Á leen ńké ńtsẅi pɔ́ gʉa né nká’ yé.
en: And when he had agreed with the labourers for a penny a day, he sent them into his vineyard.

ngiemboon: Nèm lepfwɔ’ɔ́ piŋ ńku’, á gíŋe ńkẅɛɛ mbʉ̀a yé, ńgyá tsɔ́ ngàŋa fà’ gíŋe ńtyé mefagá nzsè, pɔ́ té ne ńgÿo tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: And he went out about the third hour, and saw others standing idle in the marketplace,

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gʉa gí nká’ mèŋ fa’a fà’. Mèŋ n ge gÿo lʉŋte gẅi ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ ná fà’a gí.
en: and said unto them; Go ye also into the vineyard, and whatsoever is right I will give you. And they went their way.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ zyě yɔ́b fà’ ná nèm tʉ̀a ncwò nzém tó, mé náa tà’a pàga nkáb mbwó wɔ̌wɔɔ ná pɔ́b.
en: And when they came thatwere hiredabout the eleventh hour, they received every man a penny.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwaa kẅé lóŋ wɔb ne ńgyáŋa ńtí ngàŋ nká’.
en: And when they had receivedit, they murmured against the goodman of the house,

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Áa pú’u tá pàgwɔ́ nzèm ge lá’ cʉ́’ pàgwɔ́ mvfò, pàgwɔ́ mvfò e cʉ́’ pàgwɔ́ nzèm
en: So the last shall be first, and the first last: for many be called, but few chosen.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ḿbʉʉ né Yerósalem, éfag*ngàŋa kwò yé ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém, pâ pɔ́ ne ńgiŋe, á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie:
en: And Jesus going up to Jerusalem took the twelve disciples apart in the way, and said unto them,

ngiemboon: Má pà Jâg pɔ́ Jâŋ, é gubé Zebede, leen ńké ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńtóo mvfò Yěsô, ńkẅí’te ssé lélúɔ tsɔ́ mmó mbwó yé.
en: Then came to him the mother of Zebedee's children with her sons, worshippinghim, and desiring a certain thing of him.

ngiemboon: Yetsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô legém gwɔ́ tà ńjú’u nò gie pɔ́ gɔ̌ɔn, ńgyáŋa lóŋ ńtí wɔ́b mépʉ́a.
en: And when the ten heardit, they were moved with indignation against the two brethren.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ná pi lɔɔn ne ńkwoŋo légwɔ́ ndÿò tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, mbà á poŋ ngie á zẅíŋe légwɔ́ nkwɔɔn gi
en: and whosoever will be chief among you, let him be your servant:

ngiemboon: Yěsô paa*ngàŋa kwò yé gÿo ne foo tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ Yériko nkẅɛɛ, anùɔ lá’ cʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: And as they departed from Jericho, a great multitude followed him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tyé ńtóŋo wɔ́b, ńzɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi tsɔ́ɔn ngie mèŋ n gÿo lêkɔ́ ná pi?
en: And Jesus stood still, and called them, and said,What will ye that I shall do unto you?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, gÿo ngie menÿɔ́g még gyá jʉ’.
en: They say unto him, Lord, that our eyes may be opened.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ne ńkyɛ́’ɛ, nyìŋ gɔɔn nò, pi tsɔ́’ ngie: A Ndè zɔ ne ńtsɔ́ɔn. Mbà à ge gwóon nyé pi lɔg ńgʉa.
en: And if anymansay ought unto you, ye shall say, The Lord hath need of them; and straightway he will send them.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò gwɔ́ pá’ɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ḿbumte ná nò gie à*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé la lá’ ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: All this was done, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying,

ngiemboon: ńnéŋe ndùm nzìkásè, á gwɔ́ mùɔ nzìkásè».
en: And a colt the foal of an ass.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gʉa ńkúu wó, ńgÿo kɔ́ɔkɔ́ wɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ Yěsô ně ńtsẅi,
en: And the disciples went, and did as Jesus commanded them,

ngiemboon: ńdɔg nzìkásè pɔ́ múɔ ńtó, ńzáb menzsǒ fÿɔg mɔ́b nkà’ menzìkásè, Yěsô ńnéŋe nà tsɔ̌.
en: and brought the ass, and the colt, and put on them their clothes, and they sethimthereon.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gʉa tà ńkúu Yerósalem, àtÿǒsoŋ pú ńcʉ́’ʉ, èpʉ̀a ne ńzɛ́te ngie: Wɔɔn nyìŋ gwɔ́ pɔ́ wɔ̌?
en: And when he was come into Jerusalem, all the city was moved, saying, Who is this?

ngiemboon: Àlá’ tsɔ́’ ngie: Aa Yěsô á*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé, à fóo tÿǒsoŋo Nǎzarɛd nà pàga ngwòŋ Galilea.
en: And the multitude said, This is Jesus the prophet of Nazareth of Galilee.

ngiemboon: Pàfʉ̀ menÿɔ́g mbɔɔ pàpwɔ́’te mekwò piŋ tóo lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, á gÿo pɔ́ zeŋe.
en: And the blind and the lame came to him in the temple; and he healed them.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńnyé wɔ́b, éfó tÿǒsoŋ ńkẅɛ ńgʉa né Mbetáni, ńkúu wó ńdá’.
en: And he left them, and went out of the city into Bethany; and he lodged there.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a pɔ́ gwaa piŋ né tÿǒsoŋ, nzyè gyáŋa Yěsô.
en: Now in the morning as he returned into the city, he hungered.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé gyá pá’ á jǔm, á pú ńcʉa wɔ́b, pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie: Á gÿo lêkɔ́ tá tÿǒ yɔɔn tyé pɔ́ fʉ̀’ yɔɔn ńjúm?
en: And when the disciples sawit, they marvelled, saying, How soon is the fig tree withered away!

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé, ésẅíŋte yé ńdúɔ kɔ́ɔkɔ́ wɔ́, mbà à ge ná.
en: And all things, whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer, believing, ye shall receive.

ngiemboon: MÀbiŋ ngie pʉ̀a mesoŋ, mbà lá’ té ge nyé wégè wɔ́, mélà’mie pʉ̀a metsèm ne ńzsé ngie Jâŋ laa*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: But if we shall say, Of men; we fear the people; for all hold John as a prophet.

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ ngie: Mèŋ n dʉ̌’. Mbiŋ ńnéŋe, ńdʉa mmó gie á ně ńgÿo á gɔɔn pú’u, ńgʉa né nká’.
en: He answered and said, I will not: but afterward he repented, and went.

ngiemboon: Tá wɔb gíŋe ńgɔɔn pɔ tà’a nò mbwó wetsɔ́ múɔ, wɛ̌ múɔ tsɔ́’ ngie: Oon, mèŋ n ge gʉa, tá’, ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńké tè wó gʉa.
en: And he came to the second, and said likewise. And he answered and said, Igo, sir: and went not.

ngiemboon: Àndÿò leen ńké ńtúmo kwà’ míŋ we, ńne ńkwaŋa ngie á ge gǎ wɔ́, pɔ́ gÿo mekù’ mé.
en: But last of all he sent unto them his son, saying, They will reverence my son.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńgwoon yé, éshwoŋo yé ńdɔg fó nká’ ńkẅɛ, ńgʉa ńzẅé!
en: And they caught him, and casthimout of the vineyard, and slewhim.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te ngie: Tà ndÿò wɔɔn ge gÿo tó, é gÿo lêkɔ́ ná pʉ̀a pie à la cʉ́me nká’ né pɔ́b?
en: When the lord therefore of the vineyard cometh, what will he do unto those husbandmen?

ngiemboon: á gwɔ́ máa nò mbòŋo á menÿɔ́g pege»?
en: And it is marvellous in our eyes?

ngiemboon: Tóon ŋwɛ́ aa gẅie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwe mǒ, mbà ngàŋ ge pwɔ́’te, á piŋ ńgwe ná nyìŋ, mbà à ge pú gwɔ’ɔ ngàŋ.]
en: And whosoever shall fall on this stone shall be broken: but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will grind him to powder.

ngiemboon: *Metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ pà*farisay jú’ yɔɔn sagá nò, ńdiŋ ngie à gɔɔn né pɔ́b,
en: And when the chief priests and Pharisees had heard his parables, they perceived that he spake of them.

ngiemboon: éfa’ shÿó légwoon yé, tá ḿbɔ́g nÿɔ́g lá’, á nue lá’ la ne ńzsé ngie Yěsô aa*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: But when they sought to lay hands on him, they feared the multitude, because they took him for a prophet.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńdɔg pɔ́ sagá nò, ńgɔɔn mbwó lá’ gie á ne ńzẅí’te shwóŋó yé ngie:
en: And Jesus answered and spake unto them again by parables, and said,

ngiemboon: Pi gyá pá’*lefùɔ Ssé ée pú’u. Àtsɔ̌ fùɔ lǎ’ ńtáŋte máamáa línɔ́ɔn ná nò lɔ́ɔn ndá míŋ we we mbàŋa.
en: The kingdom of heaven is like unto a certain king, which made a marriage for his son,

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ gwoon mentsìndá fùɔ ŋwɛ́, ńgege wɔ́b, ńzẅéte wɔ́b.
en: and the remnant took his servants, and entreatedthemspitefully, and slewthem.

ngiemboon: Pi leen ńké ńgʉa fʉ̀’ɔɔn ná metwó nzsè, ńgyá mbaa wɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́, pi tóŋo yé tóŋ.
en: Go ye therefore into the highways, and as many as ye shall find, bid to the marriage.

ngiemboon: Fùɔ gÿo ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ lemù légyá lá’ gie á tǒ nà lɔ́ɔn ndá, ńkúu wó, ńgyá tsɔ̌ mámbàŋa, mbà à kaa nzsǒ lɔ́ɔn ndá ma’à
en: And when the king came in to see the guests, he saw there a man which had not on a wedding garment:

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né yé ngie: Àshǔ wɔ̀ɔn, ɔ̀ gÿǒ lêkɔ́ ńkúu jʉ’ɔɔn té ma’ nzsǒ lɔ́ɔn ndá? Nyìŋ awɛ̌ tè zsé nò gie à ge gɔɔn wɔ́.
en: and he saith unto him, Friend, how camest thou in hither not having a wedding garment? And he was speechless.

ngiemboon: Yěsô cʉ́me ngie: Áa pú’u, nue e Ssé ne ńtóŋo pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn tá pàgʉa tà ńkú té gyɔ́ɔn.
en: For many are called, but fewarechosen.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a*farisay gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’, ńgÿo cú’tè, éfa’ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ fó ná nò gie Yěsô gɔ̌ɔn ńgwoon yé,
en: Then went the Pharisees, and took counsel how they might entangle him inhistalk.

ngiemboon: Shwóŋo weg pá’ ɔ̀ kwǎŋ jú ná yɔɔn nò:*Lepʉ̌ ségè ée pé’e ńzẅíŋ ngie pege ma’ ncùb Kása pà*Roma ka ngǎŋ?
en: Tell us therefore, What thinkest thou? Is it lawful to give tribute unto Cæsar, or not?

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô zsé nkwaŋá tepòŋ wɔ́b, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pànkwòŋ menÿɔ́g, pi kwa’te wɔ̀ɔn mélà’a kɔ́?
en: But Jesus perceived their wickedness, and said,Why tempt ye me,yehypocrites?

ngiemboon: Pi nyɛɛ wɔ̀ɔn nkáb gie mé lɔgɔ ńnáa ncùb. Pɔ́ lɔgɔ pàga nkáb ńtó, ńnyɛɛ yé.
en: Shew me the tribute money.And they brought unto him a penny.

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Wɔɔn ée shÿó wɔ́ gẅie ée ná nkáb? Sɔɔn gwɔ́ lezíŋ wɔ́ sie ée mǒ?
en: And he saith unto them,Whoseisthis image and superscription?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ pá’ à tsɔ̌’ pú’u, á cʉa wɔ́b. Pɔ́ nyé yé jʉ’ó, ńgʉa.
en: When they had heardthese words, they marvelled, and left him, and went their way.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa zso, manzwě kwé yé.
en: And last of all the woman died also.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pʉ̀a pɔɔn sɔɔn mbʉ́a la pú ńzɔ́’ɔ manzwě wɔɔn ŋwɛ́ lɔɔn, mé ge lá’ zíme ná legwé, à gwɔ́ nzwě wɔ́?
en: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife shall she be of the seven? for they all had her.

ngiemboon: ńgʉa ná mepfó pá’ pɔ́ ge gÿo zím, mbà pi laa fó ńtóŋo mmó gie Ssé la gɔɔn wɔ́ ka, à la te gɔɔn ngie:
en: But as touching the resurrection of the dead, have ye not read that which was spoken unto you by God, saying,

ngiemboon: Menùɔ lá’ mie é laa jʉ’ó la ne ńgɔ’te ntí gie Yěsô lɔgɔ ńzí’i pʉ̀a mmó pú’u.
en: And when the multitude heardthis, they were astonished at his doctrine.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a*farisay gwɔ́ tà ńjú’ pà’ Yěsô jÿɔ̌’ ncwò pʉ̀a*sadukay, ḿbú ńcú’te lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô.
en: But when the Pharisees had heard that he had put the Sadducees to silence, they were gathered together.

ngiemboon: Àtsɔ̌ nyìŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ńgwɔ́ nkyàgte mbʉ̌ Ssé tà ńgwɔ́ wɛ̌, á tó ńkwa’te Yěsô, ńzɛ́te yé ngie:
en: Then one of them,which wasa lawyer, askedhim a question, tempting him, and saying,

ngiemboon: Tsítsà, áa nà mbʉ̌ pé’e sɛ̌ gwɔ́ sé lyò.
en: Master, whichisthe great commandment in the law?

ngiemboon: ée*lepʉ̌ sé lÿò ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ndùŋ mvfò.
en: This is the first and great commandment.

ngiemboon: *Lepʉ̌ mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a sie é sẅé sɔɔn gwɔ́ ngie: «Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie ɔ̀ Kwoŋo nyìŋ mesoŋ pá’ twó mbùm jú».
en: And the secondislike unto it, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

ngiemboon: Mbʉ̌ Mǒsê ntsèm mbɔɔ menò mie pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé la gɔɔn éfóo pɔ́ ná mbʉ̌ mɔɔn mémbʉ́a.
en: On these two commandments hang all the law and the prophets.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a*farisay gwɔ́ tà ńcú’te, Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie:
en: While the Pharisees were gathered together, Jesus asked them,

ngiemboon: Pi kwǎŋ gí ngie*nzà’nkÿo aa wɔ̌? Ngie aa míŋ wɔ̌? Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó yé ngie: Aa nyìŋ na ngẅɛ fùɔ Ndavíd.
en: saying,What think ye of Christ? whose son is he?They say unto him,The sonof David.

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ngǎ, mbà Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a la jÿó fùɔ Ndavíd á tóŋo yé lê Ndè,
en: He saith unto them,How then doth David in spirit call him Lord, saying,

ngiemboon: tà á lá’ ńkú fʉ̀’ gie mèŋ n gÿǒ ɔ̀ neŋte megàŋ mbù pú».
en: Till I make thine enemies thy footstool?

ngiemboon: Tà fùɔ Ndavíd lɔ̌ɔn ńtóŋo yé lê we Ndè pá’ɔɔn, á piŋ ńgwɔ́ míŋ we lêkɔ́?
en: If David then call him Lord, how is he his son?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńgɔɔn mbwó menùɔ lá’ tà mbɔɔ mbwó*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie:
en: Then spake Jesus to the multitude, and to his disciples,

ngiemboon: *pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê pâ pà*farisay gẅiin lékyagte*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê.
en: saying,The scribes and the Pharisees sit in Moses' seat:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kúu jʉ’e melínɔ́ɔn, ńnéŋe pɔ́ nà jʉ’e melÿò, ńkúu*mendá cú’tè ńkaŋa yɔ́b jʉ’ pɔ́ mvfò.
en: and love the uppermost rooms at feasts, and the chief seats in the synagogues,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kwoŋ ngie mé tyé mangǐɛ, ńtsyɛ’te wɔ́b lê mekù’, epʉ̀a piŋ ńnéŋe ńtóŋo wɔ́b lê tsítsà.
en: and greetings in the markets, and to be called of men, Rabbi, Rabbi.

ngiemboon: Tà pi tóŋo tsɔ́ nyìŋ ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ lê tá gẅi, á nue pi gẅiin pɔ́ tà’ tá wémɔ’ɔ́ á gwɔ́ tÿǒ lepwó.
en: And call nomanyour father upon the earth: for one is your Father, which is in heaven.

ngiemboon: Tà pi zẅíŋ mé tóŋo gẅi ngie pàtyé mvfò, á nue nyìŋ gẅie à tyé mvfò à gwɔ́ pɔ́ wémɔ’ɔ́, ńgwɔ́ nzá’nkÿo gẅie Ssé la ka’.
en: Neither be ye called masters: for one is your Master,evenChrist.

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie nyìŋ ndÿò tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi lɔg mbùm ye pɔ́ pá’ nkwɔɔn gi la
en: But he that is greatest among you shall be your servant.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńŋá’te nnɛ́, mbà Ssé ge sẅé’e yé náa ssé, ésẅé’e mbùm yé ńnáa ssé, mbà Ssé ge kwé’e yé
en: And whosoever shall exalt himself shall be abased; and he that shall humble himself shall be exalted.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńdɔgɔ jʉ’e mé nuŋe pwɔ́’ wó ńkʉa nò, mbà à lɔgɔ yɛ̌ jʉ’ mbɔɔ mmó gie áa ndùm wó ńkʉa.
en: Whoso therefore shall swear by the altar, sweareth by it, and by all things thereon.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à lɔgɔ́*jʉ’ʉ Ssé ńkʉa nò, à lɔgɔ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé mbɔɔ Ssé gẅie aa jʉ’ wó ńkʉa.
en: And whoso shall swear by the temple, sweareth by it, and by him that dwelleth therein.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńdɔgɔ tÿǒ lepwó ńkʉa nò, mbà à lɔgɔ lʉŋe Ssé, mbɔɔ Ssé gẅie à ńnéŋe mǒ ńkʉa.
en: And he that shall swear by heaven, sweareth by the throne of God, and by him that sitteth thereon.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ*farisay, ɔ́ɔ fʉ̀ menÿɔ́g, ɔ̀ lɔɔn ḿvɔg ńtsí’i tsɛ̀ɛ ntú’, tà é lʉ́a, mbà nzème pǐ ge pɔ́ɔnte lʉ́a.
en: Thoublind Pharisee, cleanse first thatwhich iswithin the cup and platter, that the outside of them may be clean also.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔgɔ pú’u, ńzẅíŋe ngie pi ee púɔ pʉ̀a pie é la zẅéte pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: Wherefore ye be witnesses unto yourselves, that ye are the children of them which killed the prophets.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi lɔgɔ fà’a pàmangʉa njʉ’ pí, ńgʉa lê mvfò.
en: Fill ye up then the measure of your fathers.

ngiemboon: Pi ee ngẅɛ̀ mennú, ńgwɔ pà másèm nnú, ńgwɔ́ pí gǎ ńdá’ ńtsó té kúu tsɛ̀ɛ mmɔ̌g?
en: Yeserpents,yegeneration of vipers, how can ye escape the damnation of hell?

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, mé ge lá’ tsɔ́’ ndu ndú menò ámɛ̌, é ná né pʉ̀a pie ee tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó fʉ’ɔɔn.
en: Verily I say unto you, All these things shall come upon this generation.

ngiemboon: Áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn pá’ɔɔn jʉ’ gie pi la kwɛ́ légu’te Ssé tsɛ̀ɛ wó, yé Ssé ge kyé a tyé sẅɛ̀ɛ
en: Behold, your house is left unto you desolate.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Pi laga twó gí, ḿbɔ́ɔn nyìŋ léfʉ gẅí.
en: And Jesus answered and said unto them,Take heed that no man deceive you.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò ge lá’ lɔgɔ gwɔ́ pá’ manzwě gẅie à zyete lélúme la.
en: All thesearethe beginning of sorrows.

ngiemboon: Pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé pe cÿɔ’ nò kẅɛte tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, éfʉte lelÿò pʉ̀a.
en: And many false prophets shall rise, and shall deceive many.

ngiemboon: Menò tepòŋ kẅi’i ńgyɔ́ɔn, tà lelÿò pʉ̀a le gíŋe ńkwoŋe tà ńkwoŋe wɔ́.
en: And because iniquity shall abound, the love of many shall wax cold.

ngiemboon: Tá, nyìŋ gẅie à shÿɔg shÿɔg té kʉa zɔ́ gÿo ńtsẅɛ́.
en: But he that shall endure unto the end, the same shall be saved.

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie, mé lɔɔn ńdá’ ńgwɔ́ tà ńgyá yé, pʉ̀a pie ee Jẅidea kÿo ńdɔg ye mekwɔ’ɔ́ ńgʉa ńdyeen.
en: then let them which be in Judæa flee into the mountains:

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à ge lá’ gwɔ́ nà tetʉ́a gie aa ntsɔ̀’ ndá, á pɔ́ɔn lésẅɛ́’ ngie à ge píi mmó ndá tá lɔg kÿo.
en: let him which is on the house top not come down to take any thing out of his house:

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à ge lá’ gwɔ́ nká’, à pɔ́ɔn le gɔɔn ngie à ge piŋe ndá pí nzsǒ fÿɔ́g ye.
en: neither let him which is in the field return back to take his clothes.

ngiemboon: Yee ngɔ́’ pànzwě pie é ge lá’ gwɔ́ shwoŋ, mbɔɔ pie é ge là’ ne nóŋe pûɔ mepÿɛ́ nà mɛ̌ melyɛ̌’ le!
en: And woe unto them that are with child, and to them that give suck in those days!

ngiemboon: Pi sẅíŋte Ssé ngie tà lekÿo ŋwɛ́ lá’ ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’e tyɛb tyɛb mbʉ̀ŋ, ka pɔ́ lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè wɔ́.
en: But pray ye that your flight be not in the winter, neither on the sabbath day:

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, nyìŋ ké ńdá’ ńgɔɔn né pi ngie: À*Nzà’nkÿo wɔɔn jʉ’ɔɔn, ka pɔ́ ngie à gẅi jʉ’e wɔ́ tà pi zẅíŋ,
en: Then if any man shall say unto you, Lo, hereisChrist, or there; believeitnot.

ngiemboon: Á yɔɔn, mbà mèŋ n kě ńtʉ́ njÿó shwóŋó gẅí.
en: Behold, I have told you before.

ngiemboon: «Àpfó mmó ge gÿo gwɔ́ nzɔ̌ wɔ́, megúm cú’te jʉ’ó».
en: For wheresoever the carcase is, there will the eagles be gathered together.

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pú’u, pi la’ ńgwɔ́ tà ńgyá mɔɔn menò, pi zsé ngie:*Míŋ Nyìŋ tǒ tà ńgwɔ́ ncwò ndá.
en: so likewise ye, when ye shall see all these things, know that it is near,evenat the doors.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, pʉ̀a pie ee tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó fʉ’ɔɔn té ńge lá’ kwéte tà mag té gwɔ́ gie mɔɔn menò ntsèm é tǒ wɔ́.
en: Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass, till all these things be fulfilled.

ngiemboon: Lefaŋ pɔ́ tsetsá’ ge gÿo mag tá shwóŋó yɔ́ɔn lá’ le pyé.
en: Heaven and earth shall pass away, but my words shall not pass away.

ngiemboon: *Míŋ Nyìŋ ge lá’ gwaa tó, menò mie é la gÿo fʉ̀’e Nóa gíŋe ńgÿo.
en: But as the days of Noewere, so shall also the coming of the Son of man be.

ngiemboon: Mbàŋa yépʉ́a ge lá’ gwɔ́ nká’, mé lɔgɔ tà’ ńgʉa, ńnyé wetsɔ̌.
en: Then shall two be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the other left.

ngiemboon: Pànzwě mépʉ́a ne ńgwɔ’ɔ mmó lùŋo, mé lɔgɔ tà’ ńgʉa, ńnyé wetsɔ̌.
en: Twowomen shall begrinding at the mill; the one shall be taken, and the other left.

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ tá pi pɔ́ɔn légwá’a lÿɔ̀g, á nue pi tè ne ńzsé lyɛ̌’ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅi ge tó wɔ́.
en: Watch therefore: for ye know not what hour your Lord doth come.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, mbaa pi gí, pi cwoŋte mbùm gi ḿbyɛ́b, mélà’mie*Míŋ Nyìŋ ge gÿo vege vege tó.
en: Therefore be ye also ready: for in such an hour as ye think not the Son of man cometh.

ngiemboon: Àa shÿó mbòŋo pá’ tá fà’ we lɔɔn ńgwaa piŋ nzèm, ńgyá á ne fa’a yɛ̌ fà’.
en: Blessedisthat servant, whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, tá fà’ we ge cʉ́me shúm sé ntsèm ntsèm mbwó yé.
en: Verily I say unto you, That he shall make him ruler over all his goods.

ngiemboon: Tá’ ńké ńgwɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ngàŋa fà’ we tepòŋ, ńgɔɔn lóŋ yé ngie: Tá fà’ wɔ̀ɔn tè lwo tó wɔ́,
en: But and if that evil servant shall say in his heart, My lord delayeth his coming;

ngiemboon: ńzye lécúɔ pʉ̀a pie pâ pɔ́ fa’a, pâ mepʉ̀a melù’ cú’te ḿpfɛ́ shúm, ḿbiŋ ńnú melù’.
en: and shall begin to smitehisfellowservants, and to eat and drink with the drunken;

ngiemboon: Mbà tá fà’ we ge vege vege tó, á nà fʉ̀’ gie à tè ne ńzsé wɔ́,
en: the lord of that servant shall come in a day when he looketh not forhim, and in an hour that he is not aware of,

ngiemboon: Epe métʉ̀a gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b pɔ́ té legye gẅiin, epe metʉ̀a gẅiin legye.
en: And five of them were wise, and fivewerefoolish.

ngiemboon: Pie é la tè legye gẅiin la gwaa kaa melâm mɔ́b, pɔ́ té gẅiin tsɔ́ mèvɛ tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ mmó ndyɛ̀’ɛ wɔ́.
en: They thatwerefoolish took their lamps, and took no oil with them:

ngiemboon: Epie é la gẅiin legye la gwaa kaa melâm pɔ́b, ńgíŋe ńnéŋ tsɔ́ mèvɛ tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ mmó ndyɛ̀’ɛ ńgẅiin.
en: but the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à gee ńzɔ́’ɔ, à tè tɔ́g ńtó wɔ́, pɔ́ ńnéŋe tà lelɔ́g gwoon wɔ́b pɔ́ lyéte.
en: While the bridegroom tarried, they all slumbered and slept.

ngiemboon: Tsɛ̀ɛ tsẅɛ́’ ku’, mé jú’ nyìŋ lɔg ngyè tetʉ̀ ngie: Nyìŋ gẅie à ge ńzɔ́’ɔ wɔɔn gẅie à tóo lɔɔn, pi kẅɛ ńgʉa ńzá’a yé.
en: And at midnight there was a cry made, Behold, the bridegroom cometh; go ye out to meet him.

ngiemboon: Epûɔ ngùɔ pà metsèm leen ńzyeen, wɔ̌wɔɔ kwé’e nkÿo lâm wé.
en: Then all those virgins arose, and trimmed their lamps.

ngiemboon: Epie é té legye gẅiin la, gɔɔn mbwó pie é gẅiin legye ngie: Epég melâm ne ḿbyé, pi náa wég mejʉ’ ná mèvɛ mí.
en: And the foolish said unto the wise, Give us of your oil; for our lamps are gone out.

ngiemboon: Tá á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Tá mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, mèŋ n tě ne ńzsé gẅi wɔ́.
en: But he answered and said, Verily I say unto you, I know you not.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋa fà’ gẅie mé la nyé nkáb pàg nkÿo tʉ̀a né ye, cʉ́’ ńgwóon ńdwo ńtáŋ ye, tà ńjÿó tsɔ̌ pàg nkÿo tʉ̀a.
en: Then he that had received the five talents went and traded with the same, and madethemother five talents.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie mé la nyé ye pàg nkÿo pʉ́a, gíŋe ńjÿó yé tsɔ̌ pàg nkÿo pʉ́a.
en: And likewise he thathad receivedtwo, he also gained other two.

ngiemboon: Tá’, nyìŋ gẅie mé la nyé pàg nkÿo né yé la, gʉa ńtúŋo gem tsɛ̀ɛ tsetsá’, ńde’e nkáb tá we tsɛ̀ɛ wó.
en: But he that had received one went and digged in the earth, and hid his lord's money.

ngiemboon: Ntyě ná’a sag, tá pà megàŋa fà’ pɔɔn méntá piŋ nzèm, ńtóŋo wɔ́b ńzɛ́te pá’ pɔ́ ka cʉ̌’ ńgÿo ná nkáb pú’u.
en: After a long time the lord of those servants cometh, and reckoneth with them.

ngiemboon: N ka ne ḿbɔ́gɔ gú, ńgʉa ńde’e mepàg nkáb mú tsɛ̀ɛ tsetsá’, é mɔɔn! Nkáb jù yɛ̂.
en: and I was afraid, and went and hid thy talent in the earth: lo,therethou hastthat isthine.

ngiemboon: Pi kẅé nkáb mɛ́ pàg nkÿo mbwó yé, ńnáa mbwó nyìŋ gẅie à gẅiin pàg ntsá’,
en: Take therefore the talent from him, and giveitunto him which hath ten talents.

ngiemboon: Pi gwoon ngàŋa fà’ we tè ku’u ná tsɔ́ nò wɛ̂, ḿma’a yé pí tsɛ̀ɛ mwòon nzém. À ńnéŋe wó ńdʉa, lóŋ we ne ffó
en: And cast ye the unprofitable servant into outer darkness: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

ngiemboon: é tÿɔ́g*menjʉ̀njÿò ná gwǒŋo pwó yé ye tʉ̀, é tÿɔ́g mvfó ntʉ̀ ná gwǒŋo pwó yé ye kyɛ̀bɛ.
en: and he shall set the sheep on his right hand, but the goats on the left.

ngiemboon: Á nue, nzyè la ne ńgyáŋa wɔ̀ɔn, pi náa mmó m pfɛ́, àgág yɔ́ɔn ne shÿó, pi ná ntse n nú, n daa ngʉ̀ pie kúe wɔ̀ɔn.
en: for I was an hungred, and ye gave me meat: I was thirsty, and ye gave me drink: I was a stranger, and ye took me in:

ngiemboon: N daa tè nzsǒ pi ná nzsǒ, m ma’. N da ne ńguɔ, pi tó fóŋo wɔ̀ɔn. N daa ndá tsǎŋ, pi tó ńdíe wɔ̀ɔn.
en: naked, and ye clothed me: I was sick, and ye visited me: I was in prison, and ye came unto me.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ laa ngʉ̀ pá’ɔɔn síŋe, tà peg kúe gú? Ɔ̀ laa tè nzsǒ síŋe tà peg ná nzsǒ ɔ̀ ma’?
en: When saw we thee a stranger, and tooktheein? or naked, and clothedthee?

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ laa síŋe ne ńguɔ, ńgwɔ́ ndá tsǎŋ síŋe tà peg tó ńdíe gú?
en: Or when saw we thee sick, or in prison, and came unto thee?

ngiemboon: Á nue nzyè la gyáŋa wɔ̀ɔn, pi tè náa mmó m pfɛ́ wɔ́, àgág yɔ́ɔn shÿó, pi tè ná ntse mèŋ n nú wɔ́.
en: for I was an hungred, and ye gave me no meat: I was thirsty, and ye gave me no drink:

ngiemboon: Yěsô la zí’i nò Ssé mbwó pʉ̀a tà ńcÿé jʉ’, ńgɔɔn mbwó*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie:
en: And it came to pass, when Jesus had finished all these sayings, he said unto his disciples,

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie, é cʉ́’ʉ ńzága pɔ́ lyɛ̌’ sépʉ́a mé jÿó línɔ́ɔn*Páskà. Mé ge sẅiŋe*Míŋ Nyìŋ, mé kime yé ná tÿǒ nkǐ.
en: Ye know that after two days isthe feast ofthe passover, and the Son of man is betrayed to be crucified.

ngiemboon: ńcú’te pú’u, ńzáb ngie pɔ́ ge shúte gwoon Yěsô, é zẅé yé.
en: and consulted that they might take Jesus by subtilty, and killhim.

ngiemboon: Tá tà mé ké ńgwoon yé lyɛ’ɛ́ línɔ́ɔn, ḿbɔ́gɔ lá’ létág jʉ’.
en: But they said, Not on the feastday, lest there be an uproar among the people.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńgwɔ́ Mbetáni, á ndá Símo,*ngàŋ nkà’ pǎb,
en: Now when Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper,

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gyá, á pÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b tɛ’, pɔ́ zẅɛ́te ngie: À sěen ńcʉŋte yɔɔn làméndɔ́ɔn mélà’a kɔ́?
en: But when his disciples sawit, they had indignation, saying, To what purposeisthis waste?

ngiemboon: Á ké ńgwɔ́ mé sẅiŋ, ńkẅé máa nkáb, ńnáa mbwó mepóŋ.
en: For this ointment might have been sold for much, and given to the poor.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zsé nkwaŋá wɔ́b, ńgɔɔn mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Pi zẅɛ́te mélà’a kɔ́? À gÿǒ pɔ́ nò mbòŋo ná mèŋ.
en: When Jesus understoodit, he said unto them,Why trouble ye the woman? for she hath wrought a good work upon me.

ngiemboon: Pi ge ne gyá mepóŋ pɔ́ fʉ̀’ ntsèm, tá ńgʉa ná mèŋ, mbà pege tè gwɔ́ pɔ́ fʉ̀’ ntsèm wɔ́.
en: For ye have the poor always with you; but me ye have not always.

ngiemboon: Manzwě wɔɔn lɔgɔ yɔɔn làméndɔ́ɔn ńzɔ́’ɔ mbùm yɔ̀ɔn, ńdɔgɔ ńtʉ́ʉ njÿó ńzɔ́’ɔ wɔ̀ɔn tá mé taa ńnéŋe wɔ̀ɔn lesyè.
en: For in that she hath poured this ointment on my body, she diditfor my burial.

ngiemboon: Àtsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ ná pʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ Jẅidas Iskariod, a gʉa ńgyá*metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’,
en: Then one of the twelve, called Judas Iscariot, went unto the chief priests,

ngiemboon: Á kẅé, ńzye léfa’ shÿó pá’ à ge sẅiŋe Yěsô mbwó pɔ́b.
en: And from that time he sought opportunity to betray him.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé gÿo pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ à tsẅǐ, ńcwoŋte shúm léjÿó*Páskà jʉ’ó.
en: And the disciples did as Jesus had appointed them; and they made ready the passover.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ ncwò nzém, Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém ńnéŋe ssé lépfɛ́ɛ mmó.
en: Now when the even was come, he sat down with the twelve.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ne ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó, Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, àtsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi gee sẅiŋ mèŋ.
en: And as they did eat, he said,Verily I say unto you, that one of you shall betray me.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’, ḿbú ḿmÿɔg, àwɔ̌wɔɔ ná pɔ́b wɔ́ zɛ́te ngie: À Ndè, ńgwɔ́ á gwɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn?
