en: And they were exceeding sorrowful, and began every one of them to say unto him, Lord, is it I?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: Nyìŋ gẅie pwó yég yé fóo lépumte tsɛ̀ɛ ngwʉ̌ŋ, aa nyìŋ gẅie à ge sẅiŋe wɔ̀ɔn.
en: And he answered and said,He that dippethhishand with me in the dish, the same shall betray me.

ngiemboon: Jẅidas, ngàŋ menáŋ wɛ̌, zɛ́te yé Yěsô ngie: Tsítsà ɔ̀ gɔɔn wɔ̀ɔn ka? Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó yé ngie: Gù zɔ kě ńgɔɔn!
en: Then Judas, which betrayed him, answered and said, Master, is it I? He said unto him,Thou hast said.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ńkaa ntú’ melù’, ńná ndǎg mbwó Ssé, ńgwaa náa mbwó*ngàŋa kwò yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi kɔ̀ ḿbú ńnú metsèm.
en: And he took the cup, and gave thanks, and gaveitto them, saying,Drink ye all of it;

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ́ leen ńké ńzɔb mentse ńdɔg ńgu’te Ssé, àfʉ̀’ ku’ pɔ́ kẅɛ, ńgʉa né ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́ metÿǒ mèvɛ olive.
en: And when they had sung an hymn, they went out into the mount of Olives.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n ge gÿo gwɔ́ tà zíme nà legwé, e vɔgɔ Galilea zẅí’te gẅí.
en: But after I am risen again, I will go before you into Galilee.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a lɔɔn ńgwá’a gú ńkÿo metsèm, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mèŋ n de gú gwá’.
en: Peter answered and said unto him, Though allmenshall be offended because of thee,yetwill I never be offended.

ngiemboon: éfaga piɛ pâ penkʉ́ Zebede mépʉ́a, pâ pɔ̌ gʉa, á zye lé jú’ kekáŋ ntʉm ye, legwé pfɛ́ɛ yé,
en: And he took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and began to be sorrowful and very heavy.

ngiemboon: Tà pi gíŋe ńdyé, pi sẅíŋte Ssé, ḿbɔ́g menò njÿó lékwà’te gẅí, pi fʉa nò. Ntʉ́m nyìŋ tʉte tɛ’ tá’, mbùm nnɛ́ pÿɛ́ pÿɛ̌.
en: Watch and pray, that ye enter not into temptation: the spirit indeediswilling, but the fleshisweak.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńgíŋ ḿbiŋ nzèm, ńgyá pɔ́ ne ńdyé lyě, mélà’mie á la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà lelɔ́g pǔ ńgwoon wɔ́b tɛ’.
en: And he came and found them asleep again: for their eyes were heavy.

ngiemboon: Yěsô nyé wɔ́b, ńgíŋe ńgʉa nà mbɔ́ɔntè yétá sẅíŋte Ssé, ńgíŋe ńgɔɔn pɔ́ nò gie à zɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn,
en: And he left them, and went away again, and prayed the third time, saying the same words.

ngiemboon: Pi lu ssé pege gʉa! Nyìŋ gẅie à sẅiŋé wɔ̀ɔn mbwó pɔb wɛ̂ gẅie à tóo lɛ̂!
en: Rise, let us be going: behold, he is at hand that doth betray me.

ngiemboon: Jẅidas gwóon ńtsíŋte nnɛ́, ńtóo lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, ńgɔɔn ngie: À Ndè, n tsyɛ’té, ńdeen ńgwóon ńtáŋte yé.
en: And forthwith he came to Jesus, and said, Hail, master; and kissed him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwó yé ngie: À shǔ wɔ̀ɔn, gÿo pɔ́ mmó gie ɔ̀ tǒ ngÿǒ. Àlá’ leen ńké ńtó ńgwoon Yěsô.
en: And Jesus said unto him,Friend, wherefore art thou come?Then came they, and laid hands on Jesus, and took him.

ngiemboon: *Mentándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ lâ pàsá’a lá’, é ne fa’a cÿɔ̌ nò gẅie pɔ́ ge zába twó Yěsô tá lɔg gÿo mé zẅé yé.
en: Now the chief priests, and elders, and all the council, sought false witness against Jesus, to put him to death;

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ wɛ̂ ka gɔɔn ngie: À ku’u lékeme*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, ńdɔg lyɛ̌’ sétá ńkwɛ́.
en: and said, Thisfellowsaid, I am able to destroy the temple of God, and to build it in three days.

ngiemboon: Pi Kwǎŋ gí ngie kɔ́? Àlá’ tsɔ́’ ngie: Aa nyìŋ gẅie ńgwɔ́ mé zẅé yé zẅé.
en: What think ye? They answered and said, He is guilty of death.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ leen ńké ńtsɔg metyé shÿó Yěsô, ńtsẅiŋe yé, petsɔ́ pʉ̀a ne ńtéme mbwó letuŋó yé,
en: Then did they spit in his face, and buffeted him; and others smotehimwith the palms of their hands,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn ngie: À*Nzà’nkÿo, keme nyìŋ gẅie à cúɔ gú.
en: saying, Prophesy unto us, thou Christ, Who is he that smote thee?

ngiemboon: Piɛ tyé mvfò mânyìŋ ntsèm, ḿmoŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: N kaa zsé nò gie ɔ̀ fa’a légɔɔn wɔ́!
en: But he denied beforethemall, saying, I know not what thou sayest.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gíŋe ḿmoŋe, ńgɔɔn tà ńkʉa ngie: Mèŋ n te nyìŋ wɛ̂ zsé.
en: And again he denied with an oath, I do not know the man.

ngiemboon: Á leen ńké ńzye lé ye: E Ssé zẅé wɔ̀ɔn, à zeŋe yɔ́ɔn me, mèŋ n te ne ńzsé nyìŋ wɛ̂ wɔ́. Mênkɔ́’ gwóon ńtóŋ.
en: Then began he to curse and to swear,saying, I know not the man. And immediately the cock crew.

ngiemboon: ńgÿo mé kwɛ́ɛ yé, ńdɔgɔ yé ńgʉa ńnáa mbwó ngúmnɔ́ɔn*Pilato.
en: and when they had bound him, they ledhimaway, and delivered him to Pontius Pilate the governor.

ngiemboon: Jẅidas ma’ nkáb á*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, éfó jʉ’ó ńgʉa, ńdeen ńké ńgʉa ńcʉŋe.
en: And he cast down the pieces of silver in the temple, and departed, and went and hanged himself.

ngiemboon: Tà fó fʉ̀’ó, mé ée ńcʉ́’ʉ ńtóŋo wɛ̌ nká’, pɔ́ ngie nká’a metse tà ńkú lyɛ̌’ɔɔn.
en: Wherefore that field was called, The field of blood, unto this day.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ka ná yɛ̌ nkáb ńdɔg ńjú nká’ mbwòon mekʉŋ tsá’a, á gwɔ́ mmó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la lá’ ńtsẅi ngie mé gÿo
en: and gave them for the potter's field, as the Lord appointed me.

ngiemboon: *Mentándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ mekěme lá’ ne ńtÿɔ́gɔ menò twó Yěsô tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn, á ké tè ne ḿbÿɛɛ wɔ́.
en: And when he was accused of the chief priests and elders, he answered nothing.

ngiemboon: *Pilato, gɔɔn né yé ngie: Ɔ̀ tè ne ńjú’u nzẅìŋ menò mie mé gɔɔn ná gù wɔ́ ka?
en: Then said Pilate unto him, Hearest thou not how many things they witness against thee?

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô pú tè pÿɛ. Ngúmnɔ́ɔn gyá á pú ńkʉ’ʉ yé tɛ’.
en: And he answered him to never a word; insomuch that the governor marvelled greatly.

ngiemboon: Á lɔ́ɔn ńgwɔ́ lyɛ’ɛ́ línɔ́ɔn*Páskà, Ngúmnɔ́ɔn tsɔ́’ɔ ngàŋa tsǎŋ gẅie àlá’ zɛté.
en: Now atthatfeast the governor was wont to release unto the people a prisoner, whom they would.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, àtsɔ̌ ntʉ̀ ngàŋa tsǎŋ gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ndá tsǎŋ, mé tóŋo yé lê Yěsô Panepâse.
en: And they had then a notable prisoner, called Barabbas.

ngiemboon: *Pilato lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn pú’u, mélà’mie à cwoŋo ne ńzsé ngie mé kwɔ́’ɔ pɔ́ lóŋ ná Yěsô tá sẅiŋe ye.
en: For he knew that for envy they had delivered him.

ngiemboon: *Mentándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ mekěme lá’ ne ńtsóte lá’ ngie á zɛ́te ngie*Pilato tsɔ́’ pɔ́ Panepâse ńgÿo mé zẅé Yěsô.
en: But the chief priests and elders persuaded the multitude that they should ask Barabbas, and destroy Jesus.

ngiemboon: *Pilato zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Kwà’ nò tepòŋ gie à gÿǒ gwɔ́ pɔ́ kɔ́? Tá àlá’ kẅi’i ńnáa gwá, ńgɔɔn pé ngie: Ké ńkime yé kim!
en: And the governor said, Why, what evil hath he done? But they cried out the more, saying, Let him be crucified.

ngiemboon: Mânyìŋ ntsèm tsɔ́’ ngie: Metse nyìŋ wɛ̂ sẅɛ́’ɛ ndù peg tà mbɔɔ ndù penkʉ́ peg.
en: Then answered all the people, and said, His bloodbeon us, and on our children.

ngiemboon: Pàlÿɔ́’ ncù pà*Roma leen ńké ńdɔgɔ Yěsô ńgʉa mbʉ̀a Ngúmnɔ́ɔn, pɔ́b metsèm cú’te ńkéle yé ńnéŋe soŋ,
en: Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the common hall, and gathered unto him the whole bandof soldiers.

ngiemboon: ḿbú sẅɛ menzsǒ mé, ńcʉ́’ mma’ pɔ́ nzsǒ lefùɔ ná yé,
en: And they stripped him, and put on him a scarlet robe.

ngiemboon: Ńně ńtsɔgɔ metyé ná yé, ńkẅé kekà’a, ńcúɔ twó yé,
en: And they spit upon him, and took the reed, and smote him on the head.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa tà ńkúu tsɔ́ jʉ’ gie mé tóŋo lê Golgota, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: Àjʉ’ʉ kẅǐ twó.
en: And when they were come unto a place called Golgotha, that is to say, a place of a skull,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kúu jʉ’ó, ńdɔgɔ tsɔ́ mmó gie á lẅe lẅe ḿvoŋ melù’, ńná ngie Yěsô nú. Yěsô zẅí’ à tè kwoŋo lénú wɔ́.
en: they gave him vinegar to drink mingled with gall: and when he had tastedthereof, he would not drink.

ngiemboon: Á ku’, pɔ́ ńnéŋe ssé ńne ḿbyɛ́bɛ Yěsô.
en: And sitting down they watched him there;

ngiemboon: Mé ŋwe’e mmó gie à fʉa ńkime tÿǒ á jʉ’ gie twó yé la wó ńgie: Wɔɔn aa Yěsô, fùɔ pà Yuda.
en: and set up over his head his accusation written, THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la gíŋe ńkim metsǒŋ mépʉ́a nâ metÿǒ nkǐ, tà’ gwɔ́ nà gwǒŋo pwó Yěsô ye tʉ̀, wetsɔ̌ gwɔ́ ná gwǒŋo pwó kyɛ̀bɛ.
en: Then were there two thieves crucified with him, one on the right hand, and another on the left.

ngiemboon: Pàcʉa mánzsè la ne ńnyime yé yɔ́b, ńzoonte Yěsô,
en: And they that passed by reviled him, wagging their heads,

ngiemboon: *Metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’, pâ*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê, pâ mekěme lá’ ne ńzoonte yɔ́b Yěsô ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Likewise also the chief priests mockinghim, with the scribes and elders, said,

ngiemboon: Tà mbɔɔ metsǒŋ pie mé la kime wɔ́b nà metÿǒ nkǐ á lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô gíŋe ne ńzoonte yé yɔ́b pɔ́ pú’u.
en: The thieves also, which were crucified with him, cast the same in his teeth.

ngiemboon: Tsɛ̀ɛ zsǒ la gwɔ́ tà ńku’, ejʉ’ ntsèm tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ pú síŋ, tà ńdá’ ńkúu ná nèm tá mbÿɛ̀ njÿó.
en: Now from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land unto the ninth hour.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é laa jʉ’ó jú’, ńgɔɔn ngie: À wɛ̂ gẅie à ne ńtóŋo*Elîɛ lɛ̂!
en: Some of them that stood there, when they heardthat, said, Thismancalleth for Elias.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi cʉ́’ pege gyá ka*Elîɛ ge tó fó nà tÿǒ nkǐ ésẅi’i yé wɔ́!
en: The rest said, Let be, let us see whether Elias will come to save him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńga’te nê ngyè tetʉ̀ ndeen ńcʉ́m.
en: Jesus, when he had cried again with a loud voice, yielded up the ghost.

ngiemboon: metwó mesyè tsɔ́’ɔ ńtyé, mepfó pie pɔ́ la záb ntʉ́m ná Ssé zyeente tà ńgyɔ́ɔn,
en: and the graves were opened; and many bodies of the saints which slept arose,

ngiemboon: Pànzwě tá ńgyɔ́ɔn tyé ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a ne ńdíe, mbà pɔ́ la zsê nzèm Yěsô tà fó Galilea, ńgiŋe ńkẅéte yé.
en: And many women were there beholding afar off, which followed Jesus from Galilee, ministering unto him:

ngiemboon: Á laa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Malîɛ Magdala, ńgÿo Malîɛ má pà Jâg pɔ́ Yesyɛ̂b, ńgíŋ ńgÿo má pà gubé Zebede.
en: among which was Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of Zebedee's children.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ńgyá*pilato, ńdúɔ pfó Yěsô légʉa ńde’e.*Pilato zẅíŋ, ńtsẅi ngie mé ńná né yé.
en: he went to Pilate, and begged the body of Jesus. Then Pilate commanded the body to be delivered.

ngiemboon: Mé kyɛ́’, Yesyɛ̂b kẅé, ńdɔgɔ pwó nzsǒ sẅé ńzémte pfó ye,
en: And when Joseph had taken the body, he wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,

ngiemboon: À la gwɔ́ ńnéŋe pfó Yěsô jʉ’ó Malîɛ Magdala pɔ́ wetsɔ̌ Malîɛ ńnéŋe ssé á ngʉ̀ŋe lesyè, ńne ńgyá.
en: And there was Mary Magdalene, and the other Mary, sitting over against the sepulchre.

ngiemboon: *Pilato gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pàlÿɔ́’ ncù é pɛ̂. Pi gʉa ńgÿo mé pyɛ́b lesyè pá’ pi kwǒŋ!
en: Pilate said unto them, Ye have a watch: go your way, makeitas sure as ye can.

ngiemboon: À la ne ńkyɛ’ɛ jʉ’ pá’ nně mbʉ̀ŋ la, menzsǒ mé piŋ ne fɔ́gɔ tà ńŋwʉŋe.
en: His countenance was like lightning, and his raiment white as snow:

ngiemboon: Pàpyɛ́b lesyè gyá pú’u, ḿvɛ, ḿbɔ́g, ńgwete ńnuŋte ssé pá’ mepfó la.
en: and for fear of him the keepers did shake, and became as deadmen.

ngiemboon: Tá*cÿɔ́’ Ssé gɔɔn né pànzwě ngie: Tà pi pɔ́g, n zsě ngie pi tóo fa’ Yěsô gẅie mé ka kime yé ná tÿǒ kǐ la.
en: And the angel answered and said unto the women, Fear not ye: for I know that ye seek Jesus, which was crucified.

ngiemboon: À tè gíŋe ńgwɔ́ jʉ’ɔɔn wɔ́, à zimé nà legwé pá’ à la gɔɔn la. Pi tó ńdíe jʉ’ gie pfó yé kaa wó tá ńgyá.
en: He is not here: for he is risen, as he said. Come, see the place where the Lord lay.

ngiemboon: *Mentándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’, tóŋ mekěme lá’, pâ pɔ̌ cú’te ńnéŋe ssé, ńkwaŋte, ńná ḿbwɔ́’ nkáb mbwó pàlÿɔ́’ ncù,
en: And when they were assembled with the elders, and had taken counsel, they gave large money unto the soldiers,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gɔɔn pé ngie pi ně ne ńdyé letsẅɛ́’,*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô tó ńjʉʉ pfó yé ńdɔg ńgʉa.
en: saying, Say ye, His disciples came by night, and stole himawaywhile we slept.

ngiemboon: Ngúmnɔ́ɔn lɔɔn ńké ńjú’, mbà peg ge zsé nò gie peg ge shwóŋó yé, ḿbɔ́gɔ gẅi légyá ngɔ́’.
en: And if this come to the governor's ears, we will persuade him, and secure you.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwɔ́ tá ńgyá Yěsô, ńkwí’te ssé, ńgu’te yé, tá tsɔ́ pʉ̀a gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ńně ḿmʉ́’te mʉ’té.
en: And when they saw him, they worshipped him: but some doubted.

ngiemboon: Nzyetè Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo Yěsô Kristo gẅie aa Míŋ Ssé, e yɔɔn
en: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God;

ngiemboon: à gwɔ́ mvfò ńně ńkɔ́’ɔ nzsè jù, ɔ ne ńtóo.
en: Which shall prepare thy way before thee.

ngiemboon: ńgÿo melyěen nzsè mé e tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ»!
en: Make his paths straight.

ngiemboon: Á laa nà lyɛ̌’ ásɛ̌, Yěsô leen ńké fó Nǎzarɛd, á tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Galilea ńtó, ńgyá Jâŋ, á nu’u yé tsɛ̀ɛ ntse Jurdeŋ.
en: And it came to pass in those days, that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized of John in Jordan.

ngiemboon: Ngyè fó tÿǒ lepwó ngie: Ɔɔ míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n kwoŋo ɔ́ tɛ’, n záb ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn ná gù.
en: and there came a voice from heaven,saying, Thou art my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.

ngiemboon: À Zẅìge tóo ná Yěsô pá’ɔɔn, ńtsó yé, á gʉa lê nkwòŋo tsẅɛ.
en: And immediately the Spirit driveth him into the wilderness.

ngiemboon: Mé la gwɔ́ tà ńgwoon Jâŋ ńnéŋe ndá tsǎŋ, Yěsô gʉa nê Galilea. À lɔ̌ɔn ńtsẅii nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Now after that John was put in prison, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God,

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ áa pá’ɔɔn, mbà á kǔ’ tà Ssé ge zye lényɛ Lefùɔ sé. Pi kúbe mà gẅí, ḿbiŋ ńzẅíŋ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo wɔɔn ŋwɛ́.
en: and saying,The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand: repent ye, and believe the gospel.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi tó pege zɔ cʉ́’ʉ ńgiŋe, mèŋ n gÿo pi cʉ́’ʉ fa’a pɔ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: And Jesus said unto them,Come ye after me, and I will make you to become fishers of men.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwóon ńnyé menkÿo mɔ́b, ńcʉ́me nzèm yé.
en: And straightway they forsook their nets, and followed him.

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ́ gÿo ńgʉa Kapernawúm, á gwɔ́*lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè pà Yuda, Yěsô gʉa*ndá cú’tè, ńzye lézí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé.
en: And they went into Capernaum; and straightway on the sabbath day he entered into the synagogue, and taught.

ngiemboon: Á ne shwóŋe, tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ yé ndá ŋwɛ́, mbà tsɔ̌*Ssé tepòŋ léen ńgwoon yé, á ńnéŋe tà ḿvege vege ńgá’te ngie:
en: And there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit; and he cried out,

ngiemboon: Yěsô cÿɔ́g yɛ̌*Ssé tepòŋ ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Láŋte, éfó ná nyìŋ wɛ̂ ńkẅɛ!
en: And Jesus rebuked him, saying,Hold thy peace, and come out of him.

ngiemboon: E*Ssé tepòŋ ŋwɛ́ gwóon ńtɔ́ɔn ngàŋ ńcʉ́’ʉ yé lê tʉ̀, ńgwɔ fó ná yé kẅɛ, ńgá’te tɛ’.
en: And when the unclean spirit had torn him, and cried with a loud voice, he came out of him.

ngiemboon: Lezíŋ Yěsô gwóon saa lá’ tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Galilea ŋwɛ́ ntsèm.
en: And immediately his fame spread abroad throughout all the region round about Galilee.

ngiemboon: Mákẅì’ Símo la nuŋe, nnɛ́ ne ńkwɔ́’ɔ yé. Yěsô kúu wó mé gwóon shwóŋó yé.
en: But Simon's wife's mother lay sick of a fever, and anon they tell him of her.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a tÿǒsoŋ ŋwɛ́ metsèm cú’te ncwò ndá.
en: And all the city was gathered together at the door.

ngiemboon: Símo pâ yetsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô cʉ́’ nzèm ne fa’a yé,
en: And Simon and they that were with him followed after him.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ tà ńgyá yé, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Pʉ̀a metsèm ne fa’a gú.
en: And when they had found him, they said unto him, Allmenseek for thee.

ngiemboon: Mezìŋe mé kúu Yěsô, á tsege pwó ńkíbe yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n kwǒŋ pú’u, zeŋe.
en: And Jesus, moved with compassion, put forthhishand, and touched him, and saith unto him,I will; be thou clean.

ngiemboon: Nkà’ gwóon ḿmaga ná yé, á zeŋe.
en: And as soon as he had spoken, immediately the leprosy departed from him, and he was cleansed.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ngie, à gʉa, ńně ńtɔ́’ɔ yé tɛ’,
en: And he straitly charged him, and forthwith sent him away;

ngiemboon: É cʉa lyɛ̌’ shÿɔ́’ɔ tsɔ́ wɔ́, Yěsô gíŋ ḿbiŋe Kapernawúm. Mé jú’ ngie aa ndá,
en: And again he entered into Capernaum aftersomedays; and it was noised that he was in the house.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ pʉ̀a tó, ńgẅiin ngàŋa kwʉ́’te, mbà mbàŋa lekùa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b leŋé yé, lélɔg ńtó ńgyá Yěsô.
en: And they come unto him, bringing one sick of the palsy, which was borne of four.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê gwɔ́ jʉ’ó, ńjú’, ńkwaŋte lóŋ pɔ́b ngie:
en: But there were certain of the scribes sitting there, and reasoning in their hearts,

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ wɔɔn shwóŋó lêkɔ́ lɛ? À zoonté Ssé. E Ssé gílé yé zɔ ku’u lélege menò tepòŋ nyìŋ.
en: Why doth thismanthus speak blasphemies? who can forgive sins but God only?

ngiemboon: Lu ssé, ńkaa páŋte gù ńdɔg ńgʉa né mbʉ̀a gù.
en: I say unto thee, Arise, and take up thy bed, and go thy way into thine house.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la gíŋe ḿbiŋ nzèm nkwɔ’ɔ́ ntse Galilea. Alá’ ne ńtóo ńkẅɛ́te yé, á ne ńzí’i wɔ́b nò Ssé.
en: And he went forth again by the sea side; and all the multitude resorted unto him, and he taught them.

ngiemboon: Tá’, mé ge lá’ fó mbwo pɔ́b tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’, ésa’a yé, pɔ́ leen ńké ńnéŋe nzyè fʉ̀’ó.
en: But the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, and then shall they fast in those days.

ngiemboon: Áa pú’u, tá*Míŋ Nyìŋ zɔ zɔɔn ńgẅiin légɔɔn mmó gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé gÿo tà mbɔɔ ná*lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè pà Yuda.
en: therefore the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńgíŋe ńgʉa tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ yé ndá ŋwɛ́, mbà pwó yé léen ńkwé.
en: And he entered again into the synagogue; and there was a man there which had a withered hand.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a gwɔ́ jʉ’ó, ńně ńdeŋe yé légyá kà à ge gÿo nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ zeŋe*lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè wɔ́, pɔ́ fó mǒ, ésẅiŋe yé.
en: And they watched him, whether he would heal him on the sabbath day; that they might accuse him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn mbwo kwè pwó ŋwɛ́ ngie: Lu ssé ńtó ńtyé mvfò,
en: And he saith unto the man which had the withered hand,Stand forth.

ngiemboon: Pà*farisay leen fó*ndá cú’tè ńkẅɛ, pâ pʉ̀a*Herôd gwóon ńcú’te léfa’ shÿó pá’ pɔ́ ge gÿo tá zẅé Yěsô.
en: And the Pharisees went forth, and straightway took counsel with the Herodians against him, how they might destroy him.

ngiemboon: Tá’ Yěsô ne ńtɔ’ɔ wɔ́b tà ḿbʉ́ʉ tɛ’ ngie pɔ́ pɔ́ɔn légÿo mé zsé nyìŋ gẅie aa wɛ̌.
en: And he straitly charged them that they should not make him known.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńkwɔ́’ɔ ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́, ńtóŋ pʉ̀a pie à tsɔ’ɔ́ wɔ́b. Pɔ́ tó,
en: And he goeth up into a mountain, and callethunto himwhom he would: and they came unto him.

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ńku’u léjwoŋ*messé tepòŋ mie é pue pʉ̀a.
en: and to have power to heal sicknesses, and to cast out devils:

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie à la tsɔ́’ɔ wɔ́b, e pɔɔn: Wɔɔn laa Símo, á tsẅi lezíŋ sé lé Piɛ,
en: and Simon he surnamed Peter;

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ńgÿo Jẅidas Iskariod gẅie à la táa sẅiŋe Yěsô.
en: and Judas Iscariot, which also betrayed him: and they went into an house.

ngiemboon: Yěsô kúu ndá, alá’ gíŋe ńcú’te ńgyɔ́ɔn gyɔ́ɔn tà pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé té gyá fʉ̀’ tà ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó wɔ́.
en: And the multitude cometh together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a tsìŋe ndá pà Yěsô jú’u yɔɔn nò, ńdu ssé, ńcʉ́me mánzsè pá’ pɔ́ ge gʉa gwoon yé, ńně ńkwaŋa ngie twó yé cʉŋté.
en: And when his friends heardof it, they went out to lay hold on him: for they said, He is beside himself.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tóŋo wɔ́b pɔ́ tó, á saga mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Tà áa nénʉ́ ngie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ Sátà sele ńjwoŋo twó mbùm yé lá?
en: And he called themunto him, and said unto them in parables,How can Satan cast out Satan?

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a tà’a lá’ lɔɔn sele ńdÿɔ́’ ncù tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, mbà yɛ̌ lá’ ge pyé.
en: And if a kingdom be divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a tà’a tsìŋe ndá piŋ sele ńtág mélà’ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, mbà yɛ̌ tsìŋe ndá ge tága.
en: And if a house be divided against itself, that house cannot stand.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn mbwo pɔ́b pú’u, mélà’mie pɔ́ la ne ńgɔɔn ngie metʉ̀ mé fóo pɔ́ mbwo*Ssé tepòŋ.
en: because they said, He hath an unclean spirit.

ngiemboon: Má pà Yěsô pâ mefɛ́ pé leen ńke ńtó, ńtyé ncwò ndá, ńtúmo nyìŋ ngie à gʉa ńtóŋo yé ńná né pɔ́b.
en: There came then his brethren and his mother, and, standing without, sent unto him, calling him.

ngiemboon: Alá’ pú ńnéŋe Ssé, ńtÿɔ́’te Yěsô ńnéŋe soŋ, mé gɔɔn mbwo yé ngie: Mé gɔ̌ɔn ngie má ɔ pâ mefɛ́ pú ée pi ńně fa’a ɔ.
en: And the multitude sat about him, and they said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren without seek for thee.

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ ngie, má wɔ̀ɔn aa wɔ̌, mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn gwɔ́ pàwɔ̌?
en: And he answered them, saying,Who is my mother, or my brethren?

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, ésele ńdíe pʉ̀a pie é tÿɔ́’te yé ńnéŋe soŋ, ńgɔɔn ngie: Má wɔ̀ɔn pâ mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn pɔ̀ɔn pie pɔ́ ńnéŋe lɔɔn.
en: And he looked round about on them which sat about him, and said,Behold my mother and my brethren!

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgÿo mmó gie Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, mbà ngàŋ aa má wɔ̀ɔn, mbà aa fɛ́ wɔ̀ɔn, we mámbàŋa mbɔɔ we manzwě.
en: For whosoever shall do the will of God, the same is my brother, and my sister, and mother.

ngiemboon: Á la lɔg*sagá nò ńzí’i wɔ́b menò tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn, ńne ńzí’i wɔ́b ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: And he taught them many things by parables, and said unto them in his doctrine,

ngiemboon: Pi zẅí’te ńjú’, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ lǎ’ ńgʉa ḿma’ mbyè mmó,
en: Hearken; Behold, there went out a sower to sow:

ngiemboon: ńtóo mma’á, etsɔ́ memvòm gwe ngʉ̀ŋe mánzsè, meshʉ́ŋ tó ńdagte ḿpfɛ́.
en: and it came to pass, as he sowed, some fell by the way side, and the fowls of the air came and devoured it up.

ngiemboon: Nèm gÿo ńtʉ́a mboŋó, ńtuɔ, é júm, á nue menŋàŋ la tè lyɛɛ ssé wɔ́.
en: but when the sun was up, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.

ngiemboon: Metsɔ́ memvòm gwe tsɛ̀ɛ legǐ tepòŋ. Legǐ tepòŋ gÿo ńdu ssé, éfóme mɛ̌, é té zém.
en: And some fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.

ngiemboon: Yěsô cʉ́me ngie: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin metuŋó lélɔg ńjú’u nò, á jú’.
en: And he said unto them,He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

ngiemboon: Yěsô piŋ ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi tě ńjú’u yɔɔn*sagá nò wɔ́ pá’ɔɔn, tà piŋ jú’ metsɔ́ pɔ́ lêkɔ́?
en: And he said unto them,Know ye not this parable? and how then will ye know all parables?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à pyě mmó, à pye shwóŋè Ssé
en: The sower soweth the word.

ngiemboon: Mbyè mmó gie e gwě tsɛ̀ɛ megǐ tepòŋ, lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é jú’u shwóŋè Ssé,
en: And these are they which are sown among thorns; such as hear the word,

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin metuŋó lélɔg ńjú’u nò, á jú’.
en: If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à gẅiin mmó, mé ge gÿo kẅi’i, nyìŋ gẅie à tè gẅiin, mé kẅé méjʉ’ gẅie à zɔɔn ńgẅiin.
en: For he that hath, to him shall be given: and he that hath not, from him shall be taken even that which he hath.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie:*Lefùɔ Ssé gwá’a mbyè mmó gie nyìŋ ma’á nɔ̀ɔn yé la,
en: And he said,So is the kingdom of God, as if a man should cast seed into the ground;

ngiemboon: Tsetsá’ gílé yé zɔ gÿo mbyè mmó sá’, ńgú’, éshʉ́a metsɔ̀’, ḿmú’te.
en: For the earth bringeth forth fruit of herself; first the blade, then the ear, after that the full corn in the ear.

ngiemboon: Metsɔ̀’ gÿo ńtʉ, angàŋa nɔ̀ɔn cʉ́’ ńtúm pɔ́ pʉ̀a nká’ ńdag shúm, mélà’mie afʉ̀’ʉ lélag shúm kǔ’.
en: But when the fruit is brought forth, immediately he putteth in the sickle, because the harvest is come.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pege lɔgɔ kɔ́ ḿbí fʉ̀’ pá’*Lefùɔ Ssé ée pú’u, ńgwɔ́ pege lɔgɔ yɛ̌*sagá nò ńtyɛ’te?
en: And he said,Whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of God? or with what comparison shall we compare it?

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ ncwò nzém lyɛ’ó, Yěsô gɔɔn mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Pege túm ntse, ńgʉa nà yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ.
en: And the same day, when the even was come, he saith unto them,Let us pass over unto the other side.

ngiemboon: atsɔ̌ máamáa fóm ńnéŋe tà ńzye lécʉ’, ntse ne ḿbʉe ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, tà á cʉ́’ʉ ńgee pé ńdúe,
en: And there arose a great storm of wind, and the waves beat into the ship, so that it was now full.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie, pi sěen ḿbɔ́gɔ kɔ́, pi fɔ̌ɔn ńnyé pɔ́ tè záb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ kà.
en: And he said unto them,Why are ye so fearful? how is it that ye have no faith?

ngiemboon: Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé túm ntse tà ńkúu nà yetsɔ́ nzǐŋ, é gwɔ́ ngwòŋ pà Garazania,
en: And they came over unto the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gadarenes.

ngiemboon: Á tyé ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, ńgyá Yěsô pú’u, ńnɔ́ɔnte yé ńtó ńnuŋe mekwò yé,
en: But when he saw Jesus afar off, he ran and worshipped him,

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ la gwaa gɔɔn pú’u, á gwɔ́, mbà Yěsô tsẅǐ né*messé tepòŋ ngie pɔ́ fó ná yé ńkẅɛ.
en: For he said unto him,Come out of the man,thouunclean spirit.

ngiemboon: ńnyɛte sẅíŋte Yěsô ngie: Tsétsɔ’, tà á jwoŋ messé ŋwɛ́ tà pɔ́ fóo lá’ ayɛ̌ ńgʉa.
en: And he besought him much that he would not send them away out of the country.

ngiemboon: Á la gwaa gwɔ́, atsɔ́ nùɔ mekúnɔ́ɔn gwɔ́ jʉ’ó, á ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́ ńně ńgwá ńkʉ́’ʉ fa’a shúm ḿpfɛ́ɛ.
en: Now there was there nigh unto the mountains a great herd of swine feeding.

ngiemboon: *Messé tepòŋ sẅíŋte Yěsô ńgɔɔn ngie: Gÿo peg kú pɔ́ nà mekúnɔ́ɔn pɛ̂.
en: And all the devils besought him, saying, Send us into the swine, that we may enter into them.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ pʉ̀a gwɔ́ jʉ’ó, mbà pɔ́ ně ńgyá mmó gie á gÿǒ nyìŋ awɛ̌ mbàa mekúnɔ́ɔn. Pɔ́ ne ḿbíte shwóŋó pʉ̀a pie é tǒ nzèm.
en: And they that sawittold them how it befell to him that was possessed with the devil, andalsoconcerning the swine.

ngiemboon: Mé jú’, ńzye lésẅíŋte Yěsô ngie à fó lá’ pɔ́b ńgʉa.
en: And they began to pray him to depart out of their coasts.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’ pá’ à ge cʉ́’ gʉa yé gʉa, nyìŋ wá gẅie à zeŋé la, sẅíŋte yé ngie à zẅíŋ, pɔ́ ye gʉa.
en: And when he was come into the ship, he that had been possessed with the devil prayed him that he might be with him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zẅíŋ, pɔ́ yé cʉ́me mánzsè ńně ńgee, alá’ pú ńgwɔ́ mánzsè tɛ’, ḿbú ne sẅɛ́ɛ Yěsô.
en: AndJesuswent with him; and much people followed him, and thronged him.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ manzwě gwɔ́ yé nùɔ, ńně ńguɔ, ńgẅiin guɔ máshúɔ, mbà á gegé yé gege ngù’ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a lê legém.
en: And a certain woman, which had an issue of blood twelve years,

ngiemboon: À la jú’ pá’ mé gɔɔn ngie Yěsô ne ńgÿo pʉ̀a zeŋe, á ná’te fó nzèm ńtó ńkíbe nzsǒ Yěsô,
en: when she had heard of Jesus, came in the press behind, and touched his garment.

ngiemboon: ńně ńgɔɔn ntʉ́m yé ngie: N dɔɔn ńkíbe pɔ́ ndà’ nzsǒ Yěsô, mbà n ge zeŋe,
en: For she said, If I may touch but his clothes, I shall be whole.

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńkíbe, aguɔ yé gwóon ńzá’a, á gíŋe ńjú’, mbà à zeŋé.
en: And straightway the fountain of her blood was dried up; and she felt inherbody that she was healed of that plague.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé tsɔ́’ ngie: Ɔ̀ gyǎ alá’ pú ne sẅɛ́ɛ gú zẅìŋ wɔɔn, ɔ̀ gíŋe ńzɛ́te ngie à wɔ̌ kibé nzsǒ jù wɔ́ la?
en: And his disciples said unto him, Thou seest the multitude thronging thee, and sayest thou, Who touched me?

ngiemboon: Yěsô ké sele pɔ́ nnɛ́ ńně ńnáŋte, éfa’a lézsé nyìŋ gẅie à kibé yé.
en: And he looked round about to see her that had done this thing.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né ye ngie: Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, pá’ ɔ̀ zǎb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ la, ɔ̀ zeŋé, gʉa lê mbʉ́lè, aguɔ jú mǎg.
en: And he said unto her,Daughter, thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace, and be whole of thy plague.

ngiemboon: Yěsô jú’ pá’ fʉ̀’ gie à kaa jú’u la, ńgɔɔn né Yayelo ngie: Tè pɔ́g, záb pɔ́ ntʉ́m ná mèŋ.
en: As soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken, he saith unto the ruler of the synagogue,Be not afraid, only believe.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pɔ́ Yayelo ne ńgee, Yěsô tè zẅíŋ ngie tsɔ̌ nyìŋ cʉ́me nzèm pɔ́b wɔ́, ndà’ Piɛ ńgÿo Jâg pɔ́ fɛ́ we Jâŋ.
en: And he suffered no man to follow him, save Peter, and James, and John the brother of James.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa tà ńkúu ndá Yayelo, Yěsô gyá mé pú ńgwɔ́ wó ńně ḿbége jʉ’, epʉ̀a ne ńdʉate, petsɔ́ ne ńga’te.
en: And he cometh to the house of the ruler of the synagogue, and seeth the tumult, and them that wept and wailed greatly.

ngiemboon: Yěsô kúu ndá ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi pǔ ḿbége jʉ’, ńdʉa nzẅìŋ wɛ̂ mélà’a kɔ́? Múɔ kaa kwé, à lye lyě.
en: And when he was come in, he saith unto them,Why make ye this ado, and weep? the damsel is not dead, but sleepeth.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pú ńtɔ’ɔ wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ pɔ́ɔn légÿo tà tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ zsé mmó gie à gÿǒ, ḿbiŋ ńtsẅi ngie mé náa mmó à jÿó.
en: And he charged them straitly that no man should know it; and commanded that something should be given her to eat.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la fóo jʉ’ó, ńgʉa né lá’ pɔ́b, pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gwɔ́.
en: And he went out from thence, and came into his own country; and his disciples follow him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo fó jʉ’ó, ńgʉa ńzye légiŋe tsɛ̀ɛ melá’ shÿó jʉ’ó, ńně ńzí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé.
en: And he marvelled because of their unbelief. And he went round about the villages, teaching.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwá ńgiŋe jʉ’ ntsèm ńgɔɔn ngie: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mânyìŋ ntsèm kúbe mà.
en: And they went out, and preached that men should repent.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńgíŋe ńjwoŋo*messé tepòŋ mie é pue pʉ̀a, ńtse mèvɛ nà meguɔ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, pɔ́ zeŋe.
en: And they cast out many devils, and anointed with oil many that were sick, and healedthem.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie aa*Elîɛ, petsɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn yɔ́b ngie aa tsɔ̌*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé pá’ pe fʉ̀’ʉ mvfò.
en: Others said, That it is Elias. And others said, That it is a prophet, or as one of the prophets.

ngiemboon: Fùɔ*Herôd jú’ mɔɔn menò, ńgɔɔn yé ngie: Aa Jâŋ gẅie n da gÿo mé zá’a twó yé lá, mbà à zǐm.
en: But when Herod heardthereof, he said, It is John, whom I beheaded: he is risen from the dead.

ngiemboon: Jǎŋ ne ńkaga yé ngie:*Lepʉ̌ té ne ńzẅíŋe ngie ɔ̀ kaa nzwě fɛ́ gù wɔ́.
en: For John had said unto Herod, It is not lawful for thee to have thy brother's wife.

ngiemboon: Á la fó pú’u, tá*Herôdiad pú ńzá’ lekwɔ̀ɔn sé, ńně fa’a shÿó légÿo mé zẅé yé, ńké tè ne ńgyá wɔ́. À tě ngyá shÿó wɔ́,
en: Therefore Herodias had a quarrel against him, and would have killed him; but she could not:

ngiemboon: ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ káŋ ńdɔg ńtó, ńnáa mbwo múɔ manzwě ŋwɛ́, á kẅé ńgʉa ńnáa mbwo má we.
en: and brought his head in a charger, and gave it to the damsel: and the damsel gave it to her mother.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Jâŋ gÿo ńjú’ ngie mé zẅě tá wɔ́b, ńtó ńkaa pfó yé ńdɔg ńgʉa ńtúŋ.
en: And when his disciples heardof it, they came and took up his corpse, and laid it in a tomb.

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ̌ kúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, ńně ńgee nà jʉ’ gie membʉ̀a té wó wɔ́.
en: And they departed into a desert place by ship privately.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gÿo pʉ̀a néŋte nà megǐ menùɔ menùɔ.
en: And he commanded them to make all sit down by companies upon the green grass.

ngiemboon: Mé sẅɛ́’ ńnéŋte ssé menùɔ menùɔ, tsɔ́ menkàŋ gwɔ́ pʉ̀a móm ntʉ̀a, metsɔ́ gwɔ́ pʉ̀a nkÿo.
en: And they sat down in ranks, by hundreds, and by fifties.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́b metsèm pfɛ́, ńzẅɛ́.
en: And they did all eat, and were filled.

ngiemboon: Mé lagte mekèm mbelég mbaa messó mie é vwɔ’ɔ́, é lúe metúŋ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém.
en: And they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments, and of the fishes.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la pfɛ́ mbelég, la gyɔ́ɔn tɛ’, tà ndà’ mbàŋa gwɔ́ mmó ntsá’ tʉ̀a.
en: And they that did eat of the loaves were about five thousand men.

ngiemboon: Yěsô le’e lá’ tà pʉ̀a gwaa gʉa, á kwɔ́’ɔ ndùm tsɔ́ lekwɔ’ɔ́ lésẅíŋte Ssé.
en: And when he had sent them away, he departed into a mountain to pray.

ngiemboon: Nzěm gÿo ńgwaa síŋ, mbà kanú’ gʉ̌a tà ńgwɔ́ soŋ ntse, Yěsô nyé ńtyé pɔ́ ssé gílé ye,
en: And when even was come, the ship was in the midst of the sea, and he alone on the land.

ngiemboon: pɔ́ gyá pá’ nyìŋ ne ńgiŋe ndùm ntse, ńkwaŋ ngie áa gegÿɛ́ nyìŋ, ńzye léga’te lê tʉ̀.
en: But when they saw him walking upon the sea, they supposed it had been a spirit, and cried out:

ngiemboon: mélà’mie legyè sɔ́b nyé ḿvɔ́g vɔ́g, ńzɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gwɔ́, mbà pɔ́ kaa liŋe mmó gie Yěsô kɔ’ɔ́ ńjÿɔ́gɔ lá’ ńdɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ wɔ́.
en: For they considered notthe miracleof the loaves: for their heart was hardened.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ túm ntse, tà ńkúu nà nzǐŋ ye Jenezared, ńcʉŋe kanú’, éfó tsɛ̀ɛ wó ńkẅɛ,
en: And when they had passed over, they came into the land of Gennesaret, and drew to the shore.

ngiemboon: ńkẅɛ tà ńgwaa tyé ssé, mé liŋe Yěsô,
en: And when they were come out of the ship, straightway they knew him,

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’, etsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é fóo Yerósalem tó ńcú’te lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, ńgwɔ́ pà*farisay pâ*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê,
en: Then came together unto him the Pharisees, and certain of the scribes, which came from Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: ńgyá*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô ne ńjÿó mmó nê*lɔ̌’ nà mbwó mɔ́b, é mbwó mie pɔ́ kaa tsabte.
en: And when they saw some of his disciples eat bread with defiled, that is to say, with unwashen, hands, they found fault.

ngiemboon: ntʉ́m wɔ́b té ná mèŋ wɔ́.
en: But their heart is far from me.

ngiemboon: mbwo pʉ̀a ngie áa nò yɔ́ɔn
en: Teachingfordoctrines the commandments of men.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé légwá’*lepʉ̌ Ssé, ńcwoŋo ńkú’te pɔ́ nùŋe lá’ gẅi mboŋó.
en: And he said unto them,Full well ye reject the commandment of God, that ye may keep your own tradition.

ngiemboon: mbà pi ge zẅíŋ ngie à té gíŋe ńgẅiin lékẅéte tá we pɔ́ má we wɔ́.
en: And ye suffer him no more to do ought for his father or his mother;

ngiemboon: Pi zí’i nùŋe lá’ gẅi pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ńgwá’a shwóŋè Ssé. Pi giŋé ńne ńgÿo lìi menò ámɛ̌ tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn.
en: making the word of God of none effect through your tradition, which ye have delivered: and many such like things do ye.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńtóŋo lá’ ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi metsèm téŋe tuŋó, ńcwoŋo ńjú’u nò gie mèŋ n gee ngɔ̌ɔn.
en: And when he had called all the peopleunto him, he said unto them,Hearken unto me every oneof you, and understand:

ngiemboon: [Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin metuŋó lélɔg ńjú’u nò, á jú’]
en: If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo nyé lá’, ńgʉa tà ńkúu ndá,*ngàŋa kwò yé zɛ́te yé ngie à kyagte nò gie à foo légɔɔn, éshwóŋó wɔ́b.
en: And when he was entered into the house from the people, his disciples asked him concerning the parable.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie, ammó gie á kẅɛɛ ntʉ́m nyìŋ zɔ̌ ńnéŋe*lɔ̌’ ná ye.
en: And he said,That which cometh out of the man, that defileth the man.

ngiemboon: Ngwòŋ menò tepòŋ mɔɔn kẅɛɛ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m nyìŋ mesoŋ, tá ńnéŋe*lɔ̌’ ná ye.
en: all these evil things come from within, and defile the man.

ngiemboon: Manzwě ŋwɛ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: Andè, ɔ̀ gɔɔn shwóŋó nò, tá’ ngwé ké ńdagte mesɔ́ɔn shúm sie pènkʉ́ ne ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó, é gwete ssé.
en: And she answered and said unto him, Yes, Lord: yet the dogs under the table eat of the children's crumbs.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né ye ngie: Mèŋ n jǔ’ ntí gie ɔ̀ lɔ̌g ńtsɔ́’, lo ńgʉa, à cʉa nà shwóŋè jú,*essé tepòŋ fó ná míŋ gù ńkẅɛ.
en: And he said unto her,For this saying go thy way; the devil is gone out of thy daughter.

ngiemboon: Á leen ńké ḿbiŋe mbʉ̀a ye, ńgwaa gyá, múɔ pʉ́le ńnuŋe ndùm kǔ mbà*ssé tepòŋ fǒ ná ye ńkẅɛ.
en: And when she was come to her house, she found the devil gone out, and her daughter laid upon the bed.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lɔgɔ yé fó tsɛ̀ɛ nùɔ pʉ̀a ńkẅɛ, ńnéŋ púɔ tepwó pé tsɛ̀ɛ metuŋó mé, ńtsaba tepwó we lê metyé, ńzába nà lʉ́m yé,
en: And he took him aside from the multitude, and put his fingers into his ears, and he spit, and touched his tongue;

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńké ḿbʉ’ʉ menÿɔ́g mé ńdíe tÿǒ, ńzẅi, ńgɔɔn ngie: “Effata”! Ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: Tsɔ́’ɔ!
en: and looking up to heaven, he sighed, and saith unto him,Ephphatha,that is, Be opened.

ngiemboon: Metuŋó mé gwóon ńtsɔ́’ɔ, alʉ́m yé kyɛ́’ɛ, á zye légɔɔn nò té mʉ́’te.
en: And straightway his ears were opened, and the string of his tongue was loosed, and he spake plain.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé lɔg shúm léjÿó nzɔ̌ á nkwòŋo tsẅɛ, tà pɔ́ pfɛ́ tà ńzẅɛ́ɛ?
en: And his disciples answered him, From whence can a man satisfy thesemenwith bread here in the wilderness?

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi zɔɔn ńgẅiin mbelég mbu’ú shÿɔ́’ɔ? Pɔ́ shwóŋó yé ngie pɔ́ gẅiin mbelég mbu’ú sɔ̀ɔn mbʉ́a.
en: And he asked them,How many loaves have ye?And they said, Seven.

ngiemboon: Alá’ pú ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó tà ńzẅɛ́. Mé piŋ ńdag mekèm mie é vwɔ’ɔ́, é lúe metúŋ sɔ̀ɔn mbʉ́a.
en: So they did eat, and were filled: and they took up of the brokenmeatthat was left seven baskets.

ngiemboon: Alá’ gie á pǐŋ ḿpfɛ́ gwɔ́ nyìŋ mesoŋ ntsá’ lekùa. Yěsô leen ńké ńtsẅi pɔ́ gʉa.
en: And they that had eaten were about four thousand: and he sent them away.

ngiemboon: Á leen ńgwóon ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gʉa nê shÿó pàga ngwòŋ Ndálmanuta.
en: And straightway he entered into a ship with his disciples, and came into the parts of Dalmanutha.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn pú’u, ńdeen ńnyé pʉ̀a*farisay jʉ’ó, ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, ńtúm ntse ńgee yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ.
en: And he left them, and entering into the ship again departed to the other side.

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ̌ ne ńgee pú’u, Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi laga twó gí, ḿbɔ́ɔn*mvòŋ pà*farisay mbɔɔ ye fùɔ*Herôd.
en: And he charged them, saying,Take heed, beware of the leaven of the Pharisees, andofthe leaven of Herod.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ pá’ à kǐm*mvòŋ pú’u, ńdeen ńké ńzye légɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Tà à tě ńgɔɔn pɔ́ pá’ pege tè mbelég gẅiin wɔ́?
en: And they reasoned among themselves, saying,It isbecause we have no bread.

ngiemboon: «Pi gẅiin menÿɔ́g, ḿbiŋ tè zsé lélɔg ńgyá jʉ’ wɔ́ la? Ńgẅiin metuŋó ḿbiŋ tè nò jú’ la»? Ńzsé ngie pi tè nò kímte la?
en: Having eyes, see ye not? and having ears, hear ye not? and do ye not remember?

ngiemboon: Á leen ńké ńzɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Tà pi giŋé ńnyé pɔ́ tè jú’?
en: And he said unto them,How is it that ye do not understand?

ngiemboon: Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé la kúu Mbetsayida, mé lɔgɔ tsɔ̌ fʉ̀ menÿɔ́g ńtó, ésẅíŋte yé ngie à záb mbwó mé ná yé à zeŋe.
en: And he cometh to Bethsaida; and they bring a blind man unto him, and besought him to touch him.

ngiemboon: Á náŋte, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n ne ńgyá pʉ̀a mesoŋ, pɔ́ ne ńgiŋe, tá ńké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ metÿǒ la.
en: And he looked up, and said, I see men as trees, walking.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńzáb mbwó nà menÿɔ́g nyìŋ ŋwɛ́, á cwoŋo ńdíe jʉ’, mbà à sẅeté, tà ne ńcÿó nnɛ́ ńgyá kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ.
en: After that he puthishands again upon his eyes, and made him look up: and he was restored, and saw every man clearly.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn ngie à piŋ né mbʉ̀a yé, tá’, tà á ke ḿpfó ye tsɛ̀ɛ lá’ yɛ̂.
en: And he sent him away to his house, saying,Neither go into the town, nor tellitto any in the town.

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Kwà’ pi gí gɔɔn ngie mèŋ n gee wɔ̌? Piɛ tsɔ́’ ngie: Ɔɔ*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie Ssé la ka’.
en: And he saith unto them,But whom say ye that I am?And Peter answereth and saith unto him, Thou art the Christ.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tɔ’ɔ wɔ́b tɛ’, ńgɔɔn ngie tà pɔ́ kím tà nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ zsé nyìŋ gẅie aa wɛ̌.
en: And he charged them that they should tell no man of him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô shʉ̀ashʉ̀a ńgɔɔn mɔɔn menò pá’ɔɔn, Piɛ leen ńná’a ńtóŋo yé ntsèm, ńzye lékaga yé.
en: And he spake that saying openly. And Peter took him, and began to rebuke him.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔɔn ńzɔɔn ḿbú ńkaa njÿó yɔɔn ntsèm ńná né nyìŋ, tá á ké ńgwɔ́ gie e ge lɔg pɔ́ twó yé, mbà e ge kẅéte yé nà kɔ́?
en: For what shall it profit a man, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul?

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ lɔgɔ kɔ́ ńdɔg ńkúbe twó yé?
en: Or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul?

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô pɛ̌ métá gyá, mbà*Elîɛ pɔ́ Mǒsê kẅɛ̌ ńtyé, pâ Yěsô ne shwóŋe.
en: And there appeared unto them Elias with Moses: and they were talking with Jesus.

ngiemboon: À lɔ̌ɔn ńcʉ́’ʉ ńgɔɔn yé pɛ́’ɛ̀, tá à tě ńzsé mmó gie à gɔɔn yɛ̌ wɔ́, mbà cÿɔ’ pǔ ńgwoon wɔ́b tɛ’.
en: For he wist not what to say; for they were sore afraid.

ngiemboon: ńgwaa cʉ́me,*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô té gíŋe petsɔ́ pʉ̀a ńgyá wɔ́, ndà’ wɔ́ba Yěsô zɔ̌ cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́.
en: And suddenly, when they had looked round about, they saw no man any more, save Jesus only with themselves.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ leen ńké ḿbiŋ ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: Tà*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê gɔɔn ngie*Elîɛ ge lá’ vɔg tó pé’e mélà’a kɔ́?
en: And they asked him, saying, Why say the scribes that Elias must first come?

ngiemboon: Alá’ gwɔ́ tà ńgyá Yěsô kẅɛɛ ná pɔ́b, pɔ́ pú ńnɔ́ɔnte ńgʉa ńtsyɛ’te yé.
en: And straightway all the people, when they beheld him, were greatly amazed, and running tohimsaluted him.

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ńzɛ́te*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie pɔ́ zoŋo kɔ́ wɔ́?
en: And he asked the scribes,What question ye with them?

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te tá múɔ ngie: Yɔɔn guɔ áa pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ná múɔ tà fó síŋe? Á gɔɔn ngie tà fó fʉ̀’ gie mé la zyé yé.
en: And he asked his father,How long is it ago since this came unto him?And he said, Of a child.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pʉŋe yé ngie: Ɔ̀ piŋe ngie pá’ ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńku’ lêkɛ̂? Anò té cʉa nyìŋ gẅie à záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé wɔ́.
en: Jesus said unto him,If thou canst believe, all thingsarepossible to him that believeth.

ngiemboon: Tá múɔ leen ńdwo ńgɔɔn ngie: Oon! Mèŋ n zǎb ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn nà Ssé, kẅéte wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n kẅi’i ńzáb ntʉ́m nà yé.
en: And straightway the father of the child cried out, and said with tears, Lord, I believe; help thou mine unbelief.

ngiemboon: Tá’, Yěsô kú’te pwó yé ńkẅéte yé, ńgÿó á lu ssé ńtyé tyé.
en: But Jesus took him by the hand, and lifted him up; and he arose.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mé lɔg pɔ́ ndà’ lésẅíŋte Ssé tá ńdɔg ńgÿo yɛ̌ ntí*ssé tepòŋ fó ná nyìŋ ńkẅɛ.
en: And he said unto them,This kind can come forth by nothing, but by prayer and fasting.

ngiemboon: Pâ Yěsô fó wó ńne ńgee, ńcʉa tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Galilea, á piŋ ńké tè ne ńkwoŋo ngie mé zsé jʉ’ gie aa wó wɔ,
en: And they departed thence, and passed through Galilee; and he would not that any man should knowit.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn pú’u,*ngàŋa kwò yé ké tè jú’ mboŋó wɔ́, tá ḿbiŋ ne ḿbɔ́gɔ lé zɛ́te yé nò mǒ.
en: But they understood not that saying, and were afraid to ask him.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ té tsɔ́b, á nue pɔ́ kɔ’ɔ́ mánzsè, ńne ńzoŋo fa’a nyìŋ gẅie aa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ńgwɔ́ ndÿò wɔb metsèm.
en: But they held their peace: for by the way they had disputed among themselves, whoshould bethe greatest.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńtóŋo mûɔ mémúɔ, ńtyé pɔ́ mvfò pɔ́b, ńkaa yé ńgẅiin, ńdeen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: And he took a child, and set him in the midst of them: and when he had taken him in his arms, he said unto them,

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à kaa nò yégè tága, aa wege nyìŋ.
en: For he that is not against us is on our part.

ngiemboon: [á jʉ’ gie mentẅintẅɛ mie ée ntěen ńkwé wɔ́ pfɛ́ mepfó pʉ̀a wó. Mmɔ̌g gẅie é kÿó wó, é téen ńdá’a ḿbyé wɔ́.]
en: where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.

ngiemboon: [á jʉ’ gie mentẅintẅɛ mie ée ntěen ńkwé wɔ́ pfɛ́ mepfó pʉ̀a wó. Mmɔ̌g gẅie é kÿó wó, é téen ńdá’a ḿbyé wɔ́,]
en: where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.

ngiemboon: «á jʉ’ gie mentẅintẅɛ mie ée ntěen ńkwé wɔ́ pfɛ́ mepfó pʉ̀a wó. Mmɔ̌g gẅie é kÿó wó, é téen ńdá’a ḿbyé wɔ́».
en: where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie mmɔ̌g ge lá’ táŋte mawɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ mé lɔgɔ ngwáŋ ńtáŋte shúm pwɔ́’.
en: For every one shall be salted with fire, and every sacrifice shall be salted with salt.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a nà nùɔ pà*farisay tó yɔ́b, ńgwɔ kwà’te yé, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Tà áa pé’e*lepʉ̌ ségè zẅíŋ ngie nyìŋ jwoŋo nzwé we?
en: And the Pharisees came to him, and asked him, Is it lawful for a man to put awayhiswife? tempting him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Mǒsê la tsẅii tsɛ̀ɛ*lepʉ̌ ngie pi gÿo pɔ́ lêkɔ́?
en: And he answered and said unto them,What did Moses command you?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie Mǒsê la zẅíŋ ngie «mámbàŋa jwoŋo nzwě we, tá ńké ńgwɔ jwoŋo yé, ḿvɔg ńŋwe’e ŋwà’ne lélɔg ńjwoŋo yé».
en: And they said, Moses suffered to write a bill of divorcement, and to putheraway.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Mǒsê la ná sɛ̌*lepʉ̌ mbwo pi, pɔ́ mélà’mie à gyǎ pi tʉʉ twó mbwo Ssé tà á cʉa.
en: And Jesus answered and said unto them,For the hardness of your heart he wrote you this precept.

ngiemboon: Á la ké fó nùŋe ngwòŋ, á té pú’u, wɔ́. «E Ssé la pwóon mámbàŋa pɔ́ manzwě».
en: But from the beginning of the creation God made them male and female.

ngiemboon: ńgʉa ńda nnɛ́ nà we manzwě.
en: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and cleave to his wife;

ngiemboon: Á cʉa pú’u, pɔ́ le gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a mépʉ́a wɔ́, pɔ́ cʉ́’ʉ tà’ nyìŋ.
en: and they twain shall be one flesh: so then they are no more twain, but one flesh.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, nyìŋ mesoŋ pɔ́ɔn léfege mmó gie Ssé temté.
en: What therefore God hath joined together, let not man put asunder.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gÿo ḿbiŋ tà ńgwɔ́ ndá,*ngàŋa kwò yé zɛ́te yé nò ńtí nò ya yɛ̌.
en: And in the house his disciples asked him again of the samematter.

ngiemboon: Á shwóŋó wɔ́b ngie: Nyìŋ jwoŋo nzwě we, ńzɔ́’ɔ we ndyɛ̀’ɛ, mbà á cʉ̌a nà*kʉ̀a yɔ́b gie á tagá, á gÿo pɔ́ gÿɛ́.
en: And he saith unto them,Whosoever shall put away his wife, and marry another, committeth adultery against her.

ngiemboon: Manzwě piŋ ńkẅɛɛ nà ndǔm we, ńgʉa ńzɔ́’ɔ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ, mbà á cʉ̌a nà*kʉ̀a yɔ́b ndǔm we, á gÿo pɔ́ gÿɛ́.
en: And if a woman shall put away her husband, and be married to another, she committeth adultery.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a ne ńdɔgɔ tsɔ́ gubé ńtóo légwɔ́ gie Yěsô ge záb mbwó twó pɔ́b, tá’*ngàŋa kwò yé piŋ ńne ńtɔ’ɔ.
en: And they brought young children to him, that he should touch them: andhisdisciples rebuked those that broughtthem.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn pú’u, ńkẅé wɔ́b ńgẅiin, ńzáb mbwó ná pɔ́b, ńcʉ́me wɔ́b mbwo Ssé.
en: And he took them up in his arms, puthishands upon them, and blessed them.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ̀ tóŋo wɔ̀ɔn le nyìŋ mbòŋo mélà’a kɔ́? É té ndà’ Ssé wɔ́, mbà nyìŋ mbòŋo tè wó wɔ́.
en: And Jesus said unto him,Why callest thou me good?there isnone good but one,that is, God.

ngiemboon: Á zeŋe mbwo shÿɔ́ɔ léshúu tsɛ̀ɛ njwòŋ lesyɛ’ɛ́, ńcʉa ngàŋa mmó lézẅíŋ ngie Ssé zɔ cʉ́’ʉ sá’a yé.
en: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò fó ḿmege ńkʉ’ʉ*ngàŋa kwò yé. Pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie, tà á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pɛ́’ɛ̀, mbà wɔ̌ ge lá’ tsẅɛ́?
en: And they were astonished out of measure, saying among themselves, Who then can be saved?

ngiemboon: Yěsô líe wɔ́b tà ńgɔɔn ngie: Á cʉa pɔ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á le Ssé cʉa, ńtí nue à ku’u légÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ.
en: And Jesus looking upon them saith,With menit isimpossible, but not with God: for with God all things are possible.

ngiemboon: Piɛ leen ńké ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Tà peg leen ńnyé shúm ntsèm, ńcʉ́me nzèm gù pá’ɔɔn la?
en: Then Peter began to say unto him, Lo, we have left all, and have followed thee.

ngiemboon: Tá tsɔ̌ lelÿò pʉ̀a pie é tyé mvfò fʉ̀’ɔɔn ge lá’ cʉ́’ pà nzsò nzèm, pà gwɔ́ nzèm cʉ́’ pà gwɔ́ mvfò.
en: But manythat arefirst shall be last; and the last first.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi kwoŋo ngie mèŋ n gÿo lêkɔ́ né pi?
en: And he said unto them,What would ye that I should do for you?

ngiemboon: Yetsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô legém gwɔ́ tà ńjú’u nò gie Jâg pɔ́ Jâŋ gɔ̌ɔn, ńzye légyáŋa lóŋ ńtí wɔ́b.
en: And when the ten heardit, they began to be much displeased with James and John.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńne fa’a légwɔ́ ndÿò tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, mbà á poŋ ngie à zẅíŋ nkwɔ̀ɔn mânyìŋ ntsèm.
en: and whosoever of you will be the chiefest, shall be servant of all.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ menÿɔ́g gú’u ssé, ńzé’e nzsǒ fÿɔ́g ye ḿma’a nzèm, ńgʉa ńtsɛ́ɛ Yěsô.
en: And he, casting away his garment, rose, and came to Jesus.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋ ntúm yɛ̌ gʉa ńkúu wó, ńgyá nzìkáasè, mbà mé ně ńcʉŋe yé ncwò mbu’, á ngʉ̀ŋe mánzsè, pɔ́ kyɛ́’ɛ yé.
en: And they went their way, and found the colt tied by the door without in a place where two ways met; and they loose him.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é kɔ’ɔ́ jʉ’ó zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi kyɛ́’ɛ nzìkáasè yɛ̂ ńdɔgɔ ńgee nzɔ̌ wɔ́?
en: And certain of them that stood there said unto them, What do ye, loosing the colt?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ pá’ Yěsô ně ńtsẅi né pɔ́b pú’u. Mé nyé wɔ́b pɔ́ lɔg ńgʉa.
en: And they said unto them even as Jesus had commanded: and they let them go.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔg nzìkáasè ŋwɛ́ ńtó, ńgwaa náa yé mbwo Yěsô, ńzáb menzsǒ fÿɔ́g mɔ́b nkà’ yé, Yěsô kwɔ́’ ńnéŋe mo,
en: And they brought the colt to Jesus, and cast their garments on him; and he sat upon him.

ngiemboon: Gùugẅî gwɔ́ mbwo Ssé tàa tÿǒ lepwó!
en: Blessedbethe kingdom of our father David, that cometh in the name of the Lord: Hosanna in the highest.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, pɔ́ gwɔ́ fó Mbetáni piŋ, ńgiŋ tà nzyè gyáŋa Yěsô.
en: And on the morrow, when they were come from Bethany, he was hungry:

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né tÿǒ ŋwɛ́ ngie: Nyìŋ tě ńdá’a ńgíŋe ńjÿó mentɔ̌ɔn mú wɔ́, ńgwaa gɔɔn,*ngàŋa kwò yé ne ńjú’u.
en: And Jesus answered and said unto it,No man eat fruit of thee hereafter for ever.And his disciples heardit.

ngiemboon: ńgwá ńtɔ’ tà tsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ tè gíŋe ńkaa mmó ńdɔgɔ ńtɔ́gɔ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé wɔ́,
en: and would not suffer that any man should carryanyvessel through the temple.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ ncwò nzém, Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gíŋe fó tÿǒsoŋ ńkẅɛ.
en: And when even was come, he went out of the city.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gÿo ńgwɔ́ mba’ámba’ ńne ńcʉa, ńgyá, mbà tÿǒ mbÿé ngem yɛ̌ jǔm tà ńkúu nà menŋaŋ mé.
en: And in the morning, as they passed by, they saw the fig tree dried up from the roots.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́g ngie: Pi záb ntʉ́m gẅi nà Ssé.
en: And Jesus answering saith unto them,Have faith in God.

ngiemboon: [ Pi lɔɔn ńké tè lege mefʉ̀a petsɔ́ pʉ̀a wɔ́, mbà Tá gẅi gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó kě tè lege mí gí wɔ́.]
en: But if ye do not forgive, neither will your Father which is in heaven forgive your trespasses.

ngiemboon: ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ̀ lɔgɔ lezíŋ wɔ́ ńgÿo mɔɔn menò? Wɔ̌ zɔ túmo ńgÿo sɛ̌ shúm?
en: and say unto him, By what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority to do these things?

ngiemboon: Jâŋ gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn ńnu’u pʉ̀a ntse laa pé’e, e Ssé zɔ̌ túmo yé fa’ mɛ̌ mefà’ ka pʉ̀a mesoŋ? Pi shwóŋó wɔ̀ɔn.
en: The baptism of John, wasitfrom heaven, or of men? answer me.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kúu wó, ńgwoon ngàŋa fà’ wá, ńcúa yé, ńjwoŋo yé, á piŋ mbwó mesẅɛ̀ɛ.
en: And they caughthim, and beat him, and senthimaway empty.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńgwe ná ye, ńgwoon yé ńzẅé, éshwoŋo pfó yé, ńdɔg fó nká’ ńgʉa ńgwá’.
en: And they took him, and killedhim, and casthimout of the vineyard.

ngiemboon: léen ńcʉ́’ʉ tóon gẅie yé zɔ pi’ ndá».
en: Is become the head of the corner:

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ máa nò mbòŋo menÿɔ́g pege
en: And it is marvellous in our eyes?

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ mefɛ́ laa wó, ńgwɔ́ mbàŋa sɔ̀ɔn mbʉ́a, ndùŋ mvfò zɔ́’, ńgÿo ńkwé té cʉa mmó.
en: Now there were seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and dying left no seed.

ngiemboon: Mbɔ́ɔntè sɔgɔ mpfɔ́g, ńgíŋe ńkwé yé pɔ́ tè cʉa mmó. Mbɔ́ɔntè wɛ̌ tó ńgíŋe sɔg yé mpfɔ́g, ńdá’ ńkwé pɔ́ tè cʉa mmó.
en: And the second took her, and died, neither left he any seed: and the third likewise.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́b sɔ̀ɔn mbʉ́a lá’ ńzɔ́’ɔ manzwě ŋwɛ́, ńdá’ ńkwé pɔ́ tè cʉa mmó. Á gwaa zsote manzwě kwé yé.
en: And the seven had her, and left no seed: last of all the woman died also.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pɔ́b sɔ̀ɔn mbʉ́a la pú ńzɔ́’ɔ manzwě wɔɔn lɔɔn, mé ge lá’*zíme nà legwé à gwɔ́ we wɔ̌?
en: In the resurrection therefore, when they shall rise, whose wife shall she be of them? for the seven had her to wife.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: E Ssé tè Ssé mepfó pʉ̀a wɔ́, ee Ssé pʉ̀a metʉ̀. Pi lɔɔn ńkwaŋ pá’ pi kwaŋa lɛ̂, mbà pi fʉ̌a tɛ’.
en: He is not the God of the dead, but the God of the living: ye therefore do greatly err.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie:*Lepʉ̌ sie é pú ḿbi’ metsɔ́, ésɔɔn: «Pà Israel, pi jú’, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a aa Ssé yege, yé gílé ye zɔɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: And Jesus answered him,The first of all the commandmentsis, Hear, O Israel; The Lord our God is one Lord:

ngiemboon: mbwo gù, tà ɔ̀ tÿɔ́g mekwò mú twó pɔ́b»
en: Till I make thine enemies thy footstool.

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ńkúu jʉ’ʉ melínɔ́ɔn, ńkwoŋo léńnéŋe pɔ́ nà jʉ’ʉ melÿò, ńkú*mendá cú’tè, ńkaŋa yɔ́b jʉ’ pɔ́ mvfò,
en: and the chief seats in the synagogues, and the uppermost rooms at feasts:

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ mpfɔ́g manzwě tó yé, ńgwɔ́ mbóŋ, ńnéŋ pàg nkáb sépʉ́a, é sie é fó tè nà tsɔ́ mmó ku’.
en: And there came a certain poor widow, and she threw in two mites, which make a farthing.

ngiemboon: Shwóŋo wég fʉ̀’ gie yɔɔn nò ge lá’ gÿo. Shwóŋo wég liŋé gie mé gé lɔg zsé ngie afʉ̀’ kǔ’?
en: Tell us, when shall these things be? and whatshall bethe sign when all these things shall be fulfilled?

ngiemboon: Yěsô zye léshwóŋó wɔ́b ngie: Pi lag twó sí, ḿbɔ́ɔn nyìŋ léfʉʉ gẅí.
en: And Jesus answering them began to say,Take heed lest anymandeceive you:

ngiemboon: Á ké ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé vɔg ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwo melá’ ntsèm tá nò yɔɔn njÿó mag.
en: And the gospel must first be published among all nations.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a metsèm ge lá’ pú pʉ̀a gẅi mélà’ mɔ́ɔn, tá’, tá nyìŋ gẅie à kě shÿɔg shÿɔg té kʉ́a zɔ ge gÿo ńtsẅɛ́.
en: And ye shall be hated of allmenfor my name's sake: but he that shall endure unto the end, the same shall be saved.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à ge lá’ gwɔ́ nká’, à pɔ́ɔn lé gɔɔn ngie à ge piŋe ndá ye pí nzsǒ fÿɔ́g ye.
en: and let him that is in the field not turn back again for to take up his garment.

ngiemboon: Yěe ngɔ́’ le! Tà panzwě pie é ge lá’ gwɔ́ shwoŋ, mbɔɔ pie é ge lá’ ne nóŋe púɔ mepÿɛ́ ná mɛ̌ melyɛ̌’ ge lá’ gwá’a la!
en: But woe to them that are with child, and to them that give suck in those days!

ngiemboon: Pi sẅíŋte Ssé ngie yɔɔn nò gwaa tó, á le gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ʉ mbʉ̀ŋ wɔ́.
en: And pray ye that your flight be not in the winter.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, nyìŋ ké ńdá’ ńgɔɔn né pi ngie gyá, à*Nzà’nkÿo wɔɔn jʉ’ɔɔn, kà ngie gyá, à gẅi jʉ’e wɔ́, pi pɔ́ɔn lézẅíŋ.
en: And then if any man shall say to you, Lo, hereisChrist; or, lo,he isthere; believehimnot:

ngiemboon: Tá á ké ńgʉa ná pi, mbà mèŋ n kě ńtʉ́ njÿó shwóŋó gẅi nò gie á ne ńtóo, pi laga twó gí.
en: But take ye heed: behold, I have foretold you all things.

ngiemboon: nèm sele síŋ, saŋ le gíŋe ńtʉ́a wɔ́.
en: But in those days, after that tribulation, the sun shall be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light,

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ mmó ntʉ̀ tʉ̀ wɔ́ gie áa lefaŋ pú ńtága
en: and the stars of heaven shall fall, and the powers that are in heaven shall be shaken.

ngiemboon: Mé leen ńké ńgyá «*Míŋ Nyìŋ gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ melɔ́ɔn, ńne ńtóo», ńgẅiin shʉ́shÿɔ́g mbɔɔ máamáa metʉ̀.
en: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in the clouds with great power and glory.

ngiemboon: Lefaŋ pɔ́ tsetsá’ ge gÿo mag, tá’ ashwóŋè yɔ́ɔn lá’ le pyé.
en: Heaven and earth shall pass away: but my words shall not pass away.

ngiemboon: Pi ké ńdaga twó gi, tà pi gwá’a lÿɔg, ńdyé. Á nue pi tè ne ńzsé fʉ̀’ gie mɛ̌ menò ge gÿo tó wɔ́.
en: Take ye heed, watch and pray: for ye know not when the time is.

ngiemboon: À vege vege ńtó fʉ̀’ʉ kɔ́ wɔ́, mbà á kaa poŋ ngie à gwaa kẅɛ́te gẅí, pi ne ńdyé wɔ́.
en: lest coming suddenly he find you sleeping.

ngiemboon: Anò gie mèŋ n gɔɔn né pi lɔɔn, mèŋ n gɔɔn mbɔɔ mbwo mânyìŋ ntsèm. Tà nyìŋ gwá’a lÿɔg ńdyé.
en: And what I say unto you I say unto all, Watch.

ngiemboon: ńkwaŋa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Á té poŋ ngie á gwɔ́ nà lyɛ’ɛ́ línɔ́ɔn wɔ́, ḿbɔ́gɔ lá’ létág jʉ’.
en: But they said, Not on the feastday, lest there be an uproar of the people.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é laa jʉ’ó gyá á pÿága wɔ́b, pɔ́ zẅɛ́te ńgɔɔn ngie: À sěen ńcʉŋte yɔɔn laméndɔ́ɔn mélà’a kɔ́?
en: And there were some that had indignation within themselves, and said, Why was this waste of the ointment made?

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Pi kyɛɛ yé ńnyé, pi zẅɛte mélà’a kɔ́? À gÿǒ pɔ́ nò mbòŋo ná mèŋ.
en: And Jesus said,Let her alone; why trouble ye her? she hath wrought a good work on me.

ngiemboon: Manzwě wɔɔn gÿǒ yé mmó gie à ku’u légÿo, ńtʉ́ʉ njÿó ńdɔgɔ laméndɔ́ɔn ńzɔ́’ɔ wɔ̀ɔn, tá mé táa ńnéŋe wɔ̀ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè.
en: She hath done what she could: she is come aforehand to anoint my body to the burying.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ ncwò nzém, Yěsô pâ pʉ̀a pé ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a lê legém cú’te jʉ’ó,
en: And in the evening he cometh with the twelve.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’, ḿbú ḿmÿag. Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ná pɔ́b wɔ́ zɛ́te ngie: Ńgwɔ́ á gwɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn?
en: And they began to be sorrowful, and to say unto him one by one,Isit I? and anothersaid, Isit I?

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ńkaa ntú’ melù’, ńná ndǎg mbwo Ssé, ńnáa mbwo pɔ́b, pɔ́ pú ńnú wɔ́b métsèm.
en: And he took the cup, and when he had given thanks, he gaveitto them: and they all drank of it.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mɔɔn ée metse mɔ́ɔn, é metse mie Ssé lɔgɔ ńgwaa*kʉ̀a, é pfɛte nà twó pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: And he said unto them,This is my blood of the new testament, which is shed for many.

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ̌ leen ńké ńzɔb mentse ńdɔg ńgu’te Ssé. Afʉ̀’ ku’, pɔ́ kẅɛ, ńgʉa ne ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́ metÿǒ mèvɛ olive.
en: And when they had sung an hymn, they went out into the mount of Olives.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n ge gÿo gwɔ́ tà zíme nà legwé, é vɔgɔ Galilea zẅí’te gẅí.
en: But after that I am risen, I will go before you into Galilee.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a lɔɔn ńgwá’a gú ńkÿo metsèm, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mèŋ n de ɔ́ gwá’.
en: But Peter said unto him, Although all shall be offended, yetwillnot I.

ngiemboon: É faga Piɛ, ńgÿo Jâg pɔ́ Jâŋ, pâ pɔ̌ gʉa. Á zye lé jú’ pá’ cÿɔ’ gwoon yé, legwé pfɛ́ɛ yé,
en: And he taketh with him Peter and James and John, and began to be sore amazed, and to be very heavy;

ngiemboon: Tà pi gíŋe ńdyé, pi sẅíŋte Ssé ḿbɔ́g menò njÿó lékwa’te gẅi pi fʉa nò. Ntʉ́m nyìŋ tʉte tɛ’, tá’ mbùm nnɛ́ pÿɛ́ pÿɛ̌,
en: Watch ye and pray, lest ye enter into temptation. The spirit trulyisready, but the fleshisweak.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe fó lejʉ́ŋ pɔ́b ńgʉa sẅíŋte Ssé, ńgɔɔn pɔ́ mmó gie à ně ńzɔɔn ńgɔɔn.
en: And again he went away, and prayed, and spake the same words.

ngiemboon: Pi lu ssé pege gʉa. Nyìŋ gẅie à sẅiŋé wɔ̀ɔn mbwo pɔ́b à wɛ̂ gẅie à tóo lɛ.
en: Rise up, let us go; lo, he that betrayeth me is at hand.

ngiemboon: Jẅidas gwɔ́ tà ńtó tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, ngie: Andè, n tsyɛ’té, ńdeen ńgwóon ńtáŋte yé.
en: And as soon as he was come, he goeth straightway to him, and saith, Master, master; and kissed him.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a leen ńké ńgwoon Yěsô ńkú’te.
en: And they laid their hands on him, and took him.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé gyá pá’ mé gwǒon yé, ḿbú ńgwá’a yé métsèm ńkÿo.
en: And they all forsook him, and fled.

ngiemboon: Á fó mbwo pɔ́b sẅe, ńgwá’ nzsǒ ye ńkÿo té ma’ nzsǒ.
en: and he left the linen cloth, and fled from them naked.

ngiemboon: *Metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ*petsɔ́ pàsá’a lá’ ne fa’a nò gie mé ge zába twó Yěsô tá lɔg gÿo mè zẅé yé, ńké tè ne ńgyá wɔ́.
en: And the chief priests and all the council sought for witness against Jesus to put him to death; and found none.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn tÿɔ́g menò twó yé tɛ’. Mé píte tɛ’, á ké tè pumte.
en: For many bare false witness against him, but their witness agreed not together.

ngiemboon: Tà mbɔɔ pú’u, tà’ ncwò ké tè tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b kẅɛ.
en: But neither so did their witness agree together.

ngiemboon: *Nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò jú’ pú’u, ésele*shʉate menzsǒ mé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Pege giŋé fa’a pɔ́ yɛ̌ ntí pà njÿò ńgyá?
en: Then the high priest rent his clothes, and saith, What need we any further witnesses?

ngiemboon: Piɛ ńnéŋe tetʉ́a né mecwoŋó, atsɔ̌ tà’ ná panzwě pie pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn fa’a nɔ’*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò tó.
en: And as Peter was beneath in the palace, there cometh one of the maids of the high priest:

ngiemboon: Piɛ ne ńzɔ́gɔ mmɔ̌g, á cwoŋo ńdíe yé tà ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Mbɔɔ gù jú, pi Yěsô Nǎzarɛd wɛ ke ńgwɔ́ nùɔ.
en: and when she saw Peter warming himself, she looked upon him, and said, And thou also wast with Jesus of Nazareth.

ngiemboon: Manzwě ŋwɛ́ gÿo ńgíŋe ńgyá yé, ńzye léshwóŋ pʉ̀a pie pâ pɔ̌ laa jʉ’ó ngie: Nyìŋ wɛ, aa tsɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔb.
en: And a maid saw him again, and began to say to them that stood by, This isoneof them.

ngiemboon: Á leen ńké ńzye légɔɔn ngie, e Ssé zẅé wɔ̀ɔn, à zeŋe yɔ́ɔn mé, mèŋ n tè ne ńzsé nyìŋ gẅie pi kíme yé wɔ́.
en: But he began to curse and to swear,saying, I know not this man of whom ye speak.

ngiemboon: *Pilato zɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔɔ fùɔ pà Yuda lá? Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Ɔ̀ gɔ̌ɔn pú’u.
en: And Pilate asked him, Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answering said unto him,Thou sayestit.

ngiemboon: *Metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ ne ńtÿɔ́gɔ menò twó Yěsô tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn.
en: And the chief priests accused him of many things: but he answered nothing.

ngiemboon: *Pilato gíŋe ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ̀ laŋte laŋtě kà? Ɔ̀ tè ne ńjú’u nzẅìŋ menò mie mé gɔɔn ná gù wɔ́ kà?
en: And Pilate asked him again, saying, Answerest thou nothing? behold how many things they witness against thee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pú tè tsɔ́b, á kʉ’ʉ*Pilato tɛ’.
en: But Jesus yet answered nothing; so that Pilate marvelled.

ngiemboon: Á lɔ́ɔn ńgwɔ́ lyɛ’ɛ́ línɔ́ɔn*Páskà,*Pilato tsɔ́’ɔ ngàŋa tsǎŋ gẅie alá’ zɛté yé.
en: Now atthatfeast he released unto them one prisoner, whomsoever they desired.

ngiemboon: Alá’ gʉa ńgyá*Pilato, ńzye lézɛ́te yé ngie à gÿo pá’ à lɔ̌ɔn ńtsẅé gÿo fʉ̀’ʉ línɔ́ɔn.
en: And the multitude crying aloud began to desirehim to doas he had ever done unto them.

ngiemboon: *Pilato tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Pi kwǒŋ ngie mèŋ n nyé fùɔ pà Yuda né pi?
en: But Pilate answered them, saying, Will ye that I release unto you the King of the Jews?

ngiemboon: *Metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ jú’ á gɔɔn pú’u, pɔ́ tsóte lá’ ngie pɔ́ zɛ́te ngie*Pilato tsɔ́’ pɔ́ Panepâse ńná le pɔ́b.
en: But the chief priests moved the people, that he should rather release Barabbas unto them.

ngiemboon: Alá’ gíŋe ḿbú ńnáa gwá, ńgɔɔn ngie: Kime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ.
en: And they cried out again, Crucify him.

ngiemboon: *Pilato zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Kwà’ nò tepòŋ gie à gÿǒ áa kɔ́? Tá’, alá’ gíŋe ńkẅi’i ńnáa gwá ngie: Ké ńkime yé kim!
en: Then Pilate said unto them, Why, what evil hath he done? And they cried out the more exceedingly, Crucify him.

ngiemboon: Palÿɔ́’ ncù lɔgɔ Yěsô ńgʉa ńkúu gyɛ̌, ḿbú ńcú’te yetsɔ́ ngàŋa nùɔ wɔ́b métsèm.
en: And the soldiers led him away into the hall, called Prætorium; and they call together the whole band.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ma’ nzsǒ lefùɔ ná Yěsô, ḿbiŋ ńdɔg menzóŋ ḿbá’a cÿɔ̀’, éshuu twó ye ngie aa fùɔ,
en: And they clothed him with purple, and platted a crown of thorns, and put it about hishead,

ngiemboon: ńdeen ńké ńzye létsyɛ’te yé, ńně ńgɔɔn ngie: Mé sǐe fùɔ pà Yuda!
en: and began to salute him, Hail, King of the Jews!

ngiemboon: Ńne ńdɔgɔ kekà’a ńcúa twó yé, ńne ńtsɔgɔ metyé ná ye, ḿbiŋe ńtóo ńŋwɔ́’ɔ mvfò yé, ésíe yé.
en: And they smote him on the head with a reed, and did spit upon him, and bowingtheirknees worshipped him.

ngiemboon: Pâ Yěsô lɔg ye jʉ’ gie mé tóŋo le Golgota, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn nà shwóŋè pà Yuda ngie: Jʉ’ʉ kẅǐ twó.
en: And they bring him unto the place Golgotha, which is, being interpreted, The place of a skull.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kúu jʉ’ó, éfa’a lénná melù’ mie mé lɔgɔ́ tsɔ́ ffo gie mé tóŋo le*mire ḿvoŋ á mbwo ye, á lʉ’ʉ lénnú.
en: And they gave him to drink wine mingled with myrrh: but he receiveditnot.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ, ḿbí menzsǒ mé, ḿma’a tyèente ńdɔg ńgabte ńná ye wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ.
en: And when they had crucified him, they parted his garments, casting lots upon them, what every man should take.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńkime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ pú’u, ná nèm lepfwɔ’ɔ́ mba’ámba’.
en: And it was the third hour, and they crucified him.

ngiemboon: Mé la ŋwe’e mmó gie à fʉ̌a, ńkyɛɛ nà tÿǒ nkǐ. Á gwɔ̂ ngie fùɔ pà Yuda.
en: And the superscription of his accusation was written over, THE KING OF THE JEWS.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la gíŋe ńkim tsɔ́ metsǒŋ mépʉ́a nà metÿǒ nkǐ. Tà’ gwɔ́ nà gwoŋó pwó Yěsô ye tʉ̀, wetsɔ̌ gwɔ́ nà gwoŋó pwó kyɛ̀bɛ.
en: And with him they crucify two thieves; the one on his right hand, and the other on his left.

ngiemboon: [Á lɔgɔ ḿbumte pá’ ŋwà’ne Ssé la gɔɔn ngie: Mé léen sáŋa yé nùɔ mefÿɛ́.]
en: And the scripture was fulfilled, which saith, And he was numbered with the transgressors.

ngiemboon: kwà’ gù zɔ kẅé twó ɔ́, éfó nà tÿǒ nkǐ sẅɛ́’ la.
en: save thyself, and come down from the cross.

ngiemboon: Tsɛ̀ɛ zsǒ la gwɔ́ tà ńku’, ajʉ’ tsèm tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ pú síŋ, tà ńdá’ ńkúu ná nèm ntá mbÿɛ̀ njÿó.
en: And when the sixth hour was come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é laa jʉ’ó, jú’, ńgɔɔn ngie: À wɛ gẅie à ne ńtóŋo*Elîɛ lɛ!
en: And some of them that stood by, when they heardit, said, Behold, he calleth Elias.

ngiemboon: Tá’, Yěsô ga’te ngyè tetʉ́ʉ, ńcʉ́m.
en: And Jesus cried with a loud voice, and gave up the ghost.

ngiemboon: Yěsô cʉ́m pú’u, nzsǒ gie mé la lɔg ńkʉŋe tsɔ́ jʉ’ tsɛ̀ɛ ndá gie ee*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, éfó tÿó shʉa tà ńkúu Ssé.
en: And the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom.

ngiemboon: Á shwóŋe yé ngie à ně ńdá’ mé ńkwé.*Pilato leen ńké ńzẅíŋ ngie Yesyɛ̂b gʉa ńkyɛ́’ɛ pfó Yěsô.
en: And when he knewitof the centurion, he gave the body to Joseph.

ngiemboon: À la gwɔ́ ńnéŋe pfó Yěsô jʉ’ó, Malîɛ Magdala, pɔ́ Malîɛ má pà Joses ne ńgyá.
en: And Mary Magdalene and Marythe motherof Joses beheld where he was laid.

ngiemboon: Njÿó lʉ́a, tà nèm ne sá’a, pɔ́ mʉ́ ńgʉa ne jʉ’ʉ lesyè. Á laa ndùŋ mvfò lyɛ̌’ nà ngàba lá’.
en: And very early in the morning the firstdayof the week, they came unto the sepulchre at the rising of the sun.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la ne ńgiŋe, ńně ńzɛ́te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Tà wɔ̌ ge kúu jʉ’ó kite máa tóon ncwò lesyè né pɔ̌b wɔ́?
en: And they said among themselves, Who shall roll us away the stone from the door of the sepulchre?

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa tà ńkúu wó, ńgyá, mbà mé ně fó ncwò lesyè ńkite máa tóon ŋwɛ́.
en: And when they looked, they saw that the stone was rolled away: for it was very great.

ngiemboon: Á leen ńké ńgʉa ḿbíte shwóŋ*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô. Pɔ́ laa tsɛ̀ɛ lemÿɔg, ḿbú ne ńdʉa.
en: Andshe went and told them that had been with him, as they mourned and wept.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ ngie à zimé nà legwé tà á gyá yé á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ntèntʉ́, pɔ́ pú tè zẅíŋ.
en: And they, when they had heard that he was alive, and had been seen of her, believed not.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gyá yé pú’u, ḿbiŋ nzèm shwóŋ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a, pɔ́ gíŋe ńké tè yɔ́b zẅíŋ.
en: And they went and tolditunto the residue: neither believed they them.

ngiemboon: Ńdeen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gʉa jʉ’ ntsèm tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó, ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwo mbɔɔ wɛ̌ nyìŋ mesoŋ wɔ́ té vʉ’ʉ tsɔ̌.
en: And he said unto them,Go ye into all the world, and preach the gospel to every creature.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à zẅǐŋ la, mé nu’u yé ntse, e Ssé gÿo à tsẅɛ́. Nyìŋ gẅie à lʉ’ʉ́ lézẅíŋ lá, à ge lá’ gwe ntsàŋ.
en: He that believeth and is baptized shall be saved; but he that believeth not shall be damned.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô la gɔɔn mbwo pɔ́b tà ńtẅé jʉ’, e Ssé ŋá’a yé ńdɔg ńkwɔ́’ lé tÿǒ lepwó. Á ńnéŋe nà gwoŋó pwó yé ye tʉ̀.
en: So then after the Lord had spoken unto them, he was received up into heaven, and sat on the right hand of God.

ngiemboon: ńŋwe’e kwà’ pá’ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la gyá pá’ nò yɔɔn zyete, ḿbiŋ ńgyá pá’ á giŋe pú’u.
en: even as they delivered them unto us, which from the beginning were eyewitnesses, and ministers of the word;

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gÿo pá’ɔɔn légwɔ́ gie ɔ̀ ge tóŋ lɔg zsé ngie menò mie mé la zí’i gú ée jʉ’ó ńgwɔ́ kwà’ pú’u.
en: that thou mightest know the certainty of those things, wherein thou hast been instructed.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la tè múɔ gẅiin, mélà’mie Lisape laa nkǐŋ manzwě, mbà pɔ́ giŋé ḿbú ńzẅiŋ.
en: And they had no child, because that Elisabeth was barren, and they both werenowwell stricken in years.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ ye nùɔ fà’ we pà Sakarîɛ lêen ńké ńgÿo ńku’, á gwɔ́*jʉ’ʉ Ssé Yerósalem ńne nuŋe pwɔ́’.
en: And it came to pass, that while he executed the priest's office before God in the order of his course,

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́ ndá ně tuɔ shúm gyě ŋwɛ́, alá’ gwɔ́ pǐ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, ḿbú ne sẅíŋte Ssé metsèm.
en: And the whole multitude of the people were praying without at the time of incense.

ngiemboon: Sakarîɛ gwaa gyá, atsɔ̌*cÿɔ́’ Ssé vege ńkẅɛɛ mvfò yé, ńtyé jʉ’ gie mé tuɔ shúm gyě wó, á nà gwoŋó pwó tʉ̀.
en: And there appeared unto him an angel of the Lord standing on the right side of the altar of incense.

ngiemboon: Sakarîɛ gyá yé, além yé tsɔ́’ɔ, ecÿɔ́’ gwoon yé.
en: And when Zacharias sawhim, he was troubled, and fear fell upon him.

ngiemboon: Múɔ ŋwɛ́ ge lá’ gwɔ́ mbwo gù, é gwɔ́ kwà’ mmó lekág, epʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn gíŋe ńkága ná pá’ mé zyě yé.
en: And thou shalt have joy and gladness; and many shall rejoice at his birth.

ngiemboon: À gÿo pʉ̀a Israel tà ńgyɔ́ɔn sele ntʉ́m wɔ́b, ḿbiŋe mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé yɔb.
en: And many of the children of Israel shall he turn to the Lord their God.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ n ge gyá kɔ́ tá zsé ngie á ge lá’ gwɔ́ nò? Pá’ peg wɔ̀ɔn manzwě pú ńzẅiŋ tɛ’ lɔɔn?
en: And Zacharias said unto the angel, Whereby shall I know this? for I am an old man, and my wife well stricken in years.

ngiemboon: Alá’ gie á laa pi ńzẅí’te Sakarîɛ la gyá, mbà à neŋé tsɛ̀ɛ ndá tà á cʉa, á kʉ’ʉ wɔ́b.
en: And the people waited for Zacharias, and marvelled that he tarried so long in the temple.

ngiemboon: Sakarîɛ lu ńgwɔ́ tà mag mé melyɛ̌’ɛ fà’ á*jʉ’ʉ Ssé Yerósalem, ḿbiŋ né mbʉ̀a yé.
en: And it came to pass, that, as soon as the days of his ministration were accomplished, he departed to his own house.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò la tɔ́g, anzwě we Lisape gwoon shwoŋ, ńnéŋe ndyeen lyeen nà mesaŋ méntʉ̀a, ńne ńgɔɔn ntʉ́m yé ngie:
en: And after those days his wife Elisabeth conceived, and hid herself five months, saying,

ngiemboon: Malîɛ jú’, á pú ńcʉa yé tɛ’, á kwaŋte ngie: Yɔɔn ntí tsyɛ̀’te ée pá’ɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie kɔ́?
en: And when she sawhim, she was troubled at his saying, and cast in her mind what manner of salutation this should be.

ngiemboon: Malîɛ, tè pɔ́g, e Ssé cÿǒ gʉm jú.
en: And the angel said unto her, Fear not, Mary: for thou hast found favour with God.

ngiemboon: Jú’u: Ɔ̀ ge gwɔ́ shwoŋ, é gÿo zyé tà’ mûɔ mbàŋa, é tsẅi lezíŋ sé le Yěsô.
en: And, behold, thou shalt conceive in thy womb, and bring forth a son, and shalt call his name JESUS.

ngiemboon: Aa lá’a tsẅé sá’a ngẅɛ̀ Israel ntsèm; lefùɔ sé téen ńdá’a ḿmaga wɔ́.
en: and he shall reign over the house of Jacob for ever; and of his kingdom there shall be no end.

ngiemboon: Tà yɔɔn nò ge lá’ cʉa lêkɔ́, pá’ n nyě tè zsě mámbàŋa lɔɔn?
en: Then said Mary unto the angel, How shall this be, seeing I know not a man?

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nò le Ssé cʉa
en: For with God nothing shall be impossible.

ngiemboon: Malîɛ lɔg mɛ̌ melyɛ̌’, ńdu ssé, ńgiŋ pɔ́ lê metʉ̀ ńdɔ́g ye mekwɔ’ɔ́ Jẅidea ḿbʉ ńgʉa lé tsɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ,
en: And Mary arose in those days, and went into the hill country with haste, into a city of Juda;

ngiemboon: ńgʉ́a tà ńkúu mbʉ̀a Sakarîɛ, ńkúu ndá, ńtsyɛ’te Lisape.
en: and entered into the house of Zacharias, and saluted Elisabeth.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ gẅiin mbʉ́lè Ssé, ńcʉa pànzwě metsèm. Mbʉ́lè gǐŋ ńgwɔ́ ná múɔ gẅie ɔ̀ ge táa zyé.
en: and she spake out with a loud voice, and said, Blessedartthou among women, and blessedisthe fruit of thy womb.

ngiemboon: Má pà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ̀ɔn tóo ńguɔ wɔ̀ɔn pá’ɔɔn, n gwɔ́ yɔ́ɔn wɔ́?
en: And whenceisthis to me, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?

ngiemboon: Gyá pá’ n děen ńjú’u tsyɛ̀’te ɔ́, múɔ ŋele, ńkága lepfòm mèŋ.
en: For, lo, as soon as the voice of thy salutation sounded in mine ears, the babe leaped in my womb for joy.

ngiemboon: Ɔɔ shÿó mbòŋo, mélà’mie ɔ̀ ka zẅǐŋ ngie menò mie Ssé ka tǔm mé tsẅii mbwo gù, ge táa púmte.
en: And blessedisshe that believed: for there shall be a performance of those things which were told her from the Lord.

ngiemboon: M bǔ ne ńnáa legú’ mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a,
en: My soul doth magnify the Lord,

ngiemboon: Ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn ne ńkága tɛ’ ńtí pá’ à gÿǒ mèŋ n tsẅɛ́.
en: And my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a mesoŋ nà mejwoŋó mejwoŋó ge lá’a cʉ́’ʉ tóŋo wɔ̀ɔn lé shÿó mbòŋo,
en: For, behold, from henceforth all generations shall call me blessed.

ngiemboon: E Ssé ee Ssé
en: And holyishis name.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ńgÿo ná púɔ pɔ́b á ná mejwoŋó mejwoŋó
en: From generation to generation.

ngiemboon: À tǎg pàŋá’te nnɛ́ ńdɔg sáa tsẅɛ
en: He hath scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts.

ngiemboon: ńkaa mepóŋ ńnéŋe mǒ
en: And exalted them of low degree.

ngiemboon: ńjwoŋ megàŋa mmó pɔ́ gʉa mbwo mesẅɛ̀ɛ
en: And the rich he hath sent empty away.

ngiemboon: À kaa lege lényɛɛ pòŋo ntʉ́m yé wɔ́,
en: In remembrance ofhismercy;

ngiemboon: Á mbwo Ábalam pɔ́ ngẅɛ̀ ndá yé mejwoŋó mejwoŋó
en: To Abraham, and to his seed for ever.

ngiemboon: Malîɛ la gɔɔn pú’u, pɔ́ Lisape lá’ ńnéŋe mmó mesaŋ méntá, tá á piŋ nzèm.
en: And Mary abode with her about three months, and returned to her own house.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’e Lisape ge zyé ku’, á zyé mûɔ mbàŋa.
en: Now Elisabeth's full time came that she should be delivered; and she brought forth a son.

ngiemboon: Megàŋ nkwɔ’ɔ́ mbʉ́a pâ mefɛ́ pé jú’ pá’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tsɔ̌ɔn mezìŋe mé, ńnáa yé mûɔ, pâ pɔ́ pú ńkág.
en: And her neighbours and her cousins heard how the Lord had shewed great mercy upon her; and they rejoiced with her.

ngiemboon: Me tóŋo yé le Jâŋ.
en: And his mother answered and said, Notso; but he shall be called John.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tiŋ ńdʉ’, ńgɔɔn ngie atsɔ̌ nyìŋ tè tsetsɛ̀ɛ mefɛ́ pí lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ pɛ́’ɛ wɔ́.
en: And they said unto her, There is none of thy kindred that is called by this name.

ngiemboon: Ńdêen ńké ńdɔg mbwó ńzɛ́te Sakarîɛ pá’ à kwǒŋ ngie mé tóŋo múɔ pú’u.
en: And they made signs to his father, how he would have him called.

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te mmó gie à ge ŋwe’e mmó mǒ, mé ná, á ŋwe’e ngie lezíŋ sé ée lé Jâŋ. Pɔ́ gyá á kʉ’ʉ wɔ́b tɛ’.
en: And he asked for a writing table, and wrote, saying, His name is John. And they marvelled all.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwɔ́ gyá ncwò Sakarîɛ gwoon ńtsɔ́’ɔ tà á gwaa gíŋe zye légɔɔn nò, ńně ńgu’te Ssé.
en: And his mouth was opened immediately, and his tongueloosed, and he spake, and praised God.

ngiemboon: À Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a pú ńjÿó tá we Sakarîɛ, á gɔɔn nò pá’*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé lá, ngie:
en: And his father Zacharias was filled with the Holy Ghost, and prophesied, saying,

ngiemboon: à tǒ ńkẅéte pʉ̀a pé, ńcu’u wɔ́b ndá nkwɔ̀ɔn.
en: For he hath visited and redeemed his people,

ngiemboon: À kẅɛɛ nà ngẅɛ̀ nda ngàŋa fà’ wé, fùɔ Ndavid,
en: In the house of his servant David;

ngiemboon: oon, à la lɔg ncwò*pàntsẅì nkʉ̀ pé ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: As he spake by the mouth of his holy prophets, which have been since the world began:

ngiemboon: mbɔɔ nà mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ té ne ńkwoŋo légyá gẅi wɔ́.
en: That we should be saved from our enemies, and from the hand of all that hate us;

ngiemboon: ńkímte*kʉ̀a ndʉalʉ̌a gie pâ pɔ́ la gwa,
en: And to remember his holy covenant;

ngiemboon: À lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn ńtíi wege ngie:
en: The oath which he sware to our father Abraham,

ngiemboon: tá pɔ́ lêen ńké ńku’u léfa’a mbwo mèŋ té pɔ́g.
en: Might serve him without fear,

ngiemboon: ndùmo Ssé tsetsá’.
en: In holiness and righteousness before him, all the days of our life.

ngiemboon: ńnyɛte mánzsé we.
en: For thou shalt go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways;

ngiemboon: á tsoté tà ḿbɔ́ɔnte pá’ à ge lege menò tepòŋ mɔ́b, é gÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́,
en: By the remission of their sins,

ngiemboon: À ge túmo Nyìŋ gẅie à ge gÿo pege gwɔ́ wó, angàŋ fó tÿǒ ńtó ńgwɔ́ nkà’,
en: Whereby the dayspring from on high hath visited us,

ngiemboon: é tsege wɔ́b ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ sẅétè.
en: To guide our feet into the way of peace.

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ lɔ́gɔ ńgwɔ́ ndùŋ mvfò lesǎŋ pʉ̀a pú’u. Kirinus gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó ńgwɔ́ ngúmnɔ́ɔn á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Siria.
en: (Andthis taxing was first made when Cyrenius was governor of Syria.)

ngiemboon: Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ lêen ńké ńně ḿbiŋe lesa’á pɔ́b, ńgÿo mé sáŋa yé.
en: And all went to be taxed, every one into his own city.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ nzwě we Malîɛ gwɔ gʉa me sáŋa wɔ́b yé á gwɔ́ shwoŋ,
en: to be taxed with Mary his espoused wife, being great with child.

ngiemboon: ńkúu wó múɔ gwoon Malîɛ.
en: And so it was, that, while they were there, the days were accomplished that she should be delivered.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó pàpyɛ́b mvfó shÿó jʉ’ó ne ńdá’a pǐ ḿbyɛ́bɛ mvfó yɔ́b,
en: And there were in the same country shepherds abiding in the field, keeping watch over their flock by night.

ngiemboon: Mé la’á tÿǒsoŋ fùɔ Ndavíd lyɛ̌’ɔɔn, ńzyé Nyìŋ gẅie à ge gÿo pi tsẅɛ́. Aa Kristo gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé la ka’.
en: For unto you is born this day in the city of David a Saviour, which is Christ the Lord.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn tà ńgwaa cʉ́me, anùɔ*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé tà ńgyɔ́ɔn gíŋe fóo tÿǒ ńtó ńkẅi’i ná yé, pâ pɔ̌ zɔb, ńgu’te Ssé, ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God, and saying,

ngiemboon: Legu’ gwɔ́ mbwo Ssé á tàa tÿǒ lepwó, asẅétè gwɔ́ mbwo pʉ̀a mesoŋ ndùmo Ssé tsetsá’. E Ssé kwoŋo wɔ́b.
en: And on earth peace, good will toward men.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ tà ńgyá yé, ńzye lépíte ngwòŋ menò ntsèm mie*cÿɔ́’ Ssé shwóŋó wɔ́b ńtíi yé.
en: And when they had seenit, they made known abroad the saying which was told them concerning this child.

ngiemboon: Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ně ńjú’u mɔɔn menò, á ncwò pàpyɛ́b mvfó, ḿmɔɔn tɛ’,
en: And all they that hearditwondered at those things which were told them by the shepherds.

ngiemboon: ńgʉa ná Malîɛ, á pú ńde’e menò amɛ̌ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m yé, ńně ńkwaŋa nò mǒ fʉ̀’ ntsèm.
en: But Mary kept all these things, and ponderedthemin her heart.

ngiemboon: Mbà à la lá’ ńtʉ́ njÿó shwóŋó yé ngie à těen ńdá’a ńkwé té gwɔ́ gie à zabá léjÿɔ́g ná*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie à tǔm wɔ́.
en: And it was revealed unto him by the Holy Ghost, that he should not see death, before he had seen the Lord's Christ.

ngiemboon: Símeon kẅé yé ńgẅiin mbwo yé, ńně síe Ssé, ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: then took he him up in his arms, and blessed God, and said,

ngiemboon: ngwɔ́ ɔ̀ nyé ngàŋa fà’ gù á pʉ́lè ńkwé pá’ ɔ̀ la gɔɔn.
en: According to thy word:

ngiemboon: pʉ̀a mesoŋ tsẅɛ́.
en: For mine eyes have seen thy salvation,

ngiemboon: Aa letsẅɛ́ gẅie ɔ̀ la lá’ nyɛte ńzáb lényɛɛ mbwo ngwòŋo ngwòŋ.
en: Which thou hast prepared before the face of all people;

ngiemboon: mbwo Israel, á lá’ ɔ́.
en: And the glory of thy people Israel.

ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̂b pɔ́ Malîɛ jú’ menò mie Símo gɔ̌ɔn ná múɔ á kʉ’ʉ wɔ́b.
en: And Joseph and his mother marvelled at those things which were spoken of him.

ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̂b pɔ́ Malîɛ lɔ́ɔn ńgwɔ̂ ngù’ ntsèm, ńgee Yerósalem léjÿó línɔ́ɔn*Páskà.
en: Now his parents went to Jerusalem every year at the feast of the passover.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ńgẅiin ngù’ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a pâ pɔ́ pú ńgʉa pá’ tsẅé lá’ yɔ́b la ne ńzɛ́te pú’u,
en: And when he was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem after the custom of the feast.

ngiemboon: ńdá’ tè yé gyá, kékáŋ tà ḿbiŋe Yerósalem, ńgiŋe fa’a yé,
en: And when they found him not, they turned back again to Jerusalem, seeking him.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie é la jú’u shwóŋè yé ně ḿbúu ńgɔ’te zsé nò yé mbɔɔ yé ntí letsɔ’ɔ́ nò.
en: And all that heard him were astonished at his understanding and answers.

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Pi piŋe fa’a wɔ̀ɔn pú’u, mélà’a kɔ́? Pi te ně ńzsé ngie á póŋ mèŋ shwôŋ menò Tá wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́ kà?
en: And he said unto them,How is it that ye sought me? wist ye not that I must be about my Father's business?

ngiemboon: À la tsɔ́’ pú’u, pɔ́ ké te jú’u nò gie à lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn wɔ́.
en: And they understood not the saying which he spake unto them.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńgú’u, azsé nò yé né ńkẅi’i, e Ssé gwɔ́ lé yé, pʉ̀a mesoŋ ně ńkwoŋo yé.
en: And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature, and in favour with God and man.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kúbe mà wɔb à nu’u wɔ́b ntse, e Ssé lege menò tepòŋ mɔ́b ńnáa mbwo pɔ́b.
en: And he came into all the country about Jordan, preaching the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins;

ngiemboon: ńgÿo melyěen nzsé mé e tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ.
en: Make his paths straight.

ngiemboon: ńkwɔg melu’ú mie ée ná mánzsé ésaŋte
en: And the rough waysshall bemade smooth;

ngiemboon: Tá à cʉa pú’u, pʉ̀a metsèm gyá pá’ Ssé ge gÿo pege tsẅɛ́».
en: And all flesh shall see the salvation of God.

ngiemboon: Tà á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pú’u, peg gǎ?
en: And the people asked him, saying, What shall we do then?

ngiemboon: Tsítsà, tà peg ge gÿo yég lêkɔ́?
en: Then came also publicans to be baptized, and said unto him, Master, what shall we do?

ngiemboon: Pi kẅé ndà’ mmó gie*lepʉ̌ ne ńzɛ́te, tà pi kẅi’i.
en: And he said unto them, Exact no more than that which is appointed you.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ ne shwóŋó nò Ssé pú’u, ńgíŋe ńnáa mentÿɔgɔ́ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn mbwo lá’.
en: And many other things in his exhortation preached he unto the people.

ngiemboon: *Herôd gwaa mege cÿɔb, ńtsẅi mé gwoon Jâŋ ḿma’a ndá tsǎŋ
