en: added yet this above all, that he shut up John in prison.

ngiemboon: Kaynam gwɔ́ míŋ Enos. Enos gwɔ́ míŋ Sɛd. Sɛd gwɔ́ míŋ Adam. Adam gwɔ́ gẅie Ssé la pwóon ye.
en: which wasthe sonof Enos, which wasthe sonof Seth, which wasthe sonof Adam, which wasthe sonof God.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ la gwɔ́ tà ńnu’u Yěsô ntse, á fó nkʉ̀ŋ ntse Jurdeŋ ńgʉa. A Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a pú ńjÿó yé, ńgÿo á gʉa lê nkwòŋo tsẅɛ,
en: And Jesus being full of the Holy Ghost returned from Jordan, and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness,

ngiemboon: Sátà lêen ńtó ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Pá’ ɔɔ Míŋ Ssé lá, lêen ńké ńtsẅi né tóon wɛ̂ ngie à sele ńcʉ́’ʉ mmó léjÿó ɔ̀ jÿó.
en: And the devil said unto him, If thou be the Son of God, command this stone that it be made bread.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo Sátà ngie: Mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie: Nyìŋ tè lɔg pɔ́ ndà’ mmó gie à pfɛ̌ tá gwɔ́ wó wɔ́
en: And Jesus answered him, saying,It is written, That man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.

ngiemboon: Sátà lêen ńké ńkwé’e yé ńtÿɔ́gɔ tsɔ́ jʉ’ taa tÿǒ, ńtyé wó ńgÿo á pú ńgyá mengwòŋo mengwòŋ mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó tà’ legʉ̀a,
en: And the devil, taking him up into an high mountain, shewed unto him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gɔɔn pɔ́ ndà’ ngie ɔ̀ kẅí’te mvfò mèŋ, ńgu’te wɔ̀ɔn, e lêen ńcʉ́’ shú.
en: If thou therefore wilt worship me, all shall be thine.

ngiemboon: mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie: Ssé ge tsẅi mecÿɔ́’ pé tó ḿbyɛ́bte gú
en: for it is written, He shall give his angels charge over thee, to keep thee:

ngiemboon: Mé la gíŋ ńŋwe’e ngie: Pɔ́ ge lɔg mbwo mɔ́b kaa gú tà ɔ́ le túu kwò ɔ́ ná tóon wɔ́
en: And intheirhands they shall bear thee up, lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone.

ngiemboon: Sátà kwa’te Yěsô tà ḿmag mentí, ńgyá kékáŋ, ńnyé yé, ńgʉa, ńně ńzẅí’te fʉ̀’e ndyɛ̀’ɛ gie à ge gÿo gíŋe tóo ná yé.
en: And when the devil had ended all the temptation, he departed from him for a season.

ngiemboon: mélà’mie à la ne ńda’te nò Ssé á*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda, pʉ̀a metsèm ně ńgu’te yé.
en: And he taught in their synagogues, being glorified of all.

ngiemboon: ngie n gʉa, ńtág nzèm pʉ̀a pie mé ne sẅɛ́ɛ wɔ́b,
en: To set at liberty them that are bruised,

ngiemboon: yɔɔn ee ngù’ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe pʉ̀a pé
en: To preach the acceptable year of the Lord.

ngiemboon: Á lêen ńké ńzye lékyagte, ńgɔ́ɔn ngie: Menò mie pi foo lé jú’u tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé lɛ é pumté lyɛ̌’ɔɔn.
en: And he began to say unto them,This day is this scripture fulfilled in your ears.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋó gẅi nénʉ́, mé ee ntě ńzẅíŋe nò*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé lá’ pɔ́b wɔ́.
en: And he said,Verily I say unto you, No prophet is accepted in his own country.

ngiemboon: Tá, e Ssé ké ńdá’ te túmo*Elîɛ mbʉ̀a tsɔ́ wɔb wɔ́, ńtsẅi, á kẅɛ ńgʉa pɔ́ ndá mpfɔ̌g manzwě Serepta á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Sidoŋ.
en: but unto none of them was Elias sent, save unto Sarepta,a cityof Sidon, unto a womanthat wasa widow.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a metsèm pie é laa*ndá cú’tè jú’ pú’u, lóŋ wɔb ffó.
en: And all they in the synagogue, when they heard these things, were filled with wrath,

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô tɔ́gɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ńgʉa.
en: But he passing through the midst of them went his way,

ngiemboon: Mé pu ḿmɔɔn ye ntí lezi’í pʉ̀a mmó, mélà’mie e Ssé la ne ńnáa yé metʉ̀ tá á lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn nò.
en: And they were astonished at his doctrine: for his word was with power.

ngiemboon: Lezíŋ sé léen ḿbú saa yɛ̌ pàga ngwòŋ.
en: And the fame of him went out into every place of the country round about.

ngiemboon: Á tó ńŋwé’e ngʉ̀ŋe kǔ, ńdɔg tʉ̀ ńgɔɔn nò, ennɛ́ jú’ ńzá’a. Mákẅi’ Símo ŋwɛ́ gwoon ńdu ssé, ńnyɛte shúm ńdɔg ńdye wɔ́b.
en: And he stood over her, and rebuked the fever; and it left her: and immediately she arose and ministered unto them.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńzye légiŋe tsɛ̀ɛ*mendá cú’tè pà Yuda, á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Jẅidea ńtsẅii Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo.
en: And he preached in the synagogues of Galilee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ma’ nÿɔ́g, ńgyá kanú’ sépʉ́a ngʉ̀ŋe ntse, mbà pàmà’ ssó ně fó tsoló ńkẅɛ, ńgwɔ́ ntse sɔgɔ menkÿò mɔ́b.
en: and saw two ships standing by the lake: but the fishermen were gone out of them, and were washingtheirnets.

ngiemboon: À la gwaa gɔɔn pú’u, mbà cÿɔ’ pǔ ńgwoon wɔ́ba pʉ̀a pé, ńtí nzẅìŋ messó mie pɔ́ gwǒon.
en: For he was astonished, and all that were with him, at the draught of the fishes which they had taken:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ pú’u, ńdɔg mekanú’ ḿbiŋ lé ngʉ̀ŋe ntse, ńkúu wó, ḿbú ńnyé kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́, ńcʉ́me nzèm Yěsô.
en: And when they had brought their ships to land, they forsook all, and followed him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô jú’, ńtsege pwó, ńkíbe yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n kwǒŋ pú’u, zeŋé. Nkà’ gwoon ḿmaga ná yé.
en: And he put forthhishand, and touched him, saying,I will: be thou clean.And immediately the leprosy departed from him.

ngiemboon: Tá’, Yěsô ńnéŋe tà ńdu ssé ńgee jʉ’ gie nyìŋ tè wó wɔ́, ńgu’te Ssé.
en: And he withdrew himself into the wilderness, and prayed.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá ntí gie pʉ̀a pɔɔn lɔ̌g ńzáb ntʉ́m ná yé, ńgɔɔn né ngùɔ ngie: Ashǔ wɔ̀ɔn, mé legé menò tepòŋ mú ńnáa mbwo ɔ̀.
en: And when he saw their faith, he said unto him,Man, thy sins are forgiven thee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwóon ńzsé mmó gie pɔ́ zẅɛ́te mǒ, ńzɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi gaa ńgẅiin yɛ̂ ntí nkwaŋá ntʉ́m pi?
en: But when Jesus perceived their thoughts, he answering said unto them,What reason ye in your hearts?

ngiemboon: Pi gyǎ gí ngie á zéŋe pɔ́ légɔɔn né nyìŋ ngie mé legé menò tepòŋ mú kà pɔ́ lé gɔɔn ngie lu ssé ńgiŋ?
en: Whether is easier, to say, Thy sins be forgiven thee; or to say, Rise up and walk?

ngiemboon: Á gwóon ńdu ssé tsetsɛ̀ɛ lá’, ńkaa páŋte, ńdêen ńké ńgwaa piŋ lê mbʉ̀a yé, ńgiŋe ńgu’te Ssé.
en: And immediately he rose up before them, and took up that whereon he lay, and departed to his own house, glorifying God.

ngiemboon: Lěvi nyé shúm ntsèm, ńdu ssé, ńcʉ́me nzèm yé, pɔ́ yé gʉa.
en: And he left all, rose up, and followed him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô saga mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Ngwɔ́ nyìŋ le gwɔ́ ntentʉ́ ńgʉa fa’a ńgÿò meffo wɔ́. Nyìŋ guɔ tá fa’a yé.
en: And Jesus answering said unto them,They that are whole need not a physician; but they that are sick.

ngiemboon: Tá’, mé ge lá’ fó mbwo pɔ́b tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’ sa’a yé, pɔ́ lêen ńké ńnéŋe nzyè fʉ̀’ó la.
en: But the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, and then shall they fast in those days.

ngiemboon: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé néŋ melù’ mesẅé pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntú’ ye sẅé.
en: But new wine must be put into new bottles; and both are preserved.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ pʉ̀a nà nùɔ pà*farisay zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Mélà’a kɔ́ pi gÿo mmó gie mé la pʉ́ légÿo á lyɛ̌’ɛ nzsé?
en: And certain of the Pharisees said unto them, Why do ye that which is not lawful to do on the sabbath days?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’, ńgʉa ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́ lésẅíŋte Ssé, tà ńdá’a wó lá’.
en: And it came to pass in those days, that he went out into a mountain to pray, and continued all night in prayer to God.

ngiemboon: Njÿó lʉ́a, á tóŋ*ngàŋa nkwò yé, ńgʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ńtsɔ́’ pʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém, ńtsẅi lezíŋ sɔ́b lê ngàŋ ntúm wé.
en: And when it was day, he calledunto himhis disciples: and of them he chose twelve, whom also he named apostles;

ngiemboon: ńgÿo Matio, ńgÿo Tomáse, ńgÿo Jâg míŋ Alfe, ńgÿo Símo gẅie pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńtóŋo yé le mûɔ ngwòŋ,
en: Matthew and Thomas, James thesonof Alphæus, and Simon called Zelotes,

ngiemboon: ńgÿo Jẅide míŋ Jâg, ńgÿo Jẅidas Iskariod gẅie à la táa sẅiŋe Yěsô.
en: and Judasthe brotherof James, and Judas Iscariot, which also was the traitor.

ngiemboon: Mânyìŋ ntsèm la ne fa’a lézába pwó ná yé, mélà’mie metʉ̀ la ne fóo ná yé, ńzoŋo wɔ́b metsèm.
en: And the whole multitude sought to touch him: for there went virtue out of him, and healedthemall.

ngiemboon: Pi ee pàshÿó mbòŋo, pi pie pi ee mepóŋ, mélà’mie*lefùɔ Ssé gwɔ́ pɔ́ sí.
en: And he lifted up his eyes on his disciples, and said,Blessedbe yepoor: for your's is the kingdom of God.

ngiemboon: Pi ee pàshÿó mbòŋo pi pie pi ee fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńne ńdʉa, mélà’mie pi ge gÿo gẅe.
en: Blessedare yethat hunger now: for ye shall be filled. Blessedare yethat weep now: for ye shall laugh.

ngiemboon: Tá’, pi ee kwà’ pàshÿó tepòŋ pi pie pi ee megàŋa mmó, mélà’mie pi lêen ńgẅiin léjÿó sî shúm mbòŋo pɔ́ ndà’ fʉ̀’ɔɔn.
en: But woe unto you that are rich! for ye have received your consolation.

ngiemboon: Pi ee pàshÿó tepòŋ pi pie pi ne ńgẅe fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mélà’mie pi ge lá’ cʉ́’ʉ ńnéŋe pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ lemÿɔg é piŋ ne lʉa.
en: Woe unto you that are full! for ye shall hunger. Woe unto you that laugh now! for ye shall mourn and weep.

ngiemboon: Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tó ńdúɔ mmó mbwo gù wɔ́, ɔ̀ ná. Nyìŋ tó ḿbíi mmó jú ńdɔg ńgʉa, ɔ̀ pɔ́ɔn lékʉ́a.
en: Give to every man that asketh of thee; and of him that taketh away thy goods askthemnot again.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie pi ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie me gÿo ná pi lá, pi gÿo kwà’ yɛ̌ ná petsɔ́ pʉ̀a.
en: And as ye would that men should do to you, do ye also to them likewise.

ngiemboon: Pi tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe pʉ̀a pá’ Tá gẅi Ssé tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mânyìŋ ntsèm.
en: Be ye therefore merciful, as your Father also is merciful.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ngie: Anzì’i fà’ tè tá fà’ we cʉa. Tá’, anzì’i fà’ gẅie à zi’í fà’ tà ńcʉ́me gÿo yé pá’ tá fà’ we lá.
en: The disciple is not above his master: but every one that is perfect shall be as his master.

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ngǎ ɔ̀ ne ńgyá múɔ méfùbe pǐŋ gie e gwě lejÿɔ́g fɛ́ gù, tá kúmo nuŋe lejÿɔ́g gù, ɔ̀ piŋ ńké tè gyá?
en: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother's eye, but perceivest not the beam that is in thine own eye?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Atÿǒ mbòŋo té zém ntɔ̌ɔn tèpòŋ wɔ́. Atÿǒ tepòŋ piŋ ńké tè ntɔ̌ɔn mbòŋo zém.
en: For a good tree bringeth not forth corrupt fruit; neither doth a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Mélà’a kɔ́ pi ne ńtóŋo wɔ̀ɔn lé Andè! Andè! MÀbiŋ ńké tè ne ńgÿo mmó gie mèŋ n tsẅǐ wɔ́?
en: And why call ye me, Lord, Lord, and do not the things which I say?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńtó, ńtsɛ́ɛ wɔ̀ɔn, ńzẅí’te shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn, ńgÿo pá’ á né ńzɛ́te, mbà à ge sẅé nyìŋ gẅie n gee nyɛ̌ pi lɔɔn.
en: Whosoever cometh to me, and heareth my sayings, and doeth them, I will shew you to whom he is like:

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn nò mbwo lá’ tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, ḿbiŋ nzèm né Kapernawúm.
en: Now when he had ended all his sayings in the audience of the people, he entered into Capernaum.

ngiemboon: À kwoŋo lá’a yégè kwoŋ tà mbà à la kwɛ́*ndá cú’tè né peg.
en: for he loveth our nation, and he hath built us a synagogue.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie tá ndá ncù pà*Roma tumó wɔ́b gÿo ḿbiŋ tà ńkúu ndá, ńgyá, mbà nguɔ zeŋé.
en: And they that were sent, returning to the house, found the servant whole that had been sick.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô gyá mpfɔ̌g ŋwɛ́, mezìŋe mé kúu yé, á gɔɔn né yé ngie: Tè gíŋe ńdʉa,
en: And when the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her, and said unto her,Weep not.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ésẅɛ’te nnɛ́, ńtó ńkíbe nkùm mpfó, pʉ̀a pie é la kaa tyé, Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Mûɔ shùm, n tsẅǐ ngie ɔ̀ zyeen.
en: And he came and touched the bier: and they that barehimstood still. And he said,Young man, I say unto thee, Arise.

ngiemboon: Á lêen ńgwóon ḿbʉ’ʉ nnɛ́ ńnéŋe ńnéŋe, ńzye léshwóŋe, Yěsô kíbe yé ńnáa mbwo má we.
en: And he that was dead sat up, and began to speak. And he delivered him to his mother.

ngiemboon: Mé la lɔg menò mie Yěsô gÿǒ ḿbú saa pàga ngwòŋ Jẅidea, tà mbɔɔ metsɔ́ melá’ shÿó jʉ’ó.
en: And this rumour of him went forth throughout all Judæa, and throughout all the region round about.

ngiemboon: *Megàŋa kwò Jâŋ Mbabtis jú’ yɔ́b mɔɔn menò ntsèm, ńtó, ḿbíte shwóŋó yé. Jâŋ tsɔ́’ pʉ̀a mépʉ́a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b,
en: And the disciples of John shewed him of all these things.

ngiemboon: Ashÿó mbòŋo aa nyìŋ gẅie à tè kʉ́a lezáb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ wɔ́.
en: And blessed ishe, whosoever shall not be offended in me.

ngiemboon: Tà pi kɔ̌ɔn ńgee ńgyá pɔ́ kɔ́? Á*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé lá? Oon tà mèŋ n ké shwóŋó gẅí, à kaa wɛ̌ tà ńcʉa mbɔɔ*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé!
en: But what went ye out for to see? A prophet? Yea, I say unto you, and much more than a prophet.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Tà mèŋ n ge lɔgɔ kɔ́ pí fʉ̀’ ná pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó fʉ̀’ɔɔn? Pɔ́ ee pé’e sẅé pà wɔ̌?
en: And the Lord said,Whereunto then shall I liken the men of this generation? and to what are they like?

ngiemboon: Wɛ̂ aa kwà’ pá’ mé la gÿo ná Jâŋ Mbabtis. À ka tǒ, à tè mmó pfɛ́, à tè melù’ nú, pi gɔɔn ngie aa pʉ̀a.
en: For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine; and ye say, He hath a devil.

ngiemboon: Tá pʉ̀a metsèm pie é zẅiŋé yɔɔn zsé nò lɔgɔ nyɛɛ ngie à gÿo menò mbòŋo Ssé.
en: But wisdom is justified of all her children.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwóon ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Símo, pɔgɔ gẅiin shwóŋè. Á gɔɔn ngie: Tsítsà, n ne ńjú’u.
en: And Jesus answering said unto him,Simon, I have somewhat to say unto thee.And he saith, Master, say on.

ngiemboon: Símo tsɔ́’ ngie: N kwǎŋ ngie à ge gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie ye njǔ la gyɔ́ɔn. Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Ɔ̀ shwóŋó nò.
en: Simon answered and said, I suppose thathe, to whom he forgave most. And he said unto him,Thou hast rightly judged.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ně fó te lɔgɔ méjʉ’ʉ mèvɛ ńzɔ́’ɔ twó yɔ́ɔn mɔ́, tá à kě ńdɔgɔ laméndɔ́ɔn ńzɔ́’ mekwò mɔ́ɔn.
en: My head with oil thou didst not anoint: but this woman hath anointed my feet with ointment.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lêen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwó manzwě wá ngie: E Ssé legé menò tepòŋ mú ńnáa mbwo gu.
en: And he said unto her,Thy sins are forgiven.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn né manzwě ŋwɛ́ ngie: Ɔ̀ tsẅɛ̌ ndòon menò tepòŋ mú, mélà’mie ɔ̀ zǎb ntʉ́m ɔ́ ná mèŋ. Gʉa lê sẅétè.
en: And he said to the woman,Thy faith hath saved thee; go in peace.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńgiŋe pú’u, anùɔ lá’ fó meshÿó meshÿó ńtó. Á gÿo ńdɔg*sagá nò ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: And when much people were gathered together, and were come to him out of every city, he spake by a parable:

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ memvòm gwe nà jʉ’ ye metóon, ńtóo lésá’, ńzág ntse, ńgwóon ńjúm.
en: And some fell upon a rock; and as soon as it was sprung up, it withered away, because it lacked moisture.

ngiemboon: Metsɔ́ memvòm gwe tsɛ̀ɛ megǐ tepòŋ, pâ pɔ̌ pú ńdu ssé, legǐ tepòŋ fóme mɛ̌.
en: And some fell among thorns; and the thorns sprang up with it, and choked it.

ngiemboon: *Megàŋa kwò Yěsô gÿo ńzɛ́te yé ngie à kyagte mmó gie yɔɔn*sagá nò ŋwɛ́ lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn é shwóŋó wɔ́b.
en: And his disciples asked him, saying, What might this parable be?

ngiemboon: Á cʉ́’ʉ lékyagte yɔɔn sagá nò ńgɔɔn ngie: Mbyè mmó lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ shwóŋè Ssé.
en: Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.

ngiemboon: Mé tó, ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Má ɔ̀ pâ mefɛ́ pú ée pi ně fa’a légyá ɔ́.
en: And it was told himby certainwhich said, Thy mother and thy brethren stand without, desiring to see thee.

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ ngie: Má wɔ̀ɔn pâ mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn ée pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ jú’u nò Ssé, ńgÿo pá’ á ne ńzɛ́te.
en: And he answered and said unto them,My mother and my brethren are these which hear the word of God, and do it.

ngiemboon: Pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gʉa tà ńkúu Garazania, é ngwòŋ gẅie mé fó nzǐŋ ye pàga ngwòŋ Galilea, é gwɔ́ nà yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ.
en: And they arrived at the country of the Gadarenes, which is over against Galilee.

ngiemboon: *Messé tepòŋ ŋwɛ́ sẅíŋte Yěsô ngie, tà á túmo wɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ pÿé.
en: And they besought him that he would not command them to go out into the deep.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la ne ḿbyɛ́bɛ mekúnɔ́ɔn gyá pú’u, ńtága ńkÿo, ńgʉa ńdɔgɔ yɔɔn nò saa jʉ’ tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ melá’.
en: When they that fedthemsaw what was done, they fled, and went and tolditin the city and in the country.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie é ne ńgyá nzyète nò píte pá’ á ně ńcʉa tá nyìŋ gẅie*messé tepòŋ ke ńgwɔ́ ná yé la, á zeŋe.
en: They also which sawittold them by what means he that was possessed of the devils was healed.

ngiemboon: Yěsô piŋ nzèm tà ńkúu nà yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ, alá’ gwɔ́ wó, mbà á ně ńdá’ ńzye lézẅí’te yé, pɔ́ gyá yé ḿbú ńkág tɛ’.
en: And it came to pass, that, when Jesus was returned, the peoplegladlyreceived him: for they were all waiting for him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô jú’ pú’u, ńdu Ssé pɔ́ yé gʉa, alá’ zse nzèm ye, ńtÿɔ́’ɔ yé ńnéŋe soŋ tà jʉ’ cʉ́’ʉ sẅíbe sẅibé.
en: for he had one only daughter, about twelve years of age, and she lay a dying. But as he went the people thronged him.

ngiemboon: Á ná’te, éfóo nzèm, ńtó ńkíbe tsɔ̌ɔn nzsó Yěsô. Aguɔ yé gwóon ḿmag.
en: came behindhim, and touched the border of his garment: and immediately her issue of blood stanched.

ngiemboon: Yěsô cwoŋo ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ kibé wɔ̀ɔn. N jǔ’ pá’ metʉ̀ mɔ́ɔn fa’a fà’.
en: And Jesus said,Somebody hath touched me: for I perceive that virtue is gone out of me.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie míŋ wɔɔn, ntí gie ɔ̀ lɔ̌g ńzáb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ gÿǒ ɔ̀ tsẅɛ́, gʉa né mbʉ́lè,
en: And he said unto her,Daughter, be of good comfort: thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tʉ́a tuŋó ńjú’, ńgɔɔn né Yayelo ngie: Tè pɔ́g, záb pɔ́ ntʉ́m ɔ́ ná mèŋ, míŋ ɔ̀ ge tsẅɛ́.
en: But when Jesus heardit, he answered him, saying,Fear not: believe only, and she shall be made whole.

ngiemboon: Alá’ la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà á zyě lé lʉa legwé. Yěsô gɔɔn ngie, tà mé gíŋe ńdʉa, múɔ kaa kwé, à lye lyě.
en: And all wept, and bewailed her: but he said,Weep not; she is not dead, but sleepeth.

ngiemboon: Mé jú’ ńgẅe yé gẅe, mélà’mie pɔ́ la ne ńzsé ngie à kwǎ’ ńkwé.
en: And they laughed him to scorn, knowing that she was dead.

ngiemboon: Tá’, Yěsô ké ńgʉa gʉa tà ńkúu pɔ́ jʉ’ gie múɔ la nuŋe wó, ńkíbe pwo yé, ńdɔg ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ngie: Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, zyeen.
en: And he put them all out, and took her by the hand, and called, saying,Maid, arise.

ngiemboon: Jʉ́jʉ́ŋ we gwóon ḿbiŋ, á pʉ́’ʉ nnɛ́, Yěsô tsẅi ngie mé náa mmó à jÿó.
en: And her spirit came again, and she arose straightway: and he commanded to give her meat.

ngiemboon: Tá múɔ pɔ́ má múɔ gyá, á kʉ’ʉ wɔ́b. Tá’ Yěsô tɔ’ ngie tà pɔ́ ke shwóŋó nyìŋ mmó gie á cʉ̌a.
en: And her parents were astonished: but he charged them that they should tell no man what was done.

ngiemboon: Ńdêen ńké ńtúmo wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ gʉa shwóŋ pá’ nò*lefùɔ Ssé áa pú’u, ńgíŋ ńgÿo megàŋa guɔ zeŋe,
en: And he sent them to preach the kingdom of God, and to heal the sick.

ngiemboon: Pi gʉa tà ńkúu jʉ’, mé gɔɔn ngie pi lá’a tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ ndá wɔ́, pi ke ńtsẅé pɔ́ ndá ŋwɛ́ tà ńdá’ ńgʉa.
en: And whatsoever house ye enter into, there abide, and thence depart.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lêen ńké ńgʉa, ńkʉ́’ʉ melá’ melá’, ńgiŋe ńtsẅii Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé, ńgíŋe ně ńgÿo megàŋa guɔ zeŋe.
en: And they departed, and went through the towns, preaching the gospel, and healing every where.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gÿo pɔ́ ńnéŋe ssé.
en: And they did so, and made them all sit down.

ngiemboon: Alá’ pfɛ́, ńzẅɛ́, mé lágte pfwɔ’ á lúe metǔŋ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém.
en: And they did eat, and were all filled: and there was taken up of fragments that remained to them twelve baskets.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Kwà’ pi gí gɔɔn ngie mèŋ, n gee wɔ̌? Piɛ tsɔ́’ ngie: Ɔɔ*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie à foo mbwo Ssé.
en: He said unto them,But whom say ye that I am?Peter answering said, The Christ of God.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tɔ’ɔ wɔ́b tɛ’, ngie tà pɔ́ gɔɔn tà nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ jú’,
en: And he straitly charged them, and commandedthemto tell no man that thing;

ngiemboon: Mé lɔɔn ńzɔɔn ḿbú ńkaa njÿó yɔɔn ntsèm ńná né nyìŋ, tá á ké ńgwɔ́ gie e ge lɔg pɔ́ twó yé, mbà á ge kẅéte yé nà kɔ́?
en: For what is a man advantaged, if he gain the whole world, and lose himself, or be cast away?

ngiemboon: ńkúu wó, á ne ńtsyɛ’te Ssé, aliŋé shÿó wé pú ńkúbe, menzsǒ mé pú fɔ́g tà ńŋwʉŋe.
en: And as he prayed, the fashion of his countenance was altered, and his raimentwaswhiteandglistering.

ngiemboon: Mé gyá pʉ̀a mépʉ́a kẅɛ, pâ Yěsô ne shwóŋe. Á gwɔ́ Mǒsê pɔ́*Elîɛ,
en: And, behold, there talked with him two men, which were Moses and Elias:

ngiemboon: Mbà pɔ́ lɔgɔ́ shéshÿɔ́g Ssé ńtó, pâ Yěsô ne shwóŋó nò nà nzsè Yerósalem, pá’ à ge tóo wó kwé.
en: who appeared in glory, and spake of his decease which he should accomplish at Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Ńnyé ńgɔɔn gɔɔn, tsɔ́ melɔ́ɔn sẅɛ́’ ńkábte wɔ́b.*Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gyá pá’ melɔ́ɔn kabté wɔ́b, ḿbú ḿbɔ́g.
en: While he thus spake, there came a cloud, and overshadowed them: and they feared as they entered into the cloud.

ngiemboon: Ngyè nyìŋ fóo tsɛ̀ɛ melɔ́ɔn ŋwɛ́, ńgɔɔn ngie: Wɔɔn aa míŋ wɔ̀ɔn mie n kǎŋ, pi jú’ ncwò wé.
en: And there came a voice out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son: hear him.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé yétá gwaa fó lekwɔ’ɔ́ ŋwɛ́ cwóŋ, mbà lá’ kẅɛ̌ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ńtó ńzá’a yé.
en: And it came to pass, that on the next day, when they were come down from the hill, much people met him.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ sẅiŋté*ngàŋa kwò ɔ́ ngie pɔ́ jwoŋ ssé ayɛ̌, tá pɔ́ pú te mǒ ku’.
en: And I besought thy disciples to cast him out; and they could not.

ngiemboon: Pi cwoŋo ńjú’u nò gie n gee ngɔ̌ɔn lɔɔn mboŋó, ḿbiŋ ńkímte. Mé ne ńgee sẅǐŋ*Míŋ Nyìŋ mbwo pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: Let these sayings sink down into your ears: for the Son of man shall be delivered into the hands of men.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ̌ ntsaŋ lêen ńké ńnéŋe tà sá’a tsetsɛ̀ɛ*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô, pɔ́ ne fa’a nyìŋ gẅie aa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ńgwɔ́ ndÿò.
en: Then there arose a reasoning among them, which of them should be greatest.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zsé nkwaŋá gẅie ée ntʉ́m pɔ́b, ńtóŋo mûɔ mémúɔ, ńtÿɔ́gɔ lejʉ́ŋ yé,
en: And Jesus, perceiving the thought of their heart, took a child, and set him by him,

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Tà pi tɔ’ɔ yé légÿo pú’u. Nyìŋ gẅie à kaa nò yégè tága aa wege nyìŋ.
en: And Jesus said unto him,Forbidhimnot: for he that is not against us is for us.

ngiemboon: Pàlá’ ŋwɛ́ jú’ ngie Yěsô cʉa ńgee ne Yerósalem, ńdʉ’ʉ lé náa jʉ’ mbwo ye.
en: And they did not receive him, because his face was as though he would go to Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Yěsô sele nnɛ́ ńdíe wɔ́b, ńcÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b [ ngie pi kaa zsé nkwaŋá gẅie é tsóte gẅi wɔ́.
en: But he turned, and rebuked them, and said,Ye know not what manner of spirit ye are of.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Nyé mepfó pɔ́ túŋ mepfó pɔ́b. Ɔ̀ gẅiin pɔ́ légʉa shwóŋ pá’ nò*lefùɔ Ssé áa pú’u.
en: Jesus said unto him,Let the dead bury their dead: but go thou and preach the kingdom of God.

ngiemboon: Pi lo, n túmo gẅi pɔ́ pà’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé túm púɔ mvfó tsetsɛ̀ɛ menɔ̀ɔn ngẅì.
en: Go your ways: behold, I send you forth as lambs among wolves.

ngiemboon: Pi gʉa tà ńkúu ndá nyìŋ, pi vɔg ńgɔɔn ngie: E Ssé néŋ mbʉ́lè tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn ndá.
en: And into whatsoever house ye enter, first say, Peacebeto this house.

ngiemboon: Pi gɔɔn pú’u, nyìŋ gẅie à kwǒŋ mbʉ́lè gwɔ́ ndá, mbà mbʉ́lè ge kúu ná yé. Tà á té pú’u wɔ́, mbà è ge piŋ kúu ná pi.
en: And if the son of peace be there, your peace shall rest upon it: if not, it shall turn to you again.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ wɔ́, tà pʉ̀a kúe gẅí, pɔ́ ná pɔ́ kɔ́ wɔ́, pi jÿó.
en: And into whatsoever city ye enter, and they receive you, eat such things as are set before you:

ngiemboon: Oon, mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, á ge lá’ gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ gie Ssé ŋaga pʉ̀a mesoŋ, ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ pɛ̌ pʉ̀a gyɔ́ɔn ńcʉa ye pʉ̀a Sodom.
en: But I say unto you, that it shall be more tolerable in that day for Sodom, than for that city.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé mboŋó ngie: Á ge lá’ gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ gie Ssé ŋaga pʉ̀a mesoŋ, egi ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ cʉa ye pʉ̀a Tir pâ pʉ̀a Sidoŋ,
en: But it shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment, than for you.

ngiemboon: MÀbiŋ sele nnɛ́, ńtsẅe ńgɔɔn mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Pi ee pàshÿó mbòŋo tɛ’ pá’ pi ne ńgyá shúm sie pi ne ńgyá lɛ̀.
en: And he turned him untohisdisciples, and said privately,Blessedarethe eyes which see the things that ye see:

ngiemboon: Yěsô jú’ pú’u, ńgɔɔn mbwo yé ngie: Ɔ̀ tóŋo jú ŋwà’ne Ssé ńjú’u pɔ́ lêkɔ́?
en: He said unto him,What is written in the law? how readest thou?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn mbwó yé ngie: Ɔ̀ tsɔ̌’ mboŋó, gÿo pú’u, pi Ssé zɔ lá’a ńcʉ́’ʉ ńnéŋe.
en: And he said unto him,Thou hast answered right: this do, and thou shalt live.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ gwɔ́ zoŋo twó yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Ayɛ̀ tà ḿboŋ, tà fɛ́ wɔ̀ɔn nyìŋ mesoŋ aa pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wɔ́?
en: But he, willing to justify himself, said unto Jesus, And who is my neighbour?

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nuŋe pwɔ́’ ye Yuda gÿo ne ńcʉa jʉ’ó, ńgyá nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ nuŋe ssé, á lí’te, ḿpfó nà yetsɔ́ gwoŋó nzsè, ńtɔ́g ńcʉa.
en: And by chance there came down a certain priest that way: and when he saw him, he passed by on the other side.

ngiemboon: Tá’, tsɔ̌ nyìŋ Samalîɛ ne ńgee né legìŋ, ńgʉa tà ńkúu jʉ’ó, ńgyá yé, mezìŋe mé kúu yé.
en: But a certain Samaritan, as he journeyed, came where he was: and when he saw him, he had compassionon him,

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Mágtà, Mágtà, ɔ̀ pǔ’ mbùm ɔ̀, ńgwá ńgyá ngɔ́’ nà shúm tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: And Jesus answered and said unto her,Martha, Martha, thou art careful and troubled about many things:

ngiemboon: Tá’ tà’a mmó gwɔ́ wó, ńgwɔ́ tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ, Malîɛ kaŋá yɛ̌ ŋwɛ́, ḿbɔ́ɔn nyìŋ léfó mbwo yé ńkẅé.
en: but one thing is needful: and Mary hath chosen that good part, which shall not be taken away from her.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ ntsèm, ńnáa yég mmó léjÿó gie á ge ku’u ná peg á nà lyɛ̌’ɔɔn
en: Give us day by day our daily bread.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lúɔ mmó, mbà mé ge náa mbwó yé, éfa’, mbà à ge gyá, ḿbiŋ ńkwá’te ncwò ndá, mbà mé ge tsɔ́’ ná né yé.
en: For every one that asketh receiveth; and he that seeketh findeth; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened.

ngiemboon: Míŋ wɔ̌ piŋ ńdúɔ lepùm ngáb, mbà à ge gwoon ngɔ́ɔn ssé, é ńnéŋe mbwó yé?
en: Or if he shall ask an egg, will he offer him a scorpion?

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a ne ńtsóte Yěsô tsotě, ńne fa’a liŋé gie á la’te ngie Ssé zɔ tumó yé.
en: And others, temptinghim, sought of him a sign from heaven.

ngiemboon: Pi zsě gí ngie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgẅiin shúm ncù, ńgíŋe ńgẅiin metʉ̀ lélɔg ḿbyɛ́b mbʉ̀a ye, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ammó yé le pyé.
en: When a strong man armed keepeth his palace, his goods are in peace:

ngiemboon: A lɔɔn ḿbiŋ nzèm, ńgyá, mbà mé kéen ńjÿɔg ndá ńtáŋte,
en: And when he cometh, he findethitswept and garnished.

ngiemboon: Yěsô pʉŋe ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Ɔ̀ kɔ’ɔ́ gɔɔn pɔ́ ngie: Pàshÿó mbòŋo ée pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ jú’u shwóŋè Ssé, ńgÿo pá’ á ne ńzɛ́te.
en: But he said,Yea rather, blessedarethey that hear the word of God, and keep it.

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ńzɛ́te ngie ɔ̀ laga twó ɔ́, ḿbɔ́ɔn nÿɔ́g mú lélɔgɔ gú ńgee tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm.
en: Take heed therefore that the light which is in thee be not darkness.

ngiemboon: nyìŋ*farisay gyá pá’ à kaa sɔg mbwó mé pá’*lepʉ̌ lá’ sɔ́b ée ssé ńne ńzɛ́te wɔ́, á pú ńkʉ’ʉ yé tɛ’.
en: And when the Pharisee sawit, he marvelled that he had not first washed before dinner.

ngiemboon: Pi ee megʉ̀gʉ̀! Né ngie Ssé gẅie à la nyɛte nzème pǐ zɔ la gíŋ ńnyɛte tsɛ̀ɛ wó lá?
en: Yefools, did not he that made that which is without make that which is within also?

ngiemboon: Ndòon ee twó pi pà*farisay! Pi kúu*ndá cú’tè, ńkaŋa gí jʉ’ pɔ́ mvfò, ńkwoŋ ngie mé tó ńtsyɛ’te gẅi ndùmo gyɛ̌.
en: Woe unto you, Pharisees! for ye love the uppermost seats in the synagogues, and greetings in the markets.

ngiemboon: ńgÿo pú’u, éfa’a létsíŋe yé tà gwɔ á gɔɔn nò éfʉa tsɔ́, pɔ́ zẅɛ́’ ḿbii yɛ̌ ńdɔg sẅiŋe yé.
en: laying wait for him, and seeking to catch something out of his mouth, that they might accuse him.

ngiemboon: Á ge gÿo gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, à Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a shwóŋó gẅi nò gie pi ge gɔɔn.
en: for the Holy Ghost shall teach you in the same hour what ye ought to say.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ fóo nùɔ lá’, ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Tsítsà tsẅi né fɛ́ wɔ̀ɔn ngie à gab shúm tá weg yé ńná sɔ́ɔn.
en: And one of the company said unto him, Master, speak to my brother, that he divide the inheritance with me.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Awɔ̌ la zába wɔ̀ɔn léŋag mentsaŋ mí, kà pɔ́ légab shúm sí ńná né pi?
en: And he said unto him,Man, who made me a judge or a divider over you?

ngiemboon: Ńdeen ńké saga mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Tsɔ̌ ngàŋa mmó lǎ’ ńgwɔ́ wó, metsetsá’ mé gwɔ́ tsɔ̌ ngù’ ńkwɔ́ shúm léjÿó tɛ’.
en: And he spake a parable unto them, saying,The ground of a certain rich man brought forth plentifully:

ngiemboon: Á zye lékwaŋ ngie: Mèŋ n ge gÿo lêkɔ́ tá pú le’e shúm sɔ́ɔn? Ajʉ’ ge kɔ́g,
en: and he thought within himself, saying, What shall I do, because I have no room where to bestow my fruits?

ngiemboon: é sele gɔɔn né twó mbùm yɔ́ɔn ngie: Ashǔ, afù’ áa ssé nà mengù’ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, zẅɛte! Pfɛ́ɛ! Núu! Pím pá’ ɔ̀ kwǒŋ!
en: And I will say to my soul, Soul, thou hast much goods laid up for many years; take thine ease, eat, drink,andbe merry.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé mboŋó ngie, gẅi le gwɔ́ cʉa shúm léjÿó, mbùm nyìŋ piŋ ńgwɔ́ mmó tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ ńcʉa menzsǒ.
en: The life is more than meat, and the bodyis morethan raiment.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pi le séen ńdɔg pɔ́ pá’ pi ne ḿbú’u mbùm gi, ńkú’u lékẅi’i tà’a lyɛ̌’ nà melyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ mí wɔ́.
en: And which of you with taking thought can add to his stature one cubit?

ngiemboon: Tà á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie pi fó tè ku’u légÿo pú’u wɔ́, pi piŋ ḿbú’ mbùm gi ná setsɔ́ shúm mélà’a kɔ́?
en: If ye then be not able to do that thing which is least, why take ye thought for the rest?

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pú’u, tà pi gíŋe ḿbú’ mbùm gí ngie mé ge pfɛ́ɛ kɔ́, mé ge núu kɔ́?
en: And seek not ye what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink, neither be ye of doubtful mind.

ngiemboon: Pàtèzsě Ssé zɔ̌ ńnéŋe ńgẅiin yɛ̌ ntí nkwaŋá. Á gʉa ná pi, mbà Tá gẅi Ssé zsé shúm sie é ge kẅéte gẅí.
en: For all these things do the nations of the world seek after: and your Father knoweth that ye have need of these things.

ngiemboon: Pi fa’ pɔ́ pá’ gẅi nkwaŋá ge tyé pɔ́ nà nò*lefùɔ Ssé, à lêen ńké ńcʉ́’ʉ ńná sɛ̌ shúm ńdɔgɔ ńkẅi’i kẅi’i.
en: But rather seek ye the kingdom of God; and all these things shall be added unto you.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn, pi gwɔ̌ pɔ́ mbó ntá’ tá’, tà pi pɔ́g, mélà’mie Tá gẅi Ssé ka gyǎ ngie à ge ná lefùɔ mbwo pi.
en: Fear not, little flock; for it is your Father's good pleasure to give you the kingdom.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńde’e nkáb gi nzɔ̌ wɔ́, mbà ntʉ́m gẅi ge gwɔ́ pɔ́ jʉ’ó.
en: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.

ngiemboon: Pi cwoŋte mbùm gi, ńdyɛ melâm, ńtÿɔ́gte!
en: Let your loins be girded about, andyourlights burning;

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ nò tá fà’ tó tsɛ̀ɛ tsẅɛ́’ kà pɔ́ nkwɔ̀’ njÿó wɔ́, ńtó ńgyá pɔ́ nyé pɔ́ te lyé, mbà pɔ́ ée pàshÿó mbòŋo.
en: And if he shall come in the second watch, or come in the third watch, and findthemso, blessed are those servants.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, mbàa pi gí, pi cwoŋte mbùm gí ḿbyɛ́b, mélà’mie*Míŋ Nyìŋ ge gÿo tó, tá pi tè ne ńzsé fʉ̀’ wɔ́.
en: Be ye therefore ready also: for the Son of man cometh at an hour when ye think not.

ngiemboon: Piɛ jú’ pú’u, ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Andè, ɔ̀ saga sɔɔn legʉa pá’ɔɔn pɔ́ ndà’ mbwo peg kà mbwo mânyìŋ ntsèm?
en: Then Peter said unto him, Lord, speakest thou this parable unto us, or even to all?

ngiemboon: Tá fà’ we lɔɔn ńdá’ ńgwaa piŋ nzèm, ńgyá á ne fa’a yɛ̌ fà’, mbà aa shÿó mbòŋo.
en: Blessedisthat servant, whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, tá fà’ we ge cʉ́me shúm sé ntsèm ntsèm mbwo yé.
en: Of a truth I say unto you, that he will make him ruler over all that he hath.

ngiemboon: Tà pi kwaŋ ngie n ka tǒ, ńdɔg mbʉ́lè ńtóo ndùmo ssé tsetsá’, n ka lɔg pɔ́ fagte ńtó.
en: Suppose ye that I am come to give peace on earth? I tell you, Nay; but rather division:

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ńgyá fefà sele tà ńcʉ́’ fóo pɔ́ shÿó ntsíŋ ńcʉ’ʉ, pi gɔɔn ngie lùm gee ntʉ̌a, á ké ńtʉ́a.
en: And whenye seethe south wind blow, ye say, There will be heat; and it cometh to pass.

ngiemboon: Mélà’a kɔ́ pi tè zsé légyá mmó gie mé lɔɔn ńgÿo á gwɔ́ mbòŋ wɔ́?
en: Yea, and why even of yourselves judge ye not what is right?

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, ngàŋ ge lá’ gwɔ́ kẅɛɛ tsǎŋ, é pú tóŋo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie mé ne ńkʉ́a tà tsɔ́ le pyé.
en: I tell thee, thou shalt not depart thence, till thou hast paid the very last mite.

ngiemboon: Ngǎŋ, á té nò wɔ́, pi zsé ngie pi lɔɔn ńké tè kúbe gẅi mà wɔ́, mbà pi ge gÿo lége gí pɔ́ pá’ pɔ́b.
en: I tell you, Nay: but, except ye repent, ye shall all likewise perish.

ngiemboon: Ngǎŋ, á té nò wɔ́. Pi lɔɔn ńké tè kúbe gẅi mà wɔ́, mbà pi ge lége gí pɔ́ pá’ pɔ́b.
en: I tell you, Nay: but, except ye repent, ye shall all likewise perish.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋa fà’ tsɔ́’ ngie: Andè, mé ná’a ńnyé yé yɔɔn ngù’, mèŋ n ge túŋ letsiŋé sé, é lɔg kʉ̀ŋe tsáb,
en: And he answering said unto him, Lord, let it alone this year also, till I shall dig about it, and dungit:

ngiemboon: pú’u, kà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á lá’a fʉ̀’ pá’ɔɔn ńzém ntɔ̌ɔn wɔ́? Ńké ḿbiŋ tè zém ɔ̀ tsẅi mèŋ n kɔ́’.
en: and if it bear fruit,well: and if not,thenafter that thou shalt cut it down.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tsɔ́*lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè pà Yuda, Yěsô gwɔ́*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda ńne ńda’te nò Ssé mbwo lá’.
en: And he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the sabbath.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá yé, ńtóŋo yé, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Agùɔ jú yɛ magá,
en: And when Jesus saw her, he calledher to him, and said unto her,Woman, thou art loosed from thine infirmity.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńzáb mbwo mé twó manzwě ŋwɛ́. Á gwóon ḿbʉ’ʉ nnɛ́ ńtyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, ńgu’te Ssé.
en: And he laidhishands on her: and immediately she was made straight, and glorified God.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ngie:*Lefùɔ Ssé ée pé’e ńgwá’a lá, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mèŋ n dɔgɔ kɔ́ ḿbí fʉ̀’?
en: Then said he,Unto what is the kingdom of God like? and whereunto shall I resemble it?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n gíŋe ńdɔgɔ kɔ́ ḿbí fʉ̀’ nà*lefùɔ Ssé?
en: And again he said,Whereunto shall I liken the kingdom of God?

ngiemboon: Yěsô la gíŋ ńtyé mánzsé ńne ńgee Yerósalem, ńcʉa nà metÿǒsoŋ lâ melá’ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, ńgiŋe ńda’te nò Ssé mbwo pʉ̀a.
en: And he went through the cities and villages, teaching, and journeying toward Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Tá’, à gíŋe ńgɔɔn mbwo pi ngie: N tè ne ńzsé pʉ̀a pie pi ee pɛ̌ wɔ́. Pi fó ncwò ndá mèŋ ńgʉate, pi ee pàfʉate menò!
en: But he shall say, I tell you, I know you not whence ye are; depart from me, allyeworkers of iniquity.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie tsɔ́ pà gwɔ́ mvfò fʉ̀’ɔɔn ge lá’ cʉ́’ pà gwɔ́ nzèm, etsɔ́ pà gwɔ́ nzèm fʉ̀’ɔɔn lá’ ńgwɔ́ pà gwɔ́ mvfò.
en: And, behold, there are last which shall be first, and there are first which shall be last.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ gwɔ́ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ tyé mvfò yé, mbà kwɔ́’te lěen ńgwoon yé.
en: And, behold, there was a certain man before him which had the dropsy.

ngiemboon: Tá pɔ́ pú tè tsɔ́b, Yěsô kíbe ngùɔ ŋwɛ́, ńgÿo á zéŋe, ńtsẅi á gʉa.
en: And they held their peace. And he tookhim, and healed him, and let him go;

ngiemboon: Á cʉa wɔ́b, pɔ́ zága pÿɛ.
en: And they could not answer him again to these things.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ la’ ne ńtóŋo línɔ́ɔn, ɔ̀ tóŋ pàtèmmó, ńtóŋ menkÿǒon, ńtóŋ pànkème kwò, ńtóŋ pàfʉ̀ menÿɔ́g.
en: But when thou makest a feast, call the poor, the maimed, the lame, the blind:

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Tsɔ̌ nyìŋ lǎ’ ńtáŋte máamáa línɔ́ɔn, ńtsẅii mbwo pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: Then said he unto him,A certain man made a great supper, and bade many:

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’e léjÿó shúm gÿo ńku’, á túmo ménkʉ́ we ngie à gʉa ńtóŋo wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ leen ńké ńtó fʉ̀’ɔɔn.
en: and sent his servant at supper time to say to them that were bidden, Come; for all things are now ready.

ngiemboon: Wetsɔ̌ ye: Mèŋ, n ka nyě ńzɔ́’ɔ, ńgwɔ́ n de tó.
en: And another said, I have married a wife, and therefore I cannot come.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa tà ḿbiŋ, ńgɔɔn né tá we ngie: Andè, mèŋ, m bǔ ńgÿo mmó gie ɔ̀ ně ńtsẅi, n něŋ pʉ̀a ndá tá’, ajʉ’ nyé pɔ́ wó.
en: And the servant said, Lord, it is done as thou hast commanded, and yet there is room.

ngiemboon: Zsé mboŋó ngie, ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ tà’ ná pʉ̀a pie n ka vɔg ńtsẅii mbwo pɔ́b la, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á le mmó léjÿó yɔ́ɔn zẅí’.
en: For I say unto you, That none of those men which were bidden shall taste of my supper.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’, ńcʉ́me mánzsé ńne ńgiŋe, pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn gwɔ́ nzèm yé, á kúu tsɔ́ jʉ’, ésele nnɛ́ ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie:
en: And there went great multitudes with him: and he turned, and said unto them,

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn tè kaa yé tÿǒ nkǐ ńdɔgɔ ńzẅíŋe lékwé, tá ńcʉ́me nzèm mèŋ wɔ́, mbà ńgwɔ́ á le ku’u légwɔ́*ngàŋa kwò wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́.
en: And whosoever doth not bear his cross, and come after me, cannot be my disciple.

ngiemboon: ḿbɔ́gɔ lénuŋe cÿó, ndá ńcʉa yé. Mé lá’a ńzɔ́gɔ ńgyá ńgẅe yé ngie:
en: Lest haply, after he hath laid the foundation, and is not able to finishit, all that beholditbegin to mock him,

ngiemboon: Gyá pá’ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ wá la zye ndá, à tè ku’u lémege wɔ́.
en: saying, This man began to build, and was not able to finish.

ngiemboon: Ngwáŋ ée mmó mbòŋo, tá ńgwɔ́ gie é lɔɔn ńcʉ́’ ńdebe lebe, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé gÿo lêkɔ́ tà é gíŋe ńdʉm?
en: Saltisgood: but if the salt have lost his savour, wherewith shall it be seasoned?

ngiemboon: *Pàkẅé ncùb pà Roma lâ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie mé lɔ́ɔn ńkʉ́e wɔ́b ne ńtóo metsèm, á lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô lé jú’u nò yé.
en: Then drew near unto him all the publicans and sinners for to hear him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lêen ńké saga mbwo pɔ́b ngie:
en: And he spake this parable unto them, saying,

ngiemboon: À ge fa’ tà gyá, é pú kág, é kaa zába mekẅí yé,
en: And when he hath foundit, he layethiton his shoulders, rejoicing.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí: Á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pú’u,*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé kág ńtí tà’ nyìŋ tepòŋ wémɔ’ɔ́ gẅie à kubé mà we.
en: Likewise, I say unto you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repenteth.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: Atsɔ̌ mámbàŋa lǎ’ ńgẅiin gubé yé mbàŋa yépʉ́a.
en: And he said,A certain man had two sons:

ngiemboon: ńcʉŋte nkáb tà é gwɔ mag, gwáŋa gwe tsɛ̀ɛ wɛ̌ ngwòŋ. Á zye lézága ye mpfɛ̌.
en: And when he had spent all, there arose a mighty famine in that land; and he began to be in want.

ngiemboon: Ńtebe tà ńgʉa ńkúu fà’ mbwo tsɔ̌ nyìŋe lá’ ŋwɛ́. Á túmo yé nká’ lépyɛ́b mekúnɔ́ɔn.
en: And he went and joined himself to a citizen of that country; and he sent him into his fields to feed swine.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, n tè gíŋe ńku’u gẅie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ɔ̀ tóŋ lê míŋ ɔ̀ wɔ́. Fó ńdɔgɔ wɔ̀ɔn ńgÿo tsɔ̌ ngàŋa fà’ ɔ̀ lâ.
en: and am no more worthy to be called thy son: make me as one of thy hired servants.

ngiemboon: Pi fa’a mûɔ fòŋ gẅie à fǎŋ tɛ’ la, ńzẅé pege pfɛ́, ńkág,
en: and bring hither the fatted calf, and killit; and let us eat, and be merry:

ngiemboon: ńtí pá’ míŋ wɔ̀ɔn mɔɔn à ka kwě, à zǐm, à ka pyě, n giŋé ńgyá yé. Á gɔɔn pú’u, pɔ́ zye lékág.
en: for this my son was dead, and is alive again; he was lost, and is found. And they began to be merry.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, míŋ we we lÿò gwɔ́ nká’, ńgÿo ne ḿbiŋe, ńgʉa tà ńcʉ́’ʉ lékúu mbʉ̀a, ńjú’ mé gwɔ́ wó ńzɔbɔ ńzíŋe.
en: Now his elder son was in the field: and as he came and drew nigh to the house, he heard musick and dancing.

ngiemboon: Á tóŋo tsɔ̌ ngàŋa fà’, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Akɔ́ áa mbʉ̀a?
en: And he called one of the servants, and asked what these things meant.

ngiemboon: Andyè we jú’ pú’u, ḿbú ńgyáŋa lóŋ tà ńdʉ’ʉ lékúu ndá. Tá we kẅɛɛ pǐ ḿbú’ mbwó mbwo yé ngie à kúu ndá.
en: And he was angry, and would not go in: therefore came his father out, and intreated him.

ngiemboon: Tá we gɔɔn ngie, míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, pɔgɔ zɔɔ ńzɔ́gɔ. Akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie n gẅiin wɔ́ áa jú.
en: And he said unto him, Son, thou art ever with me, and all that I have is thine.

ngiemboon: Ńńnéŋe tà ńgɔɔn ngie: N zsě pá’ mèŋ n ge gÿo tà fʉ̀’ gie mé kẅilé wɔ̀ɔn nà fà’ la, epʉ̀a kúe wɔ̀ɔn membʉ̀a mɔ́b,
en: I am resolved what to do, that, when I am put out of the stewardship, they may receive me into their houses.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn tè ku’u lépɔ́ɔn shúm se yɔɔn njÿó ye tepòŋ wɔ́, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wɔ̌ cʉ́me kwà’ shúm se tʉ̀ nzẅìŋ mbwo pi?
en: If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the trueriches?

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn tè zsé lépɔ́ɔn mmó nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ wɔ́, mbà wɔ̌ ge lá’ náa gie áa kwà’ gí mbwo pi?
en: And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another man's, who shall give you that which is your own?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn pú’u, pà*farisay pie é laa jʉ’ó jú’, ḿbú sóon, ńgẅe yé, mélà’mie pɔ́ gɔ’ nkáb tɛ’.
en: And the Pharisees also, who were covetous, heard all these things: and they derided him.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ mbóŋ gwɔ́ yé wó, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ le Nǎzalo. Mefʉ̌ŋ pú ńgwɔ́ ná yé tɛ’, á nuŋe ncwò ndá ngàŋ nkáb ŋwɛ́,
en: and there was a certain beggar named Lazarus, which was laid at his gate, full of sores,

ngiemboon: Á kúu lá’ mepfó, ḿbú ne ńgyá ngɔ́’ tɛ’, ḿma’ lejÿɔ́g ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, ńgyá Ábalam, Nǎzalo ńnéŋe lejʉ́ŋ ye.
en: and in hell he lift up his eyes, being in torments, and seeth Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋ nkáb gɔɔn né yé ngie: Tá wɔ̀ɔn, e sẅiŋte gú, ńdyɛ́’ ɔ̀ túmo Nǎzalo, á gʉa mbʉ̀a peg.
en: Then he said, I pray thee therefore, father, that thou wouldest send him to my father's house:

ngiemboon: Mémá nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgÿo nò tepòŋ ná yé, á pʉ́le pʉlé shwóŋó yé, á zẅíŋe mefʉ̀a, á lege ńnáa mbwo yé.
en: Take heed to yourselves: If thy brother trespass against thee, rebuke him; and if he repent, forgive him.

ngiemboon: Megàŋa kwò Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, kẅéte wég lékẅi’i ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé.
en: And the apostles said unto the Lord, Increase our faith.

ngiemboon: À tè séen gíŋe ná ndǎg mbwo ngàŋa fà’, mélà’mie à gÿǒ mmó gie à tsẅǐ wɔ́.
en: Doth he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded him? I trow not.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mánzsé ńne ńgee Yerósalem, ńcʉa nà pàa lá’ pà Samalîɛ pâ pà Galilea.
en: And it came to pass, as he went to Jerusalem, that he passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ lá’, megàŋ nkà’ pǎb legém zá’a yé, tà ńtyé pɔ́ ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a,
en: And as he entered into a certain village, there met him ten men that were lepers, which stood afar off:

ngiemboon: ńga’te lê tʉ ńgɔɔn ngie: Yěsô, Andè, tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe még.
en: and they lifted uptheirvoices, and said, Jesus, Master, have mercy on us.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tà’ ná pɔ́b gyá pá’ à zeŋé, ḿbiŋ nzèm, ńkwé’e ngyè ye ńnáa tÿǒ ńdɔg ńgú’te Ssé.
en: And one of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, and with a loud voice glorified God,

ngiemboon: Ńtó ńnuŋe mekwò Yěsô, ńcÿɔ’ɔ zí yé ssé, ńná ndǎg mbwo yé. Angàŋ laa nyìŋ Samalîɛ.
en: and fell down onhisface at his feet, giving him thanks: and he was a Samaritan.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: Pʉ̀a legém pǔ ńzeŋe, pe lepfwɔ’ɔ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ nzɔ̌?
en: And Jesus answering said,Were there not ten cleansed? but wherearethe nine?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ pǔ ńzeŋe metsèm, tà ndà’ gù wɔɔn zɔ tǒ lénná ndǎg mbwo Ssé ká?
en: There are not found that returned to give glory to God, save this stranger.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwo nyìŋ Samalîɛ ŋwɛ́ ngie: Lu ssé ńgʉa, e Ssé gÿǒ ɔ̀ tsẅɛ́, ńtí pá’ ɔ̀ zǎb ntʉ́m ɔ́ ná mèŋ.
en: And he said unto him,Arise, go thy way: thy faith hath made thee whole.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a ge lá’ ne gɔɔn né pi ngie: Yé wɔɔn jʉ’ɔɔn kà pɔ́ ngie yé gẅi jʉ’ e wɔ́. Pi pɔ́ɔn léjwoŋte, tà pi gwá ńkÿo mendʉ́.
en: And they shall say to you, See here; or, see there: go not afterthem, nor followthem.

ngiemboon: Tá’, á ge ké zɔɔn gwaa gwɔ́ pú’u,*Míŋ Nyìŋ zɔɔn ḿvɔg ńgyá ngɔ́’ pá’ɔɔn tɛ’, pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó fʉ̀’ɔɔn lʉ’ʉ yé.
en: But first must he suffer many things, and be rejected of this generation.

ngiemboon: À ge lá’ gwaa tó menò mie é la gÿo fʉ̀’e Noá gíŋe ńgÿo.
en: And as it was in the days of Noe, so shall it be also in the days of the Son of man.

ngiemboon: Pi gyá nò gie á ge lá’ gíŋe gÿo pʉ̀a, á nà lyɛ̌’ gie*Míŋ Nyìŋ ge lá’ vege vege tó.
en: Even thus shall it be in the day when the Son of man is revealed.

ngiemboon: Pi kímte nzwě Lod.
en: Remember Lot's wife.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à ge gÿo fà’a lépɔ́ɔn we le gwɔ́, à ge gÿo pyé, nyìŋ gẅie à zẅiŋé lépyé, yé zɔ gÿo ńgwɔ́ wó.
en: Whosoever shall seek to save his life shall lose it; and whosoever shall lose his life shall preserve it.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ gie pànzwě mépʉ́a ne ńgwɔ’ɔ ngesáŋ lùŋo ńkẅéte, mbà mé ge lɔgɔ tà’ gʉa, é nyé wetsɔ̌,
en: Twowomenshall be grinding together; the one shall be taken, and the other left.

ngiemboon: [ńgwɔ́ gie mbàŋa ée nká’ yépʉ́a, mbà mé ge lɔgɔ tà’ gʉa, é nyé wetsɔ̌].
en: Twomenshall be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the other left.

ngiemboon: Yěsô saga tsɔ́ nò, ńdɔg ńda’te mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé pà’ á poŋo lésẅíŋte Ssé fʉ̀’ ntsèm té kʉ́a.
en: And he spake a parable unto themto this end, that men ought always to pray, and not to faint;

ngiemboon: Ńgɔ́ɔn ngie: Atsɔ̌ ntsɔ́’te mentsaŋ gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ, à tè Ssé pɔ́g, ḿbiŋ tè líe nyìŋ mesoŋ pá’ tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: saying,There was in a city a judge, which feared not God, neither regarded man:

ngiemboon: Yěsô fó mǒ ngie: Pi cwoŋo ńjú’ gí nò gie ntsɔ́’te ntsaŋ wɔɔn gɔ̌ɔn, tá ńgwɔ́ tè pɔ̌g Ssé.
en: And the Lord said,Hear what the unjust judge saith.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋ saga tsɔ́ nò ná pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ kwaŋ ngie pɔ́ zɔ̌ gÿo mmó gie Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, ḿbiŋ ńcʉ́’ʉ ńgwága petsɔ́ pʉ̀a gwǎg,
en: And he spake this parable unto certain which trusted in themselves that they were righteous, and despised others:

ngiemboon: Mèŋ, n gee ńkwoŋo kwoŋ ńzɔ́gɔ nzyè ngʉ̀a mbʉ́a nà ngàba lá’, ńgíŋe ńgabte shúm sɔ́ɔn nzsè legém, ńnáa tà’ nzsè mbwo gù.
en: I fast twice in the week, I give tithes of all that I possess.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ ńkěm pà Yuda tó ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: Tsítsà we mbòŋo, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mèŋ n gÿo lêkɔ́ tá ńgẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì?
en: And a certain ruler asked him, saying, Good Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ̀ tóŋo wɔ̀ɔn le nyìŋ mbòŋo mélà’a kɔ́? É té ndà’ Ssé wɔ́, mbà tsɔ́ nyìŋ mbòŋo tè wó wɔ́.
en: And Jesus said unto him,Why callest thou me good? noneisgood, save one,that is, God.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: Tà fó pá’ n dà nyé mûɔ shùm, mèŋ n gee ńké ńtsẅé ńkú’te mbʉ̌ mɛ̂ ku’té ntsèm.
en: And he said, All these have I kept from my youth up.

ngiemboon: Á jú’, eshÿó wé sẅɛ́’, mélà’mie à la gẅiin shúm nkáb tɛ’.
en: And when he heard this, he was very sorrowful: for he was very rich.

ngiemboon: Á zeŋe mbwo shÿóon léshúu tsɛ̀ɛ njwóŋ lesyɛ’ɛ́, ńcʉa ngàŋa mmó lézẅíŋ ngie Ssé zɔ cʉ́’ʉ sá’a yé.
en: For it is easier for a camel to go through a needle's eye, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la ne ńjú’u yɔɔn nò gɔɔn ngie: Tà á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɛ́’ɛ, mbà wɔ̌ ge lá’ tsẅɛ́?
en: And they that hearditsaid, Who then can be saved?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Anò gie á cʉa pʉ̀a mesoŋ, á té Ssé cʉa.
en: And he said,The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gɔɔn mbwo Yěsô ngie: Tà peg léen ńnyé yég kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, ńcʉ́me nzèm gù pá’ɔɔn lá.
en: Then Peter said, Lo, we have left all, and followed thee.

ngiemboon: mbà ngàŋ ge zso pɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn gíŋe gẅiin sɛ̌ shúm tà tɔ́g sie à ka nyě, é lá’ gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ sẅé, é gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì.
en: who shall not receive manifold more in this present time, and in the world to come life everlasting.

ngiemboon: é lɔg ngwɔ̀ɔn cúa yé, é gÿo mé zẅé yé, à piŋ ńzíme nà legwé nà mbɔ́ɔntè lyɛ̌’ tá.
en: and they shall scourgehim, and put him to death: and the third day he shall rise again.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gʉa tà ne ńkúu tÿǒsoŋo Yériko, atsɔ̌ fʉ̀ menÿɔ́g ńnéŋe ngʉ̀ŋe mánzsè ńne ńdúɔ ndúɔ,
en: And it came to pass, that as he was come nigh unto Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the way side begging:

ngiemboon: ńjú’ pá’ alá’ ne ńzẅɛ́ɛ shwǒŋ ńcʉa, ńzɛ́te pʉ̀a ngie: Áa kɔ́?
en: and hearing the multitude pass by, he asked what it meant.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a tsɔ́’ ngie: Aa Yěsô mûɔ Nǎzarɛd gẅie à cʉa.
en: And they told him, that Jesus of Nazareth passeth by.

ngiemboon: Á leen ńké ńzye léga’te lê ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ngie: Yěsô nyìŋ nà ngẅɛ̀ fùɔ Ndavíd, tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mɔ́ɔn.
en: And he cried, saying, Jesus,thouSon of David, have mercy on me.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tyé ńtsẅi ngie mé lɔgɔ yé ńtó ńná né yé, á tó tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ yé, Yěsô zɛ́te yé ngie:
en: And Jesus stood, and commanded him to be brought unto him: and when he was come near, he asked him,

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ tsɔɔn ngie mèŋ n gÿo lêkɔ́ ná gù? Afʉ̀ gɔɔn ngie: Andè, mèŋ n tsɔɔn légíŋe ńgyá jʉ’.
en: saying,What wilt thou that I shall do unto thee?And he said, Lord, that I may receive my sight.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Pá’ ɔ̀ zǎb ntʉ́m ɔ́ ná mèŋ lá, gyá jʉ’!
en: And Jesus said unto him,Receive thy sight: thy faith hath saved thee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô kúu Yériko, ńně ńzyɛ́’ɛ tÿǒsoŋ,
en: AndJesusentered and passed through Jericho.

ngiemboon: atsɔ̌ nyìŋ kẅɛ, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ le Sakîo, á gwɔ́ tá ndá pàkẅé ncùb pà*Roma, ńgwɔ́ ngàŋa mmó tɛ’.
en: And, behold,there wasa man named Zacchæus, which was the chief among the publicans, and he was rich.

ngiemboon: Á kÿote ńgʉa mvfò, á nà shÿó gẅie Yěsô lɔ̌ɔn nge cʉa mǒ, ńkwɔ́’ ńzébe nà tsɔ́ tÿǒ, ḿbyɛ́b pá’ à ge gwaa cʉa à gyá yé.
en: And he ran before, and climbed up into a sycomore tree to see him: for he was to pass thatway.

ngiemboon: Sakîo gwôon sẅɛ́’, ńtyé ssé, ńdɔgɔ lékág ńkúe Yěsô.
en: And he made haste, and came down, and received him joyfully.

ngiemboon: Alá’ la gyá pá’ pɔ́ ye gee, ńzẅɛ́te ngie: A gẅie à gee ndá nyìŋ tepòŋ ńda’a lɛ.
en: And when they sawit, they all murmured, saying, That he was gone to be guest with a man that is a sinner.

ngiemboon: Yěsô jú’, ńgɔɔn ngie: E Ssé gÿǒ yɔɔn tsìŋe ndá pú ńtsẅɛ́ lyɛ̌’ɔɔn, mélà’mie Sakîo giŋé ńgwɔ́ yé tsɔ̌ míŋ Ábalam!
en: And Jesus said unto him,This day is salvation come to this house, forsomuch as he also is a son of Abraham.

ngiemboon: *Míŋ Nyìŋ la zɔɔn ńtó pɔ́ léfa’ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la kúu pyé, é gÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́.
en: For the Son of man is come to seek and to save that which was lost.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ mûɔ ntɔ́’ lǎ’ ńdu ssé ńgʉa tàa túm pá’ mé ge lɔgɔ yé gÿo fùɔ ntÿɔ́’ tá à piŋ nzèm, ésá’a yé pàga lá’.
en: He said therefore,A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom, and to return.

ngiemboon: Andùŋ mvfò tó, ńtyé mvfò yé ńgɔɔn ngie: Zɔɔn múɔ, n tǎŋ nkáb gie ɔ̀ la ná né mèŋ la, tà njÿó pàg legém.
en: Then came the first, saying, Lord, thy pound hath gained ten pounds.

ngiemboon: Ambɔ́ɔntè tó yé ńgɔɔn ngie: Ankwɔbɔ́, n tǎŋ nkáb gie ɔ̀ la ná né mèŋ la, tà ńjÿó pàg sétʉ̀a.
en: And the second came, saying, Lord, thy pound hath gained five pounds.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Á gʉa ná gù, mbà mèŋ n dɔgɔ́ gú ńgÿo ngúmnɔ́ɔn gẅie ɔ̀ ge sá’ metÿǒsoŋ méntʉ̀a.
en: And he said likewise to him, Be thou also over five cities.

ngiemboon: Wetsɔ̌ tó ńgɔɔn ngie: Metʉ̌a, tà’a pàga nkáb gù wá wɔɔn, n da lɔgɔ mmó nzsǒ ńkwɛ́ ńde’e.
en: And another came, saying, Lord, behold,here isthy pound, which I have kept laid up in a napkin:

ngiemboon: Mélà’a kɔ́ ɔ̀ la tè néŋ nkáb yɔɔn mbâŋ, á jʉ’ gie mèŋ n ge gwaa tó kẅé, apì zébe mǒ wɔ́?
en: wherefore then gavest not thou my money into the bank, that at my coming I might have required mine own with usury?

ngiemboon: Ńdeen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwo pʉ̀a pie é laa jʉ’ó ngie: Pi gwoon yé, ńkẅé ye nkáb, ńnáa mbwo nyìŋ gẅie à jÿǒ legém.
en: And he said unto them that stood by, Take from him the pound, and giveitto him that hath ten pounds.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zoŋ ngie: Metʉ̌a, à ně ńdá’ ńgẅiin legém!
en: (And they said unto him, Lord, he hath ten pounds.)

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn yɔɔn sagá nò mbwo lá’ tà ḿmag, ńcʉa ńgwɔ́ mvfò, ńně ḿbʉʉ né Yerósalem.
en: And when he had thus spoken, he went before, ascending up to Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ne ńkyɛ́’ɛ, nyìŋ zɛ́te gẅi ngie pi kyɛ’ɛ nzikáase yɛ mélà’akɔ́ wɔ́? Pi tsɔ́’ ngie Andè zɔ ne ńtsɔ́ɔn.
en: And if any man ask you, Why do ye loosehim? thus shall ye say unto him, Because the Lord hath need of him.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie à tumó wɔ́b leen ńgʉa tà ńkúu wó, ńgyá kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ Yěsô ně shwóŋó wɔ́b.
en: And they that were sent went their way, and found even as he had said unto them.

ngiemboon: Pɔ ne ńkyɛ́’ɛ megàŋ nzikáase ŋwɛ́ gɔɔn ngie: Pi kyɛ́’ɛ mûɔ nzikáase yɛ̂ mélà’a kɔ́?
en: And as they were loosing the colt, the owners thereof said unto them, Why loose ye the colt?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: Andè zɔ ne ńtsɔ́ɔn.
en: And they said, The Lord hath need of him.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔg nzikáasè ńtó tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô, ńzáb menzsǒ fÿɔ́g mɔ́b nkà’ ye, ńgÿo á kwɔ́’ ńnéŋe ndùmó.
en: And they brought him to Jesus: and they cast their garments upon the colt, and they set Jesus thereon.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńgee, epʉ̀a ne saŋte menzsǒ mɔ́b ndùm mánzsè, á gíŋe ndùmó.
en: And as he went, they spread their clothes in the way.

ngiemboon: agù’te gwɔ́ mbwo yé gẅie aa tàa tÿǒ lepwó.
en: saying, Blessedbethe King that cometh in the name of the Lord: peace in heaven, and glory in the highest.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ pà*farisay pie é laa yɔ́b jʉ’ó, fóo nùɔ lá’, ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Tsítsà, gÿo*ngàŋa kwò ɔ́ láŋte!
en: And some of the Pharisees from among the multitude said unto him, Master, rebuke thy disciples.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gʉa tà ne ńkúu Yerósalem, ńdíe tÿǒsoŋ ńzye lélʉa,
en: And when he was come near, he beheld the city, and wept over it,

ngiemboon: Yěsô fóo jʉ’ó, ńgʉa tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, ńzye létág pàsẅiŋ shúm,
en: And he went into the temple, and began to cast out them that sold therein, and them that bought;

ngiemboon: Tá fá’ shÿó kékáŋ, mélà’mie alá’ ntsèm la ne ńtéŋe letwoŋó tɛ’ ńzẅí’te nò gie Yěsô gɔɔn.
en: and could not find what they might do: for all the people were very attentive to hear him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn, mèŋ, n ge zɛ́te gẅi tà’a nò. Pi shwóŋó wɔ̀ɔn:
en: And he answered and said unto them,I will also ask you one thing; and answer me:

ngiemboon: Awɔ̌ la túmo Jâŋ Mbabtis? E Ssé kà pɔ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ?
en: The baptism of John, was it from heaven, or of men?

ngiemboon: Ńkwaŋ pá’ɔɔn, ńcʉ́’ ńtsɔ́’ pɔ́ ngie pɔ́ kaa zsé.
en: And they answered, that they could not tell whenceit was.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn yé né pɔ́b ngie: Mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn, n tè shwóŋó gẅi nyìŋ gẅie n dɔgɔ lezíŋ sé ńgÿo mɔɔn menò wɔ́.
en: And Jesus said unto them,Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ńtúmo wetsɔ̌, pɔ́ gíŋe wéwɛ̌ ńcúa, ńzoonte yé, ńjwoŋo yé á piŋ mbwo mesẅɛ̀ɛ.
en: And again he sent another servant: and they beat him also, and entreatedhimshamefully, and senthimaway empty.

ngiemboon: Angàŋ nká’ gíŋe ńtúmo mbɔ́ɔntè yétá, pɔ́ gíŋe ńnéŋ mefʉ̌ŋ ná wéwɛ̌, ńjwoŋo yé.
en: And again he sent a third: and they wounded him also, and casthimout.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńzɛ́te ngie, pi gyǎ gí ngie ngàŋ nká’ ge tó gÿo lêkɔ́ ná pɔ́b?
en: So they cast him out of the vineyard, and killedhim. What therefore shall the lord of the vineyard do unto them?

ngiemboon: Tóon ŋwɛ́ aa gẅie mbɔɔ wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ lɔɔn ńgwe mǒ, mbà ngàŋ ge pwɔ́’te. Á píŋ ńgwe ná nyìŋ, mbà à ge pú gwɔ’ɔ ngàŋ.
en: Whosoever shall fall upon that stone shall be broken; but on whomsoever it shall fall, it will grind him to powder.

ngiemboon: Shwóŋo wég:*Lepʉ̌ ségè ée pé’e ńzẅíŋ ngie pege má’ ncùb Kása pà*Roma kà ngǎŋ?
en: Is it lawful for us to give tribute unto Cæsar, or no?

ngiemboon: Yěsô zsé ngie pɔ́ zẅí’i pɔ́ ncwò we, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie:
en: But he perceived their craftiness, and said unto them,Why tempt ye me?

ngiemboon: Yěsô lêen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pú’u, pi náa mmó gie áa ye Kása mbwo Kása, ńnáa ye Ssé mbwo Ssé.
en: And he said unto them,Render therefore unto Cæsar the things which be Cæsar's, and unto God the things which be God's.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ pá’ à tsɔ̌’ pú’u, á kʉ’ʉ wɔ́b, pɔ́ té gyá tsɔ́*lɔ̌’ nà shwóŋó gie à gɔ̌ɔn mbwo lá’ gwɔ́, ńdáŋte.
en: And they could not take hold of his words before the people: and they marvelled at his answer, and held their peace.

ngiemboon: Shwóŋo wég: Etsɔ́ mefɛ́ laa wó, ńgwɔ́ mbàŋa sɔɔn mbʉ́a, ndùŋ mvfò zɔ́’, ńgÿo ńkwé té cʉa mmó.
en: There were therefore seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and died without children.

ngiemboon: Mbɔ́ɔntè sɔgɔ mpfɔ́g, ńgíŋe ńkwé yé té cʉa mmó.
en: And the second took her to wife, and he died childless.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa zsote manzwě kwé yé.
en: Last of all the woman died also.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pɔ́b sɔɔn mbʉ́a la pú ńzɔ́’ɔ manzwě wɔɔn lɔɔn, mé ge lá’ zíme nà legwé, à gwɔ́ we wɔ̌ fʉ̀’ó?
en: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them is she? for seven had her to wife.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Áa nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbàŋa lâ pànzwě ne ńzɔ́’ɔ.
en: And Jesus answering said unto them,The children of this world marry, and are given in marriage:

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ pú’u, tsɔ́*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê tóontè ńgɔɔn ngie: Tsítsà ɔ̀ tsɔ̌’ kwà’ mboŋó.
en: Then certain of the scribes answering said, Master, thou hast well said.

ngiemboon: Á fo fʉ̀’ó nyìŋ tè gíŋe ńgẅiin shÿɔ́g légíŋe ńzɛ́te yé tsɔ́ nò wɔ́.
en: And after that they durst not ask him anyquestion at all.

ngiemboon: Tóo ńnéŋe nà gwoŋó pwó yɔ́ɔn ye tʉ̀,
en: Sit thou on my right hand,

ngiemboon: ńzẅí’te mèŋ n dɔg megàŋ mbù pú, ńgÿo ntÿɔgɔ́ mekwò mú
en: Till I make thine enemies thy footstool.

ngiemboon: Tà fùɔ Ndavíd tóŋo yé le we Ndè pá’ɔɔn,*Nzà’nkÿo piŋ ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ nà ngẅɛ̀ ye lêkɔ́?
en: David therefore calleth him Lord, how is he then his son?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńtsẅe ńně náa ntÿɔgɔ́ mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé, alá’ ntsèm gie á laa jʉ’ó ne ńjú’u. Á gɔɔn ngie:
en: Then in the audience of all the people he said unto his disciples,

ngiemboon: Ńgyá tsɔ̌ mpfɔ́g manzwě, ńgwɔ́ mbóŋ tó yé, ńnéŋ pà tà’ ndólà mépʉ́a pie é té tsɔ́ mmó ku’.
en: And he saw also a certain poor widow casting in thither two mites.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, àmpfɔ̌g manzwě wɔɔn, ńgwɔ́ mbóŋ, něŋ nkáb, ńcʉa pʉ̀a metsèm.
en: And he said,Of a truth I say unto you, that this poor widow hath cast in more than they all:

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Alá’ ge lá’ lu ssé lÿɔ́’ɔ yetsɔ́, afùɔ túm lu ssé ńdÿɔ́’ɔ wetsɔ̌.
en: Then said he unto them,Nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom:

ngiemboon: Tá à leen ńké ńcʉa pú’u, ńdɔg náa gẅi shÿó léshwóŋó nyìŋ gẅie mèŋ n gee wɛ̌.
en: And it shall turn to you for a testimony.

ngiemboon: Tà pi tʉ́ njÿó ḿmÿɔg ngie pi ge lá’ kúu jʉ’ʉ ntsàŋ é zoŋo twó gí lêkɔ́ wɔ́?
en: Settleittherefore in your hearts, not to meditate before what ye shall answer:

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a metsèm ge lá’ pú pʉ̀a gẅi mélà’ mɔ́ɔn.
en: And ye shall be hated of allmenfor my name's sake.

ngiemboon: Tá’, tsɔ̌ tà’ noŋ ké letsɔ́’ɔ twó pi tà ḿbyé wɔ́.
en: But there shall not an hair of your head perish.

ngiemboon: Pi shÿɔg shÿɔg, ńgÿo ńgẅiin légwɔ́ tèmì.
en: In your patience possess ye your souls.

ngiemboon: Pi gÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ńgyá pà lÿɔ́’ ncù tó ńzéme Yerósalem tà ḿbume, pi zsé ngie fʉ̀’ gie mé ge tágte tÿǒsoŋ ne ńku’u.
en: And when ye shall see Jerusalem compassed with armies, then know that the desolation thereof is nigh.

ngiemboon: À lɔgɔ pú’u, ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ gie Ssé ńnéŋe ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ twó pʉ̀a Yerósalem. Menò mie mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé lɔgɔ ḿbumte.
en: For these be the days of vengeance, that all things which are written may be fulfilled.

ngiemboon: Mé leen ńké ńgyá*Míŋ Nyìŋ gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ melɔ́ɔn ńne ńtóo, ńgẅiin shʉ́shÿɔ́g mbɔɔ máamáa metʉ̀.
en: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pu’u, ésag ngie: Pi líe tÿǒ tsɔ̀ɔn nzsó pâ metsɔ́ metÿǒ tá ńgyá,
en: And he spake to them a parable;Behold the fig tree, and all the trees;

ngiemboon: é gwɔ́ tà ńzye létáb, pi zsé ngie afʉ̀’e lùm ne ńtóo.
en: when they now shoot forth, ye see and know of your own selves that summer is now nigh at hand.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi, kwà’ nénʉ́, pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó fʉ̀’ɔɔn té nge lá’ kwéte tà mag té gwɔ́ gie mɔɔn menò tsèm tǒ wɔ́.
en: Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass away, till all be fulfilled.

ngiemboon: Lefaŋ pɔ́ tsetsá’ ge gÿo mag, tá shwóŋó yɔ́ɔn lá’ le pyé.
en: Heaven and earth shall pass away: but my words shall not pass away.

ngiemboon: á gwɔ́ mbwo pi pá’ lejÿɔ’ la. Pi zsé ngie menò yɛ̌ lyɛ̌’ ge lá’ vege vege gwoon pʉ̀a metsèm ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ ntsèm.
en: For as a snare shall it come on all them that dwell on the face of the whole earth.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gwaa ye e lʉa lʉ̌a, alá’ ntsèm mʉ́ mbà’a mbà’, ńtóo tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, á lejʉ̌ŋ Yěsô lé jú’u shwóŋò yé.
en: And all the people came early in the morning to him in the temple, for to hear him.

ngiemboon: *Metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ*pàkyàgte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê ne fa’a shÿó légÿo mé zẅé Yěsô, tá ne ḿbɔ́gɔ nÿɔ́g lá’.
en: And the chief priests and scribes sought how they might kill him; for they feared the people.

ngiemboon: Sátà kúu tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m Jẅidas, á gwɔ́ tsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ ná pʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém, gẅie setsɔ́ lezíŋ sé laa le Iskariod.
en: Then entered Satan into Judas surnamed Iscariot, being of the number of the twelve.

ngiemboon: Á pú ḿboŋo wɔ́b, tà pɔ́ zẅíŋ ngie pɔ́ ge ná nkáb mbwo ye.
en: And they were glad, and covenanted to give him money.

ngiemboon: Á zẅíŋ, ńgwóon ńzye léfa’ shÿó pá’ à ge sẅiŋe Yěsô mbwo pɔ́b tà lá’ le zsé.
en: And he promised, and sought opportunity to betray him unto them in the absence of the multitude.

ngiemboon: Alyɛ’ɛ́*Páskà ŋwɛ́ leen ńké ńtó, ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ gie mé lɔ́ɔn ńgwaa púɔ*njʉ̀njÿò línɔ́ɔn.
en: Then came the day of unleavened bread, when the passover must be killed.

ngiemboon: Yěsô túmo Piɛ pɔ́ Jâŋ, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gʉa ńcwoŋte ségè shúm*Páskà.
en: And he sent Peter and John, saying,Go and prepare us the passover, that we may eat.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ kwǒŋ ngie: Peg gʉa nzɔ̌ ńcwoŋte?
en: And they said unto him, Where wilt thou that we prepare?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa ńkúu wó, ńgyá akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ Yěsô shwóŋó wɔ́b. Pɔ́ cwoŋte shúm léjÿó*Páskà jʉ’ó.
en: And they went, and found as he had said unto them: and they made ready the passover.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ gÿo ńku’, Yěsô pâ ngàŋ ntúm wé tó ńnéŋe ssé,
en: And when the hour was come, he sat down, and the twelve apostles with him.

ngiemboon: ńně ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó, á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: N ka kě ńtsɔ́ɔn tɛ’ pá’ pege ge pú jÿó wɔɔn*Páskà tá mèŋ n gyá ngɔ́’.
en: And he said unto them,With desire I have desired to eat this passover with you before I suffer:

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie mèŋ, n tě ńdá’a ńgíŋe ńnúu melù’ wɔ́ tà lá’ kú fʉ̀’ gie Ssé zɔ cʉ’ʉ́ sá’a njÿó.
en: for I say unto you, I will not drink of the fruit of the vine, until the kingdom of God shall come.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n kě ńgɔɔn pá’ɔɔn nyìŋ gẅie à ge sẅǐŋ mèŋ gwɔ́ jʉ́’ɔɔn tà peg yé ne ńteme ńjÿó mmó.
en: But, behold, the hand of him that betrayeth meiswith me on the table.

ngiemboon: Áa nò ngie*Míŋ Nyìŋ ge kwé pá’ Ssé la lá’ ńzáb, tá’ ndòon ee twó nyìŋ gẅie à ge tsege yé ná mé zẅé yé.
en: And truly the Son of man goeth, as it was determined: but woe unto that man by whom he is betrayed!

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ pú’u, ḿbú ḿmɔɔn, ésele ńzɛ́te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Awɔ̌ aa pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nùɔ pɔ́b ńku’u léfʉ’ yɔɔn ntí nò wɔ́?
en: And they began to enquire among themselves, which of them it was that should do this thing.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gÿo ńzye lézoŋo nò, éfa’a nyìŋ gẅie aa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ńgwɔ́ ndÿò.
en: And there was also a strife among them, which of them should be accounted the greatest.

ngiemboon: Pi pɔɔn zɔ kà ńnéŋe lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ nà fʉ̀’ʉ ngɔ́’ yɔ́ɔn.
en: Ye are they which have continued with me in my temptations.

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ tá, ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ Tá wɔ̀ɔn léen ńná lefùɔ né mèŋ la, n ge lá’ ná sí lefùɔ.
en: And I appoint unto you a kingdom, as my Father hath appointed unto me;

ngiemboon: Yěsô piŋ ńgɔɔn mbwo Piɛ ngie: Símo, Símo, Sátà ně ńdá’ ńdúɔ léta’a gẅi métsèm ńtyɛ́te, pá’ mé tá’a mekú ńtyɛ́te la.
en: And the Lord said,Simon, Simon, behold, Satan hath desiredto haveyou, that he may siftyouas wheat:

ngiemboon: Piɛ gɔɔn ngie: Andè, á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lekǔ tsǎŋ, mbà aa pɔgɔ, ńtó fó ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ legwé, mbà aa pɔgɔ.
en: And he said unto him, Lord, I am ready to go with thee, both into prison, and to death.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé gɔɔn mbwo yé ngie: Andè, menně ncù mɔɔn ssé mémbʉ́a. Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: Pi nyé pɛ́’ɛ.
en: And they said, Lord, behold, herearetwo swords. And he said unto them,It is enough.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la gɔɔn pú’u, ńkẅɛ, pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gʉa ne ndùm lekwɔ’ɔ́ metÿǒ mèvɛ olive, pá’ à laa mà mbwo ye.
en: And he came out, and went, as he was wont, to the mount of Olives; and his disciples also followed him.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la gʉa tà ńkúu wó, á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi sẅíŋte Ssé ḿbɔ́g menò njÿó lé kwa’te gẅi pi fʉa nò,
en: And when he was at the place, he said unto them,Pray that ye enter not into temptation.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńnyé wɔ́b ńgíŋ ńtyé lema’á tóon, ésẅɛ́’ ńkẅí’te ssé, ńně sẅíŋte Ssé ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: And he was withdrawn from them about a stone's cast, and kneeled down, and prayed,

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, tà’*cÿɔ́’ Ssé tó ńne ńtóonte yé
en: And there appeared an angel unto him from heaven, strengthening him.

ngiemboon: Esẅíŋte Ssé tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, ḿbʉ́’ʉ nnɛ́, ḿbiŋ nê lejʉ́ŋ*ngàŋa kwò yé, ńgwɔ tó, mbà pɔ́ mÿɔ̌g tà ńkʉ́a ńdyéte.
en: And when he rose up from prayer, and was come to his disciples, he found them sleeping for sorrow,

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn ngie: Pi ńnéŋe té lyé, ḿbɔ́g menò njÿó lékwa’te gẅi pi fʉa nò.
en: and said unto them,Why sleep ye? rise and pray, lest ye enter into temptation.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Jẅidas, ɔ̀ ge lɔg pɔ́ tsyɛ̀’te tá tsege*Míŋ Nyìŋ ka?
en: But Jesus said unto him,Judas, betrayest thou the Son of man with a kiss?

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gie é laa lejʉ́ŋ yé gyá mmó gie á gee ncʉ̌a, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Andè, peg lɔg menně ńdÿɔ́’ɔ?
en: When they which were about him saw what would follow, they said unto him, Lord, shall we smite with the sword?

ngiemboon: Tsɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔb gwoon soŋ nně lélɔg ńkɔ́’ɔ ngàŋa fà’*tándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’, é kẅɛ́te letuŋó sé se gwoŋó pwó tʉ̀, ńjúɔ.
en: And one of them smote the servant of the high priest, and cut off his right ear.

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô kaga yé ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi tsẅé jʉ’, á kǔ’ pɛ́’ɛ, ńdeen ńzába pwó yé nà letuŋó, á sẅéte.
en: And Jesus answered and said,Suffer ye thus far.And he touched his ear, and healed him.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwoon yé ńdɔg ńgʉa lê mbʉ̀a*tándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’, Piɛ zse nzèm yɔb, tá ńké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a.
en: Then took they him, and ledhim, and brought him into the high priest's house. And Peter followed afar off.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kúu wó, mé nyɛte mmɔ̌g soŋ tetʉ́a ńně ńzɔ́gɔ. Piɛ tó yé ńnéŋe nùɔ pɔ́b.
en: And when they had kindled a fire in the midst of the hall, and were set down together, Peter sat down among them.

ngiemboon: Piɛ lʉ’, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Manzwě wɛ, mèŋ n tè ne ńzsé yé wɔ́!
en: And he denied him, saying, Woman, I know him not.

ngiemboon: Piɛ tsɔ́’ ngie: Ambàŋa wa! Mèŋ n kaa zsé nò gie ɔɔ pɛ́’ɛ ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn wɔ́. Piɛ nyé ńgɔɔn gɔɔn, mênkɔ́’ gwóon ńtóŋ.
en: And Peter said, Man, I know not what thou sayest. And immediately, while he yet spake, the cock crew.

ngiemboon: Piɛ fóo tetʉ́a ńkẅɛ, ḿbú ńdʉa tɛ’.
en: And Peter went out, and wept bitterly.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la kú’te Yěsô la ne ńcúa yé, ńně ńzoonte yé.
en: And the men that held Jesus mocked him, and smotehim.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ laa pú’u, ńgíŋ ně ńkẅi’i ńnege yé.
en: And many other things blasphemously spake they against him.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́*Nzà’nkÿo, ɔ̀ shwóŋó wég. Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi pi é le zẅíŋ,
en: Art thou the Christ? tell us. And he said unto them,If I tell you, ye will not believe:

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ńzɛ́te gẅi nò, pi é le tsɔ́’.
en: and if I also askyou, ye will not answer me, nor letmego.

ngiemboon: Tà mbɔɔ pú’u, áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, mbà á kǔ’ pá’ Ssé ngàŋ metʉ̀ ntsèm ge ńnéŋe*Míŋ Nyìŋ nà gwoŋó pwó yé ye tʉ̀.
en: Hereafter shall the Son of man sit on the right hand of the power of God.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ metsèm la jú’ ńdeen ńgɔɔn ngie: Ɔ̀ lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ Míŋ Ssé wɔ́? Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Á kẅɛ̌ ncwò pi, mèŋ n ge wɛ̌.
en: Then said they all, Art thou then the Son of God? And he said unto them,Ye say that I am.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋa cú’tè gɔɔn pú’u, ńdu ssé métsèm, ńdɔgɔ Yěsô ńgʉa nê mvfò*Pilato.
en: And the whole multitude of them arose, and led him unto Pilate.

ngiemboon: *Pilato zɛ́te Yěsô ngie: Ɔɔ fùɔ pà Yuda la? Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Ɔ̀ gɔ̌ɔn pú’u.
en: And Pilate asked him, saying, Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answered him and said,Thou sayestit.

ngiemboon: *Pilato jú’ pú’u, ńzɛ́te ngie: Aa nyìŋ Galilea wá?
en: When Pilate heard of Galilee, he asked whether the man were a Galilæan.

ngiemboon: Ńzɛ́te yé menò tà é gyɔ́ɔn tɛ’, à tè tsɔ́ tsɔ́’.
en: Then he questioned with him in many words; but he answered him nothing.

ngiemboon: *Metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’ pâ*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê gwɔ́ jʉ’ó, ḿbú ne ńzába menò twó Yěsô tɛ’.
en: And the chief priests and scribes stood and vehemently accused him.

ngiemboon: Á la gwaa gwɔ́*Pilato pɔ́*Herôd gwɔ́ lê mbù, ḿbiŋ fó lyɛ̌’ó pɔ́ cʉ́’ mesǒ.
en: And the same day Pilate and Herod were made friends together: for before they were at enmity between themselves.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔgɔ yé ńkúu wó,*Pilato tóŋ*metándá pànùŋe pwɔ́’, mbɔɔ pàsá’a lá’ lâ lá’,
en: And Pilate, when he had called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people,
I will therefore chastise him, and releasehim.

ngiemboon: Á lɔ́ɔn ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’e línɔ́ɔn*Páskà,*Pilato gẅiin lékẅile tà’ ngàŋa tsǎŋ ńnáa mbwo lá’].
en: (For of necessity he must release one unto them at the feast.)

ngiemboon: Tá, alá’ zye lézẅɛɛ shwǒŋ ngie: Gÿo mé zẅé nyìŋ wɛ, ɔ̀ nyé Panepâse né peg.
en: And they cried out all at once, saying, Away with thisman, and release unto us Barabbas:

ngiemboon: Panepâse ŋwɛ́ laa tsǎŋ ńtí và’ gie à la ma’a tÿǒsoŋ, ḿbiŋ ńgíŋ ńtí pá’ à la zẅé nyìŋ.
en: (who for a certain sedition made in the city, and for murder, was cast into prison.)

ngiemboon: *Pilato ne fa’a lékyɛɛ Yěsô ńnyé, tá á cʉa pú’u, á gíŋe ńgɔɔn nò mbwo lá’ gɔɔn.
en: Pilate therefore, willing to release Jesus, spake again to them.

ngiemboon: Tá lá’ ntsèm ké ne ńkẅi’i ḿbége pɔ́ shwǒŋ ńgɔɔn ngie: Kime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ, ké ńkime yé pɔ́ nà tÿǒ nkǐ.
en: But they cried, saying, Crucifyhim, crucify him.

ngiemboon: Á zá’ ntsàŋ pá’ lá’ ne ńkwoŋo.
en: And Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they required.

ngiemboon: Alá’ laa nzèm tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, pànzwě gwɔ́ nùɔ ńdʉa ńtʉ́ʉ ngɔ́’ Yěsô.
en: And there followed him a great company of people, and of women, which also bewailed and lamented him.

ngiemboon: Á ge lá’ gwɔ́ gwɔ́ tà pʉ̀a tsẅi né mekwɛ́ ngie: Pi kwɔgɔ sẅɛ́ɛ wég, é tsẅi né mekwɔ’ɔ́ ngie: Pi sẅɛ́’ ḿbwoon wég.
en: Then shall they begin to say to the mountains, Fall on us; and to the hills, Cover us.

ngiemboon: Mé la gwaa lɔgɔ Yěsô gʉa, ḿbéle metsǒŋ mépʉ́a ná ye, pá’ mé ge pú zẅé wɔ́b apɔ̌.
en: And there were also two other, malefactors, led with him to be put to death.

ngiemboon: Pàlÿɔ́’ ncù lá ne ńgíŋe ńyime yé yɔ́b, ésẅɛ’te nnɛ́ ńtóo lejʉ́ŋ yé, ńnáa kikíi melù’ né yé.
en: And the soldiers also mocked him, coming to him, and offering him vinegar,

ngiemboon: Ńně ńgɔɔn ngie: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ kwà’ fùɔ pà Yuda, ɔ̀ kẅé twó ɔ̀ mbwo legwé.
en: and saying, If thou be the king of the Jews, save thyself.

ngiemboon: Pɔgɔ kwé menò mɔ́gɔ. Tá ńgʉa ná yé, mbà à kaa tsɔ́ nò fʉa.
en: And we indeed justly; for we receive the due reward of our deeds: but this man hath done nothing amiss.

ngiemboon: Á kaga yé pú’u, ḿbiŋ sẅíŋte Yěsô ngie: Yěsô, ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńdá’ ńtóo nà lefùɔ shú, ɔ̀ pɔ́ɔn lélege wɔ̀ɔn.
en: And he said unto Jesus, Lord, remember me when thou comest into thy kingdom.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Mèŋ shwóŋó gú, áa kwà’ nénʉ́, ngie, pé lyɛ̌’ɔɔn pɔgɔ ge gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ lekág mvfò Ssé.
en: And Jesus said unto him,Verily I say unto thee, To day shalt thou be with me in paradise.

ngiemboon: Tsɛ̀ɛ zsǒ gÿo ńku’, nèm pyé, nzěm pú síŋe tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ ntsèm tà ńkúu ná nèm tá mbÿɛ njÿó.
en: And it was about the sixth hour, and there was a darkness over all the earth until the ninth hour.

ngiemboon: Nzsǒ gie mé la lɔg ńkʉŋe jʉ’ gie*pànùŋe pwɔ́’ tyé wɔ́ ndá Ssé, éshʉa tsetsɛ̀ɛ, éfó tÿǒ ńkúu ssé.
en: And the sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was rent in the midst.

ngiemboon: Ngwòŋ mesǒ Yěsô, tà mbɔɔ pànzwě pie pɔ́ la fó Galilea ńcʉ́me nzèm yé la tyé pɔ́ tàa nzèm tá ńgyá mɔɔn menò.
en: And all his acquaintance, and the women that followed him from Galilee, stood afar off, beholding these things.

ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̂b ŋwɛ́ gʉa ńgyá*Pilato, ńdúɔ pfó Yěsô mbwo yé, á zẅíŋ.
en: Thismanwent unto Pilate, and begged the body of Jesus.

ngiemboon: À lɔ̌ɔn ńnéŋe pú’u mbÿɛ̀ njÿó Faladé, mé ne ńtaŋte nnɛ́ pá’ lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè yɔ́b ne ńgee nzyě.
en: And that day was the preparation, and the sabbath drew on.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa tà ńkúu wó, ńgyá, mbà mé kà fó ncwò lesyè, ńtsó máamáa tóon gẅie à kaa wó.
en: And they found the stone rolled away from the sepulchre.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zyɛ́’ ńkúu tsòló, ńké tè pfó Ndè Yěsô gyá.
en: And they entered in, and found not the body of the Lord Jesus.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la tyé ńdíe jʉ’ é ne ńkʉ́’ʉ wɔ́b, pɔ́ gwoon ńgyá pʉ̀a mépʉ́a kẅɛ, ḿma’ menzsǒ é fɔ́g tà ńŋwʉŋe.
en: And it came to pass, as they were much perplexed thereabout, behold, two men stood by them in shining garments:

ngiemboon: À cʉ’ʉ́ jʉ’ɔɔn wɔ́, à zimé nà legwé. Pi zɔɔn ńkímte nò gie à la ne ńgɔɔn mbwo pi fʉ̀’ gie pi lâ pɔ́ la nyé Galilea.
en: He is not here, but is risen: remember how he spake unto you when he was yet in Galilee,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ pú’u, ńdeen ńké ńkímte ngie, ée menò mie Yěsô la zɔɔn shwóŋó wɔ́b,
en: And they remembered his words,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ é gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ njÿòon la, pɔ́ té zẅíŋ.
en: And their words seemed to them as idle tales, and they believed them not.

ngiemboon: Ńgiŋe shwóŋe nà menò ntsèm mie é ka pǔ ńcʉa.
en: And they talked together of all these things which had happened.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’e pɔ́ la ne shwóŋe, ńně ńzoŋo la, Yěsô lê twó yé kẅɛ́te wɔ́b mánzsè, pâ pɔ̌ ne ńgiŋe.
en: And it came to pass, that, while they communedtogetherand reasoned, Jesus himself drew near, and went with them.

ngiemboon: Tá’, atsɔ́ mmó táte, pɔ́ té yé liŋ.
en: But their eyes were holden that they should not know him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi sěen ńgiŋe ńzoŋo pɔ́ kɔ́ pɛ́’ɛ̀? Pɔ́ jú’ ńtyé, ḿma’ mezìŋe, éshʉ́ŋe twó.
en: And he said unto them,What manner of communicationsarethese that ye have one to another, as ye walk, and are sad?

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi gwě gígyé. Pi tè ne ńdwo ńzẅíŋe menò ntsèm mie*pàntsẅi nkʉ̀ Ssé la ŋwé’e wɔ́.
en: Then he said unto them,O fools, and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken:

ngiemboon: Pi kaa zsé ngie, á ka ne ńzɛ́te ngie*Nzà’nkÿo vɔg ńgyá ngɔ́’ tá ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ legú’ we wɔ́ ka?
en: ought not Christ to have suffered these things, and to enter into his glory?

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ̌ gʉa tà ne ńkúu lá’ gie pɔ́ mépʉ́a lɔ́ɔn ńgee wo. Pɔ́ gyá á fa’a pɔ́ pá’ à giŋé ńge giŋ tà ngʉ̀a sag.
en: And they drew nigh unto the village, whither they went: and he made as though he would have gone further.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ʉ léjÿó shúm gÿo ńku’, pɔ́ ńnéŋe ssé, á pí mbelég, ńná ndǎg mbwo Ssé, ḿbwɔ́’te ńná né pɔ́b.
en: And it came to pass, as he sat at meat with them, he took bread, and blessedit, and brake, and gave to them.

ngiemboon: Tá menÿɔ́g mɔ́b leen ńké ńnyɛ́’ɛ pɔ́ liŋe yé, á gwoon ḿbyé.
en: And their eyes were opened, and they knew him; and he vanished out of their sight.

ngiemboon: Ńkẅɛ́te wɔ́b pú’u, pɔ́ shwóŋó wɔ́b ngie: Áa nénʉ́ ngie Ndè zimé nà legwé, Símo ně ńgyá yé.
en: saying, The Lord is risen indeed, and hath appeared to Simon.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gíŋe ḿbíte yɔ́b mmó gie pɔ́ ně ńtóo mánzsè ńgyá, ńgie pɔ́ ně ńgwaa liŋe yé, mbà à pǐ mbelég tà ne ńgaba.
en: And they told what thingswere donein the way, and how he was known of them in breaking of bread.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ nyé shwóŋó shwoŋó, Yěsô gwóon ńkẅɛɛ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ńtsyɛ’te wɔ́b ngie: Mbʉ́lè gwɔ́ ne pi!
en: And as they thus spake, Jesus himself stood in the midst of them, and saith unto them,Peacebeunto you.

ngiemboon: Aléme yɔ́b tsɔ́’ɔ. Pɔ́ cÿɔ’, ńzɔɔn ne ńkwaŋa pɔ́ ngie áa gegÿɛ́ nyìŋ.
en: But they were terrified and affrighted, and supposed that they had seen a spirit.

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Aléme gí séen ńtsɔ́’ɔ tsɔ’ɔ́ mélà’a kɔ? Pi mʉ’te mʉ’té mélà’a kɔ́?
en: And he said unto them,Why are ye troubled? and why do thoughts arise in your hearts?

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gɔɔn ńne nyɛɛ wɔ́b mbwó mé lâ mekwò mé.
en: And when he had thus spoken, he shewed themhishands andhisfeet.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ fa’a kème ssó ye ntuɔ ńná né yé.
en: And they gave him a piece of a broiled fish, and of an honeycomb.

ngiemboon: Á kẅé, ńtyé pɔ́ mvfò pɔ́b ḿpfɛ́.
en: And he tookit, and did eat before them.

ngiemboon: Ńdeen ńké ńtsɔ́’ legyè sɔ́b, ńgÿo pɔ́ jú’ menò mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé.
en: Then opened he their understanding, that they might understand the scriptures,

ngiemboon: Pi pɛ zɔ ké ńgwɔ́ pànjÿò ńgyá, á lélɔg menò ŋwɛ́ saa lá’.
en: And ye are witnesses of these things.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn pú’u, ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńkẅɛ, ńgʉa tà ńcʉ́’ʉ lékúu Mbetáni, ńka’ mbwó ńnáa tÿǒ, ńnéŋ mbʉ́lè ná pɔ́b.
en: And he led them out as far as to Bethany, and he lifted up his hands, and blessed them.

ngiemboon: Á ne ńnéŋe mbʉ́lè ná pɔ́b pú’u, ńně ńkwɔ́’ɔ ńgee nê tÿǒ lepwó.
en: And it came to pass, while he blessed them, he was parted from them, and carried up into heaven.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ cʉ́’ ńtyé jʉ’ó ńně ńgu’te yé, tà á ku’, pɔ́ lɔgɔ lekág ḿbiŋ nzèm ne Yerósalem.
en: And they worshipped him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy:

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa tà ńkúu wó, ńké ńcʉ́’ ńnéŋe pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé fʉ̀’ ntsèm, ńgu’te Ssé.
en: and were continually in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.

ngiemboon: Njÿó la gwɔ́ zyète, ashwóŋè gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, yé shwóŋè pɔ́ Ssé laa wó. Á piŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ Ssé.
en: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.

ngiemboon: Yé shwóŋè pɔ́ Ssé gwɔ́ tà fó pɔ́ nzyeté.
en: The same was in the beginning with God.

ngiemboon: Akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gwaa gwɔ́ wó, ńcʉa pɔ́ ná yé. Atsɔ́ mǒ té gwɔ́ wó té gwɔ́ gie á cʉ̌a pɔ́ ná yé wɔ́.
en: All things were made by him; and without him was not any thing made that was made.

ngiemboon: Legwɔ́ à laa ná yé, le gwɔ́ ŋwɛ́ á gwɔ́ kyɛ̀’ gie á kyɛ’ɛ pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: In him was life; and the life was the light of men.

ngiemboon: Akyɛ̀’ ne ńkyɛ’ɛ nzěm, nzěm ké tè kúbe.
en: And the light shineth in darkness; and the darkness comprehended it not.

ngiemboon: E Ssé gÿo ńtúmo tsɔ̌ nyìŋ, lezíŋ se gwɔ́ lé Jâŋ.
en: There was a man sent from God, whose namewasJohn.

ngiemboon: Á tó ńgwɔ́ njÿò ńgyá, á léshwóŋó mmó gie à zsě ńtí kyɛ̀’ ŋwɛ́, légwɔ́ gie wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ge záb ntʉ́m we ná kyɛ̀’ ŋwɛ́.
en: The same came for a witness, to bear witness of the Light, that allmenthrough him might believe.

ngiemboon: À la tè kyɛ̀’ wɔ́, à la tó yé pɔ́ leshwóŋ pʉ̀a nò ná kyɛ̀’.
en: He was not that Light, butwas sentto bear witness of that Light.

ngiemboon: Yé shwóŋè ŋwɛ́ láa kwà’ kyɛ̀’ gie á tóo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó lékyɛ’ɛ mânyìŋ ntsèm.
en: Thatwas the true Light, which lighteth every man that cometh into the world.

ngiemboon: Ye shwóŋè laa tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó, tá pʉ̀a mesoŋ ké tè yé zsé. Mbà pɔ́ la ké ńcʉa pɔ́ ná yé tá ńgwɔ́ wó.
en: He was in the world, and the world was made by him, and the world knew him not.

ngiemboon: À la tóo kwà’ lá’ pɔ́b, epʉ̀a lá’ pé té yé kúe.
en: He came unto his own, and his own received him not.

ngiemboon: Tá’, etsɔ́ pʉ̀a kúe yé, ńzáb ntʉ́m ná yé, á leen ńké ńnáa wɔ́b tʉ̀ lécʉ́’ púɔ Ssé.
en: But as many as received him, to them gave he power to become the sons of God,evento them that believe on his name:

ngiemboon: Angàŋ keen ńtó, à lɔg pá’ à gẅiin poŋo ntʉ́m, ńcÿó gʉm yégè metsèm tɛ̀’, ńcÿó sele ńcÿó, mélà’mie à gẅiin nkwòŋe tɛ’.
en: And of his fulness have all we received, and grace for grace.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la cʉa ná Mǒsê, ńná*lepʉ̌, anò nénʉ́ pɔ́ nò lécÿó gʉm yégè piŋ ńcʉa pɔ́ nà Yěsô Kristo.
en: For the law was given by Moses,butgrace and truth came by Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ laa Ssé gyá, tà ndà’ Múɔ wémɔ’ɔ́ gẅie aa Ssé ńgwɔ́ léjʉ́ŋ Tá, à la gÿo mé zsé yé.
en: No man hath seen God at any time; the only begotten Son, which is in the bosom of the Father, he hath declaredhim.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ shʉ̀ashʉ̀a ńgɔɔn mbwo mânyìŋ ntsèm té mʉ́’te ngie: Mèŋ n tè*Nzà’nkÿo gẅie Ssé la ka’ wɔ́.
en: And he confessed, and denied not; but confessed, I am not the Christ.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie mé la túmo wɔ́b mbwo Jâŋ la, lâ pà*farisay.
en: And they which were sent were of the Pharisees.

ngiemboon: Ayé nò ge pɔ́ɔnte yɔ́ɔn, mèŋ fǒ tè kú’u léŋwé’e ssé ńkyɛ́’ nkÿo melɔ̌ɔn mé wɔ́.
en: he it is, who coming after me is preferred before me, whose shoe's latchet I am not worthy to unloose.

ngiemboon: Mé lɔ́ɔn ńzɛ́te yé mɔɔn menò pá’ɔɔn á Mbetáni, á nà yétsɔ́ nzǐŋ ntse Jurdeŋ á jʉ’ gie à lɔ̌ɔn ńnu’u pʉ̀a ntse wó.
en: These things were done in Bethabara beyond Jordan, where John was baptizing.
