ngiemboon: Jâŋ gíŋe ńgɔɔn tsɔ́ nò gie à zsé ná Yěsô, ńgie: Mèŋ n da gyá zẅìge Ssé sẅɛ́’ ńnéŋe ná yé, ńgwɔ́ pá’ Kàpʉ̀ŋ.
en: And John bare record, saying, I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove, and it abode upon him.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n da gyá, tà mèŋ n ne sá’a shwóŋó pʉ̀a ngie aa Míŋ Ssé.
en: And I saw, and bare record that this is the Son of God.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, Jâŋ pâ tsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò yé yépʉ́a nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ jʉ’ gie à kaa wó.
en: Again the next day after John stood, and two of his disciples;

ngiemboon: Á má’ lejÿɔ́g, ńgyá Yěsô pá’ à ne ńcʉa, ńgɔɔn ngie: Wɔɔn aa Mûɔ*Njʉ̀njÿò Ssé.
en: and looking upon Jesus as he walked, he saith, Behold the Lamb of God!

ngiemboon: Ngáŋa kwò Jâŋ yépʉ́a jú’u yɔ̀ɔn shwóŋè, ńcʉ́me nzèm Yěsô.
en: And the two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.

ngiemboon: Filib ŋwɛ́ laa nyìŋ Mbetsayida, á tÿǒsoŋo pà Ndeléya pɔ́ Piɛ.
en: Now Philip was of Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.

ngiemboon: Natanayɛl gɔɔn né yé ngie: Tà mé lǎ zɔɔn ńgyá mmó mbòŋo fó Nǎzarɛd? Filib tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Tóo, ɔ̀ ge gyá.
en: And Nathanael said unto him, Can there any good thing come out of Nazareth? Philip saith unto him, Come and see.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá pá’ Natanayɛl ne ńtóo, ńgɔɔn nò ná yé ngie: Wɔɔn aa kwà’ mûɔ Israel gẅie anò nkÿo nkÿo té ná yé wɔ́.
en: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him, and saith of him,Behold an Israelite indeed, in whom is no guile!

ngiemboon: Natanayɛl tsɔ́’ ngie: Rabbi, ɔ́ɔ Mìŋ Ssé, ɔ́ɔ fùɔ pà Israel.
en: Nathanael answered and saith unto him, Rabbi, thou art the Son of God; thou art the King of Israel.

ngiemboon: É cʉa lyɛ̌’ pʉ́a, atsɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ndá gwɔ́ tÿǒsoŋo Kána, á tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Galilea, má pà Yěsô gwɔ́ wó.
en: And the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee; and the mother of Jesus was there:

ngiemboon: Mé gíŋe ńtóŋo Yěsô yé pâ ngàŋa nkwò yé, á jʉ’ʉ lɔ́ɔn ndá ŋwɛ́.
en: and both Jesus was called, and his disciples, to the marriage.

ngiemboon: Melù’ gÿo ḿmag, má pà Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Epʉ̀a té gíŋe ńgẅiin melù’ mie pɔ́ ge nú wɔ́.
en: And when they wanted wine, the mother of Jesus saith unto him, They have no wine.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Má wɔ̀ɔn, ɔ̀ kẅé kɔ́ mbwo mèŋ? À yɔ́ɔn fʉ̀’ nyé tè ku’.
en: Jesus saith unto her,Woman, what have I to do with thee? mine hour is not yet come.

ngiemboon: Má we gʉa ńgɔɔn né pàlyè pʉ̀a ngie à lɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie pi gÿo pɔ́ kɔ́ wɔ́ pi gÿo.
en: His mother saith unto the servants, Whatsoever he saith unto you, doit.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pàlyè pʉ̀a ngie: Pi néŋ ntse tsɛ̀ɛ mekʉŋ ŋwɛ́ tà é lúe. Pɔ́ néŋ ntse tsoló tà é lúe.
en: Jesus saith unto them,Fill the waterpots with water.And they filled them up to the brim.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi kú tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn, ńgʉa ńnáa mbwo nyìŋ gẅie à táŋte línɔ́ɔn. Pɔ́ kú ńgʉa ná né yé.
en: And he saith unto them,Draw out now, and bear unto the governor of the feast.And they bareit.

ngiemboon: Alínɔ́ɔn*Páskà pà Yuda la ne ḿbɔ́ɔnte, Yěsô leen ńké ḿbʉ né Yerósalem,
en: And the Jews' passover was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn mbwo pàsẅìŋ mekàpʉ̀ŋ ngie: Pi lɔg shúm sɛ̂ éfó jʉ’ɔɔn ńgʉa! Pi pɔ́ɔn lélɔgɔ jʉ’ʉ Tá wɔ̀ɔn ńgÿo jʉ’ʉ metʉ̌a.
en: and said unto them that sold doves,Take these things hence; make not my Father's house an house of merchandise.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô leen ńké ńkímte jʉ’ʉ ŋwà’ne Ssé gie á gɔɔn ngie: «Mèŋ, n kwoŋo jʉ’ jú kwoŋ tà mèŋ n ge lá’ kwé pɔ́ mǒ».
en: And his disciples remembered that it was written, The zeal of thine house hath eaten me up.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Pi keme*jʉ’ʉ Ssé yɔɔn, mèŋ n dɔg lyɛ̌’ sétá, ḿbʉ’ʉ ńtÿɔ́g tÿɔ́g.
en: Jesus answered and said unto them,Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn,*jʉ’ʉ Ssé gie à kime é gwɔ́ pɔ́ mbùm ye.
en: But he spake of the temple of his body.

ngiemboon: Tá’ Yěsô tè gwá’ mbùm ye mbwo pɔ́b wɔ́, mélà’mie à né ńzsé pá’ pɔ́ gwɔ́ metsèm.
en: But Jesus did not commit himself unto them, because he knew allmen,

ngiemboon: À la tè ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie mé kyagte kyagte éshwóŋó yé wɔ́. Kwà’ yé lê twó yé à zsé mmó gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m nyìŋ mesoŋ.
en: and needed not that any should testify of man: for he knew what was in man.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́ pú’u, atsɔ̌ nkěm pà Yuda gwɔ́ nà nùɔ Pà*farisay, mé tóŋo yé le Nikodem.
en: There was a man of the Pharisees, named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ɔn lémɔɔn pá’ mèŋ n gɔ̌ɔn né gù ngie mé gẅiin légíŋe ńzyé gẅi tsɔ́ legʉ̀a.
en: Marvel not that I said unto thee, Ye must be born again.

ngiemboon: Nikodem leen ńké ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie, á gwaa gwɔ́ pú’u, ńcʉa lêkɔ́?
en: Nicodemus answered and said unto him, How can these things be?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ Israel ńgwɔ́ tà’ tsítsà tà mé zsé gú tɛ’, ɔ̀ piŋ tè yɔɔn nò zsé la?
en: Jesus answered and said unto him,Art thou a master of Israel, and knowest not these things?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ laa zɔɔn ńkwɔ́’ɔ tÿǒ lepwó wɔ́, ndà’*Míŋ Nyìŋ gẅie à la fó wó sẅɛ́’.
en: And no man hath ascended up to heaven, but he that came down from heaven,eventhe Son of man which is in heaven.

ngiemboon: À cʉa pú’u, nyìŋ gẅie à zǎb ntʉ́m wé ná yé, à gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì.
en: that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have eternal life.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò tɔ́g, Yěsô pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé gʉa ne tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Jẅidea, pâ pɔ̌ ná’a ńzye ńnéŋe, à ne ńnu’u pʉ́a ntse.
en: After these things came Jesus and his disciples into the land of Judæa; and there he tarried with them, and baptized.

ngiemboon: Á la gwaa gwɔ́, mé nyé té ńnéŋe Jâŋ ndá tsǎŋ.
en: For John was not yet cast into prison.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ pà Yuda pâ tsɔ̌ ngàŋa nkwò Jâŋ ńnéŋe tà ńzye lézoŋo nò ná nò lésɔgɔ pʉ̀ tá ńgu’te Ssé.
en: Then there arose a question betweensomeof John's disciples and the Jews about purifying.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: E Ssé gẅie aa tÿǒ lepwó zɔ náa fà’ ye wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ.
en: John answered and said, A man can receive nothing, except it be given him from heaven.

ngiemboon: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie yé nò gwaa kẅi’i gee mvfò, ayɔ́ɔn ne ḿbiŋe né nzèm.
en: He must increase, but Imustdecrease.

ngiemboon: À gɔɔn nò gie à zsé nà shúm sie à la gyá mbɔɔ sie à la jú’, tá nyìŋ tè zẅíŋ.
en: And what he hath seen and heard, that he testifieth; and no man receiveth his testimony.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à zẅíŋe nò gie à gɔɔn, lɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ ngie e Ssé ee nénʉ́ nà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ.
en: He that hath received his testimony hath set to his seal that God is true.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie e Ssé túmo yé, à gɔɔn menò mie é fóo mbwo Ssé, á nue e Ssé gÿo Zẅìge yé gwɔ́ pɔ́ ná yé fʉ̀’ ntsèm.
en: For he whom God hath sent speaketh the words of God: for God giveth not the Spirit by measureunto him.

ngiemboon: E Ssé Tá kwoŋo Míŋ we, mbà à léen ńnéŋ shúm ntsèm á nà lɔ̌ɔn pwó Míŋ we.
en: The Father loveth the Son, and hath given all things into his hand.

ngiemboon: Ńzɔɔn ńké ńgwaa gɔɔn pú’u, kwà’ Yěsô zɔ tě ńnu’u pʉ̀a ntse wɔ́,*ngàŋa kwò yé zɔ̌ ne ńnu’u wɔ́b.
en: (though Jesus himself baptized not, but his disciples,)

ngiemboon: Yěsô zsé ngie pà*farisay jǔ’, éfó tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Jẅidea ńcʉ́me mánzsè lépiŋe tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Galilea.
en: he left Judæa, and departed again into Galilee.

ngiemboon: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie à zyɛ́’ ye tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Samalîɛ.
en: And he must needs go through Samaria.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ manzwě we Samalîɛ tó létú’ ntse, Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Ná ntse mèŋ n nú.
en: There cometh a woman of Samaria to draw water: Jesus saith unto her,Give me to drink.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gʉ̌a tÿǒsoŋ léjú shúm léjÿó.
en: (For his disciples were gone away unto the city to buy meat.)

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Nyìŋ nú wɛ̂ mɛ́, agág yé ké ńgíŋe shÿó shÿó.
en: Jesus answered and said unto her,Whosoever drinketh of this water shall thirst again:

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Gʉa ńtóŋo ndǔm ɔ̀ pi yé tó.
en: Jesus saith unto her,Go, call thy husband, and come hither.

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Mèŋ n tè ndǔm gẅiin.
en: The woman answered and said, I have no husband. Jesus said unto her,Thou hast well said, I have no husband:

ngiemboon: Manzwě ŋwɛ́ leen ńké ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Andè, mèŋ n gyá ngie ɔɔ*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: The woman saith unto him, Sir, I perceive that thou art a prophet.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Mèŋ gẅie pɔgɔ shwóŋe lɔɔn, mèŋ n gee yé.
en: Jesus saith unto her,I that speak unto thee amhe.

ngiemboon: Manzwě ŋwɛ́ nyé tÿóon ntse yé jʉ’ó, ḿbiŋe tÿǒsoŋ, ńgɔɔn né lá’ ngie:
en: The woman then left her waterpot, and went her way into the city, and saith to the men,

ngiemboon: Pi tó ńgyá tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie à shwoŋó wɔ̀ɔn menò ntsèm mie n da gÿǒ. Tà à tè gwɔ́ pɔ́*Nzà’nkÿo wɔ́?
en: Come, see a man, which told me all things that ever I did: is not this the Christ?

ngiemboon: Alá’ fó tÿǒsoŋ ńkẅɛ, ńtó né lejʉ́ŋ Yěsô.
en: Then they went out of the city, and came unto him.

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ tó pú’u,*ngàŋa kwò yé ne ńtsíŋe yé ńgɔɔn ngie: Rabbi, pfɛ́ɛ mémmó la.
en: In the mean while his disciples prayed him, saying, Master, eat.

ngiemboon: Tá á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ n gẅiin tsɔ́ mmó léjÿó gie mèŋ n gee ńjÿó, á gwɔ́ gie pi tè ne ńzsé wɔ́.
en: But he said unto them,I have meat to eat that ye know not of.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé jú’ pú’u, ésele ńzɛ́te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: Tsɔ̌ nyìŋ cʉ̌’ ńdɔgɔ mmó léjÿó ńtó ná né yé keen?
en: Therefore said the disciples one to another, Hath any man brought himoughtto eat?

ngiemboon: Pú’u, esàga nò gie e gɔɔn ngie: Ambyè aa wó, andàga gwɔ́ wó lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ nénʉ́.
en: And herein is that saying true, One soweth, and another reapeth.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a gíŋ ńkẅi’i ńzáb ntʉ́m ná ye tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, ńtí shwóŋè yé.
en: And many more believed because of his own word;

ngiemboon: Elyɛ̌’ sépʉ́a sa gwɔ́ tà ńtɔ́g, Yěsô fó jʉ’ó, ńne ńgee tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Galilea.
en: Now after two days he departed thence, and went into Galilee.

ngiemboon: Mbà yé máŋwɛ́ la gɔɔn ngie: Mé té ná mekù’*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé lá’ pɔ́b wɔ́.
en: For Jesus himself testified, that a prophet hath no honour in his own country.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋa fà’ ngúmnɔɔn ŋwɛ́ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Tsétsɔ’, Andè, cwóŋo ńgyá míŋ wɔ̀ɔn tá à kwé.
en: The nobleman saith unto him, Sir, come down ere my child die.

ngiemboon: Ńnyé pɔ́ mánzsè ńcwóŋo ńgee, ngàŋa fà’ yé tó ńzá’a yé, éshwóŋó yé ngie míŋ gù aa ntentʉ́.
en: And as he was now going down, his servants met him, and toldhim, saying, Thy son liveth.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò tɔ́g, á fʉ̀’e tsɔ́ línɔ́ɔn pà Yuda ne ńku’u, Yěsô pʉ ńgʉa né Yerósalem.
en: After this there was a feast of the Jews; and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gwɔ́ jʉ’ó, mbà à gǔɔ guɔ ngù’ ntsɔ̀b lefɔ̌ɔn né móm ntá.
en: And a certain man was there, which had an infirmity thirty and eight years.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Lu ssé, ḿbíi mátà gù, ńgiŋ.
en: Jesus saith unto him,Rise, take up thy bed, and walk.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò gwaa tɔ́g pá’ɔɔn, á gwɔ́*lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè pà Yuda.
en: And immediately the man was made whole, and took up his bed, and walked: and on the same day was the sabbath.

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Nyìŋ gẅie à gÿǒ mèŋ n zeŋe gɔ̌ɔn né mèŋ ngie: Píi mátà gù, ńgiŋ.
en: He answered them, He that made me whole, the same said unto me, Take up thy bed, and walk.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɛ́te yé ngie: Nyìŋ gẅie à gɔ̌ɔn né gù ngie píi mátà gù ńgiŋ aa wɔ̌?
en: Then asked they him, What man is that which said unto thee, Take up thy bed, and walk?

ngiemboon: Tá nyìŋ gẅie á ně ńzeŋe la ké tè ne ńzsé ngàŋ wɔ́. Á nue Yěsô ně ńgɔɔn pú’u, ḿbyéte tsetsɛ̀ɛ lá’ gie á ke ńgwɔ́ jʉ’ó.
en: And he that was healed wist not who it was: for Jesus had conveyed himself away, a multitude being inthatplace.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ wá gʉa shwóŋ pàsá’a lá’ ngie nyìŋ gẅie à la zoŋo yé la, à laa Yěsô.
en: The man departed, and told the Jews that it was Jesus, which had made him whole.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Tá wɔ̀ɔn nyě fa’a pɔ́ fà’ tà ńkú fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn mèŋ n giŋé ne fa’a pɔ́ fà’.
en: But Jesus answered them,My Father worketh hitherto, and I work.

ngiemboon: Pá’ Tá we gÿo pʉ̀a pie é kwě zím ńgwɔ́ wó la, áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ Múɔ giŋé ńku’ yé légÿo nyìŋ gẅie à kwoŋo yé gwɔ́ wó.
en: For as the Father raiseth up the dead, and quickeneththem; even so the Son quickeneth whom he will.

ngiemboon: E Ssé Tá, aa ntě ńzá’a ntsàŋ nyìŋ wɔ́, à léen ńnyé yɛ̌ jʉ’ mbwo Míŋ we.
en: For the Father judgeth no man, but hath committed all judgment unto the Son:

ngiemboon: Áa pú’u mélà’mie Ssé Tá gẅie aa lesa’á le gwɔ́ tèmí, à la ná mɛ̌ metʉ̀ mbwo míŋ we.
en: For as the Father hath life in himself; so hath he given to the Son to have life in himself;

ngiemboon: À la gíŋe ńnáa yé metʉ̀ lélɔg ńzá’ mentsaŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ, mélà’mie yé zɔɔ*Míŋ Nyìŋ.
en: and hath given him authority to execute judgment also, because he is the Son of man.

ngiemboon: Tà á mɔ́ɔn ńkʉ’ʉ gẅi kʉ’ʉ, á nue afʉ̀’ ne ńku’u pá’ mepfó ssé metsèm pie é nuŋe tsɛ̀ɛ mesyè ge jú’ ngyè ye,
en: Marvel not at this: for the hour is coming, in the which all that are in the graves shall hear his voice,

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ke ńgwɔ́ pé’e ne sele ńgɔɔn pɔ́ nò gie mèŋ n zsé nà twó mbùm yɔ́ɔn, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé le yɛ̌ nò zẅíŋ.
en: If I bear witness of myself, my witness is not true.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ zɔ gɔɔn nò gie à zsé ná mèŋ, mèŋ m biŋ ne ńzsé ngie nò gie à gɔɔn ná mèŋ áa nénʉ́.
en: There is another that beareth witness of me; and I know that the witness which he witnesseth of me is true.

ngiemboon: Pi la tè túm pʉ̀a mbwo Jâŋ wɔ́ le? À la gɔɔn nò gie à zsě nà nò gie áa nénʉ́.
en: Ye sent unto John, and he bare witness unto the truth.

ngiemboon: Jâŋ la gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ lâm gẅie mé lyɛ̌ ńtÿɔ́g á ne ńkyɛ’ɛ jʉ’. Á kyɛ’ jʉ’, anò poŋo gẅi tá á té ńnéŋe.
en: He was a burning and a shining light: and ye were willing for a season to rejoice in his light.

ngiemboon: Ashwóŋè yé té ntʉ́m pi wɔ́, mélà’mie pi kaa záb ntʉ́m ná nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo yé wɔ́.
en: And ye have not his word abiding in you: for whom he hath sent, him ye believe not.

ngiemboon: Pi piŋ ńké tè ne ńkwoŋo létóo mbwo mèŋ ńgẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì wɔ́.
en: And ye will not come to me, that ye might have life.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n tè ne ńtsɔ́ɔn tsɔ̌ ngɔ́ɔnte gie e fóo mbwo pʉ̀a mesoŋ wɔ́.
en: I receive not honour from men.

ngiemboon: Tá’, mèŋ n zɔɔn ne ńzsé gẅí, pi ee ntʉ́m pi, pi tè Ssé kwoŋ.
en: But I know you, that ye have not the love of God in you.

ngiemboon: Pi la zɔɔn pé’e ńzẅíŋe nò gie Mǒsê la gɔɔn, mbà pi zẅíŋe yɔ́ɔn, mélà’mie à la ŋwè’e nò ńtí wɔ̀ɔn.
en: For had ye believed Moses, ye would have believed me: for he wrote of me.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pi tè ne ńzẅíŋe nò gie Mǒsê la ŋwe’e wɔ́ la, pi ge gǎ tá zẅíŋe nò gie mèŋ n gɔɔn?
en: But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò tɔ́g, Yěsô túm ńgʉa yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ letʉŋ sie ée Galilea, mé gíŋe ńtóŋ ngie letʉŋ Tiberiad
en: After these things Jesus went over the sea of Galilee, which isthe seaof Tiberias.

ngiemboon: Alá’ ne ńcʉ́me nzèm yé tɛ’, á nue pʉ̀a la ne ńgyá menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn mie à la ne ńgÿo nà megàŋa guɔ.
en: And a great multitude followed him, because they saw his miracles which he did on them that were diseased.

ngiemboon: Yěsô kwɔ́’ɔ ndùm tsɔ́ lekwɔ’ɔ́, pâ*ngàŋa kwò yé ńnéŋe ssé.
en: And Jesus went up into a mountain, and there he sat with his disciples.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, afʉ̀’ gie pà Yuda gee ńjÿó línɔ́ɔn yɔ́b gie mé tóŋo le*Páskà ne ńku’u.
en: And the passover, a feast of the Jews, was nigh.

ngiemboon: À lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ńdʉŋte yé lʉŋte. Kwà’ yé Yěsô ne ńzsé mmó gie à ge piŋ gÿo.
en: And this he said to prove him: for he himself knew what he would do.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gwɔ́ jʉ’ó, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ le Ndeléya, á gwɔ́ fɛ́ Símo. Á gɔɔn né Yěsô ngie:
en: One of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter's brother, saith unto him,

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ mûɔ mbàŋa aa jʉ’ɔɔn, ńgẅiin mbelégmbu’ú ntʉ̀a, ńgÿo messó ntá’ pʉ́a, sɛ̌ shúm ké ńku’u kɔ́ nà nzẅìŋ lá’ yɔɔn?
en: There is a lad here, which hath five barley loaves, and two small fishes: but what are they among so many?

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a metsèm pfɛ́ɛ mmó tà ńzẅɛ́, Yěsô gɔɔn né*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Pi lag mekèm mie é vʉ’ʉ́ tà mmó le pyé.
en: When they were filled, he said unto his disciples,Gather up the fragments that remain, that nothing be lost.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ ncwò nzém,*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô cwóŋ ńgʉa né nkʉ̀ŋ ntse Galilea.
en: And when even wasnowcome, his disciples went down unto the sea,

ngiemboon: Ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ kanú’, ńne ńgee né Kapernawúm ná yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ, nzěm gwaa síŋ, Yěsô nyé pɔ́ tè kẅɛté wɔ́b.
en: and entered into a ship, and went over the sea toward Capernaum. And it was now dark, and Jesus was not come to them.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ máamáa fèfà ne ńcʉ’ʉ, ntse ne ḿbʉe.
en: And the sea arose by reason of a great wind that blew.

ngiemboon: Tá Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie tà pi pɔ́g, à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mèŋ.
en: But he saith unto them,It is I; be not afraid.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ne fa’a légÿo á kúu tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’, ńgwóon ńgyá, mbà mé kǔ ngʉ̀ŋe ntse.
en: Then they willingly received him into the ship: and immediately the ship was at the land whither they went.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa tà ńkúu nà yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ, ńgyá yé, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Tsítsà, ɔ̀ tǒ tà ńkúu jʉ’ɔɔn fʉ̀’e kɔ́.
en: And when they had found him on the other side of the sea, they said unto him, Rabbi, when camest thou hither?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Peg ge gÿo lêkɔ́ tá gÿo mmó gie Ssé ne ńkwoŋo?
en: Then said they unto him, What shall we do, that we might work the works of God?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Ammó gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo ngie pi gÿo, aa lezáb ntʉ́m ná nyìŋ gẅie à ka tǔm.
en: Jesus answered and said unto them,This is the work of God, that ye believe on him whom he hath sent.

ngiemboon: Á nue shúm léjÿó sie é fóo mbwó Ssé, aa nyìŋ gẅie à fǒ tÿǒ lepwó ésẅɛ́’, ńgÿo pʉ̀a mesoŋ tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó gwɔ́ wó.
en: For the bread of God is he which cometh down from heaven, and giveth life unto the world.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ leen ńké ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Andè, ńnéŋe ńnáa sɛ̌ shúm léjÿó né peg fʉ̀’ ntsèm.
en: Then said they unto him, Lord, evermore give us this bread.

ngiemboon: Tá’, mèŋ n ka shwóŋó gẅí, pi ne ńgyá wɔ̀ɔn, ńké tè záb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ wɔ́.
en: But I said unto you, That ye also have seen me, and believe not.

ngiemboon: Pàsá’a lá’ leen ńké ńzye lézẅɛ́te nzèm Yěsô, mélà’mie à gɔ̌ɔn ngie aa mmó léjÿó gie à fóo tÿǒ lepwó.
en: The Jews then murmured at him, because he said, I am the bread which came down from heaven.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Tà pi gíŋe ńzẅɛ́te!
en: Jesus therefore answered and said unto them,Murmur not among yourselves.

ngiemboon: Sɔɔn nyìŋ laa Tá gyá, tà ńdí’ ndà’ nyìŋ gẅie à fóo lejʉ́ŋ ye. Àngàŋ zɔ lǎ gyá Ssé Tá.
en: Not that any man hath seen the Father, save he which is of God, he hath seen the Father.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzáb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ, mbà ngàŋ ge gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì.
en: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me hath everlasting life.

ngiemboon: Ammó léjÿó gie á gÿo mé gwɔ́ wó à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mèŋ.
en: I am that bread of life.

ngiemboon: Pà mangʉa njʉ’ pí la pfɛ́ɛ mána nkwòŋo tsẅɛ, ńgíŋ ńkwé kwé.
en: Your fathers did eat manna in the wilderness, and are dead.

ngiemboon: Tá’, ammó léjÿó gie á fóo tÿǒ lépwó sẅɛ́’ɛ, áa gie nyìŋ jÿó, á le gíŋe ńkwé wɔ́.
en: This is the bread which cometh down from heaven, that a man may eat thereof, and not die.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, pàsá’a lá’ pá zoŋo tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b tɛ’ ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ wɛ̂ ge gÿo lêkɔ́ tá ná mbab nnɛ́ ye pege pfɛ́?
en: The Jews therefore strove among themselves, saying, How can this man give ushisflesh to eat?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ pfɛ́ mbab nnɛ́ yɔ̀ɔn, ńnú metse mɔ́ɔn, á gẅiin le gwɔ́ tèmì. Mèŋ n gÿo ńzíme ngàŋ nà legwé á lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsò nzèm.
en: Whoso eateth my flesh, and drinketh my blood, hath eternal life; and I will raise him up at the last day.

ngiemboon: Á nue mbab nnɛ́ yɔ̀ɔn ée shúm léjÿó se mbòŋo, metse mɔ́ɔn é gwɔ́ kwà’ mmó nǔ.
en: For my flesh is meat indeed, and my blood is drink indeed.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ pfɛ́ mbab nnɛ́ yɔ̀ɔn, ńnú metse mɔ́ɔn, mbà à temté ná mèŋ, mèŋ n temte ná yé.
en: He that eateth my flesh, and drinketh my blood, dwelleth in me, and I in him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn mɔɔn menò, á fʉ̀’ gie à la ne ńzí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé tsɛ̀ɛ*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda á Kapernawúm.
en: These things said he in the synagogue, as he taught in Capernaum.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô jú’u shwóŋè yé, lelÿò zye légɔɔn ngie: Ashwóŋe yɛ̂ á tʉ̌ tà ńcʉa! À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ à wɔ̌ zẅí’te?
en: Many therefore of his disciples, when they had heardthis, said, This is an hard saying; who can hear it?

ngiemboon: Yěsô zsé ngie*ngàŋa kwò yé ne ńzẅɛ́te ńtí nò gie à gɔ̌ɔn, ńzɛ́te wɔ́b ngie ashwóŋè yɔ́ɔn ne ńgege gẅi gege ka?
en: When Jesus knew in himself that his disciples murmured at it, he said unto them,Doth this offend you?

ngiemboon: Tà pi lɔɔn ńgwɔ gyá*Míŋ Nyìŋ gíŋe ńkwɔ́’ ńgʉa né jʉ’ gie à la zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wó, pi gÿo pɔ́ lêkɔ́?
en: Whatand if ye shall see the Son of man ascend up where he was before?

ngiemboon: Á fó fʉ’ó, lelÿò*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô kÿo, pâ pɔ̌ té gíŋe ńgiŋ wɔ́.
en: From thattimemany of his disciples went back, and walked no more with him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńgɔɔn mbwo pʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a nê legém ngie: Pi tè ne ńkwoŋo gí légʉa wɔ́ ka?
en: Then said Jesus unto the twelve,Will ye also go away?

ngiemboon: Símo Piɛ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, peg ge gʉa kẅɛ́te pɔ́ wɔ̌? Ɔ̀ gẅiin shwóŋè gie á náa le gwɔ́ tèmì.
en: Then Simon Peter answered him, Lord, to whom shall we go? thou hast the words of eternal life.

ngiemboon: Peg léen ńdá’ ńzẅíŋ, ńgíŋ ne ńzsé ngie ɔ́ɔ kwà’ nyìŋ gẅie à fóo lejʉ́ŋ Ssé.
en: And we believe and are sure that thou art that Christ, the Son of the living God.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, alínɔ́ɔn pà Yuda gie mé tóŋo le línɔ́ɔn*mentàb ne ḿbɔ́ɔnte.
en: Now the Jews' feast of tabernacles was at hand.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn ńtí nue kwà’ pɔ́b mefɛ́ Yěsô la tè ne ńzába ntʉ́m ná yé wɔ́.
en: For neither did his brethren believe in him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Ayɔ́ɔn fʉ̀’ nyé tè ku’, tá ńgʉa ná pi, mbà fʉ̀’ʉ kɔ́ wɔ́ áa mbwo pi ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mbòŋ.
en: Then Jesus said unto them,My time is not yet come: but your time is alway ready.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔ pʉ ńgʉa jʉ’ʉ línɔ́ɔn. Á gʉa ná mèŋ, mbà mèŋ n tě ńgee nê wó wɔ́, ayɔ́ɔn fʉ̀’ kaa ku’u.
en: Go ye up unto this feast: I go not up yet unto this feast; for my time is not yet full come.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b pú’u, ńgíŋ ńnéŋe Galilea.
en: When he had said these words unto them, he abodestillin Galilee.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pé piŋ ńgwɔ́ tà ḿbʉ nê jʉ’ʉ línɔ́ɔn, á leen ńké ńcʉ́m yé mánzsè. Tá ńgiŋ pɔ́ shute shuté.
en: But when his brethren were gone up, then went he also up unto the feast, not openly, but as it were in secret.

ngiemboon: Mé gwɔ́ tà ne ńjÿó línɔ́ɔn, pàsá’a lá’ pà Yuda ne ńgwá fa’a yé, ńzɛ́te ngie: Yěsô gwɔ́ pɔ́ nzɔ̌?
en: Then the Jews sought him at the feast, and said, Where is he?

ngiemboon: Tá nyìŋ ké tě ńgɔɔn nò ná yé tà ngyè ye kwɔ́’ɔ tÿǒ wɔ́, ḿbɔ́gɔ pàsá’a lá’ pà Yuda.
en: Howbeit no man spake openly of him for fear of the Jews.

ngiemboon: Mé jÿó línɔ́ɔn tà ńgebe, Yěsô gʉa ne*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, ńzye lézí’i pʉ̀a mmó.
en: Now about the midst of the feast Jesus went up into the temple, and taught.

ngiemboon: Á kʉ’ʉ pà Yuda, pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie: À gÿo lêkɔ́ ńzsé ŋwà’ne Ssé pɛ́’ɛ̀, tá mbà à la tè sekúd zí’i?
en: And the Jews marvelled, saying, How knoweth this man letters, having never learned?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Ammó gie mèŋ n zí’i pʉ̀a té fóo mbwo mèŋ wɔ́, á fóo pɔ́ mbwo nyìŋ gẅie à ka tumó wɔ̀ɔn.
en: Jesus answered them, and said,My doctrine is not mine, but his that sent me.

ngiemboon: Mǒsê zɔ la tè ná meŋwà’ne né pi wɔ́ le? Tà wɔ̌ ná pi mɔ̌ɔn ńne ńgiŋe mǒ? Pi piŋe fa’a lézẅé wɔ̀ɔn mélà’a kɔ́?
en: Did not Moses give you the law, andyetnone of you keepeth the law? Why go ye about to kill me?

ngiemboon: Alá’ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo Yěsô ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ*ssé tepòŋ! Awɔ̌ ne fa’a lézẅé gú?
en: The people answered and said, Thou hast a devil: who goeth about to kill thee?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńtsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ n ka gÿǒ pɔ́ ndà’ tà’a mmó, á pú ńgege gẅi metsèm.
en: Jesus answered and said unto them,I have done one work, and ye all marvel.

ngiemboon: Tà pi ŋaga nò nyìŋ té zsé letsiŋé, pi ŋag pɔ́ pá’ áa jʉ’ó ńgwɔ́ pú’u.
en: Judge not according to the appearance, but judge righteous judgment.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a Yerósalem ne ńgɔɔn ngie: Wɛ̂ tè nyìŋ wá gẅie mé fa’a lézẅé yé la wâ?
en: Then said some of them of Jerusalem, Is not this he, whom they seek to kill?

ngiemboon: Yé wɛ̂, ńne shʉ̀ashʉ̀a ńgɔɔn nò, nyìŋ tě ńtsɔ́bɔ wɔ́. Ndyɛ̀’ pàsá’a lá’ pégè gyǎ ngie aa*Nzà’nkÿo nénʉ́.
en: But, lo, he speaketh boldly, and they say nothing unto him. Do the rulers know indeed that this is the very Christ?

ngiemboon: Tá’, wɛ̂ nyìŋ aa pɛ́’ɛ̀ peg ne ńzsé jʉ’ gie à fóo wó. Tá ńgʉa ná*Nzà’nkÿo, mbà nyìŋ tè gÿo zsé jʉ’ gie à fóo wó wɔ́.
en: Howbeit we know this man whence he is: but when Christ cometh, no man knoweth whence he is.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n kě ne ńzsé yé. Mèŋ fóo pɔ́ ne lejʉ́ŋ yé, mbà yé zɔ ka tumó wɔ̀ɔn.
en: But I know him: for I am from him, and he hath sent me.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’u yɔɔn nò, éfa’a légwoon yé, tá nyìŋ ké tè pwó ná yé záb, mélà’mie à yé fʉ̀’ la nyé tè ku’.
en: Then they sought to take him: but no man laid hands on him, because his hour was not yet come.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́ Yěsô ne ńgɔɔn mbwo lá’ ngie pege ge gíŋe ná’a ńnéŋe, n gʉa ńtsɛ́ɛ nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn.
en: Then said Jesus unto them,Yet a little while am I with you, andthenI go unto him that sent me.

ngiemboon: Pi ge gÿo gwá fa’a wɔ̀ɔn, é piŋ ké le wɔ̀ɔn gyá, á nue ajʉ’ gie mèŋ n gee nê wó, pi tè ku’u létóo jʉ’ó wɔ́.
en: Ye shall seek me, and shall not findme: and where I am,thitherye cannot come.

ngiemboon: Alá’ jú’u shwóŋè Yěsô, etsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b gɔɔn ngie aa kwà’*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé.
en: Many of the people therefore, when they heard this saying, said, Of a truth this is the Prophet.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn ngie yé zɔɔ*Nzà’nkÿo. Tá’, petsɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn yɔ́b pɔ́ ngie*Nzà’nkÿo lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á le fó Galilea wɔ́.
en: Others said, This is the Christ. But some said, Shall Christ come out of Galilee?

ngiemboon: Anò Yěsô leen ńké ḿma’a fàgte tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b.
en: So there was a division among the people because of him.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a ná pɔ́b ne fá’a légwoon Yěsô, tá’ atsɔ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́b ké tè ku’u lézába pwó ná yé wɔ́.
en: And some of them would have taken him; but no man laid hands on him.

ngiemboon: Pàpyɛ́bɛ jʉ’e Ssé tsɔ́’ ngie: Peg laa zɔɔn ńjú’ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ shwóŋó pá’ nyìŋ áwe wɛ̌ wɔ́!
en: The officers answered, Never man spake like this man.

ngiemboon: Pà*farisay leen ńké ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Ńzsé ngie à selé twó gí gí wɔ́?
en: Then answered them the Pharisees, Are ye also deceived?

ngiemboon: Tsoon tsɔ̌ tà’ ná mekěm peg, tsoon tà’ ná pà*farisay laa záb ntʉ́m ná nyìŋ wɛ̂ wɔ́!
en: Have any of the rulers or of the Pharisees believed on him?

ngiemboon: Anùɔ lá’ yɛ̂ gie á tè ŋwà’ne Ssé zsé, ée megàŋ ndòon.
en: But this people who knoweth not the law are cursed.

ngiemboon: Áa nà*lepʉ̌ sége pé’e, mé gɔɔn ngie nyìŋ gwě ntsaŋ té gwɔ́ gie mé ju’ú nò gie á kẅɛ̌ ncwò yé, ḿbiŋ ńzsé mmó gie à gÿǒ?
en: Doth our law judgeanyman, before it hear him, and know what he doeth?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gÿo pú’u, ésyeente, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gʉa nê mbʉ̀a yé.
en: And every man went unto his own house.

ngiemboon: Yěsô fó yé jʉ’ó, ńgʉa né lekwɔ’ɔ́ metÿǒ mèvɛ olive,
en: Jesus went unto the mount of Olives.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn mbwo Yěsô ngie: Tsítsà, mé kemé manzwě wɔɔn, á ne ńgÿo gÿɛ́.
en: they say unto him, Master, this woman was taken in adultery, in the very act.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńgíŋe ńŋwé’e ssé, ńgíŋe ńzye lélɔgɔ mûɔ tepwó we, ńkʉate mmó ssé.
en: And again he stooped down, and wrote on the ground.

ngiemboon: Pi ŋag pʉ̀a gí pɔ́ nà ntí yé pʉ̀a mesoŋ. Á gʉa ná mèŋ, mbà mèŋ n tè ŋaga nyìŋ wɔ́.
en: Ye judge after the flesh; I judge no man.

ngiemboon: Mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne mbʉ̌ gí ngie: Pʉ̀a mépʉ́a lɔɔn ńkẅɛ, ńgwɔ́ pàjÿó ńgyá nà nò, mbà mé ge zẅíŋ ngie áa nò.
en: It is also written in your law, that the testimony of two men is true.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, pɔ́ té zsé ngie anò gie à gɔɔn né pɔ́b, à gɔɔn pɔ́ nà Ssé Tá wɔ́.
en: They understood not that he spake to them of the Father.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn mɔɔn menò pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn zye lézáb ntʉ́m ná yé.
en: As he spake these words, many believed on him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn mbwo pà Yuda pie pɔ́ zǎb ntʉ́m ná yé ngie: Pi lɔɔn ńkú’te shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn, mbà pi ge gwɔ́ kwà’*ngàŋa kwò yɔ́ɔn.
en: Then said Jesus to those Jews which believed on him,If ye continue in my word,thenare ye my disciples indeed;

ngiemboon: Mbà pi ge zsé nò nénʉ́, anò nénʉ́ cu’u gẅí.
en: and ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, mânyìŋ ntsèm gẅie à gÿo nò tepòŋ, aa nkwɔɔn nò tepòŋ.
en: Jesus answered them,Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whosoever committeth sin is the servant of sin.

ngiemboon: Nkwɔɔn ee ntěen ńdá’a ńtsẅé pɔ́ mbʉ̀a wɔ́, mûɔ mbʉ̀a zɔɔ ńdá’a ńtsẅé wó.
en: And the servant abideth not in the house for ever:butthe Son abideth ever.

ngiemboon: Áa pú’u, tá ńgwɔ́ gie múɔ lɔɔn ńkẅile gẅi ndá nkwɔɔn, mbà pi ge fó wó kẅɛ, kwà’ nénʉ́.
en: If the Son therefore shall make you free, ye shall be free indeed.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n né ńzsé ngie pi ee ngẅɛ̀ Ábalam, tá’ pi ne fa’a lézẅé wɔ̀ɔn, á nue pi ne ńdʉ’ʉ shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn lʉ’.
en: I know that ye are Abraham's seed; but ye seek to kill me, because my word hath no place in you.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n kě ńgɔɔn pɔ́ mmó gie n dà gyá mbwo Tá wɔ̀ɔn, tá pi piŋe ńgÿo gí pɔ́ mmó gie pi la jú’u mbwo tá gẅi.
en: I speak that which I have seen with my Father: and ye do that which ye have seen with your father.

ngiemboon: Pi fa’a pɔ́ mefa’ gẅi tá, pɔ́ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Peg tè púɔ gÿɛ́ wɔ́, peg gẅiin pɔ́ tà’ Tá wémɔ’ɔ́, á gwɔ́ Ssé.
en: Ye do the deeds of your father.Then said they to him, We be not born of fornication; we have one Father,evenGod.

ngiemboon: Pi piŋ ńké tè ne ńjú’u shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn mɔ́ mélà’a kɔ́? Áa nue pi tè ku’u lézẅí’te shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn mɔ́.
en: Why do ye not understand my speech?evenbecause ye cannot hear my word.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná mèŋ, pi tě ńzába ntʉ́m ná mèŋ wɔ́, mélà’mie mèŋ shwóŋó nò nénʉ́.
en: And because I tellyouthe truth, ye believe me not.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie aa nyìŋ Ssé à zẅí’te shwóŋè Ssé. Pi piŋ tě ńzẅí’te shwóŋè yɔ́ɔn mɔ́, mélà’mie pi tè pʉ̀a Ssé wɔ́.
en: He that is of God heareth God's words: ye therefore hearthemnot, because ye are not of God.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ, n tě ne fa’a pɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn legú’ wɔ́. Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ zɔ ne fa’a wɔ̀ɔn legú’, yé zɔ ge zá’ ntsaŋ.
en: And I seek not mine own glory: there is one that seeketh and judgeth.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgiŋe nà shwóŋè gie mèŋ n gɔ̌ɔn, mbà ngàŋ tě ńdá’a ńkwé wɔ́.
en: Verily, verily, I say unto you, If a man keep my saying, he shall never see death.

ngiemboon: Ńzsé ngie ɔ̀ lɔgɔ fáŋa ńcʉa tá wèg Ábalam keen? À la kwé, pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé gíŋe ńkwéte yɔ́b. Ɔ̀ kwǎŋ ngie ɔ́ɔ kɔ́ mmó?
en: Art thou greater than our father Abraham, which is dead? and the prophets are dead: whom makest thou thyself?

ngiemboon: Pà Yuda leen ńké ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Gù gẅie ɔ̀ fǒ nyé pɔ́ tè gẅiin ngù’ móm ntʉ̀a, ɔ̀ ka gyá Ábalam lá?
en: Then said the Jews unto him, Thou art not yet fifty years old, and hast thou seen Abraham?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, Ábalam la gwaa gwɔ́ wó, ńgwɔ́ N gee gwɔ́.
en: Jesus said unto them,Verily, verily, I say unto you, Before Abraham was, I am.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ne ńcʉa tsɔ́ jʉ’, ńgyá tsɔ̌ fʉ̀ menÿɔ́g, mbà mé la zyé yé á gwɔ́ pɔ́ fʉ̀.
en: And asJesuspassed by, he saw a man which was blind fromhisbirth.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ gie mèŋ n nyé tsɛ̀ɛ njyó, mèŋ, n gwɔ́ kyɛ̀’ɛ njÿó.
en: As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie aa yé, petsɔ́ gɔɔn ngie ngǎŋ, à sẅé yé sẅé, nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ ne ńgɔɔn ngie: Aa kwà’ mèŋ.
en: Some said, This is he: otherssaid, He is like him:buthe said, I amhe.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɛ́te yé ngie: Menÿɔ́g mú gÿǒ lêkɔ́ tá ńnyɛ́’ɛ?
en: Therefore said they unto him, How were thine eyes opened?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɛ́te yé ngie: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ aa nzɔ̌? Á tsɔ́’ ngie, mèŋ, n kaa zsé.
en: Then said they unto him, Where is he? He said, I know not.

ngiemboon: Mé gwóon ńdɔgɔ nyìŋ gẅie á ke ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀ menÿɔ́g la, ńgʉa mvfò nùɔ pà*farisay.
en: They brought to the Pharisees him that aforetime was blind.

ngiemboon: Ńgwaa gwɔ́ pú’u, mbà Yěsô ně ńgwaa tyɛ́bte tsetsá’, é lɔg gÿo menÿɔ́g nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ nyɛ́’ɛ, á gwɔ́*lyɛ’ɛ́ nzsè pà Yuda.
en: And it was the sabbath day when Jesus made the clay, and opened his eyes.

ngiemboon: Tá we pɔ́ má we tsɔ́’ ngie: Aa kwà’ míŋ weg, peg ne ńzsé ngie à la kẅɛ ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀ menÿɔ́g.
en: His parents answered them and said, We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind:

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo tá we pɔ́ má we gɔɔn ngie pi zɛ́te yé, à tè nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ múɔ wɔ́.
en: Therefore said his parents, He is of age; ask him.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɛ́te yé ngie: À ně ńgÿo lêkɔ́ ná gù? À ně ńgÿo lêkɔ́ tá menÿɔ́g mú nyɛ́’ɛ?
en: Then said they to him again, What did he to thee? how opened he thine eyes?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ leen ńké ńzye lézoonte yé, ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: Gù zɔɔ*ngàŋa kwò we, peg gwɔ́ pɔ́*ngàŋa kwò Mǒsê.
en: Then they reviled him, and said, Thou art his disciple; but we are Moses' disciples.

ngiemboon: Peg ne ńzsé ngie Ssé la gɔɔn nò á mbwo Mǒsê, tá ńgʉa ná wɛ̂ nyìŋ, mbà peg tè ne ńzsé lefǒ sé wɔ́.
en: We know that God spake unto Moses:as forthisfellow, we know not from whence he is.

ngiemboon: Mé laa mé ńjú’u nyìŋ gẅie à nyɛ̌’ menÿɔ́g nyìŋ gẅie mé la gwaa zyé yé á gwɔ́ fʉ̀ menÿɔ́g wɔ́ le!
en: Since the world began was it not heard that any man opened the eyes of one that was born blind.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ ně ńgwɔ́ pé’e, mbà Ssé zɔ ka tè yé túm, mbà à ně tè ku’u légÿo tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: If this man were not of God, he could do nothing.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie, mé la lɔg pɔ́ nò tepòŋ ńzyé gú, ɔ̀ gee ńzí’i peg mmó lá! Ńdeen fó*ndá cú’tè ńjwoŋo yé ńnáa pi.
en: They answered and said unto him, Thou wast altogether born in sins, and dost thou teach us? And they cast him out.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: Aa wɔ̌ Ndè? Tá mèŋ n záb ntʉ́m nà yé?
en: He answered and said, Who is he, Lord, that I might believe on him?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: Ɔ̀ ne ńgyá yé, yé zɔ gɔɔn nò mbwo gù pá’ɔɔn.
en: And Jesus said unto him,Thou hast both seen him, and it is he that talketh with thee.

ngiemboon: Á leen ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n zǎb ntʉ́m ná gù me Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ésẅɛ́’ ńkẅí’te ssé mvfò yé.
en: And he said, Lord, I believe. And he worshipped him.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgwɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mbyɛ̀b mvfó, mbà à ge pfó pɔ́ ncwò nká’.
en: But he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.

ngiemboon: À ge gÿo pɔ́ fó nká’ ńkẅɛ tà ḿmag, à gwɔ́ mvfò, pɔ́ gwɔ́ nzèm, mélà’mie pɔ́ lǐŋ ngyè ye.
en: And when he putteth forth his own sheep, he goeth before them, and the sheep follow him: for they know his voice.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ le cʉ́me nzèm nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ wɔ́, pɔ́ ge kÿo yé kÿo, mélà’mie pɔ́ té ngyè pʉ̀a méndyɛ̀’ɛ liŋ.
en: And a stranger will they not follow, but will flee from him: for they know not the voice of strangers.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn yɔɔn sagá nò mbwo pɔ́b, tá pɔ́ ké tè jú’u mmó gie à lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn wɔ́.
en: This parable spake Jesus unto them: but they understood not what things they were which he spake unto them.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, kwà’ nénʉ́, ncwò nká’ menjʉ̀njyò à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mèŋ.
en: Then said Jesus unto them again,Verily, verily, I say unto you, I am the door of the sheep.

ngiemboon: Mbyɛ̀b mvfó we mbòŋo à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mèŋ. Ambyɛ̀b mvfó we mbòŋo, à náa twó yé ńtí*njʉ̀njÿò yé.
en: I am the good shepherd: the good shepherd giveth his life for the sheep.

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ nyìŋ gwá’a*menjʉ̀njÿò ńkÿo, mélà’mie à ka tǒ pɔ́ ńdab nkáb. Ncʉ̀ŋ*menjʉ̀njÿò té ne ńkúu yé wɔ́.
en: The hireling fleeth, because he is an hireling, and careth not for the sheep.

ngiemboon: Mbyɛ̀b mvfó we mbòŋo aa mèŋ, mèŋ n ne ńzsé*menjʉ̀njÿò mɔ́ɔn, pɔ́ gíŋe ne ńzsé wɔ̀ɔn.
en: I am the good shepherd, and know mysheep, and am known of mine.

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ Tá wɔ̀ɔn ne ńzsé wɔ̀ɔn, mèŋ n gíŋe ne ńzsé Tá wɔ̀ɔn. Mèŋ n náa twó yɔ́ɔn ńtí*menjʉ̀njÿò mɔ́ɔn.
en: As the Father knoweth me, even so know I the Father: and I lay down my life for the sheep.

ngiemboon: Tá wɔ̀ɔn kwoŋo wɔ̀ɔn, mélà’mie mèŋ n náa twó yɔ́ɔn tá gÿo gíŋe kẅé.
en: Therefore doth my Father love me, because I lay down my life, that I might take it again.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn shwóŋè gíŋe ḿma’a fàgte tsetsɛ̀ɛ pà Yuda.
en: There was a division therefore again among the Jews for these sayings.

ngiemboon: Lelÿò pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ne ńgɔɔn ngie: E*ssé tepòŋ léen ńgwoon yé. Àa pʉ̀a. À gɔɔn kɔ́ tà pi zẅí’te?
en: And many of them said, He hath a devil, and is mad; why hear ye him?

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ ne ngie: Yɛ̂ té shwóŋè nyìŋ gẅiessé tepòŋ léen ńgwoon yé wɔ́. Ngwɔ́*ssé tepòŋ nyɛ́’ menÿɔ́g mefʉ̀?
en: Others said, These are not the words of him that hath a devil. Can a devil open the eyes of the blind?

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńgwá ńgiŋte tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé, á jʉ’ʉ ncwò kɔ̀’ Salomo.
en: And Jesus walked in the temple in Solomon's porch.

ngiemboon: Tá’ pi tè ne ńzába ntʉ́m ná mèŋ wɔ́, mélà’mie pi tè ná nùɔ*menjʉ̀njÿò mɔ́ɔn mɔ́.
en: But ye believe not, because ye are not of my sheep, as I said unto you.

ngiemboon: *Me njʉ̀njÿò mɔ́ɔn jú’ ngyè yɔɔn. Mèŋ n zsé wɔ́b, pɔ́ cʉ́me nzèm mèŋ.
en: My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me:

ngiemboon: Tá wɔ̀ɔn à la náa wɔ́b né mèŋ. À gẅiin tʉ̀ ńcʉa shúm ntsèm, sɔɔn nyìŋ tè ku’u léfó mbwó mèŋ é sa’a wɔ́b gwɔ́.
en: My Father, which gavethemme, is greater than all; and nomanis able to pluckthemout of my Father's hand.

ngiemboon: Peg Tá wɔ̀ɔn gwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’ nyìŋ.
en: I andmyFather are one.

ngiemboon: Pà Yuda gíŋe ńdag metóon, lélɔg ńtémte Yěsô ńzẅé.
en: Then the Jews took up stones again to stone him.

ngiemboon: N dɔɔn tè fa’ mefà’ Tá wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́, tà pi záb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ.
en: If I do not the works of my Father, believe me not.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ leen ńké ńgíŋe fa’ shÿó légwoon yé, tá á tsẅíle nà mbwo mɔ́b.
en: Therefore they sought again to take him: but he escaped out of their hand,

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ nò tɔ́g, Yěsô gíŋe ḿbiŋe nà yetsɔ̌ nzǐŋ ntse Jurdeŋ, á jʉ’ gie Jâŋ la zye lénu’ pʉ̀a ntse wó la, ńnéŋe wó.
en: and went away again beyond Jordan into the place where John at first baptized; and there he abode.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ná pʉ̀a pie é laa jʉ’ó leen ńké ńzáb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô.
en: And many believed on him there.

ngiemboon: pɔ́b panzwě ŋwɛ́ mépʉ́a túm ńtsẅii mbwo Yěsô ngie: Andè, ashǔ lepyè gù ne ńguɔ tɛ’.
en: Therefore his sisters sent unto him, saying, Lord, behold, he whom thou lovest is sick.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lɔ̌ɔn ńkwoŋo Mágtà, pɔ́ Malîɛ mbɔɔ Nǎzalo tɛ’.
en: Now Jesus loved Martha, and her sister, and Lazarus.

ngiemboon: Ńké ńjú’u guɔ pá’ɔɔn, ńgíŋe ńnéŋe jʉ’ gie à laa wó lyɛ̌’ sépʉ́a.
en: When he had heard therefore that he was sick, he abode two days still in the same place where he was.

ngiemboon: Ńdeen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwo*ngàŋa kwò yé ngie: Pege piŋe Jẅidea.
en: Then after that saith he tohisdisciples,Let us go into Judæa again.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńké ne ńgiŋe lêtsẅɛ́’, mbà à ge kwɔɔnte, mélà’mie mmó gie á ge kyɛ’ jʉ’ ná né yé á té wó wɔ́.
en: But if a man walk in the night, he stumbleth, because there is no light in him.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé leen ńké ńgɔɔn né ye ngie: Andè, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie à lyě, mbà à ge tsẅɛ.
en: Then said his disciples, Lord, if he sleep, he shall do well.

ngiemboon: Ńgwaa gwɔ́ pú’u, Yěsô ne shwóŋó wɔ́b ngie Nǎzalo kwě. Tá pɔ́ ne ńkwaŋa yɔ́b pɔ́ ngie à gɔɔn ngie à né ńdyé lyě.
en: Howbeit Jesus spake of his death: but they thought that he had spoken of taking of rest in sleep.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké shʉ̀ashʉ̀a, ńgɔɔn mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Nǎzalo kwě.
en: Then said Jesus unto them plainly,Lazarus is dead.

ngiemboon: Tomáse gẅie mé lɔ́ɔn ńgíŋe ńtóŋo yé le mélefág, gɔɔn mbwo yetsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô ngie: Pi tó pega pɔ́ gʉa, ḿbúte ńkwé.
en: Then said Thomas, which is called Didymus, unto his fellowdisciples, Let us also go, that we may die with him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gʉa tà ńkúu wó, ńgyá, mbà Nǎzalo nuŋé tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè lyɛ̌’ lekùa.
en: Then when Jesus came, he found that he hadlainin the grave four days already.

ngiemboon: Pá’ lefǒ Yerósalem ńgʉa Mbetáni la gwɔ́ pɔ́ mmó mekílo méntá la,
en: Now Bethany was nigh unto Jerusalem, about fifteen furlongs off:

ngiemboon: lelÿò pà Yuda gwaa gwɔ́, mbà pɔ́ tǒ mbʉ̀a Mágtà pɔ́ Malîɛ, létsí’i ntse nÿɔ́g mɔ́b, ńtí fɛ́ wɔb gẅie à ka kwě.
en: and many of the Jews came to Martha and Mary, to comfort them concerning their brother.

ngiemboon: Mágtà gwɔ́ tà ńjú’ ngie Yěsô né ńtóo, ńgwaa lu ssé gʉa zá’a yé, Malîɛ cʉ́’ ńnéŋe pɔ́ ndá.
en: Then Martha, as soon as she heard that Jesus was coming, went and met him: but Mary satstillin the house.

ngiemboon: Mágtà tó ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Andè, ɔ̀ kaa pé’e ńgwɔ́ jʉ’ɔɔn, mbà fɛ́ wɔ̀ɔn ka tè kwé.
en: Then said Martha unto Jesus, Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother had not died.

ngiemboon: Tá’ tà mbɔɔ fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mèŋ n zsě ngie ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńzɛ́te kɔ́ mbwo Ssé wɔ́, mbà à ge ná ná.
en: But I know, that even now, whatsoever thou wilt ask of God, God will giveitthee.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Afɛ̌ gù ge gÿo zíme nà legwé.
en: Jesus saith unto her,Thy brother shall rise again.

ngiemboon: Mágtà tsɔ́’ ngie: Mèŋ n zsě ngie à ge gÿo zíme nà lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ nzsò nzèm pá’ mepfó ge lá’ ne zíme.
en: Martha saith unto him, I know that he shall rise again in the resurrection at the last day.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à nyé ntentʉ́, ńzáb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ, à těen ńdá’a ńkwé wɔ́. Tà ɔ̀ zẅiŋé yɔɔn nò?
en: and whosoever liveth and believeth in me shall never die. Believest thou this?

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn ngie: Oon me Cʉ̀apùa. Mèŋ, n zẅǐŋ ngie ɔ́ɔ*Nzà’nkÿo, ńgwɔ́ Míŋ Ssé gẅie mé ka né ńzẅí’te ngie à tóo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó.
en: She saith unto him, Yea, Lord: I believe that thou art the Christ, the Son of God, which should come into the world.

ngiemboon: Malîɛ jú’ pú’u, ńgwóon ńdu ssé lê tʉ̀ légʉa ńgyá yé.
en: As soon as she heardthat, she arose quickly, and came unto him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la nyé pɔ́ jʉ’e pɔ́ Mágtà ně ńtyé wó shwóŋe, tà mbà à kaa tɔ́g tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ lá’ gwɔ́.
en: Now Jesus was not yet come into the town, but was in that place where Martha met him.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn ngie: Pi ka le’e pfó yé nzɔ̌? Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Andè, tóo ńgyá.
en: and said,Where have ye laid him?They said unto him, Lord, come and see.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lʉa.
en: Jesus wept.

ngiemboon: Pà Yuda gɔɔn ngie, pi gyá pá’ à kɔ̌ɔn ńkwoŋo yé.
en: Then said the Jews, Behold how he loved him!

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńzẅi, ńgʉa jʉ’e lesyè, é gwɔ́ tsɔ̌ mvwɔ́’ɔ jʉ’, mbà mé la lɔgɔ tóon ńjÿɔ́’ ncwò.
en: Jesus therefore again groaning in himself cometh to the grave. It was a cave, and a stone lay upon it.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Mèŋ n ně tè gɔɔn né gù ngie ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńzáb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ, mbà ɔ̀ ge gyá legú’ Ssé wɔ́ le?
en: Jesus saith unto her,Said I not unto thee, that, if thou wouldest believe, thou shouldest see the glory of God?

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńdɔg ngyè tetʉ́ʉ ngie: Nǎzalo, kẅɛɛ.
en: And when he thus had spoken, he cried with a loud voice,Lazarus, come forth.

ngiemboon: Lelÿò pà Yuda pie pɔ́ ně ńtóo mbʉ̀a pà Malîɛ, é pie pɔ́ gyǎ mmó gie Yěsô gÿǒ, záb ntʉ́m wɔ́b ná Yěsô.
en: Then many of the Jews which came to Mary, and had seen the things which Jesus did, believed on him.

ngiemboon: Tá tsɔ́ ntá’ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b gʉa ḿbíte mmó gie Yěsô gÿǒ, éshwóŋ pà*farisay.
en: But some of them went their ways to the Pharisees, and told them what things Jesus had done.

ngiemboon: Pi kaa gyá ngie áa mboŋó mbwo pi pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tà’ nyìŋ wémɔ’ɔ́ kwé nà twó lá’, ńcʉa lá’a ntsèm lépú ńdége wɔ́ keen?
en: nor consider that it is expedient for us, that one man should die for the people, and that the whole nation perish not.

ngiemboon: Á fó lyɛ’ó, mekěm pà Yuda záb ngie pɔ́ ge fa’ shÿó tà zẅé Yěsô.
en: Then from that day forth they took counsel together for to put him to death.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô, Jẅidas Iskariod gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn nge gÿo sẅiŋe Yěsô gɔɔn ngie:
en: Then saith one of his disciples, Judas Iscariot, Simon'sson, which should betray him,

ngiemboon: Mélà’a kɔ́ mé ně tè sẅiŋe yɔɔn laméndɔɔn ńkẅé*mendenie nkÿo tá, ńná né mepóŋ wɔ́?
en: Why was not this ointment sold for three hundred pence, and given to the poor?

ngiemboon: Mepóŋ ge gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi pɔ́ fʉ̀’ ntsèm. Tá ńgʉa ná mèŋ, mbà pege tě ge gwɔ́ pɔ́ fʉ̀’ ntsèm wɔ́.
en: For the poor always ye have with you; but me ye have not always.

ngiemboon: Metándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ gyá pú’u, ńzáb ngie mé fa’ shÿó lézẅé mbɔɔ Nǎzalo.
en: But the chief priests consulted that they might put Lazarus also to death;

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, mélà’mie lelÿò pà Yuda ka fǒ pɔ́ nà nò Nǎzalo, ńcʉ́’ʉ ńkÿo wɔ́b kÿo, ńzába ntʉ́m pɔ́ ná Yěsô.
en: because that by reason of him many of the Jews went away, and believed on Jesus.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, alá’ gie á tǒ línɔ́ɔn Páska jú’ ngie Yěsô ne ńtóo né Yerósalem,
en: On the next day much people that were come to the feast, when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,

ngiemboon: Yěsô gyá mûɔ nzìkásè, ńkwɔ́’ ńnéŋe ndùmó. Á gwɔ́ pá’ mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie:
en: And Jesus, when he had found a young ass, sat thereon; as it is written,

ngiemboon: À ńnéŋe ndùm mûɔ Nzìkásè».
en: Fear not, daughter of Sion: behold, thy King cometh, sitting on an ass's colt.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á la gÿo tá lá’ kẅɛ, ńgʉa ńzá’a Yěsô, mélà’mie pɔ́ la jú’ pá’ à gÿǒ yɔɔn nò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn.
en: For this cause the people also met him, for that they heard that he had done this miracle.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ ntá’ pʉ̀a Gelekia, lá pʉ ńtóo Yerósalem léjÿó línɔ́ɔn, ńgu’te Ssé.
en: And there were certain Greeks among them that came up to worship at the feast:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tó ńgyá Filib, á nyìŋ Mbetsayida nà pàga ngwòŋ Galilea, ńgɔɔn né ye ngie: Andè, peg ne ńtsɔ́ɔn légyá Yěsô.
en: the same came therefore to Philip, which was of Bethsaida of Galilee, and desired him, saying, Sir, we would see Jesus.

ngiemboon: Filib gʉa shwóŋó Ndeléya, pɔ́ yé mépʉ́a gʉa ńgɔɔn mbwo Yěsô.
en: Philip cometh and telleth Andrew: and again Andrew and Philip tell Jesus.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie afʉ̀’ gie mé ge gyá legú’ we*Míŋ Nyìŋ á kǔ’.
en: And Jesus answered them, saying,The hour is come, that the Son of man should be glorified.

ngiemboon: Tá wɔ̀ɔn, gÿo mé gu’te lezíŋ shú. Ngyè nyìŋ leen ńké fó lepwó ńgɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n gÿǒ pú’u. Mèŋ n ge gíŋe gÿo sẅé sẅé.
en: Father, glorify thy name.Then came there a voice from heaven,saying, I have both glorifiedit, and will glorifyitagain.

ngiemboon: Àlá’ gie á laa jʉ’ó jú’ yɛ̌ ngyè ngie: Ée lefàŋ sie é vɛ́te. Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a gɔɔn ngie*cÿɔ́’ Ssé gɔ̌ɔn nò mbwo yé.
en: The people therefore, that stood by, and heardit, said that it thundered: others said, An angel spake to him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Yɛ̂ ngyè kaa gɔɔn nò pɛ́’ɛ̀ ńdɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ liŋé mbwo mèŋ wɔ́, e nyɛɛ pɔ́ mbwo pi.
en: Jesus answered and said,This voice came not because of me, but for your sakes.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ kǔ’ pá’ e Ssé ge ŋag yɔɔn njÿó. Á fʉ̀’ gie Ssé ge kẅile mûɔ ntɔ́’ yɔɔn njÿó, é náa yé pǐ.
en: Now is the judgment of this world: now shall the prince of this world be cast out.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná mèŋ, mbà mé lɔɔn ńgÿo ńkwé’e wɔ̀ɔn tà náa tÿǒ, mbà mèŋ n ge shwoŋte pʉ̀a metsèm náa lejʉ́ŋ mèŋ.
en: And I, if I be lifted up from the earth, will draw allmenunto me.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lɔ̌ɔn ńdɔgɔ yɔɔn shwóŋè, ńda’te ntí legwé gie à ge gÿo kwé yɛ̌.
en: This he said, signifying what death he should die.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la tsɛ ńgÿo menò mmɔɔn tɛ’ mvfò pʉ̀a tá’, pɔ́ ké tè záb ntʉ́m ná yé wɔ́.
en: But though he had done so many miracles before them, yet they believed not on him:

ngiemboon: Tà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a kɔ̌ɔn ńnyɛ metʉ̀ mé pɔ́ mbwo pà wɔ̌»?
en: And to whom hath the arm of the Lord been revealed?

ngiemboon: Esǎya la gíŋe ńgɔɔn mmó gie á ge gÿo tá pà Yuda le záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé wɔ́, à la gɔɔn ngie:
en: Therefore they could not believe, because that Esaias said again,

ngiemboon: à cʉa pú’u, pɔ́ le kúbe mà wɔb à gÿo pɔ́ zeŋe wɔ́».
en: And I should heal them.

ngiemboon: Esǎya gɔɔn nò jʉ’ɔɔn ná Yěsô, á nue à la tʉ́ njÿó ńgyá legú’ Yěsô.
en: These things said Esaias, when he saw his glory, and spake of him.

ngiemboon: Á laa pú’u, mélà’mie pɔ́ la kwoŋ mekù’ mie pʉ̀a mesoŋ náa mbwo pɔ́b, ńtɔ́g mie é fóo mbwó Ssé.
en: for they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à gyǎ wɔ̀ɔn, à giŋé ńgyá nyìŋ gẅie à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn.
en: And he that seeth me seeth him that sent me.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ, n gee kyɛ̀’, n ka tóo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó légwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzáb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ, á le gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm wɔ́.
en: I am come a light into the world, that whosoever believeth on me should not abide in darkness.

ngiemboon: Ńńnéŋe tà ńdu ssé, ésẅɛ nzsǒ fÿɔ́g ye, ńnuŋe ssé, ḿbíi tágwele ńtʉ́me zẅɛ̌’ yé.
en: he riseth from supper, and laid aside his garments; and took a towel, and girded himself.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa tà ńkúu ná Símo Piɛ, á gɔ́ɔn né yé ngie: Andè zɔ ge sɔg mekwò mɔ́ɔn lá!
en: Then cometh he to Simon Peter: and Peter saith unto him, Lord, dost thou wash my feet?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Ammó gie mèŋ n ne ńgÿo, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ɔ́ le jú’ fʉ̀’ɔɔn wɔ́. Tá ké gÿo jú’.
en: Jesus answered and said unto him,What I do thou knowest not now; but thou shalt know hereafter.

ngiemboon: Símo Piɛ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pú’u, me Nde, tè sɔg pɔ́ ndà’ mekwò mɔ́ɔn, ɔ̀ pú sɔg mbwo mɔ́ɔn pâ twó yɔ́ɔn.
en: Simon Peter saith unto him, Lord, not my feet only, but alsomyhands andmyhead.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, mélà’mie à la ne ńzsé nyìŋ gẅie à ge gÿo sẅiŋe yé tá ńgɔɔn ngie mbùm gi metsèm kaa lʉ́a.
en: For he knew who should betray him; therefore said he, Ye are not all clean.

ngiemboon: Pi tóŋo wɔ̀ɔn lê Tsítsà, ńtóŋo wɔ̀ɔn lê Ndè, ńgɔɔn shwóŋó nò á nue mèŋ n gee wɛ̌.
en: Ye call me Master and Lord: and ye say well; forsoI am.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie mèŋ Ndè, ńgwɔ́ Tsítsà, mèŋ sɔ̌g mekwò mí, mbà á zɛ́te ngie pi gí, pi ne sɔgɔ mekwò mí pi né pi.
en: If I then,yourLord and Master, have washed your feet; ye also ought to wash one another's feet.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n nyɛɛ gẅi fʉ̀’ légwɔ́ gie pi gí pi ge gÿo pá’ pi gyǎ mèŋ n gÿo.
en: For I have given you an example, that ye should do as I have done to you.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pi né ńzsé fʉ̀’ɔɔn la, pi lɔɔn ńgÿo pú’u, mbà pi ee pà shÿó mbòŋo.
en: If ye know these things, happy are ye if ye do them.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n tʉʉ njÿó shwóŋó gẅi fʉ̀’ɔɔn tà mɔɔn menò gÿo ńtó, pi zẅíŋ ngie mèŋ n gee N gee gwɔ́.
en: Now I tell you before it come, that, when it is come to pass, ye may believe that I amhe.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô jú’, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ sele ńdíe fɛ́ we, pɔ́ té zsé nyìŋ gẅie à gɔɔn yé wɔ́.
en: Then the disciples looked one on another, doubting of whom he spake.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tà’ ná*ngàŋa kwò yé gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn ńkwoŋo yé tɛ’, á gwɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ yé ńne ńjÿó mmó.
en: Now there was leaning on Jesus' bosom one of his disciples, whom Jesus loved.

ngiemboon: Símo Piɛ myɛ’ lejÿɔ́g ńdɔg ńtsẅi ngie à zɛ́te ngie à gɔɔn wɔ́ wɔ́.
en: Simon Peter therefore beckoned to him, that he should ask who it should be of whom he spake.

ngiemboon: Á lemte letuŋó Yěsô, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: Andè, angàŋa aa wɔ̌?
en: He then lying on Jesus' breast saith unto him, Lord, who is it?

ngiemboon: Jẅidas gwɔ́ tà ńkẅé, Sátà kúu tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m yé. Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Lwo sẅɛte ńgÿo mmó gie ɔ̀ gẅiin légÿo.
en: And after the sop Satan entered into him. Then said Jesus unto him,That thou doest, do quickly.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ sɔɔn nyìŋ ná pʉ̀a pie é lâ jʉ’ó, tè jú’u nò gie Yěsô fa’a légɔɔn wɔ́.
en: Now no man at the table knew for what intent he spake this unto him.

ngiemboon: Jẅidas kẅé pú’u, ńgwóon fó ndá ńkẅɛ. Mbà nzěm ně síŋ.
en: He then having received the sop went immediately out: and it was night.

ngiemboon: Pá’*Míŋ Nyìŋ ka nǎ legú’ mbwo Ssé la, E Ssé lê twó mbùm yé ge gÿo náa legú’ mbwo yé, tà á cʉ́’ pɔ́ méjʉ’ à ná.
en: If God be glorified in him, God shall also glorify him in himself, and shall straightway glorify him.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge ná*lepʉ̌ se sẅé né pi, e gwɔ́ ngie: Pi kwoŋe pi né pi. Pá’ mèŋ n da kwoŋo gẅi lá, pi gí kwoŋe pi né pi.
en: A new commandment I give unto you, That ye love one another; as I have loved you, that ye also love one another.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńkwoŋe pi né pi, mbà mânyìŋ ntsèm ge zsé ngie pi ee*ngàŋa kwò yɔ́ɔn.
en: By this shall allmenknow that ye are my disciples, if ye have love one to another.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Andè, akɔ́ ge gÿo tá mèŋ n de gwóon ńcʉ́me nzèm gù wɔ́? Mèŋ n ge náa twó yɔ́ɔn e tí gú.
en: Peter said unto him, Lord, why cannot I follow thee now? I will lay down my life for thy sake.

ngiemboon: Yěsô giŋe ńgɔɔn mbwo*ngàŋa kwò ye ngie: Tà ntʉ́m gẅi gíŋe ḿvɛ. Pi záb ntʉ́m gẅi nà Ssé, ńgíŋe ńzáb ntʉ́m gẅi ná mèŋ.
en: Let not your heart be troubled: ye believe in God, believe also in me.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà jʉ’ gie mèŋ ńgee né wó, mbà pi ne ńzsé mánzsè.
en: And whither I go ye know, and the way ye know.

ngiemboon: Tomáse gɔɔn né yé ngie: Andè, peg tè ne ńzsé jʉ’ gie ɔ̀ gee né wó wɔ́. Peg ge gǎ tá zsé mánzsè?
en: Thomas saith unto him, Lord, we know not whither thou goest; and how can we know the way?

ngiemboon: Pi gwɔ́ pé’e ńzsé wɔ̀ɔn, mbà pi zsé Tá wɔ̀ɔn yé. Mèŋ n kě ńgɔɔn pá’ɔɔn pi gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńne ńzsé yé. Mbà pi gyǎ yé.
en: If ye had known me, ye should have known my Father also: and from henceforth ye know him, and have seen him.

ngiemboon: Filib jú’, ńgɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: Andè, nyɛɛ weg Tá gù ŋwɛ́ à ku’ pú’u.
en: Philip saith unto him, Lord, shew us the Father, and it sufficeth us.

ngiemboon: Pi gÿo ńdɔg lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn ńdúɔ kɔ́ mbwo Ssé wɔ́, mbà mèŋ n ge gÿo. Á cʉa pú’u, mèŋ múɔ n da’te legú’ Tá wɔ̀ɔn.
en: And whatsoever ye shall ask in my name, that will I do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńdɔg lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn ńdúɔ mmó mbwo Ssé, mbà mèŋ n ge gÿo yɛ̌ mmó.
en: If ye shall ask any thing in my name, I will doit.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńkwoŋo wɔ̀ɔn, mbà pi ge gÿo kú’te mbʉ̌ mɔ́ɔn.
en: If ye love me, keep my commandments.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n dêen ńké sẅíŋte Tá wɔ̀ɔn, à náa wetsɔ̌ Ntàg Nzèm né pi, á gẅie pi lâ pɔ̌ zɔ ge cʉ́’ʉ gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ ntsèm.
en: And I will pray the Father, and he shall give you another Comforter, that he may abide with you for ever;

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n těen ńge ńnyé gẅi pi gwɔ́ púɔ metsé wɔ́. Mèŋ n ne ńtóo ne lejʉ́ŋ pi.
en: I will not leave you comfortless: I will come to you.

ngiemboon: À gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ó, pi zsé ngie peg Tá wɔ̀ɔn pǔ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’a mmó, é gíŋe zsé ngie pi ee nê mèŋ, mèŋ n gwɔ́ ntʉ́m pi.
en: At that day ye shall know that Iamin my Father, and ye in me, and I in you.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi mɔɔn menò á fʉ̀’ gie pege nyě ńgwɔ́ lɔɔn.
en: These things have I spoken unto you, beingyetpresent with you.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ tʉ́ʉ njÿó shwóŋó gẅi tá yɛ̌ nò gÿo tó, á gÿo ńgwɔ́ tá ńtó, pi záb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ.
en: And now I have told you before it come to pass, that, when it is come to pass, ye might believe.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie mèŋ n gee kwà’ letsiŋé tÿó. Tá wɔ̀ɔn gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à fa’a mǒ.
en: I am the true vine, and my Father is the husbandman.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie mèŋ n ka zí’i gẅi kéen ńdá’ ńgÿo pi gwɔ́ mbòŋ.
en: Now ye are clean through the word which I have spoken unto you.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńda nnɛ́ ná mèŋ, ashwóŋè yɔ́ɔn gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m pi, pi lúɔ mmó gie pi kwǒŋ, mbà mé ge gÿo yɛ̌ mbwo pi.
en: If ye abide in me, and my words abide in you, ye shall ask what ye will, and it shall be done unto you.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á gÿo mé gu’te Tá wɔ̀ɔn, aa pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pi gÿo shúm mbòŋo tɛ’, ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́*ngàŋa kwò yɔ́ɔn.
en: Herein is my Father glorified, that ye bear much fruit; so shall ye be my disciples.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gɔɔn yɔɔn nò mbwo pi légwɔ́ gie lekág gẅie aa tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m mèŋ ge gíŋe gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m gẅí, pi gẅiin kwà’ lekág.
en: These things have I spoken unto you, that my joy might remain in you, andthatyour joy might be full.

ngiemboon: *Lepʉ̌ sɔ́ɔn e sɔɔn: Pi kwoŋe pi né pi pá’ mèŋ n ka kwoŋo gẅi la.
en: This is my commandment, That ye love one another, as I have loved you.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ tè gíŋe ńgẅiin nkwòŋe tà é tɔ́g ye nyìŋ gẅie à náa we le gwɔ́ nà twó pʉ̀a pie à kwoŋo wɔ́b gwɔ́.
en: Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńgÿo mmó gie mèŋ n zɛté gẅí, mbà pi cʉ̌’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ meshǔ pɔ́ɔn.
en: Ye are my friends, if ye do whatsoever I command you.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie n kě ńzɛ́te gẅí, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie, pi gẅiin nkwòŋe pi né pi.
en: These things I command you, that ye love one another.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a njÿó lɔɔn ne ḿbʉa gẅí, pi zsé ngie pɔ́ la vɔg ḿbʉa wɔ̀ɔn yɔ́ɔn.
en: If the world hate you, ye know that it hated me beforeit hatedyou.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gÿo pú’u ná pi ńtí nue pi ee pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn, pɔ́ piŋ ńké tè ne ńzsé nyìŋ gẅi à la túmo wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́.
en: But all these things will they do unto you for my name's sake, because they know not him that sent me.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ḿbʉa wɔ̀ɔn, mbà à lɔgɔ ḿbʉa Tá wɔ̀ɔn.
en: He that hateth me hateth my Father also.

ngiemboon: Áa pú’u, ńdɔgɔ ḿbumte nà nò gie mé la gɔɔn tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne*lepʉ̌ yɔ́b ngie pɔ́ ka pʉa wɔ̀ɔn pɔ́ lê sóon.
en: Butthis cometh to pass, that the word might be fulfilled that is written in their law, They hated me without a cause.

ngiemboon: Pi gí gíŋe ńgwaa shwóŋó nò gie pi zsé ná mèŋ, à gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ pege zɔ gwɔ́ tà fó nzyetě.
en: and ye also shall bear witness, because ye have been with me from the beginning.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi mɔɔn menò légwɔ́ gie pi tè cʉ́’ nzèm gwá’a lézáb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ wɔ́.
en: These things have I spoken unto you, that ye should not be offended.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ge gÿo pú’u, mélà’mie pɔ́ kaa Tá zsé, ńké tè wɔ̀ɔn zsé.
en: And these things will they do unto you, because they have not known the Father, nor me.

ngiemboon: Pi kě ne ḿmÿaga mÿag, mélà’mie mèŋ shwoŋó gẅi ngie n ge gʉa.
en: But because I have said these things unto you, sorrow hath filled your heart.

ngiemboon: Nò tepòŋ gie à ge tó nyɛɛ wɔ́b, áa pá’ pɔ́ kaa záb ntʉ́m ná mèŋ wɔ́.
en: of sin, because they believe not on me;

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gyá ngie mèŋ wɔɔn zɔɔ nò nénʉ́, á nue mèŋ m biŋe né lejʉ́ŋ Tá wɔ̀ɔn, pi le gíŋe ńgyá wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́.
en: of righteousness, because I go to my Father, and ye see me no more;

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zsé ngie Ssé ge lá’ ŋaga wɔ́b, mélà’mie fùɔ gẅie à sá’a yɔɔn njÿó kéen ńgwe ntsaŋ.
en: of judgment, because the prince of this world is judged.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n giŋé ńgẅiin menò mie mèŋ n ge shwóŋó gẅi tɛ’, tá’ ńgwɔ́ pi le jú’ fʉ̀’ɔɔn wɔ́.
en: I have yet many things to say unto you, but ye cannot bear them now.

ngiemboon: À ge gÿo nyɛɛ wɔ̀ɔn legú’, mélà’mie à ge kẅé mbwo mèŋ tá zí’i gẅí.
en: He shall glorify me: for he shall receive of mine, and shall shewitunto you.

ngiemboon: Á cʉ́’ʉ mejʉ’ pi le gíŋe ńgyá wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́, à piŋ ńké ńgwaa láte pi gíŋe ńgyá wɔ̀ɔn.
en: A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me, because I go to the Father.

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn méjʉ’ méjʉ’ gẅie à gɔɔn lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie kɔ́? Pege tè ne ńjú’u mmó gie à fa’a légɔɔn wɔ́.
en: They said therefore, What is this that he saith,A little while?we cannot tell what he saith.

ngiemboon: À lyɛ’ó, pi lɔg lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn ńdúɔ mmó mbwo Ssé. Mèŋ n tè shwóŋó gẅi ngie mèŋ n ge gÿo sẅíŋte Tá wɔ̀ɔn ná né pi wɔ́.
en: At that day ye shall ask in my name: and I say not unto you, that I will pray the Father for you:

ngiemboon: Á nue kwà’ yé Tá wɔ̀ɔn kwoŋo gẅí. À kwoŋo gẅí, mélà’mie pi ka kwoŋo wɔ̀ɔn, ḿbiŋe ne ńzẅíŋe ngie yé zɔ la túmo wɔ̀ɔn.
en: for the Father himself loveth you, because ye have loved me, and have believed that I came out from God.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n da fóo mbwo Tá wɔ̀ɔn, ńtóo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó, mèŋ m biŋ ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńne fóo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó ńgee ne ńtsɛ́ Tá wɔ̀ɔn.
en: I came forth from the Father, and am come into the world: again, I leave the world, and go to the Father.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò yé lêen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie: Gyá pá’ ɔ̀ shʉ̀ashʉ̀a ńgɔɔn nò té lɔg sagá nò.
en: His disciples said unto him, Lo, now speakest thou plainly, and speakest no proverb.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie, ńzsé ngie pi lěen ńké ńzẅíŋ fʉ̀’ɔɔn wɔ̂!
en: Jesus answered them,Do ye now believe?

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ la ná metʉ̀ mbwo yé lélɔg ńdíe pʉ̀a mesoŋ, ńzsé ngie à ge náa légwɔ́ tèmì, á mbwo pʉ̀a metsèm pie ɔ̀ la náa mbwo yé.
en: as thou hast given him power over all flesh, that he should give eternal life to as many as thou hast given him.

ngiemboon: N ka gÿo mé gyá legú’ gù ndùmo ssé tsetsá’. Mèŋ m magá fà’ gie ɔ̀ ka náa mbwo mèŋ.
en: I have glorified thee on the earth: I have finished the work which thou gavest me to do.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ée fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńne ńzsé ngie, à kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie ɔ̀ la náa mbwo mèŋ wɔ́, fóo mbwo gù.
en: Now they have known that all things whatsoever thou hast given me are of thee.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n těen sẅíŋte ɔ́ ngie ɔ̀ fóo tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó ńkẅile wɔ́b gwɔ́, mèŋ sẅíŋte gú pɔ́ ngie ɔ̀ pɔ́ɔn wɔ́b ná Sátà nyìŋ tepòŋ.
en: I pray not that thou shouldest take them out of the world, but that thou shouldest keep them from the evil.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ té pʉ̀a njÿó wɔ́, ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn n tè nyìŋ njÿó wɔ́.
en: They are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.

ngiemboon: Lɔgɔ nò nénʉ́ jú ńgÿo pɔ́ cʉ́’ pʉ̀a pú tà shwóŋó nò. Ashwóŋè jú áa nénʉ́.
en: Sanctify them through thy truth: thy word is truth.

ngiemboon: Pá’ ɔ̀ la túmo wɔ̀ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó la, mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn n túmo wɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó.
en: As thou hast sent me into the world, even so have I also sent them into the world.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa ná mèŋ, m bǔ ná mbùm yɔ̀ɔn mbwo gù ńtí wɔ́b, ńzsé ngie pɔ́ gee fó nà nò nénʉ́, é cʉ́’ pʉ̀a pú tá shwóŋó nò.
en: And for their sakes I sanctify myself, that they also might be sanctified through the truth.

ngiemboon: Legú’ gẅie ɔ̀ la náa mbwo mèŋ la, aa wɛ̌ gẅie n ka náa mbwo pɔ́b, pɔ́ ge gwɔ́ tà’ nyìŋ pá’ pɔgɔ ée tà’ nyìŋ.
en: And the glory which thou gavest me I have given them; that they may be one, even as we are one:

ngiemboon: Yěsô zsé nò gie á ne ńtóo ná yé, ésẅɛ’te nnɛ́ né mvfò pɔ́b ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi fa’a wɔ́?
en: Jesus therefore, knowing all things that should come upon him, went forth, and said unto them,Whom seek ye?

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ tà ńgɔɔn mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Àa mèŋ, pɔ́ piŋ nzème nzème, ńgwete ssé.
en: As soon then as he had said unto them, I amhe, they went backward, and fell to the ground.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńzɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pi fa’a wɔ́? Pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie: Á Yěsô ye Nǎzarɛd.
en: Then asked he them again,Whom seek ye?And they said, Jesus of Nazareth.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Mèŋ shwoŋó gẅi ngie aa mèŋ. Á lɔɔn ńké ńgwɔ́ gie pi tóo fǎ’ mèŋ, pi nyé pɔɔn pʉ̀a pɔ́ gʉa.
en: Jesus answered,I have told you that I amhe: if therefore ye seek me, let these go their way:

ngiemboon: Anùɔ pàlÿɔ́’ ncù, pâ tándá wɔb lâ pà pyɛ́bɛ jʉ’e Ssé, é pie mekěm pà Yuda ně ńtúm, lêen ńké ńgwoon Yěsô, ńkwɛ́ɛ yé.
en: Then the band and the captain and officers of the Jews took Jesus, and bound him,

ngiemboon: Yé Kaifa aa nyìŋ gẅie à la gɔɔn mbwo mekěm Pà Yuda ngie: Mvfò aa pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tà’ nyìŋ kwé nà twó lá’.
en: Now Caiaphas was he, which gave counsel to the Jews, that it was expedient that one man should die for the people.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó ńgwɔ́ mvfò*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò. Á ne ńzɛ́te yé nò ná ngàŋa kwò yé, mbɔɔ ná mmó gie à zí’i pʉ̀a.
en: The high priest then asked Jesus of his disciples, and of his doctrine.

ngiemboon: Ánnɔ́ɔn lêen ńké ńtsẅi, tà Yěsô nyé pɔ́ menkÿo, mé lɔgɔ yé ńgʉa náa mbwo Kaifa, á*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò.
en: Now Annas had sent him bound unto Caiaphas the high priest.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gíŋe ḿmoŋe. Mênkɔ́’ gwóon ńtóŋ.
en: Peter then denied again: and immediately the cock crew.

ngiemboon: *Pilato kẅɛ́te wɔ́b pǐ, ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi sẅiŋe nyìŋ wɔɔn mélà’a kɔ́?
en: Pilate then went out unto them, and said, What accusation bring ye against this man?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: Nyìŋ áwɛ̌ ně ńgwé’e tè nò tepòŋ gÿo, mbà peg kaa lɔgɔ yé ńtóo mvfò gù wɔ́.
en: They answered and said unto him, If he were not a malefactor, we would not have delivered him up unto thee.

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ḿbumte ná nò gie Yěsô la cʉ́’ʉ léshwóŋ ntí gie à ge gÿo kwé ńgɔɔn.
en: that the saying of Jesus might be fulfilled, which he spake, signifying what death he should die.

ngiemboon: *Pilato leen ńké ḿbiŋe ndá, ńgÿo Yěsô tó, á zɛ́te yé ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ fùɔ pà Yuda lá?
en: Then Pilate entered into the judgment hall again, and called Jesus, and said unto him, Art thou the King of the Jews?

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́’ ngie: Kwà’ gù zɔ kwaŋte ńgɔɔn, kà tsɔ́ pʉ̀a zɔ̌ shwoŋó gú ngie mèŋ n gee fùɔ?
en: Jesus answered him,Sayest thou this thing of thyself, or did others tell it thee of me?

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie, mèŋ n tě ně ńgyá mmó gie mé ge cʉa mǒ tá gɔɔn ngie nyìŋ wɔɔn gwě ntsaŋ wɔ́.
en: And when he had said this, he went out again unto the Jews, and saith unto them, I find in him no faultat all.

ngiemboon: *Pilato lêen ńké ńnáa Yěsô ngie mé lɔg ngwɔɔn ńcúa yé.
en: Then Pilate therefore took Jesus, and scourgedhim.

ngiemboon: Pàlÿɔ́’ ncù lɔg menzóŋ ḿbá’a cÿɔ́’ɔ lefùɔ, éshuu twó Yěsô, ḿbíi pepaŋ nzsǒ ḿma’a ná yé.
en: And the soldiers platted a crown of thorns, and putiton his head, and they put on him a purple robe,

ngiemboon: Ńne sẅɛ́’te nnɛ́ ńtóo lejʉ́ŋ yé, ésíe yé ngie: Mé tsyɛ’té fùɔ pà Yuda! Ńtéme mbwó metuŋó yé.
en: and said, Hail, King of the Jews! and they smote him with their hands.

ngiemboon: Yěsô leen ńké ńgwaa kẅɛ, ńtɔ’ɔ cÿɔ́’ɔ menzóŋ, ḿma’a paŋ nzsǒ.*Pilato gɔɔn né mekěm pà Yuda ngie: Nyìŋ ŋwɛ́ wɛ̂.
en: Then came Jesus forth, wearing the crown of thorns, and the purple robe. AndPilatesaith unto them, Behold the man!

ngiemboon: Mekěm tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: À fʉ̌a*lepʉ̌ ség. Mé ge zẅé yé ńtí*lepʉ̌ sie à fʉ̌a. À gɔ̌ɔn ngie aa Míŋ Ssé.
en: The Jews answered him, We have a law, and by our law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God.

ngiemboon: *Pilato gwɔ́ tà ńjú’ pú’u, éfó ḿmege ńcÿɔ’.
en: When Pilate therefore heard that saying, he was the more afraid;

ngiemboon: MÀbiŋe ndá, ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ nyìŋ zsɔ̌? Tá Yěsô fó tè tsɔ́b.
en: and went again into the judgment hall, and saith unto Jesus, Whence art thou? But Jesus gave him no answer.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ gie mé cwoŋte línɔ́ɔn*Páskà, ńgwɔ́ mmó tsɛ̀ɛ zsǒ.*Pilato gɔɔn né pà Yuda ngie: Afùɔ gẅi wɛ.
en: And it was the preparation of the passover, and about the sixth hour: and he saith unto the Jews, Behold your King!

ngiemboon: Mé lêen ńké ńdɔgɔ Yěsô ńgʉa.
en: And they took Jesus, and ledhimaway.

ngiemboon: *Pilato gÿo mé ŋwe’e mmó, ńkime nà tÿǒ nkǐ. Á gwɔ́ mǒ ńgwɔ́ ngie: Yěsô nyìŋ Nǎzarɛd, fùɔ pà Yuda.
en: And Pilate wrote a title, and putiton the cross. And the writing was, JESUS OF NAZARETH THE KING OF THE JEWS.

ngiemboon: *Pilato tsɔ́’ ngie: Ammó gie mèŋ n ŋwe’é, n ně ńdá’ ŋwe’e.
en: Pilate answered, What I have written I have written.

ngiemboon: Má pà Yěsô pɔ́ mémá má we we manzwě, ńgÿo Malîɛ nzwě Kelopàs, mbɔɔ Malîɛ Magdala la tyé ngʉ̀ŋe tÿǒ nkǐ Yěsô.
en: Now there stood by the cross of Jesus his mother, and his mother's sister, Mary thewifeof Cleophas, and Mary Magdalene.

ngiemboon: Ńgíŋe ńgɔɔn mbwo*ngàŋa kwò we wá ngie: Má gù wɛ. Á fó fʉ̀’ áyɛ̌,*angàŋa kwò we wá lɔgɔ má pà Yěsô ńgʉa né mbʉ̀a yé.
en: Then saith he to the disciple,Behold thy mother!And from that hour that disciple took her unto his ownhome.

ngiemboon: Á sẅíte ńgɔɔn ngie: Ayɔ́ɔn fà’ magá, ńdeen ńké ńcʉ́ŋe twó yé, ńkwé.
en: When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said,It is finished:and he bowed his head, and gave up the ghost.

ngiemboon: Pàlÿɔ́’ ncù lêen ńké ńtó ḿbwɔ́’te mekwò ndùŋ mvfò, mbɔɔ me mbɔ́ɔntè nyìŋ gẅie mé pǔ ńkime wɔ́ba Yěsô.
en: Then came the soldiers, and brake the legs of the first, and of the other which was crucified with him.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa tà ńkúu ná Yěsô, ńgyá, mbà à ně ńdá’ ńkwé. Pɔ́ té gíŋe ḿbwɔ́’te mekwò mé wɔ́.
en: But when they came to Jesus, and saw that he was dead already, they brake not his legs:

ngiemboon: Tá tsɔ̌ tà’ ná pàlÿɔ́’ ncù lɔg lekwòŋ, ésɔbɔ gwoŋó nnɛ́ Yěsô. Metse pɔ́ ntse gwóon ńkẅɛɛ jʉ’ó.
en: but one of the soldiers with a spear pierced his side, and forthwith came there out blood and water.

ngiemboon: Mé la gíŋ ńŋwe’e ngie: «Pɔ́ ge lá’ ne líe nyìŋ gẅie pɔ́ lɔ̌g lekwòŋ ésɔbɔ yé».
en: And again another scripture saith, They shall look on him whom they pierced.

ngiemboon: Piɛ pɔ́ wéwɛ̌*ngàŋa kwò leen ńké ńkẅɛ, ńgʉa jʉ’e lesyè.
en: Peter therefore went forth, and that other disciple, and came to the sepulchre.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ mépʉ́a la pú ne ńkÿo kÿo, tá wetsɔ̌*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô zá’te mvfò Piɛ, ḿvɔgɔ jʉ’e lesyè.
en: So they ran both together: and the other disciple did outrun Peter, and came first to the sepulchre.

ngiemboon: Ńtéŋe twó yé, ńgyá shúm nzsó, é gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè, tá’ á ké tè tsoló kú.
en: And he stooping down,and looking in, saw the linen clothes lying; yet went he not in.

ngiemboon: Símo Piɛ gẅie à laa nzèm ńjwoŋte lêen ńké ńtó, ńzyɛ́’ ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè.
en: Then cometh Simon Peter following him, and went into the sepulchre, and seeth the linen clothes lie,

ngiemboon: Ńgyá mmó nzsó gie mé la zába nà twó Yěsô, á gwɔ́ ye mbwɔ’té, ńnuŋe nà yé jʉ’.
en: and the napkin, that was about his head, not lying with the linen clothes, but wrapped together in a place by itself.

ngiemboon: Wetsɔ̌*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gẅie à ně mvɔg ńtó lêen ńké ńkú yé tsoló, ńgyá mmó gie á cʉ̌a, ńzẅíŋ ngie áa nò.
en: Then went in also that other disciple, which came first to the sepulchre, and he saw, and believed.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwɔ́ mbɔɔ fʉ’ó, pɔ́ té jú’u mmó gie ŋwà’ne Ssé la lɔg ńda’te ngie Yěsô ge lá’ zíme nà legwé wɔ́.
en: For as yet they knew not the scripture, that he must rise again from the dead.

ngiemboon: *Ngàŋa kwò Yěsô lêen ńké ḿbiŋ nzèm.
en: Then the disciples went away again unto their own home.

ngiemboon: Malîɛ tó ńtyé ngʉ̀ŋe lesyè, ńne ńdʉa, ńdʉa tà ńtéŋe twó yé, ńdíe tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè.
en: But Mary stood without at the sepulchre weeping: and as she wept, she stooped down,and lookedinto the sepulchre,

ngiemboon: Ńnyé ńgɔɔn gɔɔn, ésele nnɛ́, ńgyá Yěsô tyé jʉ’ó, tá’ á ké tè zsé ngie aa Yěsô wɔ́.
en: And when she had thus said, she turned herself back, and saw Jesus standing, and knew not that it was Jesus.

ngiemboon: Yěsô tóŋo yé ngie: Malîɛ, á sele nnɛ́ ńtóŋo yé nà shwóŋè pà Heber ngie: Rabuni, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie Tsítsà.
en: Jesus saith unto her,Mary.She turned herself, and saith unto him, Rabboni; which is to say, Master.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gíŋe ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Mbʉ́lè gwɔ́ né pi. Pá’ Tá wɔ̀ɔn la túmo wɔ̀ɔn la, mèŋ n tumó gẅi yɔ́ɔn.
en: Then said Jesus to them again,Peacebeunto you: asmyFather hath sent me, even so send I you.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn pú’u, éfÿɔ́g fÿɔ́g ncwò ye ná pɔ́b, ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi kẅé Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a.
en: And when he had said this, he breathed onthem, and saith unto them,Receive ye the Holy Ghost:

ngiemboon: Tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ná nùɔ pʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ le Tomáse, ńdɔgɔ ngie mélefág, à la tè ssé fʉ̀’ gie Yěsô la tó wɔ́.
en: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came.

ngiemboon: Tomáse tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ̀ɔn, ńgwɔ́ Ssé yɔ̀ɔn.
en: And Thomas answered and said unto him, My Lord and my God.

ngiemboon: Yěsô la gíŋe ńgÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn á mvfò*ngàŋa kwò yé. Mé kaa mɛ̌ tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn ŋwà’ne ŋwe’e.
en: And many other signs truly did Jesus in the presence of his disciples, which are not written in this book:

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, Yěsô kẅɛ ńtyé nkʉ̀ŋ ntse, tá*ngàŋa kwò yé té zsé ngie aa yé wɔ́.
en: But when the morning was now come, Jesus stood on the shore: but the disciples knew not that it was Jesus.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Ńgie mbà pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn, tà pi fǒ ńgẅiin mbaŋ ssó lá? Pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie ngǎŋ.
en: Then Jesus saith unto them,Children, have ye any meat?They answered him, No.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tó fó tsɛ̀ɛ kanú’ ńkẅɛ tà ńtyé ssé, ńgyá mmɔ̌g megɔ́’, mbà mé zǎb messó nê mbelég ndumó.
en: As soon then as they were come to land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid thereon, and bread.

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi lêen ńké ńdɔg tsɔ́ messó mie pi foo légwoon la ńtó la.
en: Jesus saith unto them,Bring of the fish which ye have now caught.

ngiemboon: Yěsô lêen ńké sẅɛ’te nnɛ́, ḿbí mbelég ńná né pɔ́b, ḿbiŋ ńgíŋe ńná messó né pɔ́b.
en: Jesus then cometh, and taketh bread, and giveth them, and fish likewise.

ngiemboon: Yěsô nyɛɛ mbùm ye mbwo ngàŋa kwò yé pá’ɔɔn, é lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngʉ̀a ntá pá’ à kẅɛ̌ mvfò pɔ́b tà fó pá’ à ka zíme nà legwé.
en: This is now the third time that Jesus shewed himself to his disciples, after that he was risen from the dead.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gyá yé pú’u, ńzɛ́te Yěsô ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńgʉa ná wɔɔn nyìŋ, mbà à kɔ́ ge gÿo gÿo yé?
en: Peter seeing him saith to Jesus, Lord, and whatshallthis mando?

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gẅie mé gɔɔn, la gyá mɔɔn menò, yé zɔ la ŋwe’e. Peg piŋ ne ńzsé ngie nò gie à gɔɔn áa nénʉ́.
en: This is the disciple which testifieth of these things, and wrote these things: and we know that his testimony is true.

ngiemboon: Á ne ńkwɔ́’ɔ, pɔ́ tyé ńké ne ńdíe lefaŋ líe. Tsɔ́ pʉ̀a mépʉ́a lêen ńkẅɛ ńtyé lejʉ́ŋ pɔ́b, ḿmá’ mefefɔ́gɔ nzsǒ,
en: And while they looked stedfastly toward heaven as he went up, behold, two men stood by them in white apparel;

ngiemboon: Tá mbà à kaa tsɔ̌ tà’ nyìŋ nà nùɔ yég megàŋ ntúm. Tà ńgíŋe ńgẅiin yé twó fà’ gie à ge gÿo tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege.
en: For he was numbered with us, and had obtained part of this ministry.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ńcʉ́me ngie tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndyɛ’ɛ jÿó jʉ’ yé.
en: His bishoprick let another take.

ngiemboon: Alyɛ’ɛ́ línɔ́ɔn gie mé tóŋo le Paŋtekɔ̂dgÿo ńtó, á gwɔ gwɔ, mbà megàŋa kwò Yěsô cu’té tà’a jʉ’ métsèm.
en: And when the day of Pentecost was fully come, they were all with one accord in one place.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gyá tsɔ́ shúm kẅɛ, ńgwɔ́ pá’ lʉ́me mmɔ̌g lá, éshʉ́ate ńtyé nà wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b.
en: And there appeared unto them cloven tongues like as of fire, and it sat upon each of them.

ngiemboon: Á laa ná mɛ̌ melyɛ̌’, pà Yuda pie pɔ́ gÿo mekù’ Ssé, mbà pɔ́ ka fó tsɛ̀ɛ métúm ntsèm ńtó ńgwɔ́ Yerósalem.
en: And there were dwelling at Jerusalem Jews, devout men, out of every nation under heaven.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa kʉ’ʉ wɔ́b pɔ́ gíŋe ne saŋa nÿɔ́g ńgɔɔn ngie: Pʉ̀a pie é shwóŋó lɛ̀ té gwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a Galilea métsèm gwɔ́ lê?
en: And they were all amazed and marvelled, saying one to another, Behold, are not all these which speak Galilæans?

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ńgÿo lêkɔ́ wɔ̌wɔɔ nà pege cʉ́’ʉ ńjú’u, pɔ́ shwóŋó pɔ́ kwà’ shwóŋe lá’ ye?
en: And how hear we every man in our own tongue, wherein we were born?

ngiemboon: Á pú ńkʉ’ʉ wɔ́b tɛ’. Pɔ́ kwaŋ pɔ́ té cʉ́me, ńcʉ́’ sele ńzɛ́te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b pɔ́ ngie: Yɔɔn nò lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie kɔ́?
en: And they were all amazed, and were in doubt, saying one to another, What meaneth this?

ngiemboon: Tá petsɔ́ pʉ̀a ně ńgẅe*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô gẅe, ńgɔɔn ngie: Pʉ̀a pɛ̂ pʉ̌a melù’.
en: Others mocking said, These men are full of new wine.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pɔɔn kaa pʉ̌a melù’ pá’ pi kwaŋa lɛ̀ wɔ́. Wɔɔn zɔɔn ńnyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nèm lepfwɔ’ɔ́ mba’ámba’.
en: For these are not drunken, as ye suppose, seeing it isbutthe third hour of the day.

ngiemboon: Anò gie Joel,*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé la tʉ́ njyó ńgɔɔn zɔ̌ pá’ɔɔn ńdɔgɔ ḿbumte.
en: But this is that which was spoken by the prophet Joel;

ngiemboon: n dɔg njÿòon ńgɔɔn nò mbwo mezẅìŋe pʉ̀a pie ée tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi.
en: And your old men shall dream dreams:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ cʉ́’ pà ntsẅì nkʉ̀ pɔ́ɔn.
en: I will pour out in those days of my Spirit; and they shall prophesy:

ngiemboon: Mé gyá metse, ńgyá mmɔ̌g, ńgyá pá’ ndyé fu’u,
en: Blood, and fire, and vapour of smoke:

ngiemboon: é gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ gie e Ssé nyɛɛ mmó gie aa yɛ̌.
en: Day of the Lord come:

ngiemboon: À ké ńgwɔ́ pú’u, mânyìŋ ntsèm gẅie à ga’te ńtóŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, à tsẅɛ́.
en: And it shall come to pass,thatwhosoever shall call on the name of the Lord shall be saved.

ngiemboon: Tá e Ssé la kyɛ́’te menkÿo legwé nà yé, ńzíme yé mélà’ mie, á la zɔɔn ńtʉ́ pà’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ legwé ńnéŋe yé ndá tsǎŋ.
en: whom God hath raised up, having loosed the pains of death: because it was not possible that he should be holden of it.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ nà gwǒŋo pwó yɔ́ɔn yé tʉ̀, nně ńtóonte wɔ̀ɔn, légwɔ́ gie ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn té vege wɔ́.
en: For he is on my right hand, that I should not be moved:

ngiemboon: N zɔɔn fó ńkwé kwé, mbà pfó yɔ́ɔn ge nuŋe ne pyɛ́bɛ pyɛ̌b,
en: Moreover also my flesh shall rest in hope:

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ké lezẅíŋ ngie nyìŋ gẅie ɔ̀ la tsɔ́’ɔ yé à lʉ́ʉ tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè wɔ́.
en: Neither wilt thou suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge tó gwɔ́ jʉ’ gie ɔ́ɔ wó, anò poŋo wɔ̀ɔn. M bú ńkág tɛ’.
en: Thou shalt make me full of joy with thy countenance.

ngiemboon: *Nzà’nkÿo aa Yěsô. E Ssé ka zíme yé nà legwé, peg pɔɔn metsèm ne shwóŋó yɔɔn nò, á gwɔ́ nò gie peg ka gyá.
en: This Jesus hath God raised up, whereof we all are witnesses.

ngiemboon: Ńzẅí’te mèŋ n dɔg megàŋ mbù pú, ńgÿo ntÿɔ́gɔ mekwò mú».
en: Until I make thy foes thy footstool.

ngiemboon: Megàŋ ntúm la ně ńgÿo menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn mbɔɔ pâ ndàa gyá. Pʉ̀a métsèm gyá pú’u, ńcʉ́’ʉ ḿmɔɔn mmɔɔn.
en: And fear came upon every soul: and many wonders and signs were done by the apostles.

ngiemboon: Pàzẅíŋe nò Yěsô metsèm la gẅiin pɔ́ tà’ ntʉ́m, ńteme shúm sɔ́b tem.
en: And all that believed were together, and had all things common;

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tsɔ̌ mbÿɛ̀ njÿó, tà nèm tá fʉ̀’ gie mé tsyɛ’te Ssé ne ńku’u. Piɛ pɔ́ Jâŋ pʉ ńgʉa jʉ’e Ssé.
en: Now Peter and John went up together into the temple at the hour of prayer,beingthe ninthhour.

ngiemboon: Á gyá Piɛ pɔ́ Jâŋ ně ńcʉa ńgee tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé, á lúɔ nkáb mbwo pɔ́b.
en: who seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple asked an alms.

ngiemboon: Piɛ pɔ́ Jâŋ tÿɔ́g menÿɔ́g ná yé. Piɛ gɔɔn mbwo yé ngie, líe weg.
en: And Peter, fastening his eyes upon him with John, said, Look on us.

ngiemboon: Ngàŋa kwʉ́’te nyɛte ńtÿɔ́g menÿɔ́ ná pɔ́b, ńně ḿbyɛ́bɛ, ńně ńkwaŋa ngie á ge gÿo lêkɔ́ wɔ́ pɔ́ náa mmó né yé.
en: And he gave heed unto them, expecting to receive something of them.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, ńkibe pwó yé ye tʉ̀, ńně ḿbʉ’ʉ yé, mekwò mé pâ mejÿɔgɔ́ mekwò mé gwóon ńtʉte.
en: And he took him by the right hand, and liftedhimup: and immediately his feet and ankle bones received strength.

ngiemboon: Á lu ssé letʉ̀, ńzye légiŋ. Pâ ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô pú ńcʉa ńgee tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé. Á giŋe ńkyɛ́te, ńně ńgu’te Ssé.
en: And he leaping up stood, and walked, and entered with them into the temple, walking, and leaping, and praising God.

ngiemboon: Alá’ gie á laa jʉ’ó gyá pá’ à ne ńgiŋe ḿbiŋe ne ńgu’te Ssé.
en: And all the people saw him walking and praising God:

ngiemboon: Pi ka moŋe nyìŋ gẅie e Ssé la tsɔ́’, á gwɔ́ ndà’ nyìŋ gẅie aa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, ḿbiŋ sẅíŋte*pilato ngie à nyé fÿɛ́ né pi.
en: But ye denied the Holy One and the Just, and desired a murderer to be granted unto you;

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, mèŋ n cwoŋo ne ńzsé mboŋó ngie pi lâ mefùɔ pí ka lɔg pɔ́ gʉ̀gʉ̀ tá ńgÿo yɔɔn ntí nò nà Yěsô.
en: And now, brethren, I wot that through ignorance ye didit, asdidalso your rulers.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná nyìŋ gẅie à té lá’ jú’ ncwò wɛ̌*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé wɔ́, mé fó nùɔ pʉ̀a pie Ssé la tsɔ́’, ńkẅile yé, ńzẅé yé».
en: And it shall come to pass,thatevery soul, which will not hear that prophet, shall be destroyed from among the people.

ngiemboon: Piɛ pɔ́ Jâŋ la nyé ńgɔɔn nò mbwo lá’ gɔɔn, pànuŋe pwɔ́’, ńgÿo pàpyɛ̀bɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé lâ pà*sadukay tó.
en: And as they spake unto the people, the priests, and the captain of the temple, and the Sadducees, came upon them,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwoon wɔ́b. Á gwɔ́ gwɔ́ ńcʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ncwò nzèm. Pɔ́ ńnéŋe wɔ́b ndá tsǎŋ légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ ge lá’a wó tá njÿó lʉ́a.
en: And they laid hands on them, and putthemin hold unto the next day: for it was now eventide.

ngiemboon: Njÿó lá lʉ́a, pàsa’á lá’ pà Yuda lâ melÿò, pâ*pàkyagte lepʉ̌ Mǒsê pú ńcú’te Yerósalem.
en: And it came to pass on the morrow, that their rulers, and elders, and scribes,
