ngiemboon: À Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a jÿó Piɛ. Á lêen ńké ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Ghost, said unto them, Ye rulers of the people, and elders of Israel,

ngiemboon: «Tóon gẅie pàkwɛ́ ndá la gwá’, à kéen ńcʉ́’ʉ tóon lezẅé ndá».
en: This is the stone which was set at nought of you builders, which is become the head of the corner.

ngiemboon: Ńně ńgyá pá’ nyìŋ gẅie à ka zeŋe tyé lejʉ́ŋ Piɛ pɔ́ Jâŋ, pɔ́ té gíŋe ńzsé tsɔ́ nò gie pɔ́ ge gɔɔn wɔ́,
en: And beholding the man which was healed standing with them, they could say nothing against it.

ngiemboon: ńdêen ńké ńtsẅi mé gÿo pɔ́ fó jʉ’ʉ ntsaŋ ńkẅɛ. Pɔ́ kwaŋte pá’ pɔ́ ge gÿo,
en: But when they had commanded them to go aside out of the council, they conferred among themselves,

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà peg, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ peg léláŋte nà nò gie peg la jú’ ḿbiŋ ńgyá wɔ́.
en: For we cannot but speak the things which we have seen and heard.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋ ńgwɔ́ gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à la zeŋe nà ntí ye mmɔɔn mmɔɔn lɔɔn, la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà à tɔ̌g ngù’ móm lekúa.
en: For the man was above forty years old, on whom this miracle of healing was shewed.

ngiemboon: Melá’ melá’ fa’a nò pá’ɔɔn á gwɔ́ mélà’a kɔ́?
en: And the people imagine vain things?

ngiemboon: mbɔɔ nyìŋ gẅie à la zɔ́’ɔ yé ńdɔg ńgÿo fùɔ
en: Against the Lord, and against his Christ.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la táŋa yé pú’u, ńdêen ḿbú ńgÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie gù Ssé, ɔ̀ lá lá’ ńtʉ́ njÿó ńkwaŋte ńzáb ngie á ge lá’ gwɔ́ pú’u.
en: for to do whatsoever thy hand and thy counsel determined before to be done.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, líe fʉ̀’ɔɔn tá ńgyá pá’ pɔ́ ne ḿbebe weg. Náa shÿɔ́g mbwo ngàŋa fà’ jú, pɔ́ shwóŋó nò jú té pɔ́g.
en: And now, Lord, behold their threatenings: and grant unto thy servants, that with all boldness they may speak thy word,

ngiemboon: ńnuŋe mekwò megàŋ ntúm. Mé gabte náa yé wɔ̌wɔɔ pá’ e ge ku’u nà yé nò.
en: and laidthemdown at the apostles' feet: and distribution was made unto every man according as he had need.

ngiemboon: À la sẅiŋ wé nká’, ńdɔg nkáb ńtó nùŋe mekwò megàŋ ntúm.
en: having land, soldit, and brought the money, and laiditat the apostles' feet.

ngiemboon: Tá’, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie mé lɔ́ɔn ńtóŋo yé le Ananias pɔ́ nzwě wé Safira gʉa sẅiŋe jʉ’ʉ nká’ yɔ́b,
en: But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira his wife, sold a possession,

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà á ně ńkwé pú’u, pûɔ ngwàshùm tó ńdɔgɔ pwó nzsǒ ńzémte pfó yé, ńkaa yé ńgʉa ńtúŋ,
en: And the young men arose, wound him up, and carriedhimout, and buriedhim.

ngiemboon: é gwaa cʉa mmó nèm ntá, nzwě wé tó ńzyɛ’ ńkúu ndá. À te ne ńzsé mmó gie á gÿǒ wɔ́.
en: And it was about the space of three hours after, when his wife, not knowing what was done, came in.

ngiemboon: Piɛ zɛ́te yé ngie: Shwóŋo wɔ̀ɔn, pi ně sẅíŋ nká’ pɔ́ pá’ɔɔn lá? Á gɔɔn ngie: Oon, peg ně sẅiŋ pɔ́ pɛ́’ɛ.
en: And Peter answered unto her, Tell me whether ye sold the land for so much? And she said, Yea, for so much.

ngiemboon: Acú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo mbɔɔ tsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la jú’u yɔɔn nò pú ḿbɔ́g tɛ’.
en: And great fear came upon all the church, and upon as many as heard these things.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ ké tě fʉ’ʉ lékúu nùɔ pɔ́b wɔ́, tá pʉ̀a metsèm ké ne ńgɔ’te ngÿǒ menò mɔ́b tɛ’.
en: And of the rest durst no man join himself to them: but the people magnified them.

ngiemboon: Mbàŋa tà ńgyɔ́ɔn lâ pànzwě la ne ńzába ntʉ́m nà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tá ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ nùɔ yɔ́b á kẅi’i.
en: And believers were the more added to the Lord, multitudes both of men and women.)

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ̌ túm pʉ̀a, pɔ́ gwoon megàŋ ntúm ńnéŋe wɔ́b ndá tsǎŋ gie mé lɔ́ɔn ńnéŋe megàŋa tsǎŋ ntsèm wó.
en: and laid their hands on the apostles, and put them in the common prison.

ngiemboon: Tá á gÿo ńgwɔ́ letsẅɛ’, atsɔ̌ cÿɔ́’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tó, ńtsɔ́’ ndá tsǎŋ, ńgÿo megàŋ ntúm gwaa kẅɛ, á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie:
en: But the angel of the Lord by night opened the prison doors, and brought them forth, and said,

ngiemboon: Pi gʉa ńtyé tsɛ̀ɛ gyɛ̌ gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ*jʉ’ʉ Ssé éshwóŋó lá’ menò mie é líe le gwɔ́ we sẅe.
en: Go, stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life.

ngiemboon: Tá megàŋa fà’ gʉa ńkúu ndá tsǎŋ, pɔ́ te wɔ́b gya, ḿbiŋ nzèm shwóŋ pʉ̀a pie é ně ńtúmo wɔ́b ngie:
en: But when the officers came, and found them not in the prison, they returned, and told,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔg megàŋ ntúm ńtó, ńtÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b mvfò pàsá’a lá’. Tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie:
en: And when they had brought them, they setthembefore the council: and the high priest asked them,

ngiemboon: Tá’ Piɛ pâ megàŋ ntúm tsɔ́’ ngie: Á zɛ́te ngie me jú’ ncwò Ssé, ńcʉa le jú’ ncwò pʉ̀a mésoŋ.
en: Then Peter and theotherapostles answered and said, We ought to obey God rather than men.

ngiemboon: E Ssé pàmangʉa njʉ’ pégè, ka gÿo Yěsô gẅie pi ka kime yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ la, zíme nà legwé.
en: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom ye slew and hanged on a tree.

ngiemboon: Mekěm jú’ pá’ pɔ́ gɔ̌ɔn pú’u, mbú ńgyáŋa lóŋ, ńzyé lékwaŋte lézẅé megàŋ ntúm.
en: When they heardthat, they were cutto the heart, and took counsel to slay them.

ngiemboon: Megàŋ ntúm kẅɛ, Gamaliel gɔɔn ngie: Pà Israel, pi laga twó gí nà nò gie pi fa’a légÿo nà pʉ̀a pɛ.
en: and said unto them, Ye men of Israel, take heed to yourselves what ye intend to do as touching these men.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zẅíŋe nò gie Gamaliel gɔ̌ɔn,
en: but if it be of God, ye cannot overthrow it; lest haply ye be found even to fight against God.

ngiemboon: ńgʉa nà peg, peg ké ńzsé yég pɔ́ lésẅíŋte Ssé, ḿbiŋ ne shwóŋó pʉ̀a pɔ́ nò yé.
en: But we will give ourselves continually to prayer, and to the ministry of the word.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la tsɔ́’ pʉ̀a pɔɔn, ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńtó, ńnyɛɛ mbwo megàŋ ntúm. Megàŋ ntúm sẅíŋte Ssé, ńzáb mbwo twó pɔ́b.
en: whom they set before the apostles: and when they had prayed, they laidtheirhands on them.

ngiemboon: Pâ pɔ̌ ně ńzoŋo pú’u, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ té ŋaga yé tà ńjÿó wɔ́, mélà’mie Zẅìge Ssé lɔ́ɔn náa yé legye lélɔg ńgɔɔn nò.
en: And they were not able to resist the wisdom and the spirit by which he spake.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gyá kékáŋ, ńdúŋ pʉ̀a, ńtsẅi né pɔ́b ngie pɔ́ gɔɔn ngie pɔ́ ka jú’ pá’ Etien shwóŋó té pòŋ nà Mǒsê mbɔɔ nà Ssé.
en: Then they suborned men, which said, We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses, andagainstGod.

ngiemboon: Tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ zɛ́te Etien ngie: Anò gie n jú’u mé gɔɔn ná gù áa nò?
en: Then said the high priest, Are these things so?

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Nye tsìŋe ndá gí, éfó tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅi ńkẅɛ, ńgʉa le nà tsɔ́ lá’ gie mèŋ n ge nyɛɛ gú.
en: and said unto him, Get thee out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and come into the land which I shall shew thee.

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ́b lêen ńké ńjú’ mé yé shúm léjÿó ée tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Egipto. Á túm pàmagʉa njʉ’ pégè á wó á nà nduŋ mvfò légʉa.
en: But when Jacob heard that there was corn in Egypt, he sent out our fathers first.

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ́b gʉa Egipto, ńnéŋe wó tà ndá’ ńkwé. Pàmangʉa njʉ’ pégè gÿo ńgíŋe ńkwéte yɔ́b.
en: So Jacob went down into Egypt, and died, he, and our fathers,

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ fùɔ gÿo ńne sá’a pà Egipto, ńgwɔ́ gẅie à la tè Yesyɛ̂b zsé,
en: Till another king arose, which knew not Joseph.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó ŋwɛ́, mé lêen ńké zyé Mǒsê, á gwɔ́ múɔ, kwáŋ shÿó we lʉ́ate tɛ’. Mé gẅiin yé pɔ́ ndá tá we nà mesaŋ métá,
en: In which time Moses was born, and was exceeding fair, and nourished up in his father's house three months:

ngiemboon: ńgÿo ńgʉa tsɛ̀ɛ megǐ ńgwá’a yé. Tá míŋ fùɔ Faraon we manzwě kaa yé ńdɔg ńgʉa né mbʉ̀a yé, ńkwé’te yé ńdɔg ńgÿo míŋ we.
en: and when he was cast out, Pharaoh's daughter took him up, and nourished him for her own son.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ńgẅiin ngù’u lá’ móm lekùa, akwàŋte légyá mefɛ́ pé pà Israel, tóo twó ye.
en: And when he was full forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brethren the children of Israel.

ngiemboon: Á kúu lejʉ́ŋ pɔ́b, ńgyá tsɔ̌ nyìŋ Egipto ně ńcúa nyìŋ Israel. Á tág nzèm nyìŋ Israel, ńzẅé nyìŋ Egipto.
en: And seeing oneof themsuffer wrong, he defendedhim, and avenged him that was oppressed, and smote the Egyptian:

ngiemboon: Tá nyìŋ gẅie à ně ńzye mèlà’, pe’e Mǒsê ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Kwà’ wɔ́ zɔ ka lɔgɔ gú ńgÿo fùɔ pá’ ɔ̀ ge ŋag mentsaŋ még?
en: But he that did his neighbour wrong thrust him away, saying, Who made thee a ruler and a judge over us?

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ fa’a lézẅé wɔ̀ɔn pá’ ɔ̀ ka zẅé nyìŋ Egipto jǔɔ la keen?
en: Wilt thou kill me, as thou diddest the Egyptian yesterday?

ngiemboon: Mǒsê jú’ pú’u, ńkÿo ńgʉa né túm, á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Madiaŋ, ńnéŋe wó, ńgÿo ńzyé pûɔ mbàŋa mepʉ́a.
en: Then fled Moses at this saying, and was a stranger in the land of Madian, where he begat two sons.

ngiemboon: Mǒsê gyá wɛ̌ mmɔ̌g, é kʉ’ʉ yé. Á sẅɛ’te nnɛ́, ńně ńdíe, ńjú’ ngyè Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn né yé ngie:
en: When Moses sawit, he wondered at the sight: and as he drew near to beholdit, the voice of the Lord came unto him,

ngiemboon: Tá’ pàmangʉa njʉ’ pégè pɛ̌, la tè kwoŋo le jú’ ncwò Mǒsê wɔ́, ḿbe’e yé pe’e. Tà ńtsɔ́ɔn le gíŋe ḿbiŋe ngwòŋ Egipto,
en: to whom our fathers would not obey, but thrusthimfrom them, and in their hearts turned back again into Egypt,

ngiemboon: ńgwa menɔ̀ɔn ńdɔg ńgu’te wɔ̀ɔn mɔɔn ka?
en: By the space offorty years in the wilderness?

ngiemboon: pi gʉa tà ńtɔ́g ngwòŋ Mbabilonia.
en: And I will carry you away beyond Babylon.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la pú ńkwoŋo fùɔ Ndavíd tɛ’. Á sẅíŋte yé ngie à zẅíŋ à kwɛ́ɛ jʉ’ yé gẅie aa Ssé Yakwɔ́b.
en: who found favour before God, and desired to find a tabernacle for the God of Jacob.

ngiemboon: Tá míŋ we fùɔ Salomo zɔ̌ lá’ ńcʉ́’ tá ńkwɛ́ɛ jʉ’ ná né Ssé.
en: But Solomon built him an house.

ngiemboon: ajʉ’ gie á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n zẅɛte wó, áa wó?
en: Or whatisthe place of my rest?

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n zɔ la tè nyɛte shúm ntsèm wâ?
en: Hath not my hand made all these things?

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn pi pɛ̂ pie*cÿɔ́’ Ssé la lɔg mbʉ̌ Ssé ńtó ńnáa mbwo pi, pi ké tè mǒ giŋ.
en: who have received the law by the disposition of angels, and have not keptit.

ngiemboon: Pàsá’ ntsaŋ la jú’ pú’u, lóŋ wɔb ffó. Pɔ́ lu ssé nzèm Etien,
en: When they heard these things, they were cut to the heart, and they gnashed on him withtheirteeth.

ngiemboon: Etien gɔɔn ngie: Mèŋ n ne ńgyá pá’ ncwò tÿǒ lepwó tsɔ’ɔ́ ńtyé.*Míŋ Nyìŋ tyé nà gwǒŋo pwó Ssé ye tʉ̀.
en: and said, Behold, I see the heavens opened, and the Son of man standing on the right hand of God.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ pú’u, ńziŋe metuŋó mɔ́b, ńga’te lê tʉ̀, ńzyɛ́’ ḿbʉle ná yé,
en: Then they cried out with a loud voice, and stopped their ears, and ran upon him with one accord,

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la gwaa ně lɔgɔ metóon témte Etien, á sẅíŋte Ssé ńgɔɔn ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô, azẅìge yɔ́ɔn yɛ nà mbwo mú.
en: And they stoned Stephen, calling uponGod, and saying, Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.

ngiemboon: Á la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà tsɔ́ pà Yuda pie pɔ́ gÿo mekù’ Ssé ka ńnéŋe pfó Etien tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè, ḿbiŋ mbú ńdʉa legwé sé tɛ’.
en: And devout men carried Stephento his burial, and made great lamentation over him.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a Kristo pie pɔ́ la sa jʉ’, gʉa jʉ’ ntsèm tsɛ̀ɛ lá’, ńgiŋe ńtsẅii nkʉ̀ mbòŋo Yěsô.
en: Therefore they that were scattered abroad went every where preaching the word.

ngiemboon: Filib gʉa tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ tÿǒsoŋo Samalîɛ, ńkúu wó, ésá’a nò*Nzà’nkÿo.
en: Then Philip went down to the city of Samaria, and preached Christ unto them.

ngiemboon: Mé lêen ńké ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ, ḿbú ńcʉ́’ʉ ńkága kǎg tɛ’.
en: And there was great joy in that city.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńcwoŋo ńzẅí’te shwóŋè yé, mélà’mie tà fó tàa lyɛ̌’, á ně ńdɔgɔ lekàŋ ńgÿo menò mie é kʉ’ʉ pʉ̀a kʉ’ʉ.
en: And to him they had regard, because that of long time he had bewitched them with sorceries.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa ńkúu wó, ésẅíŋte Ssé nà twó pɛ̌ pʉ̀a Samalîɛ légwɔ́ gie e Ssé ge ńnéŋe Zẅìge yé ná pɔ́b,
en: who, when they were come down, prayed for them, that they might receive the Holy Ghost:

ngiemboon: mélà’mie a Zẅìge Ssé la nyé tè kǔ nà tsoon tà’ nyìŋ wɔb. Mé la nu’u wɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ ntse pɔ́ ndà’ ná lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô.
en: (for as yet he was fallen upon none of them: only they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.)

ngiemboon: Piɛ pɔ́ Jâŋ záb mbwo twó pɔ́b, à Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a lêen ńké ńkúu ná pɔ́b.
en: Then laid theytheirhands on them, and they received the Holy Ghost.

ngiemboon: Símo gyá pá’ ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô ne ńzába mbwo twó pʉ̀a, à Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a kúu ná pɔ́b, ḿbÿé wɔ́b nkáb,
en: And when Simon saw that through laying on of the apostles' hands the Holy Ghost was given, he offered them money,

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ pÿé ńgɔɔn ngie: Pi gÿo mèŋ n ku’ yɔ́ɔn pá’ ngwɔ́ n záb mbwo twó nyìŋ, à Zẅìge Ssé kúu ná ngàŋ.
en: saying, Give me also this power, that on whomsoever I lay hands, he may receive the Holy Ghost.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n zɔɔn ne ńgyá ngie kègɔ́’ léen ńcʉŋte ntʉ́m ɔ̀. Ɔ̀ cʉ́’ nkwɔ̀ɔn nò tepòŋ.
en: For I perceive that thou art in the gall of bitterness, andinthe bond of iniquity.

ngiemboon: Símo tsɔ́’ ngie: Kwà’ pi zɔ sẅíŋte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ná twó yɔ́ɔn. À cʉa pú’u, ànò gie pi gɔɔn á le gÿo wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́.
en: Then answered Simon, and said, Pray ye to the Lord for me, that none of these things which ye have spoken come upon me.

ngiemboon: À la ne fóo Yerósalem ḿbiŋe, ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ kélêg, ńne ńtóŋo ŋwà’ne Ntẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé Esǎya.
en: was returning, and sitting in his chariot read Esaias the prophet.

ngiemboon: A Zẅìge Ssé gɔɔn né Filib ngie: Jwoŋte kélêg wɛ.
en: Then the Spirit said unto Philip, Go near, and join thyself to this chariot.

ngiemboon: ńdáŋte pɔ́ pá’ mûɔ*njʉ̀njÿò gẅie mé ne ńkwóon menòŋ mé.
en: So opened he not his mouth:

ngiemboon: pá’ mé la zá’a yé zǎ’ ńzẅé.
en: For his life is taken from the earth.

ngiemboon: Filib lêen ńké ńgwɔ gɔɔn nò lélɔg ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo ná Yěsô, ńzye pɔ́ kwà’ ná yɔɔn jʉ’e ŋwà’ne ŋwɛ́.
en: Then Philip opened his mouth, and began at the same scripture, and preached unto him Jesus.

ngiemboon: Sɔ̂l kê ńgwɔ́ fʉ’ó, ńnyé nzèm*ngàŋa kwò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńzá’a pɔ́ nkwɔ̀ɔn ngie à ge zẅéte wɔ́b, ńgʉa ńgyá Tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’,
en: And Saul, yet breathing out threatenings and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord, went unto the high priest,

ngiemboon: Sɔ̂l nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mánzsè, tà mbà à gʉa tà ńcʉ́’ʉ lékúu Ndamas, ńgwóon ńgyá tsɔ́ mmó fó tÿǒ lepwó, ḿbú ńkyɛ’ɛ yé tɛ’.
en: And as he journeyed, he came near Damascus: and suddenly there shined round about him a light from heaven:

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́’ɔ ńgwe ssé, ńjú’ ngyè nyìŋ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Sɔ̂l, Sɔ̂l, ɔ̀ tsɔ́’ɔ kwò yɔ́ɔn té poŋ mélà’a kɔ́?
en: and he fell to the earth, and heard a voice saying unto him,Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie pâ Sɔ̂l ke ńgwɔ́ nùɔ, tyé, ńjú’ yɛ̌ ngyè, ńké tè nyìŋ gyá, ḿbiŋ tè ku’u légɔɔn tsɔ́ nò wɔ́.
en: And the men which journeyed with him stood speechless, hearing a voice, but seeing no man.

ngiemboon: Á kúu wó, ńnéŋe lyɛ̌’ tá té gyá jʉ’. À tè lǎga mmó jÿó, ńké tè ntse nú.
en: And he was three days without sight, and neither did eat nor drink.

ngiemboon: Mbà mèŋ n nyɛ̌ yé ngie tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ge tó mé tóŋo yé le Ananias. À kúu ndá, ńzáb mbwo twó yé tá à lêen ńké ńgíŋe ńgyá jʉ’.
en: and hath seen in a vision a man named Ananias coming in, and puttinghishand on him, that he might receive his sight.

ngiemboon: Kwà’ mèŋ n ge zɔɔn gÿo, à pú ńzsé nzẅìŋ ngɔ́’ gie à ge gyá é tí nò yɔ́ɔn.
en: for I will shew him how great things he must suffer for my name's sake.

ngiemboon: Sɔ̂l ńnéŋe Ndamas tsɔ́ nzẅìŋ melyɛ̌’, á tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a Kristo.
en: Then was Saul certain days with the disciples which were at Damascus.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ gwɔ, mbà à ka tè zẅí’te tá ńzye légwá ńkú mendá mecú’tè pà Yuda mie ée wó, ńne sá’a ngie Yěsô aa Míŋ Ssé wɔ́.
en: And straightway he preached Christ in the synagogues, that he is the Son of God.

ngiemboon: É cʉa tsɔ́ nzẅìŋ lyɛ̌’, pà Yuda ŋwɛ́ zába légÿo mé zẅé Sɔ̂l,
en: And after that many days were fulfilled, the Jews took counsel to kill him:

ngiemboon: ńgyá pà Yuda pie pɔ́ shwóŋe Gelekia, pâ pɔ̌ zoŋo nò mǒ zoŋ tà pɔ́ cʉ́’ʉ fa’a shÿó pɔ́ lézẅé yé.
en: And he spake boldly in the name of the Lord Jesus, and disputed against the Grecians: but they went about to slay him.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́ gwɔ́ tà ńzsé pú’u, ńdɔgɔ Sɔ̂l ńgʉa Sezare, ńtsege, ńkúu wó ńgÿo á lɔg ye Tarso ńgʉa.
en: Whichwhen the brethren knew, they brought him down to Cæsarea, and sent him forth to Tarsus.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gÿo ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ ne ńgwá ńgiŋe tsɛ̀ɛ lá’, ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌’, ńgʉa mbʉ̀a pʉ̀a Kristo pie pɔ́ tsẅé Lida,
en: And it came to pass, as Peter passed throughout allquarters, he came down also to the saints which dwelt at Lydda.

ngiemboon: ńkúu wó, ńgyá tsɔ̌ nyìŋ, mé tóŋo yé le Enée. Mbà à nuŋé kǔ guɔ ngù’ lefɔ̌ɔn, ńgwɔ́ ngàŋa kwʉ́’te.
en: And there he found a certain man named Æneas, which had kept his bed eight years, and was sick of the palsy.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gɔɔn né yé ńgie: Enée, Yěsô Kristo gÿǒ ɔ̀ zeŋe. Lu ssé, kwà’ gù zɔ cwoŋte kǔ ɔ́. Enée gwóon ńdu ssé.
en: And Peter said unto him, Æneas, Jesus Christ maketh thee whole: arise, and make thy bed. And he arose immediately.

ngiemboon: Piɛ kíbe pwó yé, ńgÿo á lu ssé. Á leen ńké ńtóŋ pʉ̀a Kristo lâ mepfɔ̌g, ńnyɛɛ Tapita mbwo pɔ́b, á gwɔ́ ntentʉ́.
en: And he gave herhishand, and lifted her up, and when he had called the saints and widows, presented her alive.

ngiemboon: Ngwòŋ pʉ̀a pie é laa Jope, jú’u yɔɔn nò gie á cʉatě, pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn záb ntʉ́m ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô.
en: And it was known throughout all Joppa; and many believed in the Lord.

ngiemboon: Piɛ ná’a ńtsẅé Jope, ńne ńnéŋe ndá tsɔ̌ Símo gẅie aa ngàŋ levfò ná lelɔ́ɔn*mengùb menɔ̀ɔn.
en: And it came to pass, that he tarried many days in Joppa with one Simon a tanner.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ɔɔn lá, túm pʉ̀a pɔ́ gʉa Jope, éfa’a tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie mé tóŋo yé lê Símo. Setsɔ́ lezíŋ sé gíŋe ńgwɔ́ lê Piɛ.
en: And now send men to Joppa, and call foroneSimon, whose surname is Peter:

ngiemboon: À neŋé ndá tsɔ̌ nyìŋ. Esé lezíŋ gíŋe ńgwɔ́ lê Símo. Angàŋ fa’a ná*mengùb menɔ̀ɔn, e ye ndá gwɔ́ ngʉ̀ŋe ntse té pàa.
en: he lodgeth with one Simon a tanner, whose house is by the sea side: he shall tell thee what thou oughtest to do.

ngiemboon: Kornɛy tóŋo wɔ́b pú’u, ńdeen ńké ḿbíte kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á cʉ̌a, éshwóŋó wɔ́b, tá ńtúmo wɔ́b Jope.
en: and when he had declared allthesethings unto them, he sent them to Joppa.

ngiemboon: Ntí ntí menɔ̀ɔn pú ńgwɔ́ tsoló. Menɔ́ɔn mekwo lekùa, menɔ̀ɔn pie pɔ́ shwóŋó lepfòm sɔ́b pɔ́ ssé, ńgÿo meshʉ́ŋ
en: wherein were all manner of fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the air.

ngiemboon: Ngyè nyìŋ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Piɛ, lu ssé, ńzẅé ḿpfɛ́.
en: And there came a voice to him,Rise, Peter; kill, and eat.

ngiemboon: Piɛ tsɔ́’ ngie: Ngǎŋ me Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Mèŋ n daa zɔɔn ńjÿó mmó gie*lepʉ̌ tɔ’ wɔ́, ḿbiŋ ńké tè pfɛ́ɛ mmó nzse wɔ́.
en: But Peter said, Not so, Lord; for I have never eaten any thing that is common or unclean.

ngiemboon: Piɛ gíŋe ńjú’ ngyè nyìŋ nà mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a, é gɔɔn né yé ngie: Ammó lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tà Ssé kẅile*lɔ̌’, tè gíŋe ńzse nzse mǒ.
en: And the voicespakeunto him again the second time,What God hath cleansed,thatcall not thou common.

ngiemboon: Á ké ńjú’ pɔ́ pú’u, tà é gwɔ́ ngʉ̀a ntá. Mé lêen ńké ńgwóon ńdɔgɔ yɛ̌ mmó ḿbiŋ ne tÿǒ lepwó.
en: This was done thrice: and the vessel was received up again into heaven.

ngiemboon: ńtóŋ ńzɛ́te ngie: Símo gẅie mé gíŋe ńtóŋo yé le Piɛ tsẅé jʉ’ɔɔn.
en: and called, and asked whether Simon, which was surnamed Peter, were lodged there.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́ Piɛ ké nyé ńkwaŋte pɔ́ nò gie à fóo légyá. A Zẅìge Ssé shwóŋó yé ngie: Pʉ̀a métá ée jʉ’ɔɔn ne fa’a gú.
en: While Peter thought on the vision, the Spirit said unto him, Behold, three men seek thee.

ngiemboon: Lu ssé, ésẅɛ́’, pia pɔ̌ gʉa. Tè zoŋ á nue mèŋ n zɔ tumó wɔ́b.
en: Arise therefore, and get thee down, and go with them, doubting nothing: for I have sent them.

ngiemboon: Piɛ tó tà ńgwɔ́ ńkúu ndá, Kornɛy tó ńzá’a yé, ńnuŋe mekwò yé, ńgÿo mekù’ mé.
en: And as Peter was coming in, Cornelius met him, and fell down at his feet, and worshippedhim.

ngiemboon: Tá Piɛ pʉ’ʉ yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Lu ssé, mèŋ n gee yɔ́ɔn pɔ́ nyìŋ mesoŋ pá’ gù.
en: But Peter took him up, saying, Stand up; I myself also am a man.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ yé gwaa zyɛ́’ kúu ndá, ńgiŋe shwóŋe. Piɛ gyá, mbà pʉ̀a pǔ ńcú’te ndá tà ńgyɔ́ɔn gyɔ́ɔn.
en: And as he talked with him, he went in, and found many that were come together.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Kornɛy, e Ssé ju’ú sẅíŋte jú. À kaa lege shúm sie ɔ̀ náa mbwo mepóŋ ńdɔgɔ ńkẅéte wɔ́b la wɔ́.
en: and said, Cornelius, thy prayer is heard, and thine alms are had in remembrance in the sight of God.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgÿo mekù’ Ssé, ńgíŋ ńgÿo mmó gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nyìŋ yɛ̌ lá’ gwɔ́, mbà nò yé ge poŋ Ssé poŋ.
en: but in every nation he that feareth him, and worketh righteousness, is accepted with him.

ngiemboon: Tá’, á kaa nà mbɔ́ɔntè lyɛ̌’ tá, e Ssé zíme yé nà legwé, ńgÿo á kẅɛ ńnyɛ mbùm ye.
en: him God raised up the third day, and shewed him openly;

ngiemboon: Piɛ nyé ńgɔɔn nò gɔɔn, a Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a sẅɛ́’, ńkúu nà ngwòŋ pʉ̀a metsèm pie pɔ́ ne ńzẅí’te nò gie à ne ńgɔɔn.
en: While Peter yet spake these words, the Holy Ghost fell on all them which heard the word.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɔɔn ńgíŋe ne ńjú’u pɔ́ ne ńdɔgɔ shwóŋè lá’a ndyɛ̀’ɛ ńnáa mekù’ mbwo Ssé. Piɛ gyá pú’u, ńcʉ́’ ńgɔɔn pɔ́ ngie:
en: For they heard them speak with tongues, and magnify God. Then answered Peter,

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀’ɔɔn gie pɔ́ ně ńdá’ ńkẅé Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a pá’ peg la, à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gíŋe ńtɔ́’ɔ lénu’u wɔ́b ntse lá?
en: Can any man forbid water, that these should not be baptized, which have received the Holy Ghost as well as we?

ngiemboon: Piɛ gÿo ńgwɔ́ tà ḿbiŋe Yerósalem, pʉ̀a Kristo pie ée pà Yuda zye léŋaga yé ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: And when Peter was come up to Jerusalem, they that were of the circumcision contended with him,

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ka kúu ndá pʉ̀a pie mé la té wɔ́b pú’ tà pia pɔ̌ fó ńjÿó mbɔɔ shúm léjÿó.
en: saying, Thou wentest in to men uncircumcised, and didst eat with them.

ngiemboon: Piɛ lêen ńké ḿbíte kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie á ka cʉa, éshwóŋó wɔ́b tà fó nzyète, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie:
en: But Peter rehearsedthe matterfrom the beginning, and expoundeditby order unto them, saying,

ngiemboon: N deen ńjú’ tsɔ̌ ngyè nyìŋ gɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Piɛ, lu ssé, ńzẅé, ḿpfɛ́!
en: And I heard a voice saying unto me,Arise, Peter; slay and eat.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n tsɔ́’ ngie: Ngǎŋ me Cʉ̀apʉ̀a! Ammó gie*lepʉ̌ tɔ’, kà pɔ́ ye nzse wɔ́, a laa ncwò wɔ̀ɔn zyɛ́’ɛ
en: But I said, Not so, Lord: for nothing common or unclean hath at any time entered into my mouth.

ngiemboon: N gíŋe ńjú’ ngyè ŋwɛ́ nà mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a, é gɔɔn ngie: Ammó lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tà Ssé kẅile*lɔ̌’ mǒ tè gíŋe ńzse nzse mǒ,
en: But the voice answered me again from heaven,What God hath cleansed,thatcall not thou common.

ngiemboon: ńgÿo pɔ́ pú’u, tà é gwɔ́ ngʉ̀a ntá. Eshúm ŋwɛ́ pú ńkwɔ́’ ńgee tÿǒ lepwó.
en: And this was done three times: and all were drawn up again into heaven.

ngiemboon: Á gwóon ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, pʉ̀a métá tóo ndá jʉ’ gie peg kaa wó. Mbà mé fǒ Sezare ńtúmo wɔ́b né mèŋ.
en: And, behold, immediately there were three men already come unto the house where I was, sent from Cæsarea unto me.

ngiemboon: À ge tó shwóŋó gú menò mie e Ssé ge cʉa mǒ gÿo pia ngẅɛ̀ ndá jù tsẅɛ́.
en: who shall tell thee words, whereby thou and all thy house shall be saved.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńtóonte wɔ́b tóonte, epʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ne ńzába ntʉ́m ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô, ńne sele ńcʉ́’ʉ pʉ̀a pé.
en: And the hand of the Lord was with them: and a great number believed, and turned unto the Lord.

ngiemboon: Panebâse piŋ ńgʉa Tarso, léfa’a Sɔ̂l,
en: Then departed Barnabas to Tarsus, for to seek Saul:

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, epʉ̀a fó lyɛ̌’, éfóo Yerósalem ńtóo Antiokia, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ńnéŋe ńtsẅii nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé.
en: And in these days came prophets from Jerusalem unto Antioch.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó, fùɔ*Herôd zye létsɔ́’ɔ kwò tsɔ́ ngàŋa cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo té pòŋ,
en: Now about that time Herod the king stretched forthhishands to vex certain of the church.

ngiemboon: ńtúm mé gʉa ńdɔg nně ncù ńzẅé Jâg gẅie aa fɛ́ Jâŋ.
en: And he killed James the brother of John with the sword.

ngiemboon: Mé jÿɔ́’ɔ Piɛ ndá tsǎŋ pú’u, acú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo ne ńtsyɛ’te Ssé nà twó yé té kʉ́a.
en: Peter therefore was kept in prison: but prayer was made without ceasing of the church unto God for him.

ngiemboon: Á kwá’te ncwò nká’, atsɔ̌ ngàŋa fà’ we mánzwě, mé tóŋo yé lê Rode, á tóo létsɔ́’,
en: And as Peter knocked at the door of the gate, a damsel came to hearken, named Rhoda.

ngiemboon: Piɛ ké ńkwá’te ncwò nká’ kwá’te tà pɔ́ tsɔ́’, ńgyá á gwɔ́ yé, á pú ńkʉ’ʉ wɔ́b tɛ’.
en: But Peter continued knocking: and when they had openedthe door, and saw him, they were astonished.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉ́a, ejʉ’ pú ńnʉ’ʉ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pàlÿɔ́’ ncù. Pɔ́ té zsé mmó gie Piɛ ně ńcʉ́’ʉ yɛ̌ wɔ́.
en: Now as soon as it was day, there was no small stir among the soldiers, what was become of Peter.

ngiemboon: Mé táŋa lyɛ̌’, afùɔ*Herôd ma’ nzsǒ lefùɔ ye, ńtó ńnéŋe nà lʉ̀ŋe lefùɔ yé, ńne ńgɔɔn nò mbwo pɔ́b,
en: And upon a set day Herod, arrayed in royal apparel, sat upon his throne, and made an oration unto them.

ngiemboon: alá’ ne ḿbú ńnáa gugẅî, ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ mesoŋ zɔ těen ńgɔɔn nò pɛ́’ɛ̀ wɔ́, e gwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɔ̌ ssé.
en: And the people gave a shout,saying, It isthe voice of a god, and not of a man.

ngiemboon: Á ke ńgʉa nà shwóŋè Ssé, á ne ńkẅi’i saa jʉ’ ńgee pɔ́ nê mvfò.
en: But the word of God grew and multiplied.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’ pá’ɔɔn, ńnéŋe nzyè, ésẅíŋte Ssé tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, ńdeen ńké ńzáb mbwó twó pɔ́b, ńnyé wɔ́b pɔ́ gʉa.
en: And when they had fasted and prayed, and laidtheirhands on them, they sentthemaway.

ngiemboon: A Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a jÿó Sɔ̂l, gẅie mé gíŋe ńtóŋo yé le Pɔl la. Á lêen ńké ńdíe Elimas,
en: Then Saul, (who alsois calledPaul,) filled with the Holy Ghost, set his eyes on him,

ngiemboon: Angúmnɔ́ɔn gyá mmó gie á cʉ̌a, ńzáb ntʉ́m wé ná Yěsô. Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà nò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gie mé shwoŋó yé, á kuté yé tɛ’.
en: Then the deputy, when he saw what was done, believed, being astonished at the doctrine of the Lord.

ngiemboon: Pɔl lu ssé, ńka’a pwó yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Pà Israel, tà mbɔɔ pi pie pi pɔ́g Ssé yeg pà Israel, pi jú’.
en: Then Paul stood up, and beckoning withhishand said, Men of Israel, and ye that fear God, give audience.

ngiemboon: ńjÿɔ́gɔ wɔ́b nkwòŋo tsẅɛ jÿɔ́g, á mmó ngù’u lá’ móm lekùa,
en: And about the time of forty years suffered he their manners in the wilderness.

ngiemboon: ńgÿo ḿbyág melá’ pʉ̀a Kanaan sɔɔn mbʉ́a, ńgabte tsetsá’a yɔ́b á mbwo pʉ̀a pég.
en: And when he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Chanaan, he divided their land to them by lot.

ngiemboon: E Ssé piŋ ńgʉa nà ngẅɛ̀ ndá fùɔ Ndavíd, ńgÿo mé zyé nyìŋ gẅie à ge gÿo pà Israel tsẅɛ́ pá’ à la ka’, angàŋ gwɔ́ Yěsô.
en: Of this man's seed hath God according tohispromise raised unto Israel a Saviour, Jesus:

ngiemboon: Yěsô gÿo ńgwaa tó, mbà Jâŋ tǒ yé tà ne sá’a shwóŋó mbwó lá’a Israel ngie pɔ́ kúbe mà wɔ́b, ńgÿo mé nu’u wɔ́b ntse.
en: when John had first preached before his coming the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.

ngiemboon: ńzága mmó gie pɔ́ ge cʉa mǒ é gÿo mé zẅé yé, ńgʉa ńgyá*Pilato ngie à ke ńzẅé yé zẅé.
en: And though they found no cause of deathin him, yet desired they Pilate that he should be slain.

ngiemboon: Tá Ssé zíme yé nà legwé.
en: But God raised him from the dead:

ngiemboon: Peg yég, peg tyě pá’ɔɔn, ńne ḿbÿé gẅi á yɛ̌ nò mbòŋo. Á gwɔ́ nò gie e Ssé la lá’ ńka’a mbwo pàmangʉa njʉ’ pà Israel.
en: And we declare unto you glad tidings, how that the promise which was made unto the fathers,

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ tè lá’ nyé nyìŋ gẅie ɔ̀ la tsɔ́’ɔ yé, à lʉ́ʉ tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè wɔ́
en: Wherefore he saith also in anotherpsalm, Thou shalt not suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná Yěsô, mbà à ka tè lʉ́ʉ tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè wɔ́. E Ssé kéen ńgÿo á zíme nà legwé.
en: but he, whom God raised again, saw no corruption.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi ké ńdaga twó gí, ḿbɔ́gɔ mmó gie pà*ntsẅì nkʉ̀ Ssé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé légÿo gẅí. Pɔ́ la gɔɔn ngie:
en: Beware therefore, lest that come upon you, which is spoken of in the prophets;

ngiemboon: mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pi le zẅíŋ.
en: A work which ye shall in no wise believe, though a man declare it unto you.

ngiemboon: Yetsɔ́ lyɛ’ɛ́ zse pà Yuda gÿo ńgwɔ́, pʉ̀a tÿǒsoŋ pú ńkwɔ́’ tɛ’, ńtóo lé jú’u shwóŋe Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé.
en: And the next sabbath day came almost the whole city together to hear the word of God.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn mbwo lá’ ngie: E Ssé gÿǒ pi tsẅɛ́!
en: That thou shouldest be for salvation unto the ends of the earth.

ngiemboon: Ashwóŋè Cʉ̀apʉ̀a piŋ ne ḿbú saa yɛ̌ pàga ngwòŋ ntsèm.
en: And the word of the Lord was published throughout all the region.

ngiemboon: Á ké ńgʉa nà*ngàŋa kwò Yěsô, pɔ́ cʉ́’ʉ tÿǒsoŋo Antiokia, a Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a jÿó wɔ́b, pɔ́ ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ lekág.
en: And the disciples were filled with joy, and with the Holy Ghost.

ngiemboon: Tá’ petsɔ́ pà Yuda lʉ’ʉ lézẅíŋ, ḿbímte pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́, pɔ́ zye lélíe mefɛ́ mefɛ́ tepòŋ.
en: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles, and made their minds evil affected against the brethren.

ngiemboon: E pʉ̀a pie ée tÿǒsoŋ shʉ́a, ńgábte nzsè pʉ́a. Tà’ nùɔ cʉ́me nzèm pà Yuda. Yetsɔ́ nùɔ cʉ́me nzèm megàŋ ntúm.
en: But the multitude of the city was divided: and part held with the Jews, and part with the apostles.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ně ńtsẅii pɔ́ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo.
en: and there they preached the gospel.

ngiemboon: Pɔl lɔg ngyè tetʉ̀ ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Lu ssé, ńdɔg mekwò mú ńtyé tyé. Angàŋa kwʉ́’te jú’, ńgú’u ssé lê gub, ńzye légiŋ.
en: said with a loud voice, Stand upright on thy feet. And he leaped and walked.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ jú’u yɔɔn nò, éshʉate menzsǒ mɔ́b, ńnɔ́ɔnte ńkúu tsetsɛ̀ɛ lá’ ńga’te lê tʉ̀ ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Whichwhen the apostles, Barnabas and Paul, heardof, they rent their clothes, and ran in among the people, crying out,

ngiemboon: À laa fʉ̀’e mvfò, ńnyé túmo túm ntsèm, pɔ́ giŋe nà memánzsè mie pɔ́ kwoŋ.
en: who in times past suffered all nations to walk in their own ways.

ngiemboon: Pɔl pɔ́ Panebâse gÿo fó nà pàga ngwòŋ Pisidie, ńzyɛ́’, ńgʉa tà ńkúu ná ye Panfilia,
en: And after they had passed throughout Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia.

ngiemboon: ńkúu tÿǒsoŋ Pɛrge, éshwóŋó nò Ssé. Tà á ku’ pɔ́ cwóŋ né tÿǒsoŋo Atalia,
en: And when they had preached the word in Perga, they went down into Attalia:

ngiemboon: Pâ pʉ̀a Kristo zye ńnéŋe wó.
en: And there they abode long time with the disciples.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn pú’u, megàŋ ntúm Yěsô, lâ pàkẅé mvfò tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo ńnéŋe ssé lélíe nò ńnáa mǒ,
en: And the apostles and elders came together for to consider of this matter.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la té gÿo tsɔ́ lǎga metuŋ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pega pɔ̌ wɔ́. À la cʉa ná pá’ pɔ́ zǎb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô, ésɔg ntʉ́m wɔ́b.
en: and put no difference between us and them, purifying their hearts by faith.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ píte tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, Jâg gɔɔn yé ngie: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, pi zẅí’te nò gie mèŋ n gee ngɔ̌ɔn.
en: And after they had held their peace, James answered, saying, Menandbrethren, hearken unto me:

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn lɔgɔ ḿbumte ná nò gie e Ssé la lá’ ńdɔg ncwò pà ntsẅì kʉ̀ pé ńgɔɔn. Mé la ŋwe’e ngie:
en: And to this agree the words of the prophets; as it is written,

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge lá’ gíŋe pʉ’ʉ ndá ye gie mé la tágte tà è tyé tyé.
en: And I will set it up:

ngiemboon: À lɔgɔ pá’ɔɔn ńgÿo menò mie à la záb.
en: Saith the Lord, who doeth all these things.

ngiemboon: É gwɔ́ menò mie aa ńzsé zsě.
en: Known unto God are all his works from the beginning of the world.

ngiemboon: ée pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ léen ńzẅíŋe lékwé ńtí nò Cʉ̀apùa wege Yěsô Kristo.
en: men that have hazarded their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Peg lɔgɔ pá’ɔɔn ńtúmo Jẅide pɔ́ Silas. Pɔ́ ge tyé mvfò pi, éshwóŋó gẅi mmó gie peg ŋwe’é tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn ŋwà’ne.
en: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas, who shall also tellyouthe same things by mouth.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwɔ́ tà ńtóŋo yɛ̌ ŋwà’ne, á kẅiŋte wɔ́b. Pɔ́ pú ńkág pá’ɔɔn tɛ’.
en: whichwhen they had read, they rejoiced for the consolation.

ngiemboon: [ Tá’ Silas cʉ́’ ńzáb pɔ́ ngie à ge zso Antiokia]
en: Notwithstanding it pleased Silas to abide there still.

ngiemboon: Panebâse ne ńkwoŋo ngie pɔ́ yé lɔgɔ Jâŋ gẅie mé gíŋe ńtóŋo lé Malékuse la ńgʉa.
en: And Barnabas determined to take with them John, whose surname was Mark.

ngiemboon: Pɔl cʉ́’ ńtsɔ́’ yé Silas, pɔ́ yé gwɔ gʉa, mefɛ́ mefɛ́ cʉ́me wɔ́b mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé.
en: and Paul chose Silas, and departed, being recommended by the brethren unto the grace of God.

ngiemboon: Á zyɛ́’ ye Siria pɔ́ Silisia, ńgiŋe ńkẅiŋte*mendá cú’tè ná lenyɛte ńzáb ntʉ́m wɔ́b ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: And he went through Syria and Cilicia, confirming the churches.

ngiemboon: Timoté gwɔ́ nyìŋ, epʉ̀a Kristo pie ée Listele mbɔɔ Ikonium kíme yé mboŋó tɛ’.
en: which was well reported of by the brethren that were at Lystra and Iconium.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Kristo ne ńkẅi’i ńzába ntʉ́m nà Ssé ńdɔgɔ ńgee pɔ́ lê mvfò. Anùɔ yɔ́b ne ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ ntsèm, ńkẅi’i kẅi’i.
en: And so were the churches established in the faith, and increased in number daily.

ngiemboon: ńgʉa tà ńcʉ́’ʉ lékúu tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Misia, éfa’ shÿó légʉa Mbitinia. Tá Zẅìge Yěsô té zẅíŋ ngie pɔ́ gʉa wó wɔ́.
en: after they were come to Mysia, they assayed to go into Bithynia: but the Spirit suffered them not.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, tà pɔ́ cʉ́’ ńzyɛ́’ɛ Misia zyɛ̌’, ńcwóŋ ńgʉa lê tÿǒsoŋ Toras.
en: And they passing by Mysia came down to Troas.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn mbwo pà*Roma pie pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn sá’a lá’ ngie: Epʉ̀a pɔɔn ne ḿma’a tág tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ yégè, ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ pà Yuda.
en: and brought them to the magistrates, saying, These men, being Jews, do exceedingly trouble our city,

ngiemboon: Mé cúa wɔ́b kwà’ mboŋó, ńgʉa ḿma’a wɔ́b ndá tsǎŋ, ńtsẅi nê mbyɛ̀b ndá tsǎŋ ngie à nyɛte ḿbyɛ́bɛ wɔ́b kwà’ mboŋó.
en: And when they had laid many stripes upon them, they casttheminto prison, charging the jailor to keep them safely:

ngiemboon: Tsɛ̀ɛ tsẅɛ́’ gÿo ne ńku’u, Pɔl pɔ́ Silas ne sẅíŋte Ssé, ńzɔbɔ ntse ńdɔgɔ ńgú’te yé. Petsɔ́ megàŋa tsǎŋ ne ńjú’u,
en: And at midnight Paul and Silas prayed, and sang praises unto God: and the prisoners heard them.

ngiemboon: Tá Pɔl ga’te lê tʉ̀ ngie: Tè sɔb mbùm jù, peg gwɔ́ pɔ́ ssé métsèm.
en: But Paul cried with a loud voice, saying, Do thyself no harm: for we are all here.

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ńgÿo pâ pɔ̌ fó tsɛ̀ɛ ndá tsǎŋ ńkẅɛ, á zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Pà ndè, ńgwɔ́ n gÿo lêkɔ́ tá ńtsẅɛ́?
en: and brought them out, and said, Sirs, what must I do to be saved?

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo yé ngie: Záb ntʉ́m gú ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô. À gÿo pia ngẅɛ̀ ndá jù tsẅɛ́.
en: And they said, Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and thou shalt be saved, and thy house.

ngiemboon: Pɔl pɔ́ Silas shwóŋó nò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô mbwo pɔ́ba ngẅɛ̀ ndá yé.
en: And they spake unto him the word of the Lord, and to all that were in his house.

ngiemboon: ńtó, ḿbú’ mbwó ńgÿo pɔ́ fó ndá tsǎŋ ńkẅɛ, ńgíŋe sẅíŋte wɔ́b ngie pɔ́ fó tÿǒsoŋ ńgʉa.
en: And they came and besought them, and broughtthemout, and desiredthemto depart out of the city.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn shwóŋè pú ńtágte twó lá’ tà mbɔɔ ye pàtsɔ́’te mentsaŋ tÿǒsoŋ.
en: And they troubled the people and the rulers of the city, when they heard these things.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tà pàsá’a lá’ zɛ́te mbwo Jasoŋ pâ petsɔ́ mefɛ́ mefɛ́ ngie pɔ́ nuŋe mbwɔ́’ nkáb ssé tá mé nyé wɔ́b.
en: And when they had taken security of Jason, and of the other, they let them go.

ngiemboon: Menò mie ɔ̀ gwaa shwóŋó wég ne ńkʉ’ʉ wég kʉ’ʉ. Peg ne ńkwoŋo lécwoŋo ńzsé pá’ ɔ̀ lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn.
en: For thou bringest certain strange things to our ears: we would know therefore what these things mean.

ngiemboon: Pɔl cʉ́’ ńkẅɛɛ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ńgʉa gʉa.
en: So Paul departed from among them.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò tɔ́g, Pɔl fó tÿǒsoŋ Atɛ̀ne ńgʉa lê tÿǒsoŋ Korento,
en: After these things Paul departed from Athens, and came to Corinth;

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ yɛ̌ lyɛ’ɛ́ nzse pà Yuda wɔ́, Pɔl gʉa*ndá cú’tè pɔ́b, éfa’a shÿó léshwóŋ pà Yuda pâ pà Gelekia nò tà pɔ́ jú’.
en: And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath, and persuaded the Jews and the Greeks.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tsɔ̌ letsẅɛ́’, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn né Pɔl ngie: Pɔ́ɔn lécÿɔ’! Shwóŋo nò yɔ́ɔn shwóŋ, tè láŋte,
en: Then spake the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision,Be not afraid, but speak, and hold not thy peace:

ngiemboon: Pɔl tsẅé Korento tà’ ngù’ lê mesaŋ ntɔgɔ́, ńne ńzí’i pʉ̀a nò Ssé.
en: And he continuedtherea year and six months, teaching the word of God among them.

ngiemboon: ésẅiŋe yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: Nyìŋ wɔɔn ne sẅite pʉ̀a ńgie pɔ́ gu’te Ssé nà ntí gie*lepʉ̌ té ne ńkwoŋo wɔ́.
en: saying, Thisfellowpersuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law.

ngiemboon: Gallion gɔɔn pú’u, éfó jʉ’ gie mé sá’a ntsaŋ wó, ńjwoŋo wɔ́b.
en: And he drave them from the judgment seat.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa tà ńkúu Efeso, Pɔl nyé Piriska pɔ́ Akilas wó, ńgwɔ́ gʉa ńzɔɔn ńgʉa ńkúu*ndá cú’tè pà Yuda, éshwóŋ pà Yuda nò.
en: And he came to Ephesus, and left them there: but he himself entered into the synagogue, and reasoned with the Jews.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɛ́te yé ngie pâ pɔ̌ ná’á ńzye ńnéŋe. Tá à tè zẅíŋ.
en: When they desiredhimto tarry longer time with them, he consented not;

ngiemboon: Kanú’ gÿo ńkúu Sezare Pɔl sẅɛ́’ ḿbʉ nê Yerósalem, ńtsyɛ’te cú’tè pʉ̀a kristo tá ḿbiŋ fó wó ńgʉa lê Antiokia,
en: And when he had landed at Cæsarea, and gone up, and saluted the church, he went down to Antioch.

ngiemboon: Pɔl zɛ́te wɔ́b ngie: Tà ntí lénu’u gẅi ntse la gwɔ́ pɔ́ yɛ̌? Pɔ́ tsɔ́’ ngie: E laa ntí ye Jâŋ.
en: And he said unto them, Unto what then were ye baptized? And they said, Unto John's baptism.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ jú’u yɔɔn shwóŋè, ńgÿó mé nu’u wɔ́b ntse ná lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô.
en: When they heardthis, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pɔɔn ŋwɛ́ métsèm laa mmó ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a lê legém.
en: And all the men were about twelve.

ngiemboon: E Ssé cʉa ná mbwó Pɔl ńgÿo kwà’ menò mmɔɔn mmɔɔn mie mé laa gyá,
en: And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul:

ngiemboon: Epúɔ tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ pà Yuda sɔɔn mbʉ́a, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ lê Seva, zɔ̌ lɔ́ɔn ńgÿo yɔɔn ntí nò.
en: And there were seven sons ofoneSceva, a Jew,andchief of the priests, which did so.

ngiemboon: Lelÿò pʉ̀a zẅíŋe nò Yěsô, ḿbiŋe ne ńtóo ńtyé tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a ńkwé’e ngyè yɔb tÿǒ ńzẅíŋe mmó gie pɔ́ ka gÿo, á tepòŋ.
en: And many that believed came, and confessed, and shewed their deeds.

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn aa pá’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la ne ńdɔgɔ metʉ̀ mé ńgÿo, ashwóŋè yé ne ńkẅi’i saa jʉ’, ńne ńkẅi’i ńgẅiin tʉ̀.
en: So mightily grew the word of God and prevailed.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀’ó atsɔ̌ máamáa và’ gwe ńtí pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ée ná mánzsè Yěsô.
en: And the same time there arose no small stir about that way.

ngiemboon: Lóŋ pʉ̀a pie é la jú’u yɔɔn shwóŋè, la pú ffó. Pɔ́ zye lélɔg ngyè tetʉ̀ ńgɔɔn ngie: Artémis, éssé pà Efeso, e fǎŋ.
en: And when they heardthese sayings, they were full of wrath, and cried out, saying, GreatisDiana of the Ephesians.

ngiemboon: Pɔl ne fa’a lézyɛ́’ ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ nùɔ lá’, tá pʉ̀a Kristo tɔ’ɔ yé.
en: And when Paul would have entered in unto the people, the disciples suffered him not.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á lʉ’ tè wó wɔ́. Áa yɛ̌ tá mèŋ n gɔɔn ngie pi láŋte, ńgwaa gÿo nò ńkwaŋ.
en: Seeing then that these things cannot be spoken against, ye ought to be quiet, and to do nothing rashly.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔ̌g pʉ̀a pɛ̂ ńtóo jʉ’ɔɔn, tá, mbà pɔ́ kaa cʉŋte tsɔ́ mmó á nà ndá ssé Artémis wɔ́, ńké tè yé zoonte.
en: For ye have brought hither these men, which are neither robbers of churches, nor yet blasphemers of your goddess.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie aa tÿǒsoŋ yé fa’ gwɔ léŋwe’e mmo la, gɔɔn yɔɔn nò tà ńtsẅé jʉ’, ńtsẅi ngie alá’ piŋ nê membʉ̀a mɔ́b.
en: And when he had thus spoken, he dismissed the assembly.

ngiemboon: ńkúu wó, ńzyɛ́’ɛ tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ pàga ngwòŋ, ńgiŋe ńkẅiŋte pʉ̀a Kristo, éfó wó ńgʉa tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Gelekia,
en: And when he had gone over those parts, and had given them much exhortation, he came into Greece,

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nùɔ vɔg ńgwɔ́ mvfò, ḿbyɛ́bɛ wég Toras. Tá peg cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ nzèm,
en: These going before tarried for us at Troas.

ngiemboon: Pɔl lêen ńké sẅɛ́’, ńŋwé’e ssé, ńkaa yé ńgẅiin mbwó yé, ńgɔɔn ngie tà pi pú’ mbùm gí, à gwɔ́ pɔ́ ntentʉ́,
en: And Paul went down, and fell on him, and embracinghimsaid, Trouble not yourselves; for his life is in him.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná mûɔ shùm wa, mé lɔgɔ yé ḿbiŋ nzèm, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ntentʉ́, mbùm pʉ̀a kyɛ́’ɛ tɛ’.
en: And they brought the young man alive, and were not a little comforted.

ngiemboon: Á kẅɛ́te wég Asos, pega pɔ̌ kúu*máamáa kanú’ ńgʉa nê Mitilene,
en: And when he met with us at Assos, we took him in, and came to Mitylene.

ngiemboon: Pɔl kúu Milet, ńtúm mé gʉa ńtóŋ pʉ̀a pie é kẅé mvfò tsɛ̀ɛ*ndá cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo ye Efeso.
en: And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus, and called the elders of the church.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, mbà mèŋ n ka shwóŋó gẅi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ gie e Ssé la ka’a légÿo. Tà mèŋ n te tsɔ́ mmó lÿoon.
en: For I have not shunned to declare unto you all the counsel of God.

ngiemboon: N zsé ngie mèŋ n ge gwɔ́ tá gʉa, menɔ̀ɔn ngẅi kúu nà nùɔ*njʉ̀njÿò yɔ́ɔn, ńzába nò.
en: For I know this, that after my departing shall grievous wolves enter in among you, not sparing the flock.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a kẅɛ mbɔɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńzye lézí’i cÿɔ̌ nò ńdɔg shwoŋte pʉ̀a Kristo ńcʉ́’ ńnéŋ pɔ́ nzèm pɔ́b.
en: Also of your own selves shall men arise, speaking perverse things, to draw away disciples after them.

ngiemboon: N daa nkáb nyìŋ tsɔ́ɔn. N te ngɔl tsɔ́ɔn. N te menzsǒ nyìŋ tsɔ́ɔn.
en: I have coveted no man's silver, or gold, or apparel.

ngiemboon: Pɔl la gɔɔn nò tà ńgwaa tsẅé jʉ’, pâ pɔ̌ métsèm kẅí’te ssé, ésẅíŋte Ssé.
en: And when he had thus spoken, he kneeled down, and prayed with them all.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a metsèm táŋte Pɔl, ńzye lélʉa.
en: And they all wept sore, and fell on Paul's neck, and kissed him,

ngiemboon: ńgyá*máamáa kanú’ gẅie à gee nê Fenicia, ńkúu tsoló ńgʉa,
en: and finding a ship sailing over unto Phenicia, we went aboard, and set forth.

ngiemboon: ńde’e, peg gwaa kúu tsɛ̀ɛ*máamáa kanú’, pɔ́ piŋ nê membʉ̀a mɔ́b.
en: And when we had taken our leave one of another, we took ship; and they returned home again.

ngiemboon: Á gẅiin gubé yé púɔ pànzwě lekùa, mbà pɔ́ laa zɔ́’ɔ. Pɔ́ ńnéŋe ńtsẅii nò gie á fóo mbwo Ssé, a mbwo lá’.
en: And the same man had four daughters, virgins, which did prophesy.

ngiemboon: Pega mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pie pɔ́ ée Sezare jú’ pú’u, ńcwoŋo sẅíŋte Pɔl ngie à pɔ́ɔn lépʉʉ Yerósalem.
en: And when we heard these things, both we, and they of that place, besought him not to go up to Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: É piŋ ńgwɔ tɔ́g lyɛ̌’ shÿɔ́’ɔ tsɔ́ wɔ́, peg cwoŋte mbùm yeg ḿbʉ nê Yerósalem.
en: And after those days we took up our carriages, and went up to Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Peg kúu Yerósalem pú’u, mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pú ńkúe wég lê lekág.
en: And when we were come to Jerusalem, the brethren received us gladly.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉa, pega Pɔl gʉa mbʉ̀a Jâg, ńkúu wó pàkẅé mvfò tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo ye Yerósalem pú ńtó yɔ́b.
en: And thedayfollowing Paul went in with us unto James; and all the elders were present.

ngiemboon: Pɔl tsyɛ’te wɔ́b tà á ku’, á pú ḿbíte menò mie Ssé ka lɔgɔ yé ńgÿo tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́ éshwóŋó wɔ́b.
en: And when he had saluted them, he declared particularly what things God had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministry.

ngiemboon: Pege ée pá’ɔɔn, é gÿo lêkɔ́? Pɔ́ ge gǎ wɔ́ é zsé ngie ɔ̀ tǒ tà ńgwɔ́ jʉ’ɔɔn.
en: What is it therefore? the multitude must needs come together: for they will hear that thou art come.

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌, á poŋ ɔ̀ gÿo mmó gie peg ge gɔɔn mbwo gù. Epʉ̀a ée jʉ’ɔɔn lekùa pie pɔ́ ka ka’a nò mbwo Ssé.
en: Do therefore this that we say to thee: We have four men which have a vow on them;

ngiemboon: Mé lɔgɔ Pɔl ńgʉa tà ńcʉ́’ʉ lékúu jʉ’e mesetɔ̂b, alá’ nÿɔgɔ lézẅé yé. Tá pàlÿɔ́’ ncù fó ńcʉ́’ ńkaa yé kaa.
en: And when he came upon the stairs, so it was, that he was borne of the soldiers for the violence of the people.

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, alá’ gwɔ́ nzèm ńga’te ńgɔɔn ngie: Mé zẅé yé.
en: For the multitude of the people followed after, crying, Away with him.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, metá pɔ́ɔn, pi zẅí’te. Mèŋ n gee ḿbíte ncwò wɔ̀ɔn.
en: Men, brethren, and fathers, hear ye my defencewhich I makenow unto you.

ngiemboon: Pà Yuda jú’ pá’ à ne ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ kwà’ shwóŋè lá’ yɔ́b ńgɔɔn nò, ńkẅi’i ńdáŋte. Pɔl gɔɔn ngie:
en: (And when they heard that he spake in the Hebrew tongue to them, they kept the more silence: and he saith,)

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gwe ssé, ńgwóon ńjú’ ngyè nyìŋ gɔɔn lé mèŋ ngie: Sɔ̂l, Sɔ̂l, ɔ̀ tsɔ́’ɔ kwò yɔ́ɔn té pòŋ mélà’a kɔ́?
en: And I fell unto the ground, and heard a voice saying unto me,Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie pega pɔ̌ ke ńgwɔ́ nùɔ gyá pá’ ammó kyɛ̌’ jʉ’ tá’, ńké tè jú’ ngyè nyìŋ gẅie à gɔɔn nò lé mèŋ wɔ́.
en: And they that were with me saw indeed the light, and were afraid; but they heard not the voice of him that spake to me.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ɔ fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńnyé ńzẅí’te kɔ́. Lu ssé ńtó mé lɔg lezíŋ sé ńnu’u gú ntse, ńdɔg sɔg menò tepòŋ mú.
en: And now why tarriest thou? arise, and be baptized, and wash away thy sins, calling on the name of the Lord.

ngiemboon: M bɔ́ɔnte ḿbiŋe Yerósalem, ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé ne sẅíŋte Ssé, Yěsô tó ńnyɛ mbùm yé mbwo mèŋ.
en: And it came to pass, that, when I was come again to Jerusalem, even while I prayed in the temple, I was in a trance;

ngiemboon: ńgÿo pɛ́’ɛ̀, ńne ńdíte ngwòŋ, ńne ńcʉ’te menzsǒ mɔ́b, ńŋwaa pfepfɔ́b ḿma’a tÿǒ.
en: And as they cried out, and cast offtheirclothes, and threw dust into the air,

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn pú’u, Ananias, tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ tsẅii mbwo pʉ̀a pie ée lejʉ́ŋ Pɔl ngie pɔ́ cúa yé ncwò yé.
en: And the high priest Ananias commanded them that stood by him to smite him on the mouth.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ tyé lejʉ́ŋ Pɔl gɔɔn né yé ngie: Ɔ̀ zoonte tándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’ gẅie Ssé la záb la?
en: And they that stood by said, Revilest thou God's high priest?

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a pie é la kʉa pá’ɔɔn la tɔ́g pʉ̀a móm lekùa.
en: And they were more than forty which had made this conspiracy.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn pú’u, ńŋwe’e ŋwà’ne ńnáa mbwo ngúmnɔ́ɔn Felese, ńgɔɔn tsoló ngie:
en: And he wrote a letter after this manner:

ngiemboon: Àa mèŋ Kɔlɔde Lisias. Mèŋ n ŋwe’e yɔɔn ŋwà’ne ńnáa mbwo gù ngúmnɔ́ɔn Felese. Màkwáŋ weg, n tsyɛ’té.
en: Claudius Lysias unto the most excellent governor Felixsendethgreeting.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ m biŋ ne fa’a lécÿó nnɛ́ ńzsé mmó gie pɔ́ kẅé mbwo yé, ńdɔgɔ yé ńgʉa mvfò pàŋag ntsaŋ pɔ́b.
en: And when I would have known the cause wherefore they accused him, I brought him forth into their council:

ngiemboon: Pàlÿɔ́’ ncù gÿo mmó gie tándá wɔ́b tsẅǐ né pɔ́b, ńdá’a lá’ ńdɔgɔ Pɔl ńgʉa tà ńkúu Antipatelis.
en: Then the soldiers, as it was commanded them, took Paul, and broughthimby night to Antipatris.

ngiemboon: Pàkwɔ́’ melÿoon lɔgɔ yé ńgʉa tà ńkúu Sezare, ńnáa ŋwà’ne mbwo ngúmnɔ́ɔn, ńgíŋe nyé Pɔl mbwo yé.
en: who, when they came to Cæsarea, and delivered the epistle to the governor, presented Paul also before him.

ngiemboon: Peg ne ńgwaa jÿó pì mɛ̌ menò, á jʉ’ ntsèm, éfʉ̀’ ntsèm ḿbú ne sie gú tà ńgɔɔn shwóŋó nò.
en: we acceptitalways, and in all places, most noble Felix, with all thankfulness.

ngiemboon: Tá Lisias, tándá metándá ncù tó ńdɔg metʉ̀ sa’a yé mbwo peg,
en: But the chief captain Lysias cameupon us, and with great violence tookhimaway out of our hands,

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn Pà Yuda tóonte nò yé ngie: Oon à shwóŋó nò.
en: And the Jews also assented, saying that these things were so.

ngiemboon: Menò mɛ mie pʉ̀a tÿɔ́gɔ twó mèŋ lɛ, mé lɔɔn ngie megàŋ píte pɔ́ le zsé lépíte wɔ́.
en: neither can they prove the things whereof they now accuse me.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo tá mèŋ n ne ńkaga tʉ̀ légiŋ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ á mvfò Ssé, mbɔɔ mvfò pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: And herein do I exercise myself, to have always a conscience void of offence toward God, andtowardmen.

ngiemboon: Mé la ńnéŋe Festus lésá’a yɛ̌ pàga ngwòŋ é cʉa lyɛ̌’ tá, à fó tÿǒsoŋo Sezare ḿbʉ ńgʉa Yerósalem,
en: Now when Festus was come into the province, after three days he ascended from Cæsarea to Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: ńkúu wó, metándá pànuŋe pwɔ́’, pâ mekěm pà Yuda tó sẅiŋe Pɔl mvfò yé, ḿbú ńkute nò mǒ tɛ’,
en: Then the high priest and the chief of the Jews informed him against Paul, and besought him,

ngiemboon: Festus jú’, ńtsɔ́’ɔ mbwo pɔ́b ngie: Pɔl aa ndá tsǎŋ Sezare. Kwà’ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn n zɔɔn tě ge ńnéŋe jʉ’ɔɔn tɛ’ wɔ́.
en: But Festus answered, that Paul should be kept at Cæsarea, and that he himself would depart shortlythither.

ngiemboon: Pàsẅiŋe yé tó yɔ́b. Mèŋ n ne ńkwaŋa ngie pɔ́ sẅiŋe yé nà tsɔ̌ ntʉ̀ nò tɛ’. Tá’ á ké tè pú’u kẅɛ,
en: Against whom when the accusers stood up, they brought none accusation of such things as I supposed:

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne ńzsé ngie mèŋ n zɔɔn ńtúmo ngàŋa tsǎŋ, ńnáa mbwó Kása té gɔɔn mmó gie à fʉ̌a, á cʉ́’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nò cʉ̀cʉ̀ŋ.
en: For it seemeth to me unreasonable to send a prisoner, and not withal to signify the crimeslaidagainst him.

ngiemboon: Pi pie pi ne ńzẅí’te nò gie mèŋ n gɔɔn lɔɔn, pi lʉ’ʉ lézẅíŋ ngie e Ssé lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á zím pʉ̀a ná legwé mélà’a kɔ́?
en: Why should it be thought a thing incredible with you, that God should raise the dead?

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn, n ka ne ńkwaŋa ngie, n ge lɔg ncù lÿɔ́’ lezíŋ Yěsô mûɔ Nǎzarɛd, á nà meshÿó ntsèm.
en: I verily thought with myself, that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gɔɔn ngie: Àa gù wɔ̌ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a? Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tsɔ́’ ngie, n gee Yěsô. Ɔ̀ tsɔ́’ɔ pá’a pɔ́ kwò yɔ́ɔn té pòŋ.
en: And I said, Who art thou, Lord? And he said,I am Jesus whom thou persecutest.

ngiemboon: Nɔ̀ɔn temà’ fùɔ Agrippa, á la fó pú’u, n daa tʉʉ twó nà nò gie e Ssé la nyɛ́’ nÿɔ́g mɔ́ɔn n jú’ wɔ́.
en: Whereupon, O king Agrippa, I was not disobedient unto the heavenly vision:

ngiemboon: Gyá mmó gie á ka gÿǒ tá pà Yuda gwoon wɔ̀ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ jʉ’e Ssé tà fa’a lézẅé wɔ̀ɔn.
en: For these causes the Jews caught me in the temple, and went about to killme.

ngiemboon: Pɔl tsɔ́’ ngie: A Ndè, mèŋ n tè pʉa wɔ́. Menò mie mèŋ n gɔɔn ée jʉ’ó ńgwɔ́ pú’u. Mbà mèŋ n zɔ̌ɔn ńkwaŋ, tá ńgɔɔn.
en: But he said, I am not mad, most noble Festus; but speak forth the words of truth and soberness.

ngiemboon: Fùɔ Agrippa tsɔ́’ɔ mbwo Pɔl ngie: Ɔ̀ kwǎŋ ngie ɔ̀ ge ná’a lɔg pɔ́ pɛ́’ɛ̀ é gÿo n cʉ́’ʉ nyìŋ Kristo keen?
en: Then Agrippa said unto Paul, Almost thou persuadest me to be a Christian.

ngiemboon: Fùɔ Agrippa, mbɔɔ ngúmnɔ́ɔn pɔ́ Mbelenis, pâ pʉ̀a pie é kě ńgwɔ́ jʉ’ó lu ssé,
en: And when he had thus spoken, the king rose up, and the governor, and Bernice, and they that sat with them:

ngiemboon: Tá’, ńdeen ńtóo légiŋ, atsɔ̌ máamáa fóm gẅie mé tóŋo lê Erakiloŋ fó tsɛ̀ɛ lá’, ńzye lécʉ’e kwà’ lê tʉ̀,
en: But not long after there arose against it a tempestuous wind, called Euroclydon.

ngiemboon: ńdɔgɔ*máamáa kanú’ ḿpfó shÿó we ndyɛ̀’ɛ. Peg gyá kékáŋ, ńcʉ́’ ńnyé*máamáa kanú’. Á lɔgɔ wég ńgʉa lê jʉ’ gie fóm kwǒŋ.
en: And when the ship was caught, and could not bear up into the wind, we letherdrive.

ngiemboon: Njÿó gÿo ńdʉa, afóm ké ńnyé ńcʉ’e pɔ́ lê tʉ̀. Megàŋa fà’ gyá kékáŋ, ńtsẅɛ́te tsɔ́ shúm metʉ̌a, ḿma’a ntse.
en: And we being exceedingly tossed with a tempest, the nextdaythey lightened the ship;

ngiemboon: Yetsɔ̌ njÿó gÿo ńgíŋ ńdʉ́a, kwà’ pɔ́b zɔ̌ sele ńtsɔ́’ metÿǒ*máamáa kanú’ lâ menzsǒ mǒ, ńgwá’a tsɛ̀ɛ ntse.
en: and the thirddaywe cast out with our own hands the tackling of the ship.

ngiemboon: Meshǔ pɔ́ɔn, pi shÿɔg! Mèŋ n déen ńtém nzèm yɔɔn ńná né Ssé. Anò gie e Ssé ně ńgɔɔn mbwo mèŋ lɔɔn, á ge pumte pú’u.
en: Wherefore, sirs, be of good cheer: for I believe God, that it shall be even as it was told me.

ngiemboon: Afóm ge kaa wégè pɔ́ pá’ɔɔn tà gʉa ma’a wégè tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ ngwòŋ gẅie ntse la kéle ńnéŋe soŋ.
en: Howbeit we must be cast upon a certain island.

ngiemboon: Pàlÿɔ́’ ncù lêen ńké ńtsyete menkÿo mie é kě ńgẅiin kanú’, ńnyé á gʉa ntse.
en: Then the soldiers cut off the ropes of the boat, and let her fall off.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a metsèm lêen ńké shÿɔg. Awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pfɛ́ yé.
en: Then were they all of good cheer, and they also tooksomemeat.

ngiemboon: Peg gwɔ́ pú’u, ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ*máamáa kanú’, nyìŋ mesoŋ nkÿo pʉ́a lê ntsɔ̀b ntɔgɔ́ lê móm sɔɔn mbʉ́a.
en: And we were in all in the ship two hundred threescore and sixteen souls.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gwɔ́ tà ḿpfɛ́ɛ mmó tà ńzẅɛ́, ésẅí’i ngesáŋ ntsíŋ ḿma’a ntse légwɔ́ gie*máamáa kanú’ ge zeŋe.
en: And when they had eaten enough, they lightened the ship, and cast out the wheat into the sea.

ngiemboon: Pàlÿɔ́’ ncù fa’a lézẅéte megàŋa tsǎŋ, ḿbɔ́gɔ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ tà’ zɔ́’ ntse ńkÿo.
en: And the soldiers' counsel was to kill the prisoners, lest any of them should swim out, and escape.

ngiemboon: Tá Pɔl siŋe pwó yé, ńnÿɔgte ndùm mmɔ̌g. Nnú sẅɛ́’, ńgwé mmɔ̌g. Ammó té Pɔl gÿo.
en: And he shook off the beast into the fire, and felt no harm.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ megàŋa guɔ lêen ńké ńjú’, éfó meshÿó meshÿó tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ ŋwɛ́, ńtó ńgyá Pɔl. Á gÿo pɔ́ zeŋe.
en: So when this was done, others also, which had diseases in the island, came, and were healed:

ngiemboon: Peg fó tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Malte, ńgʉa tà ńkúu ngʉ̀ŋe tÿǒsoŋ Sirakuse, ésẅɛ́’, ńnéŋe wó lyɛ̌’ sétá,
en: And landing at Syracuse, we tarriedtherethree days.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b jú’u nò gie à gɔ̌ɔn, ńzẅíŋ. Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a lʉ’ lʉ’.
en: And some believed the things which were spoken, and some believed not.

ngiemboon: é cwoŋo náŋte, é ké le gyá
en: And seeing ye shall see, and not perceive:

ngiemboon: ńké ńgÿote pɔ́ pú’u, ńzsé ngie pɔ́ té piŋe mbwo mèŋ Ssé, n zeŋe wɔ́b gwɔ́.
en: And I should heal them.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn pú’u, pà Yuda gwɔ́ fó jʉ’ó gʉa, ńgiŋe ńzoŋo nò ŋwɛ́ tà ńcÿɔ́gɔ cÿɔ̌g.]
en: And when he had said these words, the Jews departed, and had great reasoning among themselves.

ngiemboon: Ntyě sǎg pá’ Ssé la la’ ńka’ wɛ̌ Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo tà ńgÿo pà Ntsẅi nkʉ̀ pé pe fʉ̀’ʉ mvfò ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne yé.
en: (which he had promised afore by his prophets in the holy scriptures,)

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ pi gí, pi ee nà nùɔ pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́, ńtí nue e Ssé ka tóŋo gẅi ngie pi gwɔ́ gí pʉ̀a Kristo.
en: among whom are ye also the called of Jesus Christ:

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo tá mèŋ n tsɔ́ɔn létó ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwo pi gí, pie pi ee tÿǒsoŋo*Roma.
en: So, as much as in me is, I am ready to preach the gospel to you that are at Rome also.

ngiemboon: mélà’mie ammó gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé zsé nà Ssé, pɔ́ gíŋe ne ńzsé yɔ́b zsé. E Ssé la shʉ̀ashʉ̀a ńnyɛɛ wɔ́b yɛ̌ mmó.
en: because that which may be known of God is manifest in them; for God hath sheweditunto them.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tóo sá’a ngie pɔ́ zsé nò, ńcʉ́’ mepʉ̀a.
en: Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools,

ngiemboon: Legyè zága wɔ́b. Pɔ́ ka’a nò pɔ́ té gÿo, ntʉ́m wɔ́b lêen ńtʉa, pɔ́ ee pà tè tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe.
en: without understanding, covenantbreakers, without natural affection, implacable, unmerciful:

ngiemboon: Pege zɔɔn ńzsé ngie Ssé gwɔ́ tà ne ńŋága pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ gÿo yɛ̌ ntí menò, ńŋága wɔ́b pɔ́ pá’ menò mɔ́b ne ńzɛ́te.
en: But we are sure that the judgment of God is according to truth against them which commit such things.

ngiemboon: À tsɔ́’ɔ fà’ ye wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pɔ́ ná pa’ ngàŋ la lɔg fa’ pú’u,
en: Who will render to every man according to his deeds:

ngiemboon: á nue e Ssé te gẅiin tyɛ̀’te tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a mésoŋ wɔ́.
en: for there is no respect of persons with God.

ngiemboon: ńzsé mmó gie Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, mbà á ka fó ná pá’ mé ka zí’i gú*lepʉ̌ ɔ̀ zsé mmó gie áa mbòŋ.
en: and knowesthiswill, and approvest the things that are more excellent, being instructed out of the law;

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ kwà’ ne ńgyá nà jú twó ngie ɔ́ɔ nyìŋ gẅie à kíbe pwó mefʉ̀ menÿɔ́g, ńne ńkyɛ’ɛ pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm,
en: and art confident that thou thyself art a guide of the blind, a light of them which are in darkness,

ngiemboon: Gù gẅie ɔ̀ ne ńŋá’te tɛ’ ngie ɔ̀ zsé*lepʉ̌ Ssé, ḿbiŋe fʉa*lepʉ̌ ŋwɛ́, ɔ̀ lɔgɔ pú’u, ńzoonte Ssé.
en: Thou that makest thy boast of the law, through breaking the law dishonourest thou God?

ngiemboon: Mé la zɔɔn ńŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie: Pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́ ne ńzoonte lezíŋ Ssé, á ké fó pɔ́ né pi.
en: For the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles through you, as it is written.

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ńgʉa nà pá’ etsɔ́ pà Yuda la nyé yɛ̌ shwóŋè pé’è, á ge cʉa pú’u, e Ssé nyé menò mie à la ka’a mbwo pɔ́b keen?
en: For what if some did not believe? shall their unbelief make the faith of God without effect?

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ ŋaga gú á le gú jÿó.
en: And mightest overcome when thou art judged.

ngiemboon: Tà tsǒon tà’.
en: There is none righteous, no, not one:

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie à kwa’ ne ńtsɔ́ɔn lézsé mánzsè Ssé à tè wó wɔ́.
en: There is none that seeketh after God.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ mesoŋ tè nò mbòŋo gÿo tà tsǒon tà’.
en: There is none that doeth good, no, not one.

ngiemboon: Anò gie á kẅɛɛ nà mekùb ncwò mɔ́b gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ sesìŋ nnú.
en: The poison of aspsisunder their lips:

ngiemboon: Ncwò wɔ́b zoon pʉ̀a zoon, ńnéŋ pɔ́ ndòon.
en: Whose mouthisfull of cursing and bitterness:

ngiemboon: Akwò yɔ́b zeŋe pɔ́ nà lénɔ̌ɔn pʉ̀a, ḿpfɛte metse mɔ́b.
en: Their feetareswift to shed blood:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ cʉa nzɔ̌ wɔ́, ńcʉŋte shúm pɔ̀ ntsèm, mé cʉ́’ ńdʉa.
en: Destruction and miseryarein their ways:

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lélɔg mbʉ́lè ńtóo jʉ’ wɔ́.
en: And the way of peace have they not known:

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gÿo yɔ́b nò pɔ́ tè pɔ̌g Ssé.
en: There is no fear of God before their eyes.

ngiemboon: á nue pɔ́b metsèm la zɔɔn ḿbú ńgÿo menò tepòŋ tà sɔ́ɔn legú’ gẅie aa lejʉ́ŋ Ssé.
en: for all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;

ngiemboon: Á gwe’e ńgwɔ́ pú’u, mbà Ssé cʉ̌’ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ye pà Yuda gílé pɔ́b, tá’ e giŋé ńgwɔ́ Ssé pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́.
en: Is hethe God of the Jews only?is henot also of the Gentiles? Yes, of the Gentiles also:

ngiemboon: MÀvéle menò tepòŋ mɔ́b
en: And whose sins are covered.

ngiemboon: Ashÿó mbòŋo aa nyìŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a cʉ’ʉ́ ńkímte menò tepòŋ mé wɔ́
en: Blessedisthe man to whom the Lord will not impute sin.

ngiemboon: ńkwa’ ne ńcwoŋo ńzsé ngie Ssé gẅiin metʉ̀ lélɔg ńgÿo ammó gie yé Ssé kǎ’ á pumte.
en: and being fully persuaded that, what he had promised, he was able also to perform.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á la gÿo e Ssé líe Ábalam á gwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé.
en: And therefore it was imputed to him for righteousness.

ngiemboon: Tá mé lɔ́ɔn tě sáŋa pɔ́ ndà’ yé gílé yé tá ńŋwe’e ngie: «E Ssé la líe yé, á gwɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò yé wɔ́».
en: Now it was not written for his sake alone, that it was imputed to him;

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tà ńkwé, à tè gíŋe ńku’u légÿo tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́, nkÿo nò tepòŋ fó ná yé ńkyɛ́’ɛ.
en: For he that is dead is freed from sin.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pega Kristo la púte ńkwé la, á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie pega pɔ̌ ge gÿo é púte gwɔ́ wó.
en: Now if we be dead with Christ, we believe that we shall also live with him:

ngiemboon: Peg cwoŋo ne ńzsé ngie Kristo la vɔg tà ńzíme nà legwé, à tè lá’ gíŋe kwé wɔ́. Legwé tè gíŋe ńgẅiin tsɔ́ nò ná yé wɔ́.
en: knowing that Christ being raised from the dead dieth no more; death hath no more dominion over him.

ngiemboon: Kristo la kwé, ńkwé pɔ́ tà’ légʉa, á nà menò tepòŋ pʉ̀a. Àa fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wó pɔ́ léná mekù’ Ssé.
en: For in that he died, he died unto sin once: but in that he liveth, he liveth unto God.

ngiemboon: á nue e Ssé kéen ńkyɛ́’ nkÿo nò tepòŋ ná pi, pi ee fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńcʉ́’ nkwɔɔn nò gie áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ.
en: Being then made free from sin, ye became the servants of righteousness.

ngiemboon: Á laa fʉ̀’ gie pi la nyé nkwɔɔn nò tepòŋ, légÿo mmó gie áa ndʉŋ ndʉŋ mvfò Ssé á té tsɔ́ nò ná pi gẅiin.
en: For when ye were the servants of sin, ye were free from righteousness.

ngiemboon: mèŋ n kwé. Á gwɔ́ pú’u, mbà*lepʉ̌ sie é kɔ’ɔ́ gÿo nyìŋ gwɔ́ wó, mbà é cʉ̌’ ńtóo ná mèŋ ńtsege wɔɔn ńnéŋ pɔ́ nà legwé.
en: And the commandment, whichwas ordainedto life, I foundto beunto death.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie mèŋ n tè kwoŋo mmó gie mèŋ n gÿo wɔ́, mbà mèŋ n dɔgɔ pú’u, ńzẅíŋe ngie*lepʉ̌ ée mbòŋ.
en: If then I do that which I would not, I consent unto the law thatit isgood.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, mèŋ n zɔ tě ńdɔgɔ ńgÿo mɛ̌ menò wɔ́, nò tepòŋ gie á léen ńjÿó wɔ̀ɔn zɔ̌ gÿo.
en: Now then it is no more I that do it, but sin that dwelleth in me.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n tè gÿo nò mbòŋo gie mèŋ n tsɔ̌ɔn légÿo wɔ́, mèŋ n gÿo pɔ́ nò tepòŋ gie mèŋ n tè tsɔ́ɔn.
en: For the good that I would I do not: but the evil which I would not, that I do.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge kwà’ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m mèŋ,*lepʉ̌ Ssé poŋo wɔ̀ɔn tɛ’.
en: For I delight in the law of God after the inward man:

ngiemboon: N tè pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ shÿó tepòŋ wɔ́, àwɔ́ ge lá’ fó tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn mbùm nnɛ́ gie e tóŋo legwé ńnéŋe ná mèŋ é kẅile wɔ̀ɔn?
en: O wretched man that I am! who shall deliver me from the body of this death?

ngiemboon: Ngwɔ́ epʉ̀a pie mbùm yɔb zɔ ne sá’a wɔ́b zɔɔn le ku’u légÿo mmó gie á pòŋ Ssé wɔ́.
en: So then they that are in the flesh cannot please God.

ngiemboon: Á nue pʉ̀a pie Zẅìge Ssé ne ńtsyeen wɔ́b ée púɔ Ssé.
en: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, they are the sons of God.

ngiemboon: Kwà’ Zẅìge ŋwɛ́ yé máŋwɛ́ ne ńgÿo pege cwoŋo ńzsé tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m wégè ngie pege ee púɔ Ssé.
en: The Spirit itself beareth witness with our spirit, that we are the children of God:

ngiemboon: Akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gie Ssé la nyɛte zɔɔn ḿbú ne ńzẅí’te tɛ’ légyá fʉ̀’ gie e Ssé ge gÿo mé gyá legú’ púɔ pé.
en: For the earnest expectation of the creature waiteth for the manifestation of the sons of God.

ngiemboon: Tá’ pá’ pege ne ńzẅí’te mmó gie pege tè ne ńgyá wɔ́ la, pege lɔgɔ kwɔgɔ nnɛ́ ńnyɛte ńzẅí’te.
en: But if we hope for that we see not,thendo we with patience wait forit.

ngiemboon: Ngwɔ́ pege gíŋe ńkẅi’i kɔ́ nà nò gie pege gɔɔn lɔɔn? Pá’ e Ssé ee nà yégè gwǒŋ la, aa ńgwɔ́ wɔ̌ ku’u ná pege?
en: What shall we then say to these things? If Godbefor us, whocan beagainst us?

ngiemboon: Tá’ á ké ńgʉa ná shúm sɛ̌ ntsèm, pege gwɔ́ pà tántʉ̀, pà cʉa sɛ̌ shúm ńzẅɛ́’ɛ nyìŋ gẅie à la kwoŋo wégè.
en: Nay, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him that loved us.

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ nò áa ngie mèŋ n neŋé lê kwà’ lemÿɔ́g, ḿbiŋ ne ńjú’u kékáŋ ntʉ́m mèŋ fʉ̀’ ntsèm ńtí mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn pà Yuda.
en: that I have great heaviness and continual sorrow in my heart.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ̌ fʉ̀’ giŋé ńgwɔ́ wó, ńgwɔ́ Rebéka pá’ pɔ́ mangʉa njʉ’ wege Esâg la zyé mefág mbàŋa yépʉ́a.
en: And not onlythis; but when Rebecca also had conceived by one,evenby our father Isaac;

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ḿbumte ná nò gie mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne Ssé ngie: «Mèŋ n kwoŋó Yakwɔ́b, ḿbe’e Esaẅi»
en: As it is written, Jacob have I loved, but Esau have I hated.

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ pú’u, ńgɔɔn ngie kɔ́? Ńgie Ssé tè ndʉŋ ndʉŋ wɔ́ keen. Ngǎŋ á té pú’u wɔ́.
en: What shall we say then?Is thereunrighteousness with God? God forbid.

ngiemboon: Pɛ̌ pʉ̀a lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wégè wɔɔn, á wégè gẅie à tsɔ’ɔ́ nùɔ pà Yuda mbɔɔ nùɔ pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yuda wɔ́.
en: even us, whom he hath called, not of the Jews only, but also of the Gentiles?

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge gÿo tóŋo wɔ́b lê pʉ̀a pie n kwoŋo wɔ́b tɛ’.
en: And her beloved, which was not beloved.

ngiemboon: Á nue Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge gÿo lwo pú gÿo mmó gie à la ka’a légÿo ndùmo ssé tsetsá’.
en: for he will finish the work, and cutitshort in righteousness: because a short work will the Lord make upon the earth.

ngiemboon: Tá’ nyìŋ gẅie à ge záb ntʉ́m wé ná yé, eshʉ́ té ge lá’ kúu yé wɔ́.
en: And whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n cwoŋo ne ńzsé ngie, pɔ́ kwa’ ne ńkwoŋo léfa’a fà’ Ssé pɔ́ lê zeŋe nnɛ́, tá pɔ́ té ne ńjú’u kwà’ mánzsè wɔ́.
en: For I bear them record that they have a zeal of God, but not according to knowledge.

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ńzɔɔn ńcʉ́me nà pá’ ŋwà’ne Ssé la gɔɔn ngie: «Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzáb ntʉ́m ná yé, mbà shʉ́ té gÿo kúu ngàŋ wɔ́»
en: For the scripture saith, Whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed.

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ńcʉ́me ná pá’ ŋwà’ne Ssé gɔɔn ngie: «Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńdá’ ńdʉa ńtóŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé, mbà ngàŋ ge tsẅɛ́.»
en: For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.

ngiemboon: Anò gie pɔ́ gɔ̌ɔn gǐŋ giŋ tà ńkúu nzsòte tsetsá’.
en: And their words unto the ends of the world.

ngiemboon: Ńtí pà túm pie pi gɔɔn ngie legyè sɔ́b té wó wɔ́
en: Andby a foolish nation I will anger you.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ka tè ne ńdúɔ tsɔ́ mmó mbwo mèŋ wɔ́.
en: I was made manifest unto them that asked not after me.

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie Ssé néŋ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ twó pɔ́b.
en: And a stumblingblock, and a recompence unto them:

ngiemboon: Ńgÿó pɔ́ gyá ngɔ́’ tà nkà’ wɔ́b cʉ́’ ńŋwé’e ŋwé’e fʉ̀’ ntsèm.
en: And bow down their back alway.

ngiemboon: Ndyɛ̌’ tsɔ́ ɔ̀ jú’ pá’ɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie mé la kɔ́’ mɛ̌ mbwó ńgwá’ légwɔ́ gie mé ge laa gú nà tÿǒ.
en: Thou wilt say then, The branches were broken off, that I might be graffed in.

ngiemboon: Á nue á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie e Ssé la kɔ́’ kwà’ mbwó yɛ̌ tÿǒ ńgwá’, mbà à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á gíŋe ńkɔ́’ɔ gú jú pɔ́ pú’u.
en: for if God spared not the natural branches,take heedlest he also spare not thee.

ngiemboon: E sele ngẅɛ̀ Yakwɔ́b pɔ́ le gíŋe ńtʉʉ twó mbwo Ssé wɔ́.
en: And shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob:

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn aa kʉa gie pega pɔ̌ ge lá’ gwa, á fʉ̀’ gie n ge lá’ kẅile menò tepòŋ mɔ́b.
en: When I shall take away their sins.

ngiemboon: Á nue e Ssé la nyémânyìŋ ntsèm á pú ńtʉʉ twó mbwo yé légwɔ́ gie à ge gÿo tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mɔ́b pɔ́ metsèm.
en: For God hath concluded them all in unbelief, that he might have mercy upon all.

ngiemboon: Awɔ́ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á náa yé ntÿɔgɔ́,
en: For who hath known the mind of the Lord? or who hath been his counsellor?

ngiemboon: Légwɔ́ gie e Ssé ge gẅiin létsɔ́’ ńnáa mbwo yé.
en: Or who hath first given to him, and it shall be recompensed unto him again?

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nà mbùm nnɛ́ nyìŋ mesoŋ, mekèm gwɔ́ mǒ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ḿbiŋ ńké tè gẅiin tà’a fà’ wɔ́
en: For as we have many members in one body, and all members have not the same office:

ngiemboon: Afù’ ye nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ lékẅéte ná mefà’, á kẅéte. A ye nyìŋ gwɔ́ lézí’i pʉ̀a mmó, á zí’i.
en: or ministry,let us waitonourministering: or he that teacheth, on teaching;

ngiemboon: Pi kwoŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ pɔ́ lê ntʉ́m gẅi ntsèm. Pi kÿo nò tepòŋ tà fÿɔ́g mekɔ́ɔn, ńkú’te nò mbòŋo tà à tʉ̀.
en: Letlove be without dissimulation. Abhor that which is evil; cleave to that which is good.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔg pá’ pi ee mefɛ́ mefɛ́, ńkwoŋe pi né pi, nyìŋ gẅi à vɔg ńná mekù’ fɛ́ we.
en: Bekindly affectioned one to another with brotherly love; in honour preferring one another;

ngiemboon: Tà pi gwɔ́ melǒŋ, pi gwɔ́ pɔ́ megàŋa fà’. Pi lɔg ntʉ́m gẅi ntsèm éfa’a mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: not slothful in business; fervent in spirit; serving the Lord;

ngiemboon: Pi ńnéŋe nê lekág ńtí mmó gie pi ne ńzẅí’te. Ngɔ́’ lɔɔn ńkúu gẅí, pi shÿɔg shÿɔg. Pi ké ńne sẅíŋte pɔ́ Ssé té kʉ́a.
en: rejoicing in hope; patient in tribulation; continuing instant in prayer;

ngiemboon: Ammó lɔɔn ńzága mbwo mefɛ́ pi pʉ̀a Kristo, pi kẅéte wɔ́b. Pi ńnéŋe ńkúe pà túm mboŋó.
en: distributing to the necessity of saints; given to hospitality.

ngiemboon: Pi tsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ nò mbòŋo á nà twó pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ne ńgÿo pi gyá ngɔ́’. Pi tsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ nò mbòŋo, tà pi tsɔ́ɔn nò tepòŋ.
en: Bless them which persecute you: bless, and curse not.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a lɔɔn ne ńkága pia pɔ̌ pú ńkág, ńne ńdʉa pia pɔ̌ pú ńdʉa.
en: Rejoice with them that do rejoice, and weep with them that weep.

ngiemboon: Mbàa yɛ̌ nò wɔ́ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ssé, tà shÿó gwɔ́ mbwo gù, ɔ̀ gÿo pɔ́ légwɔ́ gie pia pʉ̀a métsèm ge ńnéŋe lê mbʉ́lè.
en: If it be possible, as much as lieth in you, live peaceably with all men.

ngiemboon: Tà nyìŋ cʉ́’ nò gie nyìŋ gÿǒ ná yé tsóte yé, á gÿo nò tepòŋ, tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, á lɔgɔ légÿo nò mbòŋo, ḿbyága nò tepòŋ.
en: Be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gíŋe ńgÿo tá pi ma’ ncùb ngwòŋ, á nue e Ssé zɔ la záb pàfà’a yɛ̌ fà’, pá’ pɔ́ ge cÿó nnɛ́ fa’a fà’ yɔ́b.
en: For for this cause pay ye tribute also: for they are God's ministers, attending continually upon this very thing.

ngiemboon: Kristo la zɔɔn ńkwé ḿbiŋ ńzím légwɔ́ gie à ge gwɔ́ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a mepfó mbɔɔ we pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ée ntentʉ́.
en: For to this end Christ both died, and rose, and revived, that he might be Lord both of the dead and living.

ngiemboon: Wɔ́ɔwɔ́ɔ tsɔ́’ ncwò we, éshʉashʉa ńzẅíŋ ngie mèŋ n gee Ssé.
en: And every tongue shall confess to God.

ngiemboon: Pege lɔgɔ pá’ɔɔn ńgyá ngie wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege wɔ́ ge lá’ tyé mvfò Ssé, kwà’ yé zɔ píte ncwò wé ná pá’ à kɔ̌ɔn ńgÿo.
en: So then every one of us shall give account of himself to God.

ngiemboon: mbɔɔ légÿo mmó gie mé ge cʉa mǒ, éshwóŋte ná gù, tà mbɔɔ pá’ ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńzsé jú pɔ́ ngie yɛ̌ mmó áa mbòŋ.
en: Let not then your good be evil spoken of:

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn fa’a fà’ Kristo lê yɔɔn ntí, mbà nò yé ge poŋ Ssé, epʉ̀a mesoŋ piŋ ńná mekù’ ngàŋ.
en: For he that in these things serveth Christisacceptable to God, and approved of men.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pege fa’a mmó gie á ge gÿo pege ńnéŋe ńnéŋe lê sẅéte, ḿbiŋ ńkẅi’i ńtóonte mennɛ́ mégè ná lezáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé.
en: Let us therefore follow after the things which make for peace, and things wherewith one may edify another.

ngiemboon: À cʉa pú’u, pi lɔgɔ tà’ ncwò, ńdɔgɔ tà’ ngyè ńgu’te Ssé Tá pà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo.
en: that ye may with one mindandone mouth glorify God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: MÀbiŋ ńzɔb ńgu’te lezíŋ shú.
en: And sing unto thy name.

ngiemboon: Pia pʉ̀a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a temte ḿbú ńkág.
en: Rejoice, ye Gentiles, with his people.

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie pʉ̀a melá’ ntsèm pú ńkwé’e lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ńnáa tÿǒ.
en: And laud him, all ye people.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tÿɔ́g nÿɔ́g mɔ́b pɔ́ ná yé, ńne ńzẅí’te ngie à gÿo pɔ́ gwɔ́ wó.
en: In him shall the Gentiles trust.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n dɔg pá’ n da nnɛ́ ná Yěsô Kristo, ńku’u lélɔgɔ fa’a Ssé gie mèŋ n ne fa’a ńka’te.
en: I have therefore whereof I may glory through Jesus Christ in those things which pertain to God.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la tè jú’u tsɔ́ nò ná yé wɔ́, ge gÿo jú’.
en: And they that have not heard shall understand.

ngiemboon: Legwǎ ńgiŋ ńtsẅi Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo áa mmó gie á la vele wɔ̀ɔn mengʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn létó ńgyá gẅí.
en: For which cause also I have been much hindered from coming to you.

ngiemboon: Tá’ áa nà fʉ̀’ɔɔn mèŋ n ne ńgee nê Yerósalem léná nkáb mbwo pʉ̀a Ssé pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ.
en: But now I go unto Jerusalem to minister unto the saints.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge gÿo gwɔ́ tà gʉa cʉ́me yɔɔn nkáb gie mé ka ma’ lɔɔn, é gʉa Spana, é gwɔ́ gʉa cʉa yé lá’ pi.
en: When therefore I have performed this, and have sealed to them this fruit, I will come by you into Spain.

ngiemboon: M biŋ ne ńzsé ngie n ge gÿo tó, e Ssé cʉa ná mèŋ, ńnéŋ mbʉ́lè ná pi tɛ’.
en: And I am sure that, when I come unto you, I shall come in the fulness of the blessing of the gospel of Christ.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, n gwɔ́ tóo mbʉ̀a pi, ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn ne ńkága, e Ssé zẅíŋ, mbà n ge nèŋe tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, é zẅɛ́te.
en: that I may come unto you with joy by the will of God, and may with you be refreshed.

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie Ssé gẅie à náa sẅéte à ne ńgwɔ́ né pi metsèm.*Amen.
en: Now the God of peacebewith you all. Amen.

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛ’te Piriska pɔ́ Akilas ńná né mèŋ, ée pʉ̀a pie pega pɔ́ pǔ fa’a fà’a Yěsô Kristo.
en: Greet Priscilla and Aquila my helpers in Christ Jesus:

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛ’te Malîɛ. À ka téŋe zì’i tɛ’ ńtí gẅí.
en: Greet Mary, who bestowed much labour on us.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gǐŋ ńtsyɛ’te Ampliatus. Àa fɛ́ wɔ̀ɔn we ntʉ̀ nzẅìŋ nzèm Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: Greet Amplias my beloved in the Lord.

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛ’te Wirbiŋ, pega pɔ́ zɔ pǔ fa’a fà’a Kristo, ńtsyɛ’te mbɔɔ fɛ́ wɔ̀ɔn we ntʉ̀ nzẅìŋ Stakis.
en: Salute Urbane, our helper in Christ, and Stachys my beloved.

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛ’te Apelès, à ka nyɛ̌ ngie àa kwà’ nyìŋ Kristo. Pi tsyɛ’te pʉ̀a ndá Aristobul.
en: Salute Apelles approved in Christ. Salute them which are of Aristobulus'household.

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛ’te*Herôdine. Àa nyìŋ Yuda pá’ mèŋ. Pi tsyɛ’te pʉ̀a ndá Narsise pie é la nnɛ́ ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: Salute Herodion my kinsman. Greet them that be of thehouseholdof Narcissus, which are in the Lord.

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛ’te Asinkelite, lê Flégon, lê Hermes, lê Patfobas, lê Hermas, mbɔɔ mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pie pâ pɔ́ gwɔ́.
en: Salute Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermas, Patrobas, Hermes, and the brethren which are with them.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi metsèm.*Amen]
en: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christbewith you all. Amen.

ngiemboon: E Ssé zɔ zsé nó gílé yé. Pege cʉa ná Yěsô Kristo ńgu’te yé nà ngù’ nkɔ́ɔn nê nkɔ̌ɔn.*Amen.
en: Written to the Romans from Corinthus, and sent by Phebe servant of the church at Cenchrea.

ngiemboon: Tá wege Ssé mbɔɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi ḿbiŋ ne ńnéŋe sẅétè ntʉ́m pi.
en: gracebeunto you, and peace, from God our Father, andfromthe Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Á fó ná pá’ mé ka shwóŋó gẅi nò gie mé zsé ná Kristo, pi zẅíŋ lê ntʉ́m gẅi ntsèm,
en: even as the testimony of Christ was confirmed in you:

ngiemboon: Mèŋ ne síe Ssé á nue é té ndà’ Gaẅis pɔ́ Krispus wɔ́, mbà tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅi la tè kẅé ntse mbwo mèŋ wɔ́.
en: I thank God that I baptized none of you, but Crispus and Gaius;

ngiemboon: Pú’u lá, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie ngwɔ́ á gɔɔn ngie pi la kẅé ntse ńdɔgɔ pú’u, ńcʉ́’ʉ pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn à tè wó wɔ́.
en: lest any should say that I had baptized in mine own name.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la zɔɔn ńgɔɔn tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwà’ne yé ngie: Mèŋ n ge gÿo tágte zse nò pazsé nò, é pyág legyè pʉ̀a pie legyè sɔ́b ée wó.
en: And will bring to nothing the understanding of the prudent.

ngiemboon: À cʉa pú’u, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ mesoŋ le ŋá’te mvfò Ssé wɔ́.
en: that no flesh should glory in his presence.

ngiemboon: N da tyé tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńjú’ ḿbú ḿbÿɛ́ pÿɛ́, ńjú’ ḿbɔ́g pɔ́g tà ne ḿvɛɛ.
en: And I was with you in weakness, and in fear, and in much trembling.

ngiemboon: Pú’u légwɔ́ gie gẅi lezáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé tè jʉ́’ʉ nà zsé nò pʉ̀a mesoŋ wɔ́. Á ge jʉ́’ʉ pɔ́ nà metʉ̀ Ssé.
en: that your faith should not stand in the wisdom of men, but in the power of God.

ngiemboon: Légwɔ́ gie pʉ̀a pie é kwoŋo yé ge gÿo zẅɛ́’.
en: The things which God hath prepared for them that love him.

ngiemboon: Tá á ké ńgʉa ná pege, mbà à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ gie Kristo ne ńkwaŋa kɔ́ wɔ́, mbà pege zsě.
en: For who hath known the mind of the Lord, that he may instruct him? But we have the mind of Christ.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ka paa tÿǒ ssé, Apolos pfɛte ntse mǒ. Tá e Ssé zɔ̌ gÿo á kẅág.
en: I have planted, Apollos watered; but God gave the increase.

ngiemboon: Á nue peg puté ńně fa’a pɔ́ fà’a Ssé. Pi gwɔ́ nká’ Ssé, ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ ndá gie Ssé ne ńkwɛ́ɛ.
en: For we are labourers together with God: ye are God's husbandry,ye areGod's building.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà cÿó ndá, mbà á kéen ndá’ ńgwɔ́ ssé, ńgwɔ́ Yěsô Kristo. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ á legíŋ ńnuŋe tsɔ́ ye ndyɛ̀’ɛ wɔ́.
en: For other foundation can no man lay than that is laid, which is Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie nyìŋ la lɔg ńkwɛ́ ndá nà cÿó ndá ŋwɛ́, lɔɔn ńdá’ tè shÿó, mbà ngàŋ ge lá’ kẅé ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’.
en: If any man's work abide which he hath built thereupon, he shall receive a reward.

ngiemboon: Pi tè ne ńzsé ngie pi ee pɛ́’ɛ̀ ńgwɔ́*jʉ’ʉ Ssé, à Zẅìge Ssé tsẅé tsoló wɔ́ ka?
en: Know ye not that ye are the temple of God, andthatthe Spirit of God dwelleth in you?

ngiemboon: Ŋwà’ne Ssé gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zsé nkwaŋá nò pàzsé nò. À zsě ngie é té tsɔ́ mmó ku’».
en: And again, The Lord knoweth the thoughts of the wise, that they are vain.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, tà nyìŋ gẅi lɔg pá’ aa nyìŋ we mákyè ńdɔg ńka’te. Á nue akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́, gwɔ́ pɔ́ gí.
en: Therefore let no man glory in men. For all things are your's;

ngiemboon: Tá á gʉa ná pi, pi gwɔ́ mbwo Kristo, Kristo piŋ ńgwɔ́ mbwo Ssé.
en: and ye are Christ's; and ChristisGod's.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la n dɔgɔ ńgɔɔn mbwo pi ngie, pi pí fʉ̀’ ná mèŋ.
en: Wherefore I beseech you, be ye followers of me.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi ka kwaŋ ngie n tè lá’ gíŋe tó tà gyá gẅi wɔ́, ńkwaŋ pú’u, ńzye léŋá’te.
en: Now some are puffed up, as though I would not come to you.

ngiemboon: Á nue anò*lefùɔ Ssé, á té gwɔ́ léseen ńtáŋte shwóŋè ńgɔɔn wɔ́, metʉ̀ Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a zɔ̌ fa’a fà’.
en: For the kingdom of Godisnot in word, but in power.

ngiemboon: Pi gwɔ́ jʉ’ó ńne ńŋá’te, tá mbà pi kěen lúŋ yɛ̌ ntí nò lǔŋ, é piŋ fóo tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi jwoŋo nyìŋ gẅie à ka gÿo pú’u.
en: And ye are puffed up, and have not rather mourned, that he that hath done this deed might be taken away from among you.

ngiemboon: Á té poŋ pi ŋá’te lé yɛ̌ ntí nò tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi wɔ́. Pi tè ne ńzsé ngie méjʉ’ʉ*mvòŋ gÿo à feléwa ntsab pú ńkwɔ́’ wɔ́ ka?
en: Your gloryingisnot good. Know ye not that a little leaven leaveneth the whole lump?

ngiemboon: N da túmo ŋwà’ne mbwo pi ńgɔɔn tsoló ngie: Pi pɔ́ɔn légwɔ́ gie pia pʉ̀a pie é púmo wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pâ pɔ̌ núŋe nuŋe teme nò.
en: I wrote unto you in an epistle not to company with fornicators:

ngiemboon: E Ssé ge lá’ ŋag pʉ̀a pie é té pʉ̀a Kristo wɔ́. Pi fóo nùɔ pi ńjwoŋo nyìŋ tepòŋ.
en: But them that are without God judgeth. Therefore put away from among yourselves that wicked person.

ngiemboon: Pi tè ne ńzsé ngie pege ge lá’ ŋag*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé wɔ́ ka? Tà ngʉ̀a shÿɔ́’ɔ nà menò me fʉ̀’ɔɔn?
en: Know ye not that we shall judge angels? how much more things that pertain to this life?

ngiemboon: Tá, pi zɔ̌ ke ńgíŋe fʉa nò á mbwo mefɛ́ pí. Pi zɔ jʉʉ shúm sɔ́b.
en: Nay, ye do wrong, and defraud, and thatyourbrethren.

ngiemboon: Ndyɛ̌’ pi lege ngie e Ssé gẅie à la zíme Cʉ̀apʉ̀a nà legwé, à ge gÿo lɔg metʉ̀ mé é gíŋe zíme wégè yégè nà legwé.
en: And God hath both raised up the Lord, and will also raise up us by his own power.

ngiemboon: Tá’, nyìŋ gẅie à laa ye nɛ́ pɔ́ nà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, pɔ́ yé cʉ́’ ńgẅiin pɔ́ tà’a Zẅìge.
en: But he that is joined unto the Lord is one spirit.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la náa mmó ńdɔg fó ndá nkwɔɔn ńcu’u gẅi. Pi ké ńdɔg mbùm gi ńná mekù’ mbwo Ssé.
en: For ye are bought with a price: therefore glorify God in your body, and in your spirit, which are God's.

ngiemboon: Tá’ à ke ńcʉ́’ gie nyìŋ pumo wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ pɔ́ yé nuŋe nuŋe, wɛ̌ mámbàŋa wɔ́ kú’te nzwě we, wɛ̌ manzwě wɔ́ kú’te ndúm we.
en: Nevertheless,to avoidfornication, let every man have his own wife, and let every woman have her own husband.

ngiemboon: Á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mámbàŋa gÿo nò mámbàŋa ná nzwě we, manzwě gÿo nò manzwě nà ndúm we.
en: Let the husband render unto the wife due benevolence: and likewise also the wife unto the husband.

ngiemboon: é té pá’ɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́*lepʉ̌ sie mèŋ n zába wɔ́, n gɔɔn pɔ́ mmó gie pi lɔɔn ńgÿo á poŋ.
en: But I speak this by permission,andnot of commandment.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge gɔɔn mbwo menkẅì lâ mbwo mepfɔ̌g pànzwě ngie áa mboŋ ngie pɔ́ pʉ́le ńnéŋe pá’ mèŋ.
en: I say therefore to the unmarried and widows, It is good for them if they abide even as I.

ngiemboon: Tá ńké ńgwɔ́ gie pɔ́ gyǎ ngie pɔ́ té ku’u légwoonte mbùm yɔ́b wɔ́, pɔ́ zɔ́’, á nue mvfò lézɔ́’ ńcʉa léńnéŋe ńtsɔ́ɔn.
en: But if they cannot contain, let them marry: for it is better to marry than to burn.

ngiemboon: Manzwě piŋ ngwɔ́ nyìŋ Kristo, andúm we tè nyìŋ Kristo wɔ́, ńzẅíŋ pá’ pɔ́ yé ge ńnéŋe, tà á kẅɛ̀ɛ ná ye,
en: And the woman which hath an husband that believeth not, and if he be pleased to dwell with her, let her not leave him.

ngiemboon: Legwɔ́ gie mé la pú’u nyìŋ kà mé la tè yé pú’ wɔ́ tè tsɔ́ nò mvfò Ssé wɔ́. Leku’té mbʉ̌ Ssé zɔɔ nò.
en: Circumcision is nothing, and uncircumcision is nothing, but the keeping of the commandments of God.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie e Ssé la gwaa tóŋo nyìŋ, á ńnéŋe ná yɛ̌ jʉ’ wɔ́, angàŋ ké ńnéŋe pɔ́ jʉ’ó,
en: Let every man abide in the same calling wherein he was called.

ngiemboon: Kristo la cú’u gẅi ndá nkwɔɔn lê ntʉ̀ nzẅìŋ mmó. Pú’u la tà pi cʉ́’ menkwɔɔn pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: Ye are bought with a price; be not ye the servants of men.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gwɔ́ mvfò Ssé, ńnéŋe pɔ́ nà jʉ’ gie e Ssé ka gwaa tóŋo yé á ne ńnéŋe jʉ’ó.
en: Brethren, let every man, wherein he is called, therein abide with God.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná nyìŋ gẅie à zɔ̌’, mbà à kwaŋte pɔ́ menò me ndùmo ssé tsetsá’. À fa’ pɔ́ légÿo mmó gie á ge poŋo nzwě we.
en: but he that is married careth for the things that are of the world, how he may pleasehiswife.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńkwaŋa ngie à ne ńzsé tsɔ́ mmó, mbà à nyě tè zsě pá’ á kɔ’ɔ́ ne ńzɛ́te ngie à zsé pú’u.
en: And if any man think that he knoweth any thing, he knoweth nothing yet as he ought to know.
