ngiemboon: Tá ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńkwoŋo Ssé, mbà ngàŋ aa nyìŋ gẅie e Ssé ně ńdá’ ńzsé yé.
en: But if any man love God, the same is known of him.

ngiemboon: Pi jú’u nò gie n ge gɔɔn lélɔg ńkẅé twó yɔ́ɔn mbwo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ túu*lɔ̌’ nà yɔɔn ntí lélɔg fa’.
en: Mine answer to them that do examine me is this,

ngiemboon: Peg tè gẅiin yég lékẅé mmó ḿpfɛ́, ḿbiŋ ńnú ńtí fà’a yég wɔ́ ka?
en: Have we not power to eat and to drink?

ngiemboon: Kà á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie peg Panebâse gílé peg yé zɔ gẅiin léfa’ tá ńjÿó?
en: Or I only and Barnabas, have not we power to forbear working?

ngiemboon: ńdɔg pú’u, ńkẅé ntse, ńcʉ́’ pʉ̀a Mǒsê.
en: and were all baptized unto Moses in the cloud and in the sea;

ngiemboon: Pɔ́b métsèm la púte ńjÿó tà’a twó mmó léjÿó gie á lɔ́ɔn fóo mbwo Ssé.
en: and did all eat the same spiritual meat;

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò la gÿo pá’ɔɔn pá’ pege ge fó mǒ é laga twó yégè. Tá à cʉa pú’u, pege e le tsɔ́ɔn shúm tepòŋ pá’ pɔ́b wɔ́.
en: Now these things were our examples, to the intent we should not lust after evil things, as they also lusted.

ngiemboon: Pege pɔ́ɔn létsiŋe Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tsiŋé. Á piŋ ńgwɔ́ pá’ tsɔ́ pʉ̀a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b la gÿo tá menú tsɔ́gte wɔ́b pɔ́ kwéte.
en: Neither let us tempt Christ, as some of them also tempted, and were destroyed of serpents.

ngiemboon: Pege fǒ ná yɔɔn nò ńjú’ ngie lenyě ńgee ge ńzɔb, à tè poŋ
en: Wherefore let him that thinketh he standeth take heed lest he fall.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà menò mɔɔn ntsèm, mbà meshǔ pɔ́ɔn pentʉ̀ nzẅìŋ, tà pi gẅiin tsɔ́ nò ná legu’te shúm sie mé gu’te ngie ée messé.
en: Wherefore, my dearly beloved, flee from idolatry.

ngiemboon: Pege lɔɔn ńgÿo pú’u, mbà pege tě ńdɔgɔ fa’a ngie lóŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gyáŋ ńtí wégè wɔ́? Tsye pege tʉ ńcʉa yé ka?
en: Do we provoke the Lord to jealousy? are we stronger than he?

ngiemboon: Tà nyìŋ fà’ pɔ́ mmó gie á ge kẅéte pɔ́ twó mbùm yé. Nyìŋ fa’a mmó gie á ge kẅéte fɛ́ we.
en: Let no man seek his own, but every man another'swealth.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà nò mbab, mbà pi tóo metʉ̌a ńgyá mbab pi jú, ńkúu mbʉ̀a ḿpfɛ́ té gẅiin tsɔ́ nkwaŋá, té zɛ́te tsɔ́ nò.
en: Whatsoever is sold in the shambles,thateat, asking no question for conscience sake:

ngiemboon: «Ŋwà’ne Ssé gɔɔn ngie: Njÿó tà mbɔɔ shúm tsèm sie ée tsoló zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a».
en: for the earthisthe Lord's, and the fulness thereof.

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ́ ɔ̀ zɛ́te ngie mélà’a kɔ́ ɔ̀ gÿo mmó pɔ́ nà gù lekwòŋ, ntʉ́m tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀’ɛ piŋ ńŋaga yɛ̌ mmó?
en: conscience, I say, not thine own, but of the other: for why is my liberty judged of anotherman'sconscience?

ngiemboon: Tà pi gÿo mmó gie nyìŋ Yuda kà nyìŋ Gelekia wɔ́, kà nyìŋ cú’tè pʉ̀a Ssé wɔ́, ge kwɔɔnte mǒ gwe ssé.
en: Give none offence, neither to the Jews, nor to the Gentiles, nor to the church of God:

ngiemboon: Pi gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie pi píi fʉ̀’ ná mèŋ, ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ mèŋ m bíi fʉ̀’ ná Kristo.
en: Be ye followers of me, even as I alsoamof Christ.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n nǎ ngɔ́ɔnte gi pá’ pi tyé nà yɛ̌ nò wɔ́, ńkímte wɔ̀ɔn kimté. Mbɔɔ pá’ pi ne ńcwoŋo ńkú’te mà gẅie n da zí’i gẅí.
en: Now I praise you, brethren, that ye remember me in all things, and keep the ordinances, as I deliveredthemto you.

ngiemboon: á nue e Ssé la fó pɔ́ ná mámbàŋa ḿbwóon manzwě. À la tè fó pɔ́ ná manzwě ḿbwóon mámbàŋa wɔ́.
en: For the man is not of the woman; but the woman of the man.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la piŋ tè pwóon mámbàŋa ńtí manzwě wɔ́. À la pwóon pɔ́ manzwě ńtí mámbàŋa.
en: Neither was the man created for the woman; but the woman for the man.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿó manzwě gẅiin lépwoon twó yé, ńdɔg ńnyɛ ngie à ná nnɛ́ ssé á mvfò ndúm we. Pú’u, ńtí*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé.
en: For this cause ought the woman to have power onherhead because of the angels.

ngiemboon: Pi sáŋ gí tá ńjú’. Tà áa pé’e ńgwɔ́ mbòŋ ngie manzwě sẅíŋte Ssé tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo té pwoon twó yé?
en: Judge in yourselves: is it comely that a woman pray unto God uncovered?

ngiemboon: Mé ée nzɔ̌ nzɔ̌ ńzsé ngie áa nò shʉ́ mbwo mámbàŋa létsẅɛ́’ɛ twó tà á sag sag.
en: Doth not even nature itself teach you, that, if a man have long hair, it is a shame unto him?

ngiemboon: Áa nénʉ́ ngie pi gwɔ́ tà fagte menùɔ menùɔ, mé fó mǒ ńgyá pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ té kwoŋo fàgte wɔ́.
en: For there must be also heresies among you, that they which are approved may be made manifest among you.

ngiemboon: N dɔgɔ ńgyá ngie pi kúu tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè, ńgwɔ jÿó shúm léjÿó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, nkwaŋá gẅi té tyé ná yé wɔ́.
en: When ye come together therefore into one place,thisis not to eat the Lord's supper.

ngiemboon: Pú’u lá, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tsa’ mbùm ye. Tá ńdeen ńké ḿpfɛ́ yɔɔn mbelég ḿbiŋ ńnú yɔɔn ntú’,
en: But let a man examine himself, and so let him eat ofthatbread, and drink ofthatcup.

ngiemboon: á nue nyìŋ lɔɔn ḿpfɛ́ mbelég, ńnú tú’, té ne ńkímte mmó gie é lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn, mbà ngàŋ lɔgɔ ńtóŋte ntsaŋ ńnéŋe ná ye.
en: For he that eateth and drinketh unworthily, eateth and drinketh damnation to himself, not discerning the Lord's body.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿó tá pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńgwɔ́ mé guɔ. Petsɔ́ gwɔ́ menkǒon, mbà petsɔ̌ léen ńkwéte.
en: For this cause manyareweak and sickly among you, and many sleep.

ngiemboon: Pege laa pé’è ḿvɔg ńtsa’ mbùm yege, mbà à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ pege lÿɔ́’te tà pege é le gwe nà ntsaŋ mvfò Ssé wɔ́.
en: For if we would judge ourselves, we should not be judged.

ngiemboon: Tá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a à ŋaga wégè, ńdɔgɔ ńtÿɔ́gte wégè, ḿbɔ́gɔ pá’ à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ mé lá’ ńteme wég laa pʉ̀a njÿó ńŋag.
en: But when we are judged, we are chastened of the Lord, that we should not be condemned with the world.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, mbà mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, pi lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie pi cu’té léjÿó shúm, pi pyɛ́b petsɔ́ pʉ̀a.
en: Wherefore, my brethren, when ye come together to eat, tarry one for another.

ngiemboon: Afù’ gie Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a lɔg ńcÿó geme nyìŋ, áa mentí mentí, tá Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a gie á cÿó gem ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ yémɔ’ɔ́.
en: Now there are diversities of gifts, but the same Spirit.

ngiemboon: Mefà’ mie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a náa mbwo pʉ̀a, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ mentí mentí. Tá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à náa ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wémɔ’ɔ́.
en: And there are differences of administrations, but the same Lord.

ngiemboon: Pàmánzsè lélɔg fa’ mefà’, ée mentí mentí. Tá’ tà’ Ssé wémɔ’ɔ́ zɔ náa metʉ̀ mbwo wɛ̌ wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́.
en: And there are diversities of operations, but it is the same God which worketh all in all.

ngiemboon: A Zẅìge ŋwɛ́ zɔ̌ gíŋe ńgÿo wetsɔ́ nyìŋ gwɔ záb ntʉ́m wé nà Ssé tɛ’, wetsɔ̌ gẅiin légÿo megùɔ zeŋe.
en: to another faith by the same Spirit; to another the gifts of healing by the same Spirit;

ngiemboon: Tà’ Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a, ńké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ yɛ̌, zɔ̌ gÿo mɛ̌ menò, ńne ńcÿó geme wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ yé Zẅìge á kwǒŋ.
en: but all these worketh that one and the selfsame Spirit, dividing to every man severally as he will.

ngiemboon: Pege zɔɔn ne ńzsé ngie mbùm nnɛ́ tè gwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’a kèm wɔ́, e gẅiin mekèm nnɛ́ tà é gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn.
en: For the body is not one member, but many.

ngiemboon: Tá’ e Ssé la kwoŋ, ńtÿɔ́gɔ yɛ̌ kème nnɛ́ wɔ́ pɔ́ nà yé jʉ’.
en: But now hath God set the members every one of them in the body, as it hath pleased him.

ngiemboon: Mbùm nnɛ́ laa pé’è ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’a kèm wémɔ’ɔ́ gílé yé, mbà mé tóŋ lê mbùm nnɛ́?
en: And if they were all one member, wherewerethe body?

ngiemboon: Mekèm nnɛ́ tsɛ ńgyɔ́ɔn tɛ’ tá’ ńké ńcú’te ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tà’ mbùm nnɛ́.
en: But noware theymany members, yet but one body.

ngiemboon: Tà ńcʉ́’ pú’u, mbà mbɔɔ mekèm mbùm nnɛ́ mie mé kwaŋ ngie yɔ́b fà’ té gyɔ́ɔn, é kẅéte kẅetě.
en: Nay, much more those members of the body, which seem to be more feeble, are necessary:

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà mbùm Kristo, mbà pi pɛ lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ yɛ̌, wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ ná pi, gwɔ́ tà’a kèm nà mbùm ŋwɛ́.
en: Now ye are the body of Christ, and members in particular.

ngiemboon: kà pɔ́ légÿo megùɔ zeŋe wɔ́, kà pɔ́ léshwóŋó meshwóŋè mie pɔ́ laa zí’i wɔ́, kà pɔ́ lékyagte mɛ̌ meshwóŋè wɔ́.
en: Have all the gifts of healing? do all speak with tongues? do all interpret?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à kwoŋo nyìŋ mesoŋ, à gẅiin kwɔgɔ nnɛ́, à kẅete pʉ̀a, à tè gẅiin kègɔ́’ wɔ́, à tè nyɛ nnɛ́ wɔ́, à tè ŋá’te,
en: Charity suffereth long,andis kind; charity envieth not; charity vaunteth not itself, is not puffed up,

ngiemboon: à tè gÿo menò shʉ́ wɔ́, à tè kim, à tè lwo ńgyáŋa lóŋ wɔ́, à tè gẅiin nyìŋ lóŋ ye wɔ́,
en: doth not behave itself unseemly, seeketh not her own, is not easily provoked, thinketh no evil;

ngiemboon: à tè kága nà cÿɔ̌ nò wɔ́, à kǎg yé pɔ́ nà nò nénʉ́.
en: rejoiceth not in iniquity, but rejoiceth in the truth;

ngiemboon: á nue pege fʉ̀’ɔɔn ńzsé pɔ́ tsɔ́ gwǒŋ, e Ssé tè nyɛɛ wégè shúm ntsèm tá pege tsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo ye wɔ́.
en: For we know in part, and we prophesy in part.

ngiemboon: À ge ké lá’ gwɔ́ tà nyɛɛ wégè shúm ntsèm, múɔ mézsé nò we fʉ̀’ɔɔn à mag.
en: But when that which is perfect is come, then that which is in part shall be done away.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ gie ngyè ntàŋ lɔɔn tè kẅɛ mboŋó wɔ́, mbà ńgwɔ́ awɔ̌ nyɛte mbùm ye légʉa ḿma’ ncù?
en: For if the trumpet give an uncertain sound, who shall prepare himself to the battle?

ngiemboon: Meshwóŋè ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ mentí tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, tá’ mé lɔgɔ yɛ̌ wɔ́ ńgɔɔn pɔ́ nò.
en: There are, it may be, so many kinds of voices in the world, and none of themiswithout signification.

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ ntí lesíe Ssé tsɛ ńgwɔ́ mbòŋ tɛ’ tá’, e tè kẅéte wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ lékẅi’i ńzáb ntʉ́m nà Ssé wɔ́.
en: For thou verily givest thanks well, but the other is not edified.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne síe Ssé ná pá’ à la gÿo mèŋ shwóŋó meshwóŋè mie mèŋ n da tè zí’i, tà ńcʉa gẅi métsèm.
en: I thank my God, I speak with tongues more than ye all:

ngiemboon: Tá’ ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńgɔɔn nò, e Ssé tsẅii nò mbwo wetsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie aa jʉ’ó, angàŋ zá’a légɔɔn nò.
en: Ifany thingbe revealed to another that sitteth by, let the first hold his peace.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná pànzwě, mbà pi gẅiin léké ńgÿo pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ áa tsɛ̀ɛ*mendá cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo ntsèm ńgwɔ́ pú’u la,
en: For God is notthe authorof confusion, but of peace, as in all churches of the saints.

ngiemboon: Anò Ssé á la sá’ pɔ́ lá’ pi ka? Kà mé la gɔɔn pɔ́ ndà’ mbwo pi?
en: What? came the word of God out from you? or came it unto you only?

ngiemboon: Tá ńgwɔ́ gie nyìŋ lɔɔn ḿmoŋe, mbà e Ssé moŋé ye yé.
en: But if any man be ignorant, let him be ignorant.

ngiemboon: Tá’ mé lɔg pɔ́ mbʉ́lè ńgÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, tà nyìŋ néŋ ḿvéle nkàŋ.
en: Let all things be done decently and in order.

ngiemboon: Mé la ńnéŋe yé tsɛ̀ɛ lesyè, á gwaa gwɔ́ lyɛ̌’ sétá á zíme nà legwé, pá’ ŋwà’ne Ssé la tʉ́ njÿó ńgɔɔn.
en: and that he was buried, and that he rose again the third day according to the scriptures:

ngiemboon: À la nyɛ mbùm ye mbwo Piɛ, mbɔɔ mbwo yetsɔ́*ngàŋa kwò yé ná pʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a,
en: and that he was seen of Cephas, then of the twelve:

ngiemboon: À la gÿo ḿbɔ́ɔnte ńnyɛ mbùm ye mbwo Jâg ńgíŋe ńnyɛɛ mbwo megàŋ ntúm métsèm.
en: After that, he was seen of James; then of all the apostles.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie mé té kwé ńgíŋe ńzíme nà legwé wɔ́, mbà mbɔɔ Kristo la tè zím yé nà legwé wɔ́.
en: But if there be no resurrection of the dead, then is Christ not risen:

ngiemboon: á nue á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie mé té kwé ńgíŋ ńzíme nà legwé wɔ́, mbà mbɔɔ Kristo la tè zíme nà legwé wɔ́.
en: For if the dead rise not, then is not Christ raised:

ngiemboon: Á gíŋ ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie, epʉ̀a pie é la gwɔ kwé, letʉ́m sɔ́b zébe ná Kristo, pɔ́ léen ḿbyé.
en: Then they also which are fallen asleep in Christ are perished.

ngiemboon: Tá’ wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ zím pɔ́ nà yé fʉ̀’. Kristo la vɔg ńzím. Epʉ̀a pé ge lá’ zím yɔ́b, á fʉ̀’ gie à ge lá’ gíŋ tó.
en: But every man in his own order: Christ the firstfruits; afterward they that are Christ's at his coming.

ngiemboon: Anzsò nzèm ngàŋ mbù gẅie e Ssé ge lá’ pyága yé aa legwé gẅie à lɔgɔ pʉ̀a.
en: The last enemythatshall be destroyedisdeath.

ngiemboon: Mbà peg zẅiŋé léńnéŋe fʉ̀’ ntsèm ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ncwò legwé mélà’a kɔ́?
en: And why stand we in jeopardy every hour?

ngiemboon: Tà pi zẅíŋ mé fʉʉ gẅí, pi legé ngie mbàŋ tepòŋ cʉ́ŋe pʉ́a ka?
en: Be not deceived: evil communications corrupt good manners.

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ zɛ́te ngie mepfó zíme nà legwé lêkɔ́ wɔ́? MÀbiŋ ńgẅiin yɛ̌ ntí mbùm nnɛ́ fʉ̀’ó wɔ́?
en: But somemanwill say, How are the dead raised up? and with what body do they come?

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ zɛ́te pú’u, mbà aa gʉ̀gʉ̀, á nue nyìŋ pye mmó, á vɔg ńdʉ́, tá ńdeen ńké sá’ ńná letsìŋe mmó se sẅé.
en: Thoufool, that which thou sowest is not quickened, except it die:

ngiemboon: E Ssé pɔ́ɔnte ńná ntí letsiŋé sie à kwǒŋ né mbyè mmó ŋwɛ́, ńná kwà’ ntí letsiŋé ye yɛ̌ mbyè mmó wɔ́ né ye.
en: but God giveth it a body as it hath pleased him, and to every seed his own body.

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie yɔɔn mbùm gie e kwě, ńdʉ́ lɔɔn, e ge lá’ sele cʉ́’ gie e tè gíŋe kwé wɔ́, é ké le lʉ́.
en: For this corruptible must put on incorruption, and this mortalmustput on immortality.

ngiemboon: Legwé, e mú metʉ̀ lɔg ńjÿó ncù é pfǒ nzɔ̌? Legwé, à jú sisìŋ á pfǒ nzɔ̌?
en: O death, whereisthy sting? O grave, whereisthy victory?

ngiemboon: Sisìŋ gie legwé lɔg ńtsɔ́gɔ nyìŋ ée menò tepòŋ, metʉ̀ menò tepòŋ fóo ná*lepʉ̌ Ssé sie é nyɛ ngie nyìŋ à gwě ntsaŋ.
en: The sting of deathissin; and the strength of sinisthe law.

ngiemboon: Tá’ pege ná ndǎg mbwo Ssé gẅie à gÿo pege cʉa ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo, ńgÿo pege cʉa nò tepòŋ mbɔɔ legwé.
en: But thanksbeto God, which giveth us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge gÿo tó, é gwɔ́ ntúm pʉ̀a pie pi tsɔ̌’, ńná meŋwà’ne mbwó pɔ́b, pɔ́ lɔg ńgʉa Yerósalem ńná nkáb gie pi cu’té.
en: And when I come, whomsoever ye shall approve byyourletters, them will I send to bring your liberality unto Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńtó ne ńzɛ́te ngie n gʉa yɔ́ɔn wó, mbà pega pɔ́ ge gwɔ́ kwò.
en: And if it be meet that I go also, they shall go with me.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge gÿo gwɔ́ tóo lá’ pi, é zɔɔn pfó tsɛ̀ɛ paga ngwòŋ Makedonia, á nue mèŋ n gẅiin légʉa wó.
en: Now I will come unto you, when I shall pass through Macedonia: for I do pass through Macedonia.

ngiemboon: N te ne ńkwoŋo légwaa gyá gẅi fʉ̀’ɔɔn, ńně ńcʉa cʉa wɔ́. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a lɔɔn ńzẅíŋ, mbà pege ge ná’a ńnéŋe.
en: For I will not see you now by the way; but I trust to tarry a while with you, if the Lord permit.

ngiemboon: Tá’ mèŋ n ne ńkwaŋa léneŋe Efeso wɔɔn tà línɔ́ɔn Paŋtekɔ̂d lá’ ńtɔ́g,
en: But I will tarry at Ephesus until Pentecost.

ngiemboon: Tà pi gwá’a lÿɔ̀g ńdyé, pi záb ntʉ́m nà Ssé té kʉ́a, pi gwɔ́ mbàŋa, pi tʉ tʉ.
en: Watch ye, stand fast in the faith, quit you like men, be strong.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ne ńgÿo pɔ́ kɔ́ wɔ́, pi lɔg pɔ́ nkwòŋe.
en: Let all your things be done with charity.

ngiemboon: Pi jú’ ncwò pʉ̀a pá’ pɔ́b, mbɔɔ we pʉ̀a pie pâ pɔ́ pú ńtéŋe zì’i.
en: that ye submit yourselves unto such, and to every one that helpeth withus, and laboureth.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ka néŋ ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn pá’ pɔ́ ka néŋ gẅi gí. Pi ná mekù’ á mbwó ntí pʉ̀a pá’ pɔ́b lɔɔn.
en: For they have refreshed my spirit and your's: therefore acknowledge ye them that are such.

ngiemboon: Kwà’ mèŋ Pɔl, n dɔgɔ́ pwó yɔ́ɔn, ńŋwe’e yɔɔn tsyɛ’te.
en: The salutation ofmePaul with mine own hand.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn tè kwoŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô wɔ́, e Ssé néŋ ndòon twó ngàŋ. Marana tha. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a weg, tóo!
en: If any man love not the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be Anathema Maran-atha.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo néŋ mbʉ́lè ná pi métsèm.
en: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christbewith you.

ngiemboon: Tá wege Ssé mbɔɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi ḿbiŋ ne ńnéŋe sẅétè ntʉ́m pi.
en: gracebeto you and peace from God our Father, andfromthe Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ pege ne ńgyá ngɔ́’ tɛ’, pá’ Kristo la gyá yé ngɔ́’ tɛ’ la, e Ssé giŋé ne ńtóonte wégè tɛ’ ńcʉa nà Kristo.
en: For as the sufferings of Christ abound in us, so our consolation also aboundeth by Christ.

ngiemboon: Ngǎŋ! Á gʉa nà nò gie peg ka shwóŋó gẅí, peg ka tè gɔɔn nò ḿbiŋ ńkúbe wɔ́. E Ssé ne ńzsé.
en: ButasGodistrue, our word toward you was not yea and nay.

ngiemboon: Kwà’ Ssé zɔ gÿo tá peg ne ńtʉte tʉte nzèm Kristo tà mbɔɔ pi. À la faga wégè,
en: Now he which stablisheth us with you in Christ, and hath anointed us,isGod;

ngiemboon: ńcÿɔ́’ɔ liŋé yé ná pege, ńnéŋe Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ntʉ́m pege. Á lɔg ńgwɔ́ ndùŋ mvfò mmó nà shúm sie à ge náa mbwo pege.
en: who hath also sealed us, and given the earnest of the Spirit in our hearts.

ngiemboon: Pi jú’u mmó gie á ka gÿo n gyá ngie mèŋ n te gíŋe piŋe lá’ pi, é gÿo pi gíŋ ḿmÿɔg wɔ́,
en: But I determined this with myself, that I would not come again to you in heaviness.

ngiemboon: á nue n dɔɔn ńgÿo pi mÿɔg, mbà pà wɔ̌ ge piŋ gÿo ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn kág tà á légwɔ́ pɔ́ gẅi gẅie n zɔ̌ɔn ńgÿo pi mÿɔg wɔ́?
en: For if I make you sorry, who is he then that maketh me glad, but the same which is made sorry by me?

ngiemboon: Lelÿò pʉ̀a ké ńkaga yé, á ku’ pú’u.
en: Sufficient to such a manisthis punishment, whichwas inflictedof many.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, mèŋ n ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie pi gÿo nà ntí gie à ge zsé ngie pi nyě ńkwoŋo yé kwoŋ.
en: Wherefore I beseech you that ye would confirmyourlove toward him.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie n ka gǐŋ ńgwaa ŋwe’e ŋwà’ne mbwo pi ńne fa’a lélʉŋte gẅi ńgyá, ka pi ku’u lé jú’ ncwò ná menò ntsèm wɔ́.
en: For to this end also did I write, that I might know the proof of you, whether ye be obedient in all things.

ngiemboon: ńzsé ngie pege tè nyé Sátà à cʉa wégè wɔ́, á nue pege tè ne ḿmoŋe mmó gie aa nzèm pege é fa’a wɔ́.
en: lest Satan should get an advantage of us: for we are not ignorant of his devices.

ngiemboon: Pi pɛ zɔ yég ŋwà’ne, mbà mé la ŋwe’e tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m wég, pʉ̀a metsèm ne ńzsé ḿbiŋ ne ńtóŋo,
en: Ye are our epistle written in our hearts, known and read of all men:

ngiemboon: Peg gɔɔn nò ná fa’a yég pá’ɔɔn, á nue peg lɔg pá’ peg la nnɛ́ ná Kristo, ńkwa’ ńzsé ngie e Ssé zẅíŋe nò yég.
en: And such trust have we through Christ to God-ward:

ngiemboon: Pá’ á laa pú’u la, á ge gǎ tá fà’ ná nò Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a, á le náa shʉ́shÿɔ́g tà ńtɔ́gɔ wɛ̌ wɔ́?
en: how shall not the ministration of the spirit be rather glorious?

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ pege zɔɔn éfó ńgɔɔn ngie, shʉ́shÿɔ́g we fʉ̀’ɔɔn pǔ ńgwɔ́ wó tɛ’, tà we fʉ̀’e mvfò à la tè tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: For even that which was made glorious had no glory in this respect, by reason of the glory that excelleth.

ngiemboon: Pá’ peg ne ńnyɛ́te ńzsé ngie mɔɔn menò ée nénʉ́ la, peg shʉashʉa ńgɔɔn nò mǒ.
en: Seeing then that we have such hope, we use great plainness of speech:

ngiemboon: Tà ńkú lyɛ̌’ɔɔn pʉ̀a Israel gwɔ́ tà ne ńtóŋo meŋwà’ne Mǒsê, étsɔ̌ nkǔɔ pwoon legyè sɔ́b.
en: But even unto this day, when Moses is read, the vail is upon their heart.

ngiemboon: Tá nyìŋ kě ńgwɔ́ tà sele nnɛ́ ńdíe Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, nkǔɔ zyɛ́bɛ,
en: Nevertheless when it shall turn to the Lord, the vail shall be taken away.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pá’ e Ssé la lɔg pɔ́ tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe yé, ńnáa yɔɔn fà’ mbwo peg la, peg tè kʉ́a wɔ́.
en: Therefore seeing we have this ministry, as we have received mercy, we faint not;

ngiemboon: Mé kʉ́e wég e Ssé ké tè wég gwá’. Á gʉa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ ńgwá’a fʉ̀’ gie mé temé wég ssé la, tá peg ké tè kwé.
en: persecuted, but not forsaken; cast down, but not destroyed;

ngiemboon: Á fó pú’u, legwé gwaa gwɔ́ soŋ nnɛ́ peg ne fa’a yé fà’, le gwɔ́ wó ne fa’a yé fà’ soŋ nnɛ́ pi.
en: So then death worketh in us, but life in you.

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ mbùm nnɛ́ lɔɔn ńkábte wégè, pege le gíŋ ńgwɔ́ mvfò Ssé ńgwɔ́ pàtè ma’ nzsǒ wɔ,
en: if so be that being clothed we shall not be found naked.

ngiemboon: E Ssé zɔ ka cwoŋte wégè ná wɛ̌ légwɔ́, ńnáa Zẅìge yé mbwo pege ńdɔg ńgÿo zyě ssé ná shúm sie à ge gÿo tá ná né pege.
en: Now he that hath wrought us for the selfsame thingisGod, who also hath given unto us the earnest of the Spirit.

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie pege nyě tè lɔg nÿɔ́g mégè ńgyá yé. Tá’, pege neŋé ne ńzẅí’te pá’ɔɔn, mélà’mie pege záb ntʉ́m ná yé.
en: (for we walk by faith, not by sight:)

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná peg ngàŋ ntúm, peg tè ne ńgÿo tsɔ́ mmó gie ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ kwɔɔnte mǒ ńgwe ssé, mé fó mǒ ńdɔg ńzoonte fà’a yég wɔ́.
en: Giving no offence in any thing, that the ministry be not blamed:

ngiemboon: Pi meshǔ peg pie ée Korento, peg shwoŋó gẅi nò té le’e mvwɔ́’, peg pǔ ńnyɛ́’ ntʉ́m wég ńnyɛɛ gẅí.
en: OyeCorinthians, our mouth is open unto you, our heart is enlarged.

ngiemboon: Peg tè ne ńdʉ’ʉ lékwoŋo gẅi wɔ́, atsɔ́ mmó lɔɔn ńne ńtáte gẅi lékwoŋo wég, mbà à fóo né pi.
en: Ye are not straitened in us, but ye are straitened in your own bowels.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n deen ńké ńkúe gẅí.
en: And I will receive you,

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ngàŋa tʉ̀ ntsèm zɔ gɔɔn.
en: saith the Lord Almighty.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ m bǔ ńne ńkága tɛ’ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́, n gʉa ná kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, ńtém nzèm yɔ̀ɔn ńná né pi, té pɔ́g.
en: I rejoice therefore that I have confidence in you in allthings.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pég, peg ne fa’a légÿo pi zsé mmó gie e Ssé ka cÿó gʉm mecú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo mie ée Makedonia pɔ́ gÿo.
en: Moreover, brethren, we do you to wit of the grace of God bestowed on the churches of Macedonia;

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á ka gÿo peg sẅíŋte Titus ngie à gʉa lá’ pi, ńgÿo yɔɔn fà’a pòŋo ntʉ́m gie à la gÿo pi zye, á mege ńcʉ́me.
en: Insomuch that we desired Titus, that as he had begun, so he would also finish in you the same grace also.

ngiemboon: Pege ná ndǎg mbwo Ssé á ná pá’ à gÿo Titus zeŋe nnɛ́ nà nò gí pá’ peg.
en: But thanksbeto God, which put the same earnest care into the heart of Titus for you.

ngiemboon: Peg tè ne ńkwoŋo ngie mé zoonte wég ná wɔ̀ɔn máamáa mbwɔ́’ nkáb gẅie mé ne ńcubo ńge cʉ́me mbwo peg wɔ́.
en: avoiding this, that no man should blame us in this abundance which is administered by us:

ngiemboon: Apòŋo ntʉ́myé áa ntě ḿmaga wɔ́.
en: His righteousness remaineth for ever.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, á poŋ ngie pege ná ndǎg mbwo Ssé, ńtí fù’u té fʉ̀’ gie à la ná né pege.
en: Thanksbeunto God for his unspeakable gift.

ngiemboon: Peg tsɛ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ pá’ petsɔ́ tá’, e yeg ntí léma’ ncù e tè leen ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ye pʉ̀a mesoŋ wɔ́.
en: For though we walk in the flesh, we do not war after the flesh:

ngiemboon: N te kwoŋo légwɔ́ mbwo pi, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ fʉ̀’e mèŋ n kǔ’ pɔ́ létyé ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a ńŋwe’e ŋwà’ne ńdɔg ḿvege gẅi wɔ́.
en: that I may not seem as if I would terrify you by letters.

ngiemboon: N kwǎŋ ngie n dɔɔn ńgɔɔn yɔ́ɔn nò mbwo pi pá’ nyìŋ gẅie à pʉ̌a la, mbà pi ge zẅíŋ, pi ké ńcʉ́’ n gɔɔn ná yɛ̌ ntí.
en: Would to God ye could bear with me a little inmyfolly: and indeed bear with me.

ngiemboon: Tá n ne ńkwaŋa yɔ́ɔn ngie pʉ̀a pie pi gyá ngie pɔ́ ée memǎ megàŋ ntúm Yěsô lɛ, pɔ́ té cʉa wɔ̀ɔn nà tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: For I suppose I was not a whit behind the very chiefest apostles.

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn pú’u, mélà’a kɔ́? Áa nue mèŋ n te gẅi kwoŋ keen? Ngǎŋ, e Ssé ne ńzsé ngie mèŋ n kwoŋo gẅí.
en: Wherefore? because I love you not? God knoweth.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn ne ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ shúm sie é gwɔ́ pɔ́ se pʉ̀a mesoŋ ńka’te, pú’u la, n ge ka’te yɔ́ɔn.
en: Seeing that many glory after the flesh, I will glory also.

ngiemboon: Pi ne ńkwaŋa ngie legyè sí ée wó, tá á ké yɛ̂ gie pi zẅiŋé nò mepʉ̀a lɛ!
en: For ye suffer fools gladly, seeing yeyourselvesare wise.

ngiemboon: ée ngʉ̀a méntʉ̀a pá’ pà Yuda cǔa wɔ̀ɔn mengwɔ̀ɔn ntsɔ̀b lepfwɔ’ɔ́ lê móm tá,
en: Of the Jews five times received I fortystripessave one.

ngiemboon: N kaa tʉ́ ntsèm wɔ́, áa lyɛ̌’ ntsèm mèŋ n ne sáŋa nò ná mecú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo mie ée jʉ’ ntsèm,
en: Beside those things that are without, that which cometh upon me daily, the care of all the churches.

ngiemboon: Á gwé’e ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé ka’te, mbà ńgwɔ́ ńdɔg pɔ́ pá’ m bÿɛ́ pÿɛ̌ ńka’te.
en: If I must needs glory, I will glory of the things which concern mine infirmities.

ngiemboon: ée ngʉ̀a ntá pá’ mèŋ sẅiŋté Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ngie à fó ná mèŋ ńkẅile yɛ̌ ngɔ́’,
en: For this thing I besought the Lord thrice, that it might depart from me.

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ tá mèŋ n ne ńzɛ́te gẅi ngie n da túm pʉ̀a mbwo pi pé’è pɔ́ ke ńtó ńkẅé tsɔ́ mmó gí ka?
en: Did I make a gain of you by any of them whom I sent unto you?

ngiemboon: N kwǎŋ ngie pi ge zẅíŋ ngie á gʉa ná peg, mbà peg kéen ńnyɛ kwà’ mboŋó ngie peg ee mengàŋ ntúm Kristo.
en: But I trust that ye shall know that we are not reprobates.

ngiemboon: Peg zɔɔn ńgẅiin yég pɔ́ létóon nò gie áa nénʉ̀, peg tè gẅiin létáte nò gie áa nénʉ́ wɔ́.
en: For we can do nothing against the truth, but for the truth.

ngiemboon: Pega mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pie pega pɔ̌ ee jʉ’ɔɔn pǔ ńnáa yɔɔn ŋwà’ne á mbwo mecú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Galatia.
en: and all the brethren which are with me, unto the churches of Galatia:

ngiemboon: Peg ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie Tá wege Ssé mbɔɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo ne ńgwɔ né pi, ńne ńnéŋe sẅéte ntʉ́m pi.
en: gracebeto you and peace from God the Father, andfromour Lord Jesus Christ,

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a mesoŋ gu’te Ssé mengù’u mengù’, Ameŋ.
en: to whombeglory for ever and ever. Amen.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, tà mèŋ shwóŋó gẅí, nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie pi la jú’ n tsẅi é té nkwaŋá nyìŋ mesoŋ wɔ́.
en: But I certify you, brethren, that the gospel which was preached of me is not after man.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ mesoŋ zɔ la zɔɔn tè cʉ́me wɛ̌ nkʉ̀ mbwo mèŋ wɔ́. Nyìŋ mesoŋ ké tè wɔ̀ɔn zí’i, Yěsô Kristo zɔ la gÿo mèŋ n zsé.
en: For I neither received it of man, neither was I taughtit, but by the revelation of Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: é té ndà’ yé wɔ́, mbà mèŋ n da tè gíŋ ńgyá tsɔ̌ ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô we ndyɛ̀’ɛ wɔ́, n da gíŋ ńgyá pɔ́ Jâg fɛ́ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: But other of the apostles saw I none, save James the Lord's brother.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie mèŋ n ŋwe’e shwóŋó gẅi lɔɔn, áa nénʉ́. Mèŋ n tyě pá’ɔɔn mvfò Ssé, ńgɔɔn ngie mèŋ n tě ńcÿɔ nò wɔ́.
en: Now the things which I write unto you, behold, before God, I lie not.

ngiemboon: N da pɔ́ɔnte ńgʉa tsɛ̀ɛ melá’ ngwòŋ Siria mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ me Silisia,
en: Afterwards I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia;

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ ne gwaa giŋe fa’a pú’u, mbà pʉ̀a Kristo pie ée Jẅidea laa zí shÿó wɔ̀ɔn gyá.
en: and was unknown by face unto the churches of Judæa which were in Christ:

ngiemboon: Á cʉa pú’u, pɔ́ ne ńgu’te Ssé ńtí wɔ̀ɔn.
en: And they glorified God in me.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn né peg pɔ́ ndà’ ngie peg kímte mépoŋ pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo Yerósalem. N ka kě ńkímte wɔ́b kwà’ mboŋó.
en: Onlythey wouldthat we should remember the poor; the same which I also was forward to do.

ngiemboon: Tá’, Piɛ la gÿo ńtóo Antiokia mèŋ shʉa shʉa ńtyé mvfò lá’ ńdʉ’ʉ mmó gie à gÿǒ, á nue à la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà à fʉ̌a nò.
en: But when Peter was come to Antioch, I withstood him to the face, because he was to be blamed.

ngiemboon: Pi kwǎŋ ngie menò mie pi lǎ gyá, pi lɔ̌ɔn ńgyá pɔ́ sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ lá?
en: Have ye suffered so many things in vain? ifit beyet in vain.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi zsé ngie pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ záb ntʉ́m wɔ́b nà Ssé zɔ̌ kwà’ ngẅɛ̀ gie e Ssé la ka’a mbwo Ábalam.
en: Know ye therefore that they which are of faith, the same are the children of Abraham.

ngiemboon: Pi metsèm zɔɔn ńdɔg pá’ pi záb ntʉ́m ná Yěsô Kristo ńgwɔ́ púɔ Ssé.
en: For ye are all the children of God by faith in Christ Jesus.

ngiemboon: Pi metsèm, pie pi la kẅé ntse á gwɔ́ léla nnɛ́ ná Kristo, mà Kristo kéen ńjÿó gẅí.
en: For as many of you as have been baptized into Christ have put on Christ.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pi ee pʉ̀a Kristo la, pi lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngẅɛ̀ Ábalam, ńgwɔ́ pàgẅiin gí mmó nà shúm sie e Ssé la ka’.
en: And if yebeChrist's, then are ye Abraham's seed, and heirs according to the promise.

ngiemboon: À la tó pú’u, lécu’ pʉ̀a pie*lepʉ̌ Mǒsê la ne ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgÿo menkwɔɔn, mbɔɔ pá’ à ge gÿo pege metsèm cʉ́’ púɔ Ssé.
en: to redeem them that were under the law, that we might receive the adoption of sons.

ngiemboon: Pi laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ pi tè ne ńzsé Ssé wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ menkwɔɔn shúm sie mé kwaŋ ngie ée messé, tá’ e tè Ssé wɔ́.
en: Howbeit then, when ye knew not God, ye did service unto them which by nature are no gods.

ngiemboon: Pi kwé’e nzẅìŋ tsɔ́ melyɛ’ɛ́ nzse, ńkwé’e we tsɔ́ mesaŋ, ńkwé’e we tsɔ́ mefʉ̀’ʉ lá’ laa we tsɔ́ mé ngù’ tɛ’.
en: Ye observe days, and months, and times, and years.

ngiemboon: M bɔgɔ́ mmó gie pi ne ńgÿo lɛ, ńgwɔ́ mefà’ mie mèŋ n ka fa’a tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi cʉa sẅɛ̀ɛ.
en: I am afraid of you, lest I have bestowed upon you labour in vain.

ngiemboon: Áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn, mbà mèŋ n kéen ńcʉ́’ʉ ngàŋ mbù gẅi á nue mèŋ n kě ne shwóŋó gẅi pɔ́ nò nénʉ́ keen?
en: Am I therefore become your enemy, because I tell you the truth?

ngiemboon: Pi pie pi ne ńkwoŋo ngie*lepʉ̌ sá’a gẅí, pi shwóŋó wɔ̀ɔn: Pi tè ne ńjú’u mmó gie*lepʉ̌ ŋwɛ́ gɔɔn wɔ́ ka?
en: Tell me, ye that desire to be under the law, do ye not hear the law?

ngiemboon: Tá’ Yerósalem we tÿǒ lepwó à tè nkwɔɔn wɔ́, yé zɔɔ má wege.
en: But Jerusalem which is above is free, which is the mother of us all.

ngiemboon: Á nue gubé manzwě gẅie mé la gwá’a ye ge gyɔ́ɔn cʉa pe manzwě gẅie à gẅiin ndǔm.
en: For the desolate hath many more children than she which hath an husband.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, á gʉa ná pi, mbà pi ee gubé gie mé la zyé wɔ́b á nà ntí gie Ssé la ka’, é ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ Esâg la.
en: Now we, brethren, as Isaac was, are the children of promise.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pɔ́ɔn, áa mmó gie á gÿo pege té gubé manzwě gẅie aa nkwɔɔn wɔ́, pege gwɔ̌ pɔ́ gubé manzwě gẅie mé la tá.
en: So then, brethren, we are not children of the bondwoman, but of the free.

ngiemboon: Pi ka ne ńgee lê mvfò kwà’ mboŋó, awɔ̌ tɔ́’ɔ gẅi légíŋe ńjú’u nò gie áa nénʉ́ ńtÿɔ́gɔ kwò mǒ?
en: Ye did run well; who did hinder you that ye should not obey the truth?

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ véle gẅie mé la shwóŋó gẅi tà pi zẅíŋ, à lɔ̌ɔn tě fóo mbwo Ssé gẅie à ne ńtóŋo gẅi wɔ́.
en: This persuasioncomethnot of him that calleth you.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ḿbɔ́ɔn té pòŋ á kẅɛɛ kwóonte gẅie à ne fa’a leneŋé.
en: A little leaven leaveneth the whole lump.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná pʉ̀a pie é pue gẅi nà nò lépú’u nyìŋ, pɔ́ lɔgɔ nò yɔ́b ńgee mvfò, tà kwà’ pɔ́b sele shʉʉ twó mbùm yɔ́b.
en: I would they were even cut off which trouble you.

ngiemboon: Á nue anò gie á pú ńkwɛ́ metwó menò mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ*lepʉ̌ gɔɔn ngie: Kwoŋo fɛ́ gù nyìŋ mesoŋ pá’ twó mbùm jú.
en: For all the law is fulfilled in one word,evenin this; Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

ngiemboon: Tá pi lɔɔn ńzẅíŋ Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ne ńtsyeen gẅí, mbà*lepʉ̌ té gíŋe ńgẅiin lésá’a gẅi wɔ́.
en: But if ye be led of the Spirit, ye are not under the law.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ lépʉ́le, ńgwɔ́ lékú’te mbùm. Áa kwà’ nénʉ́,*lepʉ̌ té lʉ’ sɔɔn shúm wɔ́.
en: meekness, temperance: against such there is no law.

ngiemboon: Pá’ wege le gwɔ́ we fʉ̀’ɔɔn foo pɔ́ mbwo Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a la, pege giŋe ná ntí gie Zẅìge ŋwɛ́ ne ńnyɛɛ wégè.
en: If we live in the Spirit, let us also walk in the Spirit.

ngiemboon: Tà pege ŋá’te nnɛ́, tà pege tág melà’ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege, tà pege gẅiin kègɔ́’ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege.
en: Let us not be desirous of vain glory, provoking one another, envying one another.

ngiemboon: Pi kaa menò mí ḿbi’ ńkẅéte. Pi lɔɔn ńgÿo pú’u, mbà pi gÿǒ mmó gie*lepʉ̌ Kristo ne ńzɛ́te.
en: Bear ye one another's burdens, and so fulfil the law of Christ.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńkwaŋ ngie aa mmó, té gwɔ́ yɛ̌ mmó, mbà à sele fʉte twó mbùm yé.
en: For if a man think himself to be something, when he is nothing, he deceiveth himself.

ngiemboon: á nue wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ gẅiin léfa’ mé mefà’ mie e Ssé la cʉ́me mbwo ye.
en: For every man shall bear his own burden.

ngiemboon: Á póŋ ngie nyìŋ gẅie mé ne ńzí’i yé nò Ssé à gab shúm sé ńná se nyìŋ gẅie à ne ńzí’i yé.
en: Let him that is taught in the word communicate unto him that teacheth in all good things.

ngiemboon: Tà nyìŋ sele fʉte twó mbùm yé, mé ee ntě ńgwága Ssé wɔ́. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ḿbye kɔ́ wɔ́, mbà à ge lá’ káb pɔ́ yɛ̌.
en: Be not deceived; God is not mocked: for whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap.

ngiemboon: Pi gyá pá’ mɔɔn menÿɔ́g ŋwà’ne ge fáŋte fáŋte. Kwà’ mèŋ Pɔl zɔ lɔgɔ́ pwó yɔ́ɔn ńŋwe’e yɔɔn jʉ’!
en: Ye see how large a letter I have written unto you with mine own hand.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi, á tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m pi.*Amen.
en: Unto the Galatians written from Rome.

ngiemboon: Tá wege Ssé mbɔɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi, ńne ńnéŋe sẅétè ntʉ́m pi.
en: gracebeto you, and peace, from God our Father, andfromthe Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: áa fù’ gie à la náa mbwo pege tà á gyɔ́ɔn gyɔ̌ɔn, ńgwɔ náa, ńtsɔ́’ legyè ségè pege zsé nò.
en: wherein he hath abounded toward us in all wisdom and prudence;

ngiemboon: À lɔ̌ɔn ńtsɔ́’ɔ wégè pú’u, le gwɔ́ gie peg pie peg ka vɔgɔ lézáb ntʉ́m nà Kristo, peg ge gu’te yé Ssé á nue à gú’ tɛ’.
en: that we should be to the praise of his glory, who first trusted in Christ.

ngiemboon: Pá’ mèŋ n ka jú’ ngie pi ne ńkẅi’i ńzába ntʉ́m gẅi ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô, ńgíŋe ńjú’ ngie pi ne ńkwoŋo pʉ̀a Ssé métsèm lá,
en: Wherefore I also, after I heard of your faith in the Lord Jesus, and love unto all the saints,

ngiemboon: mèŋ n gee fʉ̀’ ntsèm ńně sẅíŋte Ssé, ḿbiŋe síe yé nà twó sí.
en: cease not to give thanks for you, making mention of you in my prayers;

ngiemboon: Acú’tè pʉ̀a Ssé ée mbùm nnɛ́ Kristo. Áa tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a pé fʉ̀’ ntsèm, yé gẅie à pǔ ńgwɔ́ jʉ’ ntsèm tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó.
en: which is his body, the fulness of him that filleth all in all.

ngiemboon: Pi laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ ńgwɔ́ mbwo Ssé, mbà pi léen ńkwé ńtí pá’ pi láa ngàŋa mefʉa ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ pàgÿo menò tepòŋ.
en: And youhath he quickened, who were dead in trespasses and sins;

ngiemboon: Tá’ e Ssé kě ńtsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe pʉ̀a mesoŋ tɛ’. Á la piŋ ńcʉa pɔ́ nà ntí gie à la lɔg ńkwoŋo wégè,
en: But God, who is rich in mercy, for his great love wherewith he loved us,

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ pú’u, ńké těen fóo nà mefà’ mie pi fǎ’ wɔ́. Pú’u la, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ á le lɔ́g ńŋá’te wɔ́.
en: not of works, lest any man should boast.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, pi tà mbɔɔ peg pà Yuda cʉa pɔ́ ná yé Kristo, ńgee lejʉ́ŋ Ssé Tá, tà’ Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a wémɔ’ɔ́ zɔ ké ńkẅéte wégè.
en: For through him we both have access by one Spirit unto the Father.

ngiemboon: Yé zɔ gÿo tá mesǎg ndá tyé ndʉŋ ndʉŋ, ńkwɔ́’ né tÿǒ, é gwɔ́ ndá gie e Ssé yé máŋwɛ́ ńnéŋe tsoló.
en: in whom all the building fitly framed together groweth unto an holy temple in the Lord:

ngiemboon: Pi ge tóŋo yɔɔn ŋwà’ne é jú’ ntí gie mèŋ n dɔg ńzsé ntsèm gie ee nà nò Kristo.
en: whereby, when ye read, ye may understand my knowledge in the mystery of Christ)

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo mèŋ n kẅí’te mvfò Ssé Tá
en: For this cause I bow my knees unto the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,

ngiemboon: gẅie metsìŋe ndá mie ée tÿǒ lepwó mbɔɔ mie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsá’ ntsèm, é gwaa gwɔ́ wó ńzẅɛ́’ɛ pɔ́ yé,
en: of whom the whole family in heaven and earth is named,

ngiemboon: Agù’te gwɔ́ mbwo yé tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo, ńcʉa ná Yěsô Kristo, á nà mengù’ mengù’, té zá’a pàa!*Amen.
en: unto himbeglory in the church by Christ Jesus throughout all ages, world without end. Amen.

ngiemboon: Pi kag tʉ̀ lé ké ńgẅiin pɔ́ tà’ ncwò gẅie à fóo mbwo Zẅìge Ssé, yɛ̌ zɔ̌ gwɔ́ ná mbʉ́lè mbwo pʉ̀a, ńnáa wɔ́b tà’ ncwò.
en: endeavouring to keep the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace.

ngiemboon: E Ssé gwɔ́ pɔ́ yémɔ’ɔ́, aa Tá pà mânyìŋ ntsèm. À pǔ sá’a pʉ̀a metsèm, ńdɔgɔ pʉ̀a metsèm éfa’a fà’ yé, ńgwɔ́ nà wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ.
en: one God and Father of all, whoisabove all, and through all, and in you all.

ngiemboon: Á ké ńgʉa nà wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pege, mbà Kristo la lɔgɔ fù’ ńcÿó gʉm wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ á nà ntí gie yé Kristo kwoŋ.
en: But unto every one of us is given grace according to the measure of the gift of Christ.

ngiemboon: Ńnáa fù’ ntí ntí mbwo pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: And gave gifts unto men.

ngiemboon: Tá á ké ńgʉa ná pi, mbà Kristo la tè zí’i gẅi légẅiin yɛ̌ ntí tsẅé wɔ́.
en: But ye have not so learned Christ;

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ ngie pi ka jú’u nò yé, tà mé shwóŋó gẅi nò nénʉ́ ntsèm gie á ne ńdíe yé,
en: if so be that ye have heard him, and have been taught by him, as the truth is in Jesus:

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ne ńzɛ́te ná fʉ̀’ɔɔn ngie pi zẅíŋ e Ssé kúbe mà gẅi, à cʉ́’ʉ we sẅé, mbɔɔ nkwaŋá gẅi e cʉ́’ we sẅé.
en: and be renewed in the spirit of your mind;

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńgyáŋa lóŋ, pi pɔ́ɔn légÿo nò tepòŋ, ḿbɔ́ɔn nèm légwaa pyé, agyáŋa lóŋ nyé ntʉ́m pi.
en: Be ye angry, and sin not: let not the sun go down upon your wrath:

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn lénná shÿó lɔg ńgwoon gẅi mbwo Sátà.
en: neither give place to the devil.

ngiemboon: Pi púɔ Ssé, e Ssé kwoŋo gẅi tɛ’, pú’u la pi pí fʉ̀’ ná yé.
en: Be ye therefore followers of God, as dear children;

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, tà pia yɛ̌ ntí pʉ̀a teme tsɔ́ nò.
en: Be not ye therefore partakers with them.

ngiemboon: Pi gwaa gÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́, ńta’ menò, lézsé mie é poŋo mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: proving what is acceptable unto the Lord.

ngiemboon: Tà pi kúu nùɔ pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ fa’a mefà’ mie é té kẅéte, é mefà’ nzěm. Pi shʉ̀ashʉ̀a ńkyag nzèm yɔb kyag.
en: And have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather reprovethem.

ngiemboon: Menò mie pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́ gÿo tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm, ée menò shʉ́, ńzɔɔn tè mie ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ kím mbàa kǐm wɔ́.
en: For it is a shame even to speak of those things which are done of them in secret.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn shʉa shʉa ńkyag mɛ̌ menò ntsèm, mbà é ge fɔ́g
en: But all things that are reproved are made manifest by the light: for whatsoever doth make manifest is light.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, Kristo ńnéŋe kyɛ̀’ yé ná gù.
en: Wherefore he saith, Awake thou that sleepest, and arise from the dead, and Christ shall give thee light.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la pi gwaa gÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gí wɔ́, ńdaga twó gí mboŋó. Pi pɔ́ɔn léńnéŋe we megʉ̀gʉ̀, pi ńnéŋe pá’ megàŋa zsě nò
en: See then that ye walk circumspectly, not as fools, but as wise,

ngiemboon: pie pɔ́ zsé lézẅɛ́’ melyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ mie Ssé náa mbwo pɔ́b, éfa’ mefà’ mbòŋo, á nue afʉ̀’e njÿó yɔɔn té poŋ.
en: redeeming the time, because the days are evil.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, tà pi gwɔ́ megʉ̀gʉ̀. Pi ta’ menò lézsé mie é poŋo mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: Wherefore be ye not unwise, but understanding what the will of the Lordis.

ngiemboon: Tà pi nú melù’ tà é jÿó gẅí. Legÿo pú’u, aa lecʉmé ná mánzsè tepòŋ. À Zẅìge ndʉalʉ̌a zɔ pu njÿó gẅí.
en: And be not drunk with wine, wherein is excess; but be filled with the Spirit;

ngiemboon: Pi lɔg lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo ńne síe Ssé Tá fʉ̀’ ntsèm, á nà shúm ntsèm.
en: giving thanks always for all things unto God and the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ;

ngiemboon: Pi lɔg pá’ pi ná mbùm gi Ssé mvfò Kristo, wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ná mbùm ye Ssé mvfò fɛ́ we.
en: submitting yourselves one to another in the fear of God.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa ná pi pànzwě, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ná mbùm ye ssé mvfò ndúm we pá’ à náa mbùm ye ssé mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as unto the Lord.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa ná pi mbàŋa, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ kwoŋo nzwě we ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ Kristo kwoŋo cú’tè pʉ̀a pé tà mbà à la náa twó yé ńtí yɛ̌,
en: Husbands, love your wives, even as Christ also loved the church, and gave himself for it;

ngiemboon: á nue pege gwɔ́ pɔ́ mekèm mbùm ye.
en: for we are members of his body, of his flesh, and of his bones.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn ntsèm ee wó tɛ’, n gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn ná Kristo mbɔɔ ná cú’tè pʉ̀a pé.
en: This is a great mystery: but I speak concerning Christ and the church.

ngiemboon: Tsɔ́*lepʉ̌ Ssé gɔɔn ngie: «Gÿo mekù’ tá gù pɔ́ má gù». Aa ndùŋ mvfò*lepʉ̌ sie Ssé la ka’ ntsɔ’ɔ́ fà’ mǒ.
en: Honour thy father and mother; which is the first commandment with promise;

ngiemboon: Á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngie ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgÿo pú’u, mbà «ɔ̀ ge gwɔ́ shÿó mbòŋo, é zye ńnéŋe ndùmo ssé tsetsá’».
en: that it may be well with thee, and thou mayest live long on the earth.

ngiemboon: Pi metá penkʉ́, tà pi lába lóŋ penkʉ́ pí. Pi cʉ́’ʉ lékwé’te wɔ́b, ńtÿɔ́gte wɔ́b, ńzí’i wɔ́b mmó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńkwoŋo.
en: And, ye fathers, provoke not your children to wrath: but bring them up in the nurture and admonition of the Lord.

ngiemboon: Pi fa’a fà’ yɔ́b lê ntʉ́m mbòŋo, pɔ́ pá’ pi fa’a mbwo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tà pi tě fa’a mbwo pʉ̀a mesoŋ wɔ́.
en: with good will doing service, as to the Lord, and not to men:

ngiemboon: Pi kaa shúm ncù sie e Ssé nǎ mbwo pi pɔ́ ntsèm, tá ńdɔg ńzsé ngie Sátà ge lɔg wɛ̌ shÿó ma’a gẅi wɔ́ pi le ŋele,
en: Put on the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.

ngiemboon: Leneŋé ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo Kristo gẅie é ná mbʉ́lè, é gwɔ́ mí melɔ̌ɔn mie pi ge shÿɔ́gɔ kwò pi.
en: and your feet shod with the preparation of the gospel of peace;

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n zɔɔn ńké ńtúmo yé né pi pɔ́ ngie à shwóŋó gẅi pá’ peg ee pú’u, mbɔɔ pá’ à ge kẅiŋte gẅí.
en: whom I have sent unto you for the same purpose, that ye might know our affairs, andthathe might comfort your hearts.

ngiemboon: E Ssé ne ńgwɔ́ né mânyìŋ ntsèm gẅie à kwoŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěso Kristo lê ntí nkwòŋe gie e tě ńdá’a ḿmaga wɔ́.
en: Written from Rome unto the Ephesians by Tychicus.

ngiemboon: Tá wege Ssé mbɔɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi, ńne ńnéŋe sẅétè ntʉ́m pi.
en: gracebeunto you, and peace, from God our Father, andfromthe Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n kwaŋte gẅi tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m mèŋ fʉ̀’e kɔ́ wɔ́, ésíe Ssé yɔ̀ɔn.
en: I thank my God upon every remembrance of you,

ngiemboon: N gwɔ́ sẅíŋte Ssé nà twó sí fʉ̀’ ntsèm, ntʉ́m wɔ̀ɔn ne ńkága kǎg,
en: always in every prayer of mine for you all making request with joy,

ngiemboon: À cʉa pú’u, pi ku’u lépíi ye mbòŋo, éshwoŋo nò nénʉ́. À lá’a lyɛ̌’ gie Kristo ge lá’ gíŋ tó, pi gwɔ́ pà tèfʉa.
en: that ye may approve things that are excellent; that ye may be sincere and without offence till the day of Christ;

ngiemboon: Yěsô ge gÿo pi ké ne fa’a pɔ́ mefà’ mbòŋo, ńzsé ngie pʉ̀a ge ne gyá, é gu’te Ssé, é gé’e lezíŋ sé.
en: being filled with the fruits of righteousness, which are by Jesus Christ, unto the glory and praise of God.

ngiemboon: tà pàlÿɔ́’ ncù pie é pyɛ́bɛ mbʉ̀a ngúmnɔ́ɔn lâ pʉ̀a metsèm ne ńzsé ngie mèŋ n gee ndá tsǎŋ pá’ɔɔn ntí pɔ́ nò Kristo.
en: so that my bonds in Christ are manifest in all the palace, and in all otherplaces;

ngiemboon: Kristo zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ yɔ́ɔn nò ntsèm. N dɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wó, mbà mèŋ n gee wó ńtí Kristo, ńké ńkwé, mbà mèŋ n jÿǒ pì nzèm yé.
en: For to me to liveisChrist, and to dieisgain.

ngiemboon: Tá’, áa mbòŋ ngie mèŋ n gíŋe ńnéŋe ńtí gẅí.
en: nevertheless to abide in the fleshismore needful for you.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne ńnyɛte ńzsé pú’u. Pege ge gíŋe ńnéŋe mèŋ n ne ńkẅéte gẅi métsèm lécwoŋo ńzẅíŋe nò Yěsô, ńgẅiin lekág.
en: And having this confidence, I know that I shall abide and continue with you all for your furtherance and joy of faith;

ngiemboon: A la cÿó gʉm gí, pi gwɔ́ pʉ̀a Kristo, tá á ké tè gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndà’ pú’u wɔ́, á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ mbɔɔ légyá ngɔ́’ ńtí Kristo.
en: For unto you it is given in the behalf of Christ, not only to believe on him, but also to suffer for his sake;

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ ngɔ́’ ée ncù gẅie pi ne ḿma’a, mbà pi la gyá pá’ mèŋ m ma’a. Mèŋ n kě ńnyé ḿma’a pɔ́ wɛ̌.
en: having the same conflict which ye saw in me, and now hearto bein me.

ngiemboon: Tà nyìŋ gẅi kwaŋ pɔ́ ndà’ yé twó. À gíŋe ńkwaŋa ye petsɔ́ pʉ̀a.
en: Look not every man on his own things, but every man also on the things of others.

ngiemboon: Pi gẅiin nkwaŋá gẅie Yěsô Kristo la gẅiin.
en: Let this mind be in you, which was also in Christ Jesus:

ngiemboon: ńcʉŋe nà légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ Ssé ge ké ńnéŋe pɔ́ tà’a jʉ’ wɔ́.
en: who, being in the form of God, thought it not robbery to be equal with God:

ngiemboon: Mé zyé yé pá’ mé zyé pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: but made himself of no reputation, and took upon him the form of a servant, and was made in the likeness of men:

ngiemboon: tà mé kíme yé nà tÿǒ nkǐ, á kwé.
en: and being found in fashion as a man, he humbled himself, and became obedient unto death, even the death of the cross.

ngiemboon: ńná lezíŋ sie é cʉa mezíŋ ntsèm né yé,
en: Wherefore God also hath highly exalted him, and given him a name which is above every name:

ngiemboon: á ná mekù’ cʉa mefùɔ né yé.
en: that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, ofthingsin heaven, andthingsin earth, andthingsunder the earth;

ngiemboon: Mé ge gɔ́ɔn pú’u, é lɔg ná mekù’ á mbwo Ssé Tá.
en: andthatevery tongue should confess that Jesus ChristisLord, to the glory of God the Father.

ngiemboon: E Ssé zɔɔn ne fa’a tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m pi légwɔ́ gie pi ge kwoŋ shúm sie é poŋo yé, mbɔɔ légwɔ́ gie pi ge gíŋ gÿo sɛ̌ shúm.
en: For it is God which worketh in you both to will and to do ofhisgood pleasure.

ngiemboon: Pi gÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ té zẅɛ́te, té tsɔ̌ zòŋo nò tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi,
en: Do all things without murmurings and disputings:

ngiemboon: Tà mbàa pi gí pi kág, pege pú ńkág métsèm.
en: For the same cause also do ye joy, and rejoice with me.

ngiemboon: é gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndà’ yé gẅie peg yé ne sáŋa nò ná menò mie ée ná mèŋ, ńgíŋe ne ḿmÿɔgɔ mí.
en: For I have no man likeminded, who will naturally care for your state.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a ne sáŋa nò pɔ́ ndà’ ná yɔ́b twó tà pɔ́ téen sáŋa nò ná nò Yěsô Kristo wɔ́.
en: For all seek their own, not the things which are Jesus Christ's.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne ńkwaŋa ngie mé lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tà ńzá’ ntsaŋ yɔ̀ɔn, mbà mèŋ n ge gwóon túmo yé né pi.
en: Him therefore I hope to send presently, so soon as I shall see how it will go with me.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a pǐŋ ńgÿo mèŋ n zsé ngie kwà’ mèŋ n ge tɔ́g tó gyá gẅí.
en: But I trust in the Lord that I also myself shall come shortly.

ngiemboon: Kwà’ yé zɔɔn ne ńtsɔ́ɔn tɛ’ légíŋe ńgyá gẅi métsèm, á nue à zsě ngie pi ka jú’u nò guɔ yé, á gege gẅi tɛ’.
en: For he longed after you all, and was full of heaviness, because that ye had heard that he had been sick.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi kúe yé lê kwà’ lekág, ńzsé ngie aa fɛ́ gẅi nzèm Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Pi gÿo mekù’ ntí pʉ̀a pá’ pɔ́b lɛ,
en: Receive him therefore in the Lord with all gladness; and hold such in reputation:

ngiemboon: Tá’ mɔɔn menò mɛ́ mie é lâ mbwo mèŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lemaŋ, Kristo léen ńgÿo n gyá, mbà à la gwɔ́ pɔ́ pyé,
en: But what things were gain to me, those I counted loss for Christ.

ngiemboon: légwɔ́ gie, á lɔɔn tè gwɔ́ pɔ́ kɔ́ wɔ́, e Ssé lá’ ńgÿo n zím yɔ́ɔn nà legwé pá’ Kristo.
en: if by any means I might attain unto the resurrection of the dead.

ngiemboon: Anò lÿò gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie, à jʉ’ gie pege gʉ̌a tà ńkúu wó lɔɔn, pege ké ńgʉa pɔ́ lé mvfò.
en: Nevertheless, whereto we have already attained, let us walk by the same rule, let us mind the same thing.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ sẅiŋté Evodie pɔ́ Sintishe ngie pɔ́ gwɔ́ tà’ ncwò á nue pɔ́ métsèm gwɔ́ pɔ́ pʉ̀a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a,
en: I beseech Euodias, and beseech Syntyche, that they be of the same mind in the Lord.

ngiemboon: N ge gɔɔn né pi ngie ntʉ́m gẅi ńnéŋe ńkág kág, á nue pi ee pʉ̀a Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. N gɔ̌ɔn né pi ngie, ntʉ́m gẅi ńnéŋe ńkág kág.
en: Rejoice in the Lord alway:andagain I say, Rejoice.

ngiemboon: Pi gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pie mé zsé ngie pi pʉ́le pʉlé. Pi kímte ngie ntyě pá’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge tó té ság.
en: Let your moderation be known unto all men. The Lordisat hand.

ngiemboon: Kristo zɔ náa wɔ̀ɔn metʉ̀, tá mèŋ n ku’u légÿo pú’u.
en: I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.

ngiemboon: Tà mbɔɔ pú’u, pi ka gÿo mboŋó lékẅéte wɔ̀ɔn ná fʉ̀’ɔɔn gie mèŋ n ne ńgyá ngɔ́’ lɔɔn.
en: Notwithstanding ye have well done, that ye did communicate with my affliction.

ngiemboon: N da gwɔ́ tà ńkúu Tesalonika, pi túm shúm sie é la ne ńzága mbwo mèŋ. Pi la túm ngʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: For even in Thessalonica ye sent once and again unto my necessity.

ngiemboon: E Ssé yɔ̀ɔn ge lɔg ntí gie aa gẅiin shúm pú’u, é cʉa ná Yěsô Kristo, é náa kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á ne ńzága mbwo pi té sáŋ.
en: But my God shall supply all your need according to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus.

ngiemboon: Agù’te gwɔ́ mbwo Tá wege Ssé ná mengù’u mengù’.*Amen.
en: Now unto God and our Fatherbeglory for ever and ever. Amen.

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a Kristo metsèm é tsyɛ’té gẅí, n gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn té lege tsyɛ̀’te ye pʉ̀a Kristo pie ée nɔ́’ɔ Kása.
en: All the saints salute you, chiefly they that are of Cæsar's household.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěso Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi metsèm.
en: It was written to the Philippians from Rome by Epaphroditus.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn ŋwà’ne fóo mbwo mèŋ Pɔl, e Ssé la kwoŋ ngie n gwɔ́ ngàŋ ntúm Yěsô Kristo. Peg fɛ́ wege Timoté náa
en: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timotheusourbrother,

ngiemboon: Peg ee fʉ̀’ ntsèm ńgwaa ne sẅíŋte Ssé nà twó sí, ńne síe yé síe. Peg síe yé gẅie aa Tá pà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo,
en: We give thanks to God and the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you,

ngiemboon: á nue mé ka shwóŋó wég ntí gie pi ne ńdɔgɔ ńzába ntʉ́m ná Yěsô Kristo mbɔɔ ntí gie pi ne ńdɔgɔ ńkwoŋo pʉ̀a Ssé métsèm.
en: since we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus, and of the lovewhich ye haveto all the saints,

ngiemboon: À ka shwoŋó wég ntí nkwòŋe gie Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ka ńnéŋe ntʉ́m pi.
en: who also declared unto us your love in the Spirit.

ngiemboon: À la sa’a wégè mbwo metʉ̀ nzěm, ńtsege wégè ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ nò lefùɔ Míŋ we, à kwoŋo míŋ we ŋwɛ́ tɛ’.
en: who hath delivered us from the power of darkness, and hath translatedusinto the kingdom of his dear Son:

ngiemboon: Yé zɔ la gÿo e Ssé fó tsɛ̀ɛ nò tepòŋ ńcu’u wégè, ńdege mefʉa mégè, ńnáa mbwo pege.
en: in whom we have redemption through his blood,eventhe forgiveness of sins:

ngiemboon: Njÿó la nyé pɔ́ tè gwɔ̌ wó, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó, akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ piŋ ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ pá’ á tswé’e ná yé tá ńgwɔ́ wó, ńké gwɔ̂ pɔ́ wó.
en: and he is before all things, and by him all things consist.

ngiemboon: Áa nénʉ́, mbà Ssé la kwoŋ ngie tà tsɔ́ mmó gie áa ná yé zága ná Míŋ we,
en: For it pleasedthe Fatherthat in him should all fulness dwell;

ngiemboon: Azse nò ntsèm, mbɔɔ legyè ntsèm pú ńgwɔ́ fù’ gie á cú’te ńdyeen pɔ́ ná Yěsô.
en: in whom are hid all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwóŋó gẅi mɔɔn menò ḿbɔ́gɔ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ létó ńdɔgɔ shwóŋè gie mé neŋé ssé ńtáŋte, ésele twó gí.
en: And this I say, lest any man should beguile you with enticing words.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pi ka kě ńzẅíŋ ngie Yěsô Kristo aa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅi la, á ne ńzɛ́te ngie gẅi leńnéŋe gwɔ́ pá’ à ne ńkwoŋo.
en: As ye have therefore received Christ Jesus the Lord,sowalk ye in him:

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn á nue, akɔ́ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa nà Ssé wɔ́, mé gyá ná Kristo, yé gẅie à la sele ńcʉ́’ʉ nyìŋ mesoŋ.
en: For in him dwelleth all the fulness of the Godhead bodily.

ngiemboon: Pia Kristo kéen ńtemte, e Ssé fó mǒ ńnáa gẅi fù’ ntí ntí. Kristo ŋwɛ́ pǔ ńcʉa kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á gẅiin tʉ̀, ésá’a njÿó.
en: And ye are complete in him, which is the head of all principality and power:

ngiemboon: Sɛ̌ shúm lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ jʉ́jʉ́ŋ shúm sie é ne ńtóo. Mé ge gÿo gyá Kristo, é zsé ngie mé gyǎ kwà’ sɛ̌ shúm.
en: which are a shadow of things to come; but the bodyisof Christ.

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn pá’ mé gɔɔn ngie tà pi jÿó tsɔ́ shúm léjÿó, tà pi zẅí’ mbɔɔ zẅǐ’, tà pi záb mbɔɔ pwó mǒ.
en: (touch not; taste not; handle not;

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menzse ké ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ nà shúm sie mé jÿó é mag mag, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ menò mie pʉ̀a mesoŋ ńnéŋe ssé ńkwaŋte ńzáb.
en: which all are to perish with the using;) after the commandments and doctrines of men?

ngiemboon: Pi nɔ́ɔnte pɔ́ mmó gie áa tÿǒ lepwó, tà pi nɔ́ɔnte gie áa ndùmo ssé tsetsá’.
en: Set your affection on things above, not on things on the earth.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé ngie áa nà menò njÿó, mbà pi léen ńkwé. Agẅi le gwɔ́, aa mbwo Kristo á lejʉ́ŋ Ssé, mé té ne ńgyá pá’ à gwɔ̌ wɔ́.
en: For ye are dead, and your life is hid with Christ in God.

ngiemboon: Kristo zɔɔ kwà’ gẅi le gwɔ́. À ge lá’ gwɔ́ tà kẅɛ, pi gíŋ ńkẅɛ gí, pia pɔ́ zɔ púte ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ legú’ we.
en: When Christ,who isour life, shall appear, then shall ye also appear with him in glory.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn ée menò mie é gÿo e Ssé gyáŋa lóŋ ná pʉ̀a pie é té ne ńjú’u ncwò wé wɔ́,
en: for which things' sake the wrath of God cometh on the children of disobedience:

ngiemboon: ée menò mie pi ka ne ńgÿo á fʉ̀’ gie mɔɔn menò tepòŋ ka nyě sá’a gẅí.
en: in the which ye also walked some time, when ye lived in them.

ngiemboon: Pá’ pi kéen sẅɛɛ mà we zẅìŋ pâ menò mé ná pi tà ńgwá’ la, tà cÿɔ̌ nò gíŋe ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi.
en: Lie not one to another, seeing that ye have put off the old man with his deeds;

ngiemboon: Pi mbàŋa pie pi zɔ̌’, wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ ná pi kwoŋo nzwě we, tà á gÿo nzwě we cʉ́’ʉ ngàŋ ngɔ́’.
en: Husbands, loveyourwives, and be not bitter against them.

ngiemboon: Pi penkʉ́ pi jú’ ncwò metá pí lâ memá pí nà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, á nue áa mmó gie á poŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: Children, obeyyourparents in all things: for this is well pleasing unto the Lord.

ngiemboon: Pi metá penkʉ́, tà pi lába lóŋ penkʉ́ pí, ḿbɔ́g mbùm yɔ́b létsyɛte.
en: Fathers, provoke not your childrento anger, lest they be discouraged.

ngiemboon: Pi ké ne sẅíŋte Ssé sẅíŋte, tà pi lyé, pi gwɔ́ gÿo pú’u, ńne ńnáa ndǎg mbwo Ssé,
en: Continue in prayer, and watch in the same with thanksgiving;

ngiemboon: Pi cwoŋo sẅíŋte Ssé ńzsé ngie mèŋ n ge shʉa shʉa gɔɔn nò yé pá’ á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mèŋ n gɔɔn.
en: that I may make it manifest, as I ought to speak.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n tʉʉ lélÿo ńtúmo yé ngie à gʉa shwóŋó gẅi pá’ peg lɔg ńnéŋe jʉ’ɔɔn pú’u, mbɔɔ pá’ à ge tó kẅiŋte gẅí.
en: whom I have sent unto you for the same purpose, that he might know your estate, and comfort your hearts;

ngiemboon: Ashǔ wege Lukase, á lɔ́gta lÿò, mbɔɔ Ndemas tsyɛ’té gẅí.
en: Luke, the beloved physician, and Demas, greet you.

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛ’te mefɛ́ mefɛ́ pie ée Laodisé, ńtsyɛ’te Nimfa mbɔɔ cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo gie áa ndá yé.
en: Salute the brethren which are in Laodicea, and Nymphas, and the church which is in his house.

ngiemboon: Pi gɔɔn mbwò Aleshʉpe ngie, tà á lɔgɔ fà’ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ka cʉ́me mbwo yé ńdɔg ńgÿo megʉa, ńgie à fa’ mboŋó.
en: And say to Archippus, Take heed to the ministry which thou hast received in the Lord, that thou fulfil it.

ngiemboon: E Ssé ne ńgwɔ́ né pi metsèm!
en: Written from Rome to the Colossians by Tychicus and Onesimus.

ngiemboon: Peg neŋé síe Ssé fʉ̀’ ntsèm ńtí gẅí, ḿbiŋ ńne sẅíŋte Ssé fʉ̀’e kɔ́ wɔ́, ńkwaŋte gẅi kwaŋte.
en: We give thanks to God always for you all, making mention of you in our prayers;

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pég, peg ne ńzsé ngie e Ssé kwoŋo gẅí, mbà à la tsɔ́’ɔ gẅi ńdɔg ńgÿo pʉ̀a pé.
en: knowing, brethren beloved, your election of God.

ngiemboon: Pú’u, pàzẅíŋe shwóŋè Ssé pie ée Makedonia mbɔɔ Akay píi fʉ̀’ ná pi.
en: so that ye were ensamples to all that believe in Macedonia and Achaia.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ pég nzèm Kristo, pi ne ńzsé mboŋó ngie peg ka tè tóo tÿǒsoŋ pi pɔ́ sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ wɔ́.
en: For yourselves, brethren, know our entrance in unto you, that it was not in vain:

ngiemboon: Anò gie peg zɔɔn ne shwóŋó pʉ̀a, á té nò gie á téŋe wɔ́, peg tè gẅiin nkwaŋá tepòŋ wɔ́, ńké těen ḿbá’a pɔ́ legyè wɔ́.
en: For our exhortationwasnot of deceit, nor of uncleanness, nor in guile:

ngiemboon: Pi giŋé ne ńzsé ngie peg laa lejʉ́ŋ wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ ná pi, ńgÿo pɔ́ pá’ tá múɔ gÿo lejʉ́ŋ gubé yé la.
en: as ye know how we exhorted and comforted and charged every one of you, as a fatherdothhis children,

ngiemboon: Áa nò ngie peg ka kwoŋo légiŋe ńtóo lá’ pi, kwà’ mèŋ Pɔl, méŋ fǎ’ meshÿó mekwò tà ńgyɔ́ɔn tá Sátà ké ńtáte wég táte.
en: Wherefore we would have come unto you, even I Paul, once and again; but Satan hindered us.

ngiemboon: Oon pi ee weg legú’, ńgwɔ́ weg lekág.
en: For ye are our glory and joy.

ngiemboon: Áa fʉ̀’ɔɔn, peg ge gíŋe jú’, é gwɔ́ ntentʉ́, á nue pi kaa kʉ́a légwɔ́ pɔ́ nzèm Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ́,
en: for now we live, if ye stand fast in the Lord.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ peg síe Ssé kwà’ lêkɔ́ ńtí gẅí? A ne ńgÿo peg gẅiin lekág pá’ɔɔn tɛ’ ńtí gẅí.
en: For what thanks can we render to God again for you, for all the joy wherewith we joy for your sakes before our God;

ngiemboon: Pi zɔɔn ne ńzsé mmó gie peg la lɔg lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô ńtsẅi ngie pi gÿo.
en: For ye know what commandments we gave you by the Lord Jesus.

ngiemboon: Ammó gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo á gwɔ́ pɔ́ ngie pi gwɔ́ ndʉalʉ̌a, tà mbàŋa fa’ pànzwě, tà pànzwě fa’ mbàŋa,
en: For this is the will of God,evenyour sanctification, that ye should abstain from fornication:

ngiemboon: ńgie wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi kú’te mbùmye ná ntí gie e Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, ee ntí gie e gẅiin mekù’.
en: that every one of you should know how to possess his vessel in sanctification and honour;

ngiemboon: Tà á le zẅíŋ nkwaŋá tepòŋ jÿó yé pá’ é jÿó pʉ̀a pie é té Ssé zsé wɔ́.
en: not in the lust of concupiscence, even as the Gentiles which know not God:

ngiemboon: Pú’u lá pi ńnéŋe ńdɔgɔ shwóŋè yɔɔn, ésele ńtÿɔ́gte mennɛ́ mí.
en: Wherefore comfort one another with these words.

ngiemboon: á nue pi ne ńcwoŋo ńzsé gí ngie lyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge lá’ vege vege tó pá’ ntsǒŋ gẅie à tóo lêtsẅɛ́’ la.
en: For yourselves know perfectly that the day of the Lord so cometh as a thief in the night.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, tà pege lyé pá’ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a. Tà pege gwá’a lÿɔg ńdyé, pege jÿó mmó à ku’ ku’.
en: Therefore let us not sleep, asdoothers; but let us watch and be sober.

ngiemboon: Pàlyé lelɔ́g lyé lêtsẅɛ́’, pànú melù’ tà ḿbʉ́a nú pɔ́ lêtsẅɛ́’.
en: For they that sleep, sleep in the night; and they that be drunken are drunken in the night.

ngiemboon: À la kwé nà twó ségè, légwɔ́ gie pege lɔɔn fó ńkwé mbɔɔ kwě, kà ńnyé pɔ́ ntentʉ́ wɔ́, mbà pega pɔ́ zɔɔ pú’u, ńgwɔ́.
en: who died for us, that, whether we wake or sleep, we should live together with him.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, pi kẅiŋte mennɛ́ mí pi né pi, nyìŋ tóonte nyìŋ, nyìŋ tóonte nyìŋ, pá’ pi ne ńgÿo pú’u lɛ.
en: Wherefore comfort yourselves together, and edify one another, even as also ye do.

ngiemboon: Pi gÿo mekù’ mɔ́b mboŋó, ńkwoŋo wɔ́b tɛ’, ńtí twó fà’ gie pɔ́ ée mǒ, ḿbɔ́ɔn cÿɔ́g tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi.
en: and to esteem them very highly in love for their work's sake.Andbe at peace among yourselves.

ngiemboon: Pi ne ńkága kǎg fʉ̀’ ntsèm.
en: Rejoice evermore.

ngiemboon: Pi ne ńtsyɛ’te Ssé fʉ̀’ ntsèm,
en: Pray without ceasing.

ngiemboon: Tà pi tɔ’ɔ Zẅìge Ssé léfa’a fà’.
en: Quench not the Spirit.

ngiemboon: Tà pi gwága shwóŋè pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ ńnéŋe ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwo Ssé,
en: Despise not prophesyings.

ngiemboon: ńgʉa nà kɔ́ wɔ́, ńtsa’ ḿbí pɔ́ ye mbòŋo,
en: Prove all things; hold fast that which is good.

ngiemboon: ḿbú ńkÿo nò tepòŋ ntsèm.
en: Abstain from all appearance of evil.

ngiemboon: E Ssé gẅie à la tsɔ́’ɔ gẅi pi cʉ́’ pʉ̀a pé ge gÿo à gwɔ́ pú’u, á nue à tè kúbe.
en: Faithfulishe that calleth you, who also will doit.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ́ mefɛ́, pi sẅíŋte Ssé mbɔɔ ná ség twó.
en: Brethren, pray for us.

ngiemboon: Pi tsyɛ’te mefɛ́ mefɛ́ métsèm, ńcʉ́’ʉ létsyɛ’te ńtáŋte mennɛ́ mí nà ntí ye pʉ̀a Ssé.
en: Greet all the brethren with an holy kiss.

ngiemboon: Á nà lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, n gɔɔn né pi ngie pi tóŋo yɔɔn ŋwà’ne á mvfò pʉ̀a Ssé métsèm.
en: I charge you by the Lord that this epistle be read unto all the holy brethren.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsô Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi.
en: The first epistle unto the Thessalonians was written from Athens.

ngiemboon: E Ssé Tá mbɔɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi, ńne ńnéŋe sẅétè ntʉ́m pi.
en: grace unto you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Pi zsé mbóŋo ngie e Ssé ge lá’ ŋag ntsaŋ pɔ́ pá’ á ne ńzɛ́te, é ná ngɔ́’ mbwo pʉ̀a pie é nyɛɛ gẅi ngɔ́’ fʉ̀’ɔɔn lɔɔn,
en: seeingit isa righteous thing with God to recompense tribulation to them that trouble you;

ngiemboon: À ge lá’ gwaa tó pege gyá mmɔ̌g tÿɔ́’ɔ yé ńnéŋ soŋ, à gÿo pʉ̀a pie pɔ́ la lʉ’ Nkʉ̀ Mbòŋo wé gyá ngɔ́’.
en: in flaming fire taking vengeance on them that know not God, and that obey not the gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ:

ngiemboon: Tà pi tè ne ńkímte ngie afʉ̀’ gie n daa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, n da shwóŋó gẅi menó mɔɔn wɔ́?
en: Remember ye not, that, when I was yet with you, I told you these things?

ngiemboon: Pi ne ńzsé mmó gie á táte fùɔ menò tepòŋ tá à těen ńkẅɛɛ ńtyé fʉ̀’ɔɔn wɔ́. Yɛ̌ fʉ̀’ ge gÿo ku’, tá à kẅɛ.
en: And now ye know what withholdeth that he might be revealed in his time.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kẅiŋte gẅí, ńnáa gẅi tʉ̀ pi lɔg ńgÿo pɔ́ menò mbòŋo, ḿbiŋ ńgẅiin pɔ́ shwóŋè mbòŋo.
en: comfort your hearts, and stablish you in every good word and work.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a aa ńké těen ńkúbe wɔ́. À ge gÿo pi le kʉ́a, é piŋ le zẅíŋ Sátà zába pwó ná pi wɔ́.
en: But the Lord is faithful, who shall stablish you, and keepyoufrom evil.

ngiemboon: Peg ne ńdúɔ ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zí’i gẅi lékẅi’i ńkwoŋ Ssé, mbɔɔ léshÿɔg ngɔ́’ pá’ ye Kristo.
en: And the Lord direct your hearts into the love of God, and into the patient waiting for Christ.

ngiemboon: Peg la zɔɔn ńkwa’ ńgẅiin légɔɔn ngie pi jÿɔ́gɔ wég, tá ńgwɔ́ gÿo pú’u, ńne ńtsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ ngie pi pí fʉ̀’ ná peg.
en: not because we have not power, but to make ourselves an ensample unto you to follow us.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa ná pi, mefɛ́ mefɛ́, tà pi kʉ́a légÿo pɔ́ menò mie ée mbòŋ.
en: But ye, brethren, be not weary in well doing.

ngiemboon: Tá’, ḿbɔ́ɔn gẅi lélɔgɔ yé ńgÿo ngàŋ mbù gẅi. Pi kaga yé pɔ́ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ kaga fɛ́ we.
en: Yet counthimnot as an enemy, but admonishhimas a brother.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege Yěsǒ Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi metsèm.
en: The second epistle to the Thessalonians was written from Athens.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ́ pʉ̀a kéen ńnyé mɔɔn menò, ńkúu pyé, ńcʉ́’ʉ ńzɔ́gɔ ńzoŋo pɔ́ menò mie é té tyé.
en: from which some having swerved have turned aside unto vain jangling;

ngiemboon: Pege metsèm ne ńzsé ngie mbʉ̌ mie e Ssé la cʉa ná Mǒsê ńná, ée mbòŋ ná pá’ mé lɔɔn ńkú’te ná ntí gie é ne ńzɛ́te.
en: But we know that the lawisgood, if a man use it lawfully;

ngiemboon: Lesẅiŋté Ssé nà twó pʉ̀a aa mbòŋ, ńgwɔ́ mmó gie á poŋ Ssé gẅie à gÿo pege tsẅɛ́ɛ.
en: For thisisgood and acceptable in the sight of God our Saviour;

ngiemboon: Yé gẅie à ne ńkwoŋo ngie pʉ̀a mesoŋ metsèm tsẅɛ́, ḿbiŋ ńzsé nò nénʉ́.
en: who will have all men to be saved, and to come unto the knowledge of the truth.

ngiemboon: Aa Yěsô Kristo, ńgwɔ́ yé nyìŋ mesoŋ
en: Forthere isone God, and one mediator between God and men, the man Christ Jesus;

ngiemboon: Pànzwě lɔɔn ńnéŋe ńtóo tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè, pɔ́ pʉ́le ńnéŋe ssé, ńzẅí’te mmó gie mé ne ńzí’i tà pɔ́ le pége shwǒŋ wɔ́.
en: Let the woman learn in silence with all subjection.

ngiemboon: Pi zɔɔn ńzsé ngie Ssé la vɔg ḿbwóon Adam, tá mbɔ́ɔntè ḿbwóon Eva.
en: For Adam was first formed, then Eve.

ngiemboon: Adam zɔ la piŋ tè zẅíŋ mé fʉte yé wɔ́. Manzwě zɔ la zẅíŋ mé fʉte yé, á fʉa nò mbwo Ssé.
en: And Adam was not deceived, but the woman being deceived was in the transgression.

ngiemboon: Anò gie n gee ńgɔɔn áa nénʉ́. Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńne ńtsɔ́ɔn légwɔ́ ndìe cú’tè pʉ̀a Kristo, mbà à tsɔ́ɔn fà’ gie á gẅiin mekù’.
en: Thisisa true saying, If a man desire the office of a bishop, he desireth a good work.

ngiemboon: À gwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à líe mbʉ̀a ye mboŋó, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à gẅiin penkʉ́ pé nà ntí gie pɔ́ ge jú’ ncwò wé, é gÿo mekù’ mé.
en: one that ruleth well his own house, having his children in subjection with all gravity;

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔɔn ńzɔɔn tè zsé lélíe mbʉ̀a yé wɔ́, á líe cú’tè pʉ̀a Ssé lêkɔ́?
en: (for if a man know not how to rule his own house, how shall he take care of the church of God?)

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te ngie pɔ́ kú’te nò nénʉ́ gie á laa lelyěen, e Ssé nyɛɛ wégè, ńkú’te nà ntí gie mbùm yɔb tè cúa wɔ́b gwɔ́.
en: holding the mystery of the faith in a pure conscience.

ngiemboon: Timoté, mèŋ n ne ńkwaŋa ngie n te láte tá tó gyá gú wɔ́. Mèŋ n ké ńŋwe’e yɔɔn ŋwà’ne, ńnáa mbwo gù pá’ɔɔn,
en: These things write I unto thee, hoping to come unto thee shortly:

ngiemboon: Mé jÿó á nue e Ssé gɔ̌ɔn pú’u, mé gíŋ ńne sie yé mǒ.
en: for it is sanctified by the word of God and prayer.

ngiemboon: Ashwóŋè yɔɔn áa kwà’ nénʉ́, ńgwɔ́ gie ńgwɔ́ wɔ̌wɔ́ɔ jú’ ńzẅíŋ.
en: Thisisa faithful saying and worthy of all acceptation.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn ée menò mie ɔ̀ ge tsẅii mbwo pʉ̀a, é piŋ ne zí’i wɔ́b.
en: These things command and teach.

ngiemboon: Ne ńtóŋo ŋwà’ne Ssé mvfò pʉ̀a, ńne ńkẅiŋte pʉ̀a, ńne ńzí’i wɔ́b mmó tá ńdɔgɔ ńzẅí’te wɔ̀ɔn.
en: Till I come, give attendance to reading, to exhortation, to doctrine.

ngiemboon: Nyɛte ńnéŋe twó ná yɔɔn fà’ té tsyɛte nnɛ́, ńzsé ngie pʉ̀a metsèm ge gyá pá’ fà’a jú ne ńgiŋe.
en: Meditate upon these things; give thyself wholly to them; that thy profiting may appear to all.

ngiemboon: ńdíe mezẅìŋe pànzwě pá’ memá pú, ńdíe ngwàngùɔ pá’ mefɛ́ pú pe pànzwě, tè gẅiin tsɔ́ nkwaŋá ndyɛ̀’ɛ ntʉ́m gù.
en: the elder women as mothers; the younger as sisters, with all purity.

ngiemboon: Lɔg mekù’ ńkẅéte mepfɔ̌g pie nyìŋ tè nzèm pɔ́b wɔ́.
en: Honour widows that are widows indeed.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa nà mpfɔ̌g gẅie à gwáa ńjÿo mbàŋte, mbà mé líe yé tà ne ngie manzwě wɛ̂, tá á gwɔ́ mbwo Ssé ńgwɔ́ mpfó.
en: But she that liveth in pleasure is dead while she liveth.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ mmó gie ɔ̀ gẅiin létsẅii mbwo pɔ́b, ńzsé ngie mé tè kíme wɔ́b té poŋ wɔ́.
en: And these things give in charge, that they may be blameless.

ngiemboon: é gÿo pú’u, é lɔg fʉa nò, mélà’mie pɔ́ kubé nò gie pɔ́ la ka’, á gwɔ́ ngie pɔ́ ge ńnéŋe té zɔ́’, éfa’a mbwo Kristo.
en: having damnation, because they have cast off their first faith.

ngiemboon: N gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn nue tsɔ́ lelÿò mepfɔ̌g pe mekʉ́ kéen ńnyé nò Ssé, ńcʉ́me nzèm Sátà.
en: For some are already turned aside after Satan.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa nà pʉ̀a pie é kwǎ’ ńgÿo nò tepòŋ, ɔ̀ tyé pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè ńkága wɔ́b, petsɔ́ pʉ̀a gyá pú’u, ḿbɔ́gɔ légÿo nò tepòŋ.
en: Them that sin rebuke before all, that others also may fear.

ngiemboon: Tè gíŋe ńnú pɔ́ ndà’ ntse. Núu méjʉ’ʉ melù’, ńtí lepfòm shú sie ée ńgwá ńgege gú lɛ.
en: Drink no longer water, but use a little wine for thy stomach's sake and thine often infirmities.

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a gÿo nò tepòŋ mé gyá pɔ́ lê nÿɔ́g. Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a fʉa mé lá’ ńŋaga wɔ́b tá ńzsé.
en: Some men's sins are open beforehand, going before to judgment; and somementhey follow after.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ ná mefà’ mbòŋo, ée ńzɔɔn ńkẅɛɛ pɔ́ menÿɔ́g, tà mbɔɔ mie mé té lwo ńgyá wɔ́, mé lá’ ńgyá gyá.
en: Likewise also the good worksof someare manifest beforehand; and they that are otherwise cannot be hid.

ngiemboon: Á ké ńzɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nénʉ́ ngie nyìŋ záb ntʉ́m ná Ssé, mbà aa ngàŋa fù’ pá’ nò lɔɔn ḿboŋo yé nà mmó gie Ssé nǎ mbwo yé.
en: But godliness with contentment is great gain.

ngiemboon: Pege la zɔɔn tè lɔgɔ tsɔ́ mmó ńtóo tsɛ̀ɛ yɔ́ɔn njÿó wɔ́, pege piŋ ńké tě ńdá’a ńdɔgɔ tsɔ́ éfóo wó ńgee wɔ́.
en: For we brought nothing intothisworld,and it iscertain we can carry nothing out.

ngiemboon: Pú’u la, ńgwɔ́ gie pege lɔɔn ńgẅiin mmó léjÿó mbɔɔ nzsǒ ḿma’, mbà wɛ̌ nzẅìŋ kaa kɔ́gɔ.
en: And having food and raiment let us be therewith content.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge cʉ́’ʉ lécʉ́me, ésẅíŋte ngie e Ssé gwɔ́ né pi.
en: The first to Timothy was written from Laodicea, which is the chiefest city of Phrygia Pacatiana.

ngiemboon: N daa lege pá’ pɔgɔ la gwaa fege ɔ̀ lʉa wɔ́. N ne ńtsɔ́ɔn tɛ́’ pá’ à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ n gíŋe ńgyá gú, anò poŋo wɔ̀ɔn.
en: greatly desiring to see thee, being mindful of thy tears, that I may be filled with joy;

ngiemboon: E Ssé ka nǎ fà’a létsẅi wɔɔn nkʉ̀ mbòŋo á mbwo mèŋ, pá’ mèŋ n ge gwɔ́ ngàŋ ntúm we é piŋ ne la’te mmó mbwo pʉ̀a.
en: whereunto I am appointed a preacher, and an apostle, and a teacher of the Gentiles.

ngiemboon: A Zẅìge Ssé gie áa ná pege kẅéte gú. Ɔ̀ le zẅíŋ nyìŋ gʉa ná nò mbòŋo gie mé la cʉ́me mbwo gù ńkúbe tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.
en: That good thing which was committed unto thee keep by the Holy Ghost which dwelleth in us.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ne ńzsé jú pá’ pʉ̀a ná pàga ngwòŋ Azia kéen ḿbú ńgwá’a wɔ̀ɔn métsèm tà mbɔɔ Figele pɔ́ Hergène yɔ́b.
en: This thou knowest, that all they which are in Asia be turned away from me; of whom are Phygellus and Hermogenes.

ngiemboon: À la lêen ńkúu*Roma wɔɔn, ḿbáte jʉ’ gie mèŋ n gee wó tà ńdá’ ńgyá wɔ̀ɔn.
en: but, when he was in Rome, he sought me out very diligently, and foundme.

ngiemboon: Gyá jú ngɔ́’ pá’ kwà’ ndÿɔ́’ ncù we Yěsô Kristo.
en: Thou therefore endure hardness, as a good soldier of Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ nyìŋ lɔɔn ne ńkÿo ndʉ̌, à tè kÿo nà ntí gie*lepʉ̌ ndʉ̌ ne ńzɛ́te wɔ́, mé le fà’ yé tsɔ́’.
en: And if a man also strive for masteries,yetis he not crowned, except he strive lawfully.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à fa’a nká’ nyìŋ, à lɔɔn ńtéŋe zì’i mboŋó, mbà yé zɔ ge vɔgɔ lépfɛ́ɛ mmó gie á fóo nká’.
en: The husbandman that laboureth must be first partaker of the fruits.

ngiemboon: Sáŋa nò ná menò mie mèŋ n gɔɔn lɔɔn, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge zɔɔn náa gú legyè lélɔg ḿbú ńjú’ ntsèm.
en: Consider what I say; and the Lord give thee understanding in all things.

ngiemboon: Kímte Yěsô Kristo, pá’ à la zíme nà legwé, à la fó nà ngẅɛ̀ fùɔ Ndavíd pá’ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie mèŋ n ne ńtsẅii é ne ńgɔɔn.
en: Remember that Jesus Christ of the seed of David was raised from the dead according to my gospel:

ngiemboon: mbà pege lâ pɔ̌ ge gÿo púte gwɔ́ wó.
en: It isa faithful saying: For if we be dead withhim, we shall also live withhim:

ngiemboon: mbà à ge gÿo gwá’a wégè yé.
en: if we suffer, we shall also reign withhim: if we denyhim, he also will deny us:

ngiemboon: té gwɔ́ gie áa nà we mà wɔ́
en: if we believe not,yethe abideth faithful: he cannot deny himself.

ngiemboon: Zsé ngie, á ge lá’ gwɔ́ nà melyɛ’ɛ́ lá’ nzsònzèm, ejʉ’ tʉ tɛ’.
en: This know also, that in the last days perilous times shall come.

ngiemboon: é gwɔ́ pàjÿò menáŋ, é gÿo nò pɔ́ ḿvege vege, é gwɔ́ ngàŋ ŋá’te tɛ’, é kwoŋo mmó gie á poŋo wɔ́b, pɔ́ le Ssé kwoŋ,
en: traitors, heady, highminded, lovers of pleasures more than lovers of God;

ngiemboon: é gwɔ́ pʉ̀a Ssé pɔ́ nzème pǐ, é moŋe metʉ̀ Ssé mie é kɔ’ɔ́ lɔgɔ wɔ́b gÿo pʉ̀a Ssé. Timoté lÿɔ́’te ntí pʉ̀a ápɛ̌.
en: having a form of godliness, but denying the power thereof: from such turn away.

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ tó, ńzí’i yɛ̌ ntí pànzwě nò, pɔ́ zẅí’te zẅi’té tá ńké tè ku’u lézsé nò gie áa nénʉ́ wɔ́.
en: ever learning, and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ zɔɔn le la nnɛ́ ná Yěso Kristo tà ńne ńkwoŋo légÿo mmó gie Ssé ne ńkwoŋo, mé nyé té kʉ́e yé kʉ́e wɔ́.
en: Yea, and all that will live godly in Christ Jesus shall suffer persecution.

ngiemboon: Pú’u ńzsé ngie nyìŋ Ssé ge fóo nà ŋwà’ne Ssé, é zsé nò Ssé mboŋó, tá gwɔ́ fʉ̀’e kɔ́ wɔ́, é ku’u légÿo nò gie áa mbòŋ.
en: that the man of God may be perfect, throughly furnished unto all good works.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ té gÿo ńgíŋe ńzẅí’te nò gie áa nénʉ́ wɔ́, é cʉ́’ zẅí’te pɔ́ menò pú’kwɔb.
en: and they shall turn awaytheirears from the truth, and shall be turned unto fables.

ngiemboon: N ka lÿɔ́’ ncù mbòŋo, mèŋ n ka kÿo ndʉ̌ tà ńkúu nzotě. N ka kě ně ńzába ntʉ́m pɔ́ ná Yěsô, ńně ḿbɔ́ɔnte mboŋó.
en: I have fought a good fight, I have finishedmycourse, I have kept the faith:

ngiemboon: Kag tʉ̀ ńtɔ́g ńtó ńkẅɛ́te wɔ̀ɔn.
en: Do thy diligence to come shortly unto me:

ngiemboon: Peg Lukase zɔ cʉ̌’ ńgwɔ́. Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgwɔ tó, pi Malékuse gwɔ́, á nue à ge kẅéte wɔ̀ɔn nà fà’a Ssé.
en: Only Luke is with me. Take Mark, and bring him with thee: for he is profitable to me for the ministry.

ngiemboon: N ka túmo Tishig á tÿǒsoŋo Efeso.
en: And Tychicus have I sent to Ephesus.

ngiemboon: Mbǎ gù jú lÿɔ́’te yé, á nue à ka pǔ ńtɔ’ɔ nò Ssé gie peg ka ne shwóŋó pʉ̀a.
en: of whom be thou ware also; for he hath greatly withstood our words.

ngiemboon: Tsyɛ’te Piriska pɔ́ Akilas ńná né mèŋ. Tsyɛ’te mbɔɔ pʉ̀a Onésifor.
en: Salute Prisca and Aquila, and the household of Onesiphorus.

ngiemboon: Eraste kéen ńzso Korento. N ka nyé Tolofine á Milet, mélà’mie à ka ne ńguɔ.
en: Erastus abode at Corinth: but Trophimus have I left at Miletum sick.

ngiemboon: Kág tʉ̀ ńtó tá fʉ̀’ʉ fÿɔ́g zye. Eubule, mbɔɔ Pẅideŋ, mbɔɔ Linus, mbɔɔ Kelɔdia ńgÿo petsɔ́ mefɛ́ mefɛ́, pɔ́ tsyɛ’té gú.
en: Eubulus greeteth thee, and Pudens, and Linus, and Claudia, and all the brethren.

ngiemboon: pɔ́ legíŋ ńjú’ menò pú’kwɔb pà Yuda, ńcʉŋe mǒ wɔ́, tà mbɔɔ mbʉ̌ pʉ̀a pie é teme nzèm nò gie áa nénʉ́ wɔ́.
en: not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men, that turn from the truth.

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná gù, ké ne ńzí’i pʉ̀a mmó à pumo pɔ́ nà nò nénʉ́ gie mé zí’i pʉ̀a ná Yěsô Kristo.
en: But speak thou the things which become sound doctrine:

ngiemboon: ńzsé ngie pɔ́ ge nyɛ pànzwě pie é nyé ńzɔ́’ɔ pá’ wɛ̌wɛ̌ wɔ́ à ge kwoŋo ndǔm we mbɔɔ penkʉ́ pé,
en: that they may teach the young women to be sober, to love their husbands, to love their children,

ngiemboon: Á gíŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋ ndʉŋ pá’ ɔ̀ ge kẅiŋte pûɔ mbàŋa lésáŋa nò fʉ̀’ ntsèm tá ńgÿo.
en: Young men likewise exhort to be sober minded.

ngiemboon: Tá’ e Ssé gẅie à gÿo pege tsẅɛ́ɛ nyɛ ngie ntʉ́m wé poŋ, á piŋ ńkwoŋ pʉ̀a mesoŋ,
en: But after that the kindness and love of God our Saviour toward man appeared,

ngiemboon: E Ssé la ńnéŋe Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a ŋwɛ́ ntʉ́m pege té gɔ’, ńtí Yěsô Kristo, yé gẅie à gÿo pege tsẅɛ́ɛ.
en: which he shed on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Saviour;

ngiemboon: E Ssé ne ńgwɔ́ né pi metsèm.
en: It was written to Titus, ordained the first bishop of the church of the Cretians, from Nicopolis of Macedonia.

ngiemboon: Tá wege Ssé, mbɔɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi, ńne ńnéŋe sẅétè ntʉ́m pi.
en: grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Fɛ́ wɔɔn Filemo, mèŋ ne sẅíŋte Ssé fʉ̀’ ntsèm, ńké ńkwaŋte gú kwaŋte, ésie Ssé, yé gẅie mèŋ n gu’te.
en: I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gee ngàŋ ntúm Kristo, n tsɛ ńku’u léshwóŋó gú mmó gie á zɛ́te ngie ɔ̀ gÿo tá’, á fó nà mmó gie ɔ̀ ne gÿo,
en: Wherefore, though I might be much bold in Christ to enjoin thee that which is convenient,

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ne sẅíŋte ɔ̀ nà twó Onesime, aa míŋ wɔɔn nà nò Yěso gẅie mèŋ n ka kúu ndá tsǎŋ ńzyé.
en: I beseech thee for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds:

ngiemboon: Á laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀’ ɔ̀ těen ńzẅɛ́’ɛ yé wɔ́ tá’, á ké ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ɔɔn ɔ́ɔ gwaa ne zẅɛ́’ɛ yé, mèŋ n ne ńzẅɛ́’ɛ yé yɔ́ɔn.
en: which in time past was to thee unprofitable, but now profitable to thee and to me:

ngiemboon: N tumó yé ngie à piŋ nzèm ńtsɛ́ɛ gú. Aa pɛ́’ɛ̀ ńgwɔ́ tʉ́m yɔ́ɔn.
en: whom I have sent again: thou therefore receive him, that is, mine own bowels:

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie ɔ̀ zsě ngie pɔgɔ ee nà tà’a nò, ɔ̀ kúe yé pá’ á ké ńgwé’e ńgwɔ́ wɔ̀ɔn, mbà ɔ̀ kúe wɔ̀ɔn pú’u,
en: If thou count me therefore a partner, receive him as myself.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ gie à la cʉŋte tsɔ́ mmó mbwo gù, kà ɔ̀ ne ńkʉ́a pɔ́ tsɔ́ mmó mbwo yé wɔ́, ɔ̀ nyé mèŋ n gÿo ntÿó mbwo gù.
en: If he hath wronged thee, or oweththeeought, put that on mine account;

ngiemboon: Epafalas, gẅie peg yé pǔ ńgwɔ́ ndá tsǎŋ ńtí nò Yěsô Kristo tsyɛ’té gú.
en: There salute thee Epaphras, my fellowprisoner in Christ Jesus;

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ Malékuse, mbɔɔ Alistag, mbɔɔ Ndemas pɔ́ Lukase pie pegá pɔ̌ pǔ fa’a tà’a fà’.
en: Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lucas, my fellowlabourers.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Kristo ne ńgwɔ́ né pi.
en: Written from Rome to Philemon, by Onesimus a servant.

ngiemboon: Á la cʉa pú’u, múɔ cʉa*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé, tà Ssé ná lezíŋ sé, é nyɛ ngie à fǎŋ ńcʉa wɔ́b.
en: being made so much better than the angels, as he hath by inheritance obtained a more excellent name than they.

ngiemboon: à gwɔ́ mbwo mèŋ ńgwɔ́ míŋ wɔ̀ɔn mɔ́.
en: And he shall be to me a Son?

ngiemboon: Á poŋ ngie mecÿɔ́’ pé, yé Ssé, métsèm gu’te yé,
en: And again, when he bringeth in the firstbegotten into the world, he saith, And let all the angels of God worship him.

ngiemboon: ńgíŋe ńgÿo megàŋa fà’ pé ŋwɛ́ gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ melʉ́me mmɔ̌g la.
en: And his ministers a flame of fire.

ngiemboon: Ntí gie ɔ̀ ne ńdɔgɔ sá’a lá’ jú ee ndʉŋ ndʉŋ.
en: A sceptre of righteousnessisthe sceptre of thy kingdom.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n da cÿó gʉme jú ńcʉa ye*ngàŋa kwò jú.
en: With the oil of gladness above thy fellows.

ngiemboon: Lepwó gíŋe ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mefà’ mú.
en: And the heavens are the works of thine hands:

ngiemboon: Sɛ̌ shúm ge gÿo zẅìŋ pá’ nzsǒ la
en: And they all shall wax old as doth a garment;

ngiemboon: Tá ńgʉa ná gù, mbà ɔ̀ ge lá’a gwɔ́ pɔ́ pá’ ɔ̀ gwɔ̌, agù le gwɔ́ wó à tě ńdá’a ḿmaga wɔ́
en: And thy years shall not fail.

ngiemboon: ńzẅí’te mèŋ n dɔg megàŋ mbù pú, ńgÿo ntÿɔgɔ́ mekwò mú wɔ́?
en: Until I make thine enemies thy footstool?

ngiemboon: E Ssé la zɔɔn tè gÿo ngie mecÿɔ́’ pé gẅiin nò ná lesǎ’ ngwòŋ gẅie é ne ńtóo wɔ́, é ngwòŋ gẅie pege ne ńgɔɔn nò mǒ.
en: For unto the angels hath he not put in subjection the world to come, whereof we speak.

ngiemboon: Múɔ gẅie nyìŋ mesoŋ zyě á gwɔ́ kɔ́ tà ɔ̀ ńnéŋe ńtÿɔ́’te yé?
en: Or the son of man, that thou visitest him?

ngiemboon: ńcÿó gʉm yé, ńtɔ’ɔ cÿɔ́’ɔ lefùɔ twó yé, á gie á gÿo á gẅiin legú’.
en: And didst set him over the works of thy hands:

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n ge gÿo tyé tsɛ̀ɛ cú’tè é gu’te gú.
en: In the midst of the church will I sing praise unto thee.

ngiemboon: Wɔ́ɔn wɔɔn, mbà pega gubé gie e Ssé la náa wɔ́b né mèŋ tǒ.
en: And again, I will put my trust in him. And again, Behold I and the children which God hath given me.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwɔ́, kwà’ nénʉ́, ngie Yěsô la tè tó lékẅéte*mecÿɔ́’ Ssé wɔ́, à la tóo lékẅéte pʉ̀a ngẅɛ̀ ndá Ábalam.
en: For verily he took not onhim the nature ofangels; but he took onhimthe seed of Abraham.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn fó ná pá’ Yěsô lê twó yé la gyá ngɔ́’, nkwà’te gíŋe ńkúu yé, á ku’u lékẅéte pʉ̀a pie nkwà’te ne ńkúu wɔ́b yɔ́b.
en: For in that he himself hath suffered being tempted, he is able to succour them that are tempted.

ngiemboon: Yɛ̌ ndá wɔ́ zɔɔn ńgẅiin nyìŋ gẅie à la kwɛ́, tá nyìŋ gẅie à la gÿo shúm ntsèm aa Ssé.
en: For every house is builded by someman; but he that built all thingsisGod.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńjú’ ngyè Ssé lyɛ̌’ɔɔn
en: To day if ye will hear his voice,

ngiemboon: Á lyɛ̌’ gie pɔ́ la tsóte yé nkwòŋo tsẅɛ̀ ngie à gÿo mmó né pɔ́b
en: In the day of temptation in the wilderness:

ngiemboon: ńtsóte wɔ̀ɔn pá’ɔɔn tà mbɔɔ pá’ pɔ́ gyǎ mmǒ gie mèŋ n gÿǒ gyá ngù’u lá’ móm lekùa.
en: And saw my works forty years.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la lá’ tè lɔgɔ tsɔ̌ tà’ ná menò mie n da ne ńtsẅii mbwo pɔ́b, ńtóŋo tsɔ́ nò wɔ́.
en: And they have not known my ways.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ téen ńdá’a ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ sẅétè gie n da ka’a mbwo pɔ́b wɔ́.
en: They shall not enter into my rest.)

ngiemboon: tà pi ziŋe metuŋó mí pá’ pi la ziŋe nà lyɛ̌’ gie pi la ne ńtʉʉ twó mbwo ye.
en: while it is said, To day if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts, as in the provocation.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la gwaa gɔɔn pá’ɔɔn, mbà à la lá’ fa’ mefà’ mé á fʉ̀’ gie à la nyɛte njÿó tà é mag.
en: although the works were finished from the foundation of the world.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ téen ńdá’a ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ sẅétè gie n da nyɛte ńtí wɔ́b gwɔ́.
en: If they shall enter into my rest.

ngiemboon: Tà pi ziŋe metuŋó mí.
en: Harden not your hearts.

ngiemboon: tà fó lyɛ̌’ɔɔn n gwɔ́ tá gù».
en: To day have I begotten thee.

ngiemboon: À la gwɔ́ pɔ́ Míŋ Ssé tá’, ńgyá ngɔ́’ gyǎ, tà fó pɔ́ mǒ ńzí’i lé jú’ ncwò Ssé,
en: though he were a Son, yet learned he obedience by the things which he suffered;

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ńjú’ tà ńku’u nyìŋ gẅie ńgwɔ́ á gÿo pʉ̀a pie é jú’u ncwò wé pú ńtsẅɛ́ ndà’ ndà’.
en: and being made perfect, he became the author of eternal salvation unto all them that obey him;

ngiemboon: Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà Ssé la lɔgɔ yé ńgÿo*nùŋe pwɔ́’ we lÿò á nà ntí gie Melekisedeg la gwɔ́ yé.
en: called of God an high priest after the order of Melchisedec.

ngiemboon: Pege nyé mɔɔn menò, ńzyɛ́’ ńgʉa lê mvfò, pá’ Ssé lɔɔn ńzẅíŋ.
en: And this will we do, if God permit.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn ngie: «Mèŋ n gɔɔn tà shwóŋó nò, mèŋ n ge gÿo néŋ mbʉ́lè ná gù tɛ’, é gÿo ngẅɛ̀ jù pú ńgyɔ́ɔn tɛ’».
en: saying, Surely blessing I will bless thee, and multiplying I will multiply thee.

ngiemboon: Ábalam jú’, ńzẅí’te té kʉ́a, á cʉa pú’u, á lá’ ńgẅiin mmó gie Ssé la ka’a mbwo yé.
en: And so, after he had patiently endured, he obtained the promise.

ngiemboon: Mé zɔɔn ńzsé mboŋó ngie nyìŋ gẅie à ńnéŋe mbʉ́lè à cʉa nyìŋ gẅie à kẅé mbʉ́lè.
en: And without all contradiction the less is blessed of the better.

ngiemboon: Ntí ye lelɔg ńtsɔ́’ pànuŋe pwɔ́’ lɔɔn ńzɔɔn ńkúbe, mbà*lepʉ̌ gẅiin lékúbe yé.
en: For the priesthood being changed, there is made of necessity a change also of the law.

ngiemboon: N gɔ̌ɔn ngie: Ɔ̀ɔ nùŋe pwɔ́’, é la’a gwɔ́ pɔ́ wɛ̌ á nà ngù’ nkɔ́ɔn nê nkɔ̌ɔn
en: After the order of Melchisedec:)

ngiemboon: Á la fó mǒ, e Ssé lɔgɔ Yěsô ńcwóŋ lezyɛ̌ ná yɔɔn*kʉ̀a ye sẅé gie áa mbòŋ ńcʉa yetsɔ́.
en: By so much was Jesus made a surety of a better testament.

ngiemboon: Ammó laa pé’e ńzɔɔn tè zága ná ndùŋ mvfò*kʉ̀a wɔ́, mbà mé la tè gíŋe ńgÿo tsɔ́*kʉ̀a ńdɔg ńkúbe yɛ̌ wɔ́.
en: For if that firstcovenanthad been faultless, then should no place have been sought for the second.

ngiemboon: ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀’ gie mèŋ n ge gÿo gwa*kʉ̀a sẅé á tsetsɛ̀ɛ pega pʉ̀a Israel lâ pʉ̀a Jẅida.
en: When I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah:

ngiemboon: Mèŋ yɔ́ɔn, n da tè gíŋe sáŋa wɔ́b nà tsɔ́ nò wɔ́, mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ gɔɔn.
